boiled egg so it sits longways', '11:  Chop the sliced egg white into tiny cubes and set aside', '12: To create spikes, use the straw to make 6 slits on the egg, touching at one end', '13:  Do not slit too deep', '14:  Prop up the slits by stuffing the egg white cubes under the slits', '15: For the nose, poke a hole and place a black peppercorn', '16:  Place the black sesame seeds for eyes', '17: To make the owl: Slice the olive thinly', '18: Slice the boiled egg’s bottom part so the egg sits stable', '19:  Chop the sliced egg white and set aside', '20: For the ears, make a slit in a shape of a “V” on each side of the eggs', '21: For the belly make 5 slits in a shape of a “V”', '22:  Push the slits up with using a toothpick', '23: For the beak, make a slit in a shape of a “V”', '24:  Prop up the beak by stuffing the egg white cubes under the slits', '25: Place two olive slices for eyes', '26: For the mouse: Slice the carrot and save 1 piece for making ears and julienne the rest for the tail', '27: Using a pastry tip, cut out the sliced carrot into two circles for ears', '28: Slice one side of the boiled egg so it sits longways', '29:  Chop the sliced egg white into tiny cubes and set aside', '30: Make two slits for inserting ears with using a paring knife', '31:  Insert the cut-out carrots for ears', '32: For the nose, poke a hole and place a pink peppercorn', '33:  Place the black sesame seeds for eyes', '34:  Place one of the julienne carrot pieces into the opposite side for the tail']

ingredients: ['¼ cup mint (10 g)', '¼ cup chamomile (60 g)', '¼ cup rose petal (10 g)', '2 tablespoons lavender', 'muslin reusable tea bag or reusable cotton']
instructions: ['1: Combine ¼ cup mint, ¼ cup chamomile, ¼ cup rose petals, and lavender in a bowl', '2: Scoop 2 2 tablespoons, or desired amount, into each muslin reusable tea bag and seal completely', '3: Store in an airtight container and use as you’d like']

ingredients: ['1 lb frozen pineapple (455 g) chunks', '1 tablespoon honey or preferred sweetener']
instructions: ['1: Blend all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender until thoroughly combined', '2: Pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer', '3: Freeze for 2 hours, or until 1 lb frozen but still a little soft for scooping', '4:  (If freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping', '5: )Scoop into a bowl']

ingredients: ['Lamb', '1 cup full-fat greek yogurt (285 g)', '4 cloves garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon fresh ginger minced', '1 tablespoon garam masala', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon cayenne', '1 tablespoon kosher salt divided', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '¼ cup cashews (30 g) finely ground', '2 ¼ lb rack of lamb (565 g)', 'Yogurt Sauce', '1 cup full-fat yogurt (245 g)', '2 shallots thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons sumac', '1 tablespoon fresh cilantro finely chopped', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 ½ teaspoons black pepper', '4 tablespoons pomegranate seeds', '8 fresh mint leaves torn']
instructions: ['1: Make the lamb: In a medium bowl, mix together the yogurt, 4 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, 1 tablespoon garam masala, turmeric, cayenne, 2 teaspoons of 1 tablespoon kosher 2 teaspoons kosher salt, the pepper, and ground ¼ cup cashews', '2: Set the lamb 2 ¼ lb racks in a rimmed baking dish and poke all over with a fork', '3:  This will allow the flavors of the marinade to season the meat all the way through', '4: Season the lamb with the remaining teaspoon of 1 tablespoon kosher 2 teaspoons kosher salt, then rub the marinade into the meat', '5:  Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 6–12 hours', '6: Arrange a 2 ¼ lb rack in the center of the oven', '7:  Preheat the oven to 450°F (220°C)', '8: Transfer the marinated lamb, fat-side up to a roasting pan and weave the 2 ¼ lb racks together so they are partially upright', '9:  Roast for 15 minutes, then turn the 2 ¼ lb racks over and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 130°F (55°C)', '10:  Let rest for 10–15 minutes', '11: While the lamb rests, make the yogurt sauce: In a medium bowl, stir together the yogurt, 2 shallots, 2 tablespoons sumac, 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro, 1 tablespoon kosher 2 teaspoons kosher salt, and pepper', '12:  Garnish the yogurt sauce with the 4 tablespoons pomegranate seeds and 8 fresh mint leaves', '13: Carve the lamb between the rib bones into individual chops', '14:  Transfer to a serving platter and serve with the yogurt sauce alongside']

ingredients: ['Chicken Tikka', '1 ⅓ lb chicken breast (600 g)', '1 ⅔ cups natural yogurt (410 mL)', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste', '2 tablespoons tikka masala sauce', '1 tablespoon red chili powder', '½ teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Curry', '2 tablespoons oil', '1 onion finely chopped', '2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste', '1 teaspoon cumin seed', '2 black peppercorns', '2 cloves', '1 teaspoon red chili powder', '½ teaspoon coriander powder', '1 teaspoon garam masala powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 tomatoes finely chopped', '½ cup natural yogurt (100 mL)', '⅓ cup water (100 mL)', 'Rice', '1 ⅔ cups water (400 mL)', '1 ½ cups basmati rice (300 g) soaked for at least 20 minutes', '1 bay leaf', '½ teaspoon cumin seed', 'Biryani Assembly', '1 ½ cups onion (200 g) carmelised', '½ cup fresh coriander (20 g) finely chopped', '1 tablespoon oil', '1 cup water (200 mL) saffron-infused']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven 430˚F ( 220˚C)', '2: Combine all the 1 ⅓ lb chicken 2 tablespoons tikka ingredients and marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour', '3: Skewer the marinated 1 ⅓ lb chicken pieces on bamboo skewers, then place them over a baking tray lined with parchment paper, making sure there is space underneath the 1 ⅓ lb chicken to help distribute the heat more evenly', '4: Reserve the 1 ⅓ lb chicken 2 tablespoons tikka marinade for later use', '5: Bake the 1 ⅓ lb chicken skewers for about 15 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges and cooked throughout', '6: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat, then sauté the onions with the herbs and spices until just browned', '7: Add in the chopped 2 tomatoes and fry till soft', '8: Pour in the yogurt, water, and reserved 2 tablespoons tikka marinade, and mix it well with the vegetables and spices', '9: Bring the mixture to a boil, add in the 1 ⅓ lb chicken and cook for a further 4-5 minutes', '10:  Set aside', '11: In a large pot, assemble your biryani in the following layers: ⅓ 1 ½ cups basmati rice, ½ 1 ⅓ lb chicken curry, ½ caramelised onion, ½ coriander, ⅓ 1 ½ cups basmati rice, oil, ½ of the saffron-infused water, ½ 1 ⅓ lb chicken curry, ⅓ 1 ½ cups basmati rice, the rest of the saffron-infused water, ½ caramelised onion, and finally top with the remaining coriander', '12: Simmer the biryani over a low heat for 10 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and the 1 ½ cups basmati rice and 1 ⅓ lb chicken are heated throughout']

ingredients: ['2 chicken breasts', '1 egg beaten', '2 cups panko breadcrumbs (100 g)', 'salt', 'pepper', '4 tablespoons soy sauce', '4 tablespoons honey', '4 cloves garlic crushed', '2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', '1 tablespoon  sriracha', '1 tablespoon grated ginger', 'spring onion for garnish', 'sesame seed for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Cut the 2 chicken breasts into small bite-size pieces', '3: Dip 2 chicken pieces into 1 egg mixture then coat with 2 cups panko', '4: Place the breaded 2 chicken onto a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper', '5: Bake 20 minutes until golden brown and cooked through', '6: Mix together 4 tablespoons soy sauce, 4 tablespoons honey, 4 cloves garlic, 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce, 1 tablespoon  sriracha and 1 tablespoon grated ginger in a saucepan and bring to boil, remove from heat', '7: Toss 2 chicken bites in the sauce until thoroughly coated', '8: Serve immediately with chopped spring onion and sesame seeds']

ingredients: ['¾ cup milk (180 mL)', '½ cup unsalted butter (115 g) 1 stick melted', '2 tablespoons honey', '2 large eggs', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '1 cup yellow cornmeal (150 g)', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '6 tablespoons pulled pork', '6 tablespoons cheddar cheese', '1 cup barbecue sauce (290 g) for serving', '1 ½ cups coleslaw (150 g) for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, butter, 2 2 1 6 6 tablespoons honey, and eggs until combined', '3: In a separate 2 large bowl, mix the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon salt until combined', '4: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until smooth', '5: Grease a 6-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray', '6:  Using an ice cream scoop or measuring cup, spoon about ¼ cup (70 g) of batter into each cup', '7: Spoon about 1 2 1 6 6 tablespoon of 6 6 tablespoons pulled pork in the center of the batter', '8: Top the pork with another ¼ cup (70 g) of batter to cover, using a spoon to spread the batter over the pork if necessary', '9: Sprinkle about 1 2 1 6 6 tablespoon of 6 tablespoons cheddar cheese over each muffin', '10: Bake for 25 minutes, or until the tops of the muffins spring back when touched', '11: Remove the muffins from the tin and top with barbecue sauce and 1 ½ cups coleslaw']

ingredients: ['12 cloves garlic minced', '2 tablespoons black pepper', '2 tablespoons salt', '10 lb suckling pig (4.5 kg) patted dry', '4 stalks lemongrass pounded tough outer layer removed', '1 large white onion quartered', '1 bunch green onion', '1 ½ lb longanisa humada (680 g)', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 g)', 'Preparation', '12 cloves garlic minced', '2 tablespoons black pepper', '2 tablespoons salt', '10 lb suckling pig (4.5 kg) patted dry', '4 stalks lemongrass pounded tough outer layer removed', '1 large white onion quartered', '1 bunch green onion', '1 ½ lb longanisa humada (680 g)', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 g)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 450˚F (230˚C)', '2: Combine the minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl', '3:  Rub the mixture on the inside cavity of the suckling pig', '4: Stuff the lemongrass, onion, green onions, and longanisa inside the cavity', '5: Sew the cavity shut with butcher’s twine', '6: Transfer the pig to a large baking sheet', '7:  Brush the pig with soy sauce and cover the ears and tail with aluminum foil', '8: Roast for 30 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350˚F (180˚C) and continue to cook for 2½ hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 160˚F (70˚C) and the skin is crispy', '9: Remove the pig from the oven and reserve the pan drippings for the pancit']

ingredients: ['2 habanero peppers', '¼ medium onion', '1 tablespoon ginger paste', '3 cloves garlic', '½ celery stalk', '2 fresh basils', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '1 spring cilantro', '1 mint', '1 leek petal', '¼ cup dried rosemary (10 g)', '1 green onion', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL)', '¼ cup water (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Chop 2 habanero, ¼ medium 1 1 green onion, 1 tablespoon ginger, 3 cloves garlic, ½ celery, basil, 1 sprig fresh parsley, 1 mint, leeks, 1 spring cilantro, and 1 green ¼ medium 1 1 green onion into small pieces and pour it into a blender', '2: Add the ¼ cup dried rosemary, cooking ¼ cup vegetable oil and ¼ cup water into the blender and blend into a puree', '3: Use the marinade for your all purpose cooking to add flavor to your meat, fish and stews']

ingredients: ['1 spaghetti squash', '1 tablespoon oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '12 meatballs fully cooked', '2 cups pasta sauce (520 g)', 'grated parmesan cheese to serve', 'fresh parsley chopped to serve']
instructions: ['1: Slice the 1 spaghetti squash in half', '2:  If you’re having difficult, poke some holes with a knife, then microwave for 5 minutes', '3: Scoop out the seeds and innards with a spoon, then rub 1 tablespoon oil, salt, and pepper all over the surface', '4: Microwave for about 10-15 minutes until the squash is tender and pulls away from the skin easily', '5: Using a fork, shred the squash into noodle-like strands', '6: Microwave the 12 meatballs with the 2 cups pasta sauce, covered, for about 2 minutes or until the 12 meatballs are fully heated through', '7: Spoon the 12 meatballs and sauce on top of each 1 spaghetti squash half, garnish with the Parmesan and fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['1 cucumber sliced', '½ cup cherry tomato (100 g)', '1 cup grape (170 g)', '½ cup pita chip (50 g)', '2 tablespoons hummus']
instructions: ['1: Place cucumbers, tomatoes, and grams into box', '2: Place ½ cup pita chips into box along with a scoop of 2 tablespoons hummus', '3: Refrigerate until ready to eat']

ingredients: ['1 cup peanut butter (240 g)', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '1 egg']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350ºF (180ºC)', '2: In a large bowl, mix together the 1 cup peanut butter, ½ cup sugar, and 1 egg', '3: Scoop out a spoonful of dough and roll it into a ball', '4:  Place the cookie balls onto a nonstick baking sheet', '5: For extra decoration and to make them cook more evenly, flatten the cookie balls by pressing a fork down on top of them, then press it down again at a 90º angle to make a criss-cross pattern', '6: Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies are golden brown', '7: Remove from baking sheet and cool']

ingredients: ['olive oil to taste', '¼ cup onion (38 g) minced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '7 oz spinach (198 g) washed', '6 oz cream cheese (170 g) cubed', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '5 thick-cut pork chops', 'mashed potato for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat', '3:  Add the ¼ cup onion and sauté until translucent, about 2 minutes', '4:  Add the 2 cloves garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute', '5: Add the 7 oz spinach and cool until wilted', '6: Add the 6 oz cream cheese and stir until melted', '7:  Season with salt and pepper', '8:  Remove the pan from the heat and let cool', '9: Make a slit on the side of each 5 thick-cut pork chop to make a pocket, but do not cut all the way through', '10: Fill the 5 thick-cut pork chops with the 7 oz spinach mixture', '11:  Season with salt and pepper on both sides', '12: Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat', '13:  Working in batches, sear the 5 thick-cut pork chops until golden brown on both sides', '14:  Transfer to a baking sheet', '15: Bake the 5 thick-cut pork chops for 20 minutes, or until  cooked through', '16: Serve the 5 thick-cut pork chops with mashed potatoes']

ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 lb sweet potato (425 g) peeled and diced', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium yellow onion diced', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '1 can black beans drained and rinsed', '3 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 cups enchilada sauce (480 mL) divided', '8 medium flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded mexican cheese blend (200 g)', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) finely chopped', 'cotija cheese for garnish - optional']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with nonstick spray', '3: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat', '4:  Add the 1 lb sweet potatoes and cook until fork-tender, 10 minutes', '5:  Drain the 1 lb sweet potatoes through a colander', '6: Heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat', '7:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook, stirring often, until beginning to soften, about 5 minutes', '8:  Add the 3 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, and ¼ teaspoon chili powder, and cook, stirring constantly, until aromatic, about 30 seconds', '9: Add the 1 lb sweet potatoes, 1 can black beans, and 3 teaspoons kosher salt and cook until warmed through, about 3 minutes', '10: Add 1 2 2 ¼ cup of 2 2 2 ¼ cups enchilada sauce to the bottom of the prepared baking dish and use a spatula to spread evenly', '11: Scoop ½ 2 2 ¼ cup of the 1 lb sweet potato mixture onto the lower half of a tortilla and roll up', '12:  Place seam side-down in the baking dish', '13:  Repeat with the remaining filling and tortillas, arranging in a row', '14:  Top with the remaining 2 2 ¼ cup of 2 2 2 ¼ cups enchilada sauce', '15:  Sprinkle the Mexican cheese blend on top', '16: Bake the 2 2 2 ¼ cups enchiladas for about 10 minutes, until the cheese has melted', '17: Top the 2 2 2 ¼ cups enchiladas with the cilantro and Cotija cheese, if desired, and serve immediately']

ingredients: ['4 tablespoons flour', '3 tablespoons sugar', '1 tablespoon sprinkles plus more for topping', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '3 tablespoons milk', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', 'whipped topping for topping optional']
instructions: ['1: In a 12-ounce (375 ml) or larger mug , mix all ingredients until just combined', '2: Microwave on high for 90 seconds to 2 minutes, watching to make sure it doesn’t spill over (depending on the size of the mug)', '3: Let cool one minute before eating', '4:  Top with whipped topping and 1 tablespoon sprinkles (optional)']

ingredients: ['1 apple', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', 'Pancake Batter', '1 egg', '2 tablespoons butter melted', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¾ cup milk (180 mL)', '1 cup flour (125 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', '1 pinch salt']
instructions: ['1: Peel the 1 apple and slice into 2 cm (¾-inch) thickness', '2: Using a teaspoon, cut out the core of the 1 apple and place 1 apples in a medium bowl', '3: Mix in cinnamon and coat each 1 apple ring', '4: In a large bowl, mix 1 egg, 2 tablespoons butter, vanilla extract, and ¾ cup milk with a whisk', '5: Sift in 1 cup flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, cinnamon, and 1 pinch salt, and mix the batter', '6:  It is okay to leave lumps', '7: Heat pan on medium heat and melt 2 tablespoons butter', '8:  Dunk each ring into the batter and place on pan', '9: Wait until bubbles form on the batter, then flip', '10: Top it off with your favorite toppings']

ingredients: ['salt to taste', '½ lb linguine (225 g)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic thinly sliced', '½ teaspoon red chili flakes', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 tablespoon caper', '½ cup kalamata olive (75 g)', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '14 oz diced tomato (395 g) 1 can', '5 oz tuna (140 g) 1 can drained']
instructions: ['1: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil', '2:  Cook the pasta according to package instructions', '3:  Drain', '4: Add the olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, and chile ½ teaspoon red chili flakes to a large sauté pan', '5:  Turn the heat to medium-low and slowly heat up until the 2 cloves garlic is fragrant and lightly colored, about 3 minutes', '6: Add the 2 teaspoons dried oregano, capers, olives, 2 tablespoons 14 oz 14 oz diced tomato paste, and 14 oz diced 2 tablespoons 14 oz 14 oz diced tomatoes', '7:  Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally', '8: Add the 5 oz tuna and cook for another minute', '9: Toss in the cooked pasta']

ingredients: ['8 oz good-quality chocolate (225 g) semi-sweet ', '12 tablespoons butter melted', '1 ¼ cups sugar (250 g)', '2 eggs', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '¾ cup all-purpose flour (95 g)', '¼ cup cocoa powder (30 g)', '1 teaspoon salt']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper', '3: Chop the 8 oz good-quality chocolate into chunks', '4:  Melt half of the 8 oz good-quality chocolate in the microwave in 20-second intervals, saving the other half for later', '5: In a large bowl, mix the 12 tablespoons butter and 1 ¼ cups sugar with an electric hand mixer, then beat in the 2 eggs and 2 teaspoons vanilla for 1-2 minutes, until the mixture becomes fluffy and light in color', "6: Whisk in the melted 8 oz good-quality chocolate (make sure it's not too hot or else the 2 eggs will cook), then sift in the ¾ cup all-purpose flour, ¼ cup cocoa powder, and 1 teaspoon salt", '7:  Fold to incorporate the dry ingredients, being careful not to overmix as this will cause the brownies to be more cake-like in texture', '8: Fold in the 8 oz good-quality chocolate chunks, then transfer the batter to the prepared baking dish', '9: Bake for 20-25 minutes, depending on how fudgy you like your brownies, then cool completely', '10: Slice, then serve with a nice cold glass of milk!']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce', '1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', 'tortilla to serve']
instructions: ['1: Add the 1 tablespoon olive oil to a pan over medium heat', '2:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the 15 oz chickpeas and cook until slightly golden, stirring occasionally', '3: Add 2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce, 1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder to the 15 oz chickpeas and sauté for 3-4 more minutes, until golden brown', '4: Serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings']

ingredients: ['2 strawberries sliced plus 1 for garnish', '3 slices orange plus 1 wheel for garnish', 'ice as needed', '½ cup rosé (120 mL)', '¼ cup sparkling water (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: To a short glass, add strawberry 3 slices and orange 3 slices', '2:  Muddle until juicy', '3: Add ice and fill the glass ¾ of the way with ½ cup rosé', '4:  Top with ¼ cup sparkling water', '5: Garnish with an orange wheel and a strawberry']

ingredients: ['Crust', '2 cups chocolate sandwich cookie (200 g)', '⅜ cup vegan butter (85 g) can substitute with coconut oil', 'Filling', '1 ½ cups medjool date (255 g)', '1 cup boiling water (240 mL)', '1 cup almond flour (100 g)', '¾ cup cocoa powder (90 g)', '½ cup coconut sugar (100 g)', '1 tablespoon ground flaxseed', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅓ cup milk substitute (80 mL)']
instructions: ['1: To make the crust, blend together the 2 cups chocolate sandwich cookie sandwiches and the ⅜ cup vegan butter in a food processor', '2:  Blend for 10 seconds at a time until the 2 cups chocolate sandwich cookies have absorbed all the butter', '3:  The mix should stick when pressed together', '4: Transfer to a greased pie pan, press to form a crust', '5: Refrigerate for 30 minutes', '6: To make the filling, place your dates in a bowl and soak them in the 1 cup boiling water for 10-15 minutes', '7: Transfer the dates and the water to a food processor and blend for 10 seconds at a time until a thick paste has formed', '8:  Transfer to a large mixing bowl', '9: Add the rest of the ingredients for the filling into the mixing bowl and fold them into the paste', '10:  Mix thoroughly', '11: Pour the mix into the chilled pie crust', '12:  Bake in the oven at 350° F (180° C) for 40-45 minutes', '13:  The texture should be thick and fudgy']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb beef sirloin (680 g) sliced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', 'olive oil drizzle', '2 onions sliced', '10 oz mushrooms (285 g) sliced', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '2 cloves garlic crushed', '4 cups beef stock (960 mL)', '⅓ cup heavy cream (80 mL)', '4 sourdough bread bowls', '4 slices provolone cheese']
instructions: ['1: Add sliced beef to a large bowl, season with salt, pepper, ¼ teaspoon 2 onion powder and toss to coat', '2:  Sprinkle 2 Tbsp 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour, toss to coat', '3: Place a pot over medium-high heat, drizzle olive oil', '4:  Once hot, add half the sirloin in, brown, remove onto a plate to hold, then repeat with the remaining sirloin', '5:  Set aside', '6: Add more oil to the pot, add sliced ¼ teaspoon 2 2 onions, add pinch of salt and pepper, and caramelize the ¼ teaspoon 2 2 onions, stirring frequently to avoid burning', '7: Once the ¼ teaspoon 2 2 onions are softened, add mushrooms and continue sautéing until cooked', '8: Stir in ½ teaspoon dried thyme and 2 cloves garlic', '9: Sprinkle remaining 2 Tbsp', '10:  of 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour onto mixture, stir to combine, then add beef stock', '11:  Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes', '12: Mix in ⅓ cup heavy cream, then add beef, along with juices, stir to combine', '13: Ladle stew into hollowed out 4 sourdough bowls, top with slice of 4 slices provolone, then broil until the cheese is brown and melted']

ingredients: ['3 oz instant ramen (85 g) 3 packages', '8 cups water (1.9 L) boiling hot', '1 clove garlic minced', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '2 tablespoons sesame oil', '1 lime juiced', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL) plus 1 tablespoon', '2 cups broccoli floret (300 g)', '1 tablespoon olive oil divided', '¾ lb flank steak (340 g) thinly sliced', '½ medium yellow onion thinly sliced', 'Garnishes (optional)', '2 tablespoons green onion sliced', '2 tablespoons fresh cilantro chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons sesame seeds toasted']
instructions: ['1: Place the 3 oz instant ramen noodles in a large bowl (discard the seasoning packets or save for another use) and pour the boiling 8 cups water over them', '2:  Let sit for 6 minutes, stirring every now and then to break up the noodle blocks', '3:  Drain and rinse under cold 8 cups water', '4:  Set aside', '5: In a small bowl, combine the 1 clove garlic, cornstarch, 2 tablespoons 1 ½ teaspoons sesame oil, 1 lime juice, and ¼ cup soy sauce', '6:  Stir well, then set aside', '7: Place the 2 cups broccoli in a large, microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1½ minutes, until soft', '8:  Set aside', '9: Heat 1 1 1 ½ teaspoon of 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large, nonstick pan over high heat', '10:  Add the ¾ lb flank steak to the pan and toss with 2 tablespoons of the reserved sauce', '11:  Cook until browned, about 2 minutes', '12:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '13: Heat another 1 1 ½ teaspoon of 1 tablespoon olive oil in the pan, then add the ½ medium yellow 2 tablespoons green onion', '14:  Cook, stirring often, until browned, about 4 minutes', '15: Add the 2 cups broccoli and cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes', '16:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '17: Add the remaining 1 1 ½ teaspoon of 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan, then add the noodles and the remaining sauce', '18:  Cook, stirring constantly, until the noodles soak up the sauce', '19:  Return the cooked vegetables and ¾ lb flank steak to the pan and stir to distribute', '20: Transfer the noodles to a serving dish and garnish with green ½ medium yellow 2 tablespoons green onions, cilantro, and 2 tablespoons 1 ½ teaspoons sesame seeds, if using']

ingredients: ['2 cups peanut butter (480 g)', '¼ cup coconut oil (60 g)', '½ cup powdered sugar (60 g)', '¼ cup honey (85 g)', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract']
instructions: ['1: Combine 2 cups peanut butter, melted ¼ cup coconut oil, ½ cup powdered sugar, ¼ cup honey, ½ teaspoon salt, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract in a bowl until all ingredients are well-combined', '2: Pour into a container lined with wax paper and smooth out the surface with a spoonFreeze for at least 1 hour and take the fudge out of the freezer just before serving', '3: NOTE: Leftovers should be stored in an airtight container in the freezer']

ingredients: ['9 bananas', '1 ½ cups nut butter (360 g) of choice', '½ cup cocoa powder (60 g)', '1 ½ cups blueberry (150 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: In a bowl, mash the 9 bananas with a fork', '3: Add 1 ½ cups nut butter and mix until combined', '4: Divide the batter into two bowls', '5: Add ½ cup cocoa powder to one bowl of batter and mix well', '6: Add the blueberries to the other bowl of batter and mix well', '7: Add the batter to a muffin tin', '8: Bake for 18-20 minutes', '9: Let muffins cool']

ingredients: ['2 cups short grain rice (400 g)', '5 chicken breasts medium-sized', '4 cups hot chicken broth (960 mL)', '½ cup chorizo crumbles (95 g)', '12 jumbo shrimps', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '⅓ cup onion (50 g) diced', '⅓ cup diced tomato (65 g)', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 small bay leaf', '1 pinch saffron', 'fresh cilantro as garnish']
instructions: ['1: Heat 1 tbsp 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat', '2:  Then, saute ½ cup chorizo crumbles and set aside', '3: In the same pan, brown chicken and set aside once cooked through and golden brown', '4: In the same pan (without draining the oil), add onions and tomatoes and sprinkle 1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '5:  Saute until translucent', '6: Next, add 2 cups short grain rice, chicken broth, 1 small bay leaf, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and 1 pinch saffron', '7:  Mix well', '8: Once broth reduces by half, add chicken atop rice and layer with sliced red 1 teaspoon peppers', '9:  Cover pot, reduce heat to low, and cook for 20 minutes', '10: Then, add shrimp into the pan, cover, and cook until pink', '11: Serve warm, garnished with fresh cilantro and lemon']

ingredients: ['1 cup unsweetened coconut flakes (100 g)', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '½ tablespoon maple syrup', '¼ teaspoon liquid smoke', 'coconut oil for greasing', '5 oz fresh arugula (140 g)', '1 ½ pears sliced', '1 ½ cups lentils (250 g) cooked', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', '¼ cup balsamic vinegar (60 mL)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C)', '2: In small bowl, add the 1 cup unsweetened coconut flakes, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ½ tablespoon maple syrup, and ¼ teaspoon liquid smoke', '3:  Mix until well-combined', '4:  Spread evenly on a greased baking sheet, making sure the flakes aren’t touching as much as possible', '5: Bake for 10-15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes, until golden brown', '6:  Then remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes', '7: In a large bowl, combine the 5 oz fresh arugula, 1 ½ pears, 1 ½ cups lentils, and 1 cup unsweetened coconut bacon', '8: In a ¼ teaspoon liquid measuring cup or small bowl, add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper', '9:  Mix until well-combined', '10: Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss well', '11:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['Sweet & Sour Eggplant', '6 japanese eggplants sliced into 1-inch rounds and lightly salted for 15-20 minutes prior to cooking', '2 cloves garlic sliced', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '½ red onion diced', '¼ cup cider vinegar (60 mL)', '⅛ cup sherry vinegar (30 mL)', '¼ cup mirin (60 mL)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '¼ cup agave (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon whole coriander', '1 pinch chili flakes', 'salt and pepper to taste', 'Grain Blend', '4 cups legumes (400 g) or use your favorite grains (I use an even mix of brown rice black rice and quinoa. Sushi rice could also be used mixed with lentils then chilled cut into bars and fried)', 'Crispy Garbanzo Beans', '1 cup garbanzo beans (200 g) cooked and drained', '1 tablespoon canola oil if baking', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon chili powder', 'salt to taste', 'Sumac Yogurt Sauce', '1 cup plain yogurt (240 g)', '1 tablespoon sumac', '1 teaspoon cumin', '2 tablespoons honey', 'salt to taste', 'Garnish', '1 cup mixed herbs (40 g) such as mint cilantro basil and scallions']
instructions: ['1: For the Sweet & Sour Eggplant: Heat a large sauté pan over high heat', '2:  Add both 1 tablespoon sesame 1 tablespoon canola 1 tablespoon canola oils and then the 6 japanese eggplants sliced into 1-inch rounds and lightly salted eggplant', '3:  Sauté until the eggplant begins to brown, adding more canola 1 tablespoon sesame 1 tablespoon canola 1 tablespoon canola oil if needed', '4:  In a bowl or measuring\xa0cup, combine all remaining ingredients', '5:  Deglaze your hot browning eggplant pan with the vinegar mixture, allowing it to reduce by about half', '6:  Season with salt and pepper and set aside', '7: For the Crispy Garbanzo Beans: These are best (in my opinion) when deep fried until crispy in 325-degree vegetable 1 tablespoon sesame 1 tablespoon canola 1 tablespoon canola oil', '8: ', '9: ', "10:  but they're\xa0also very good when baked at 350 degrees in an oven", '11: If frying; toss the garbanzo\xa0beans with all spices and fry them for about 4 minutes, until golden brown and crunchy', '12: ', '13: ', '14:  then drain them on a paper\xa0towel while cooling', '15: If baking; toss the garbanzo beans with the 1 tablespoon sesame 1 tablespoon canola 1 tablespoon canola oil, and then the spices, and bake', '16:  This will take approximately 45 minutes', '17: For the Sumac Yogurt Sauce: Combine all ingredients\xa0and keep cold until ready to 4 cups legumes (400 g) or use', '18: To assemble, place your grains in the base of a bowl', '19:  Top with warm eggplant, crispy garbanzo beans, a drizzle of 1 tablespoon sumac yogurt and fresh herbs']

ingredients: ['Soaked Spiced Dried Fruit', '2 cups seedless raisin (300 g)', '1 cup dried currant (150 g)', '1 cup prune (150 g) pitted', '1 cup dried cherry (120 g)', '1 ½ cups cherry brandy (360 mL)', '1 ½ cups dark rum (360 mL)', '1 cinnamon stick', '1 star anise', '¼ cup candied citrus peel (20 g) mixed', 'Burnt Sugar Syrup', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '2 tablespoons water', 'Cake Batter', '2 cups all-purpose flour (250 g)', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon nutmeg freshly grated', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 cup unsalted butter (225 g) softened', '1 cup dark brown sugar (220 g) packed', '6 large eggs', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon angostura bitters', '½ cup sliced almond (35 g)', 'Soaking Liquid', '½ cup cherry brandy (120 mL)', '½ cup dark rum (120 mL)', '¼ cup dry sherry (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Make the soaked spiced dried fruit: In a medium saucepan, combine the raisins, currants, prunes, cherries, 1 cup dried 1 ½ cups ½ cup cherry brandy, rum, cinnamon stick, and 1 star anise', '2:  Cook over medium heat until just boiling, then remove from the heat and let steep for 1-2 hours', '3: About 20 minutes before making the cake batter, make the burnt sugar syrup: Add the sugar to a small nonstick saucepan over medium-high heat', '4:  Let the sugar deeply caramelize, turning almost black and smoking a bit', '5:  Reduce the heat to low and carefully pour in the 2 tablespoons water (it will steam) and stir vigorously to incorporate', '6:  Let the syrup remain in saucepan while it cools, about 15 mins', '7:  If it hardens too much before using, add a little more 2 tablespoons water and stir over low heat', '8: Remove the cinnamon stick and 1 star anise from the soaked fruit mixture', '9:  Transfer to a food processor, add the candied citrus peel, and pulse into a chunky paste', '10:  Set aside', '11: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '12:  Grease 2 8-inch or 1 10-inch (25 cm) round cake pans', '13: Make the cake batter: In a medium bowl, combine the 2 cups all-purpose flour, cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon nutmeg, ¼ teaspoon ground allspice, and 2 teaspoons baking powder', '14:  Set aside', '15: In a 6 large bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar with an electric hand mixer', '16:  Once light and fluffy, beat in the eggs, 1 at a time', '17: With the mixer running, add ⅓ of the 2 cups all-purpose flour mixture then ½ of the fruit paste, then another ⅓ of the 2 cups all-purpose flour', '18:  Switch to a rubber spatula and fold in the remaining fruit paste and 2 cups all-purpose flour', '19: Add the burnt sugar syrup, ½ teaspoon vanilla, ½ teaspoon angostura bitters, and sliced almonds', '20:  Fold quickly to incorporate so the syrup doesn’t harden', '21: Transfer the batter to the prepared 2 teaspoons baking pan(s)', '22: Bake for 1 hour, then reduce the oven temperature to 250˚F (120˚C), and bake for 45 minutes more, until the cake is 1 ½ cups 1 cup ½ cup dark in color and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean', '23: While the cake is 2 teaspoons baking, make the soaking liquid: In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the rum, 1 cup dried 1 ½ cups ½ cup cherry brandy, and sherry', '24: Let the cakes to cool for 5 minutes, then carefully run a knife around the edges of the pans', '25:  Slowly pour the soaking liquid over each of the cakes, a little at a time, allowing it to soak in', '26:  (Reserve about ¼ cup for serving) Let the cakes cool completely in the pans', '27: You can serve the cake immediately, but the flavor improves with time', '28:  Wrap the cooled cakes in plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 months', '29:  Pour ½ cup of rum over the cake every 7 days to keep moist while storing', '30: Brush with more of the soaking liquid before slicing and serving']

ingredients: ['Candied Kumquats', '1 cup granulated sugar (200 g)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '5 kumquats thinly sliced crosswise seeds removed', 'Citrus Poppy Muffins', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '5 kumquats', '4 tangerines', '5 large meyer lemon', '1 ¼ sticks unsalted butter room temperature plus 2 tablespoons', '1 cup granulated sugar (200 g) divided plus 5 tablespoons', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 large eggs', '2 large egg yolks', '1 ¾ cups all purpose flour (215 g)', '2 tablespoons buttermilk', '1 ½ tablespoons poppy seeds', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder']
instructions: ['1: Make the candied kumquats: Prepare an ice bath in a medium bowl and set to the side with a medium fine-mesh strainer', '2: Bring a small pot of water to a boil, then add the kumquats and blanch for 1 minute', '3:  Immediately pour through the fine-mesh strainer, then set the strainer with the kumquats in the ice bath to shock (this will help keep the bright orange color of the kumquats)', '4: In the same small pot, combine the sugar and water and cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, 2–3 minutes', '5:  Add the kumquats and reduce the heat to low', '6:  Simmer for 20–30 minutes, until the kumquats are soft and translucent', '7:  Use a small strainer or fork to remove the kumquats from the syrup and transfer to a wire rack to dry, making sure that none of the slices are touching', '8:  Let cool completely', '9:  Set the pot aside', '10: Make the citrus poppy muffins: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '11:  Generously grease a standard or mini muffin tin with nonstick spray', '12: Zest the kumquats, 4 tangerines, and Meyer lemons into a small bowl', '13:  Set the citrus aside', '14: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the 1 ¼ sticks unsalted 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup sugar, the ½ teaspoon kosher salt, and citrus zest on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes', '15:  Scrape down the sides of the bowl', '16: Reduce the mixer speed to low speed and add the 2 large 2 large 2 large eggs and 2 large 2 large egg yolks, 1 at a time, mixing to incorporate between each addition', '17: Turn the mixer off and add the 1 ¾ cups all purpose flour, 1 ¼ sticks unsalted 2 tablespoons buttermilk, poppy seeds, 1 tablespoon vanilla, and 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '18:  Mix on low speed until just barely combined; do not overmix', '19: Use an ice cream scoop to scoop batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cavity half to three quarters of the way full', '20: Bake the muffins until the edges are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 12–15 minutes for regular muffins or 8–11 minutes for mini muffins', '21: Meanwhile, add the remaining 5 tablespoons of sugar, the zested kumquats and 4 tangerines, and juice of the zested Meyer lemons to a blender', '22:  Blend on low speed until the mixture is a chunky purée', '23: Pour the purée into the same pot used to candy the kumquats', '24:  Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook for about 5 minutes, until the sugar is dissolved', '25:  Remove from the heat and let steep until ready to use', '26: Once the muffins are done, remove from the oven', '27:  Set a wire rack over a 1 ½ teaspoons baking sheet and place this upside down on top of the muffins', '28:  Carefully flip the upside down to turn the muffins out of the pan while still hot, then quickly flip them right-side-up on the rack', '29:  Strain the citrus purée to remove the solids, then use a pastry brush to brush a thick layer of the purée on top of each muffin while they are still warm', '30:  Before the glaze dries, decorate the tops of the muffins with the candied kumquats', '31: The muffins are best the day they are made, but any leftovers will keep tightly wrapped at room temperature for up to 2 days']

ingredients: ['1 chicken', 'Marinade', '1 cup olive oil (200 mL)', '½ cup white vinegar (120 mL)', '8 bird-eye chillis', '8 cloves garlic', '2 medium onions', '4 teaspoons dried oregano', '4 teaspoons paprika', '2 teaspoons sugar', '4 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons pepper', '1 roasted pepper', '1 lemon juiced', 'Peri Peri Chips', '1 lb chip (500 g)', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon white pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Sides', '2 oz mayonnaise (50 g)', '2 oz hummus (50 g)', 'Preparation', '1 chicken', 'Marinade', '1 cup olive oil (200 mL)', '½ cup white vinegar (120 mL)', '8 bird-eye chillis', '8 cloves garlic', '2 medium onions', '4 teaspoons dried oregano', '4 teaspoons paprika', '2 teaspoons sugar', '4 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons pepper', '1 roasted pepper', '1 lemon juiced', 'Peri Peri Chips', '1 lb chip (500 g)', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon white pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Sides', '2 oz mayonnaise (50 g)', '2 oz hummus (50 g)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Remove the chicken’s backbone by using a pair of kitchen scissors', '2:  Turn it over and flatten it down to spread the chicken out as much as possible', '3: Blend together all of the marinade ingredients in a food processor and spread half of it over the chicken', '4: Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 3 hours or overnight', '5: Roast in the centre of a preheated oven for 60 minutes at 200°C (400°F), or until the thickest part of the thigh is 75°C', '6:  Once the chicken is cooked through, allow to rest for 10 minutes before serving', '7: Simmer the other half of the marinade for 2-3 minutes to make the Peri Peri sauce', '8: Use as a dip for your chicken or mix some into mayonnaise or hummus!To make Peri Peri Chips, just shake some smoked paprika, chili powder, garlic powder and white pepper into your chips!']

ingredients: ['4 slices bacon', '2 chicken breasts sliced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons italian seasoning', '1 teaspoon paprika', '2 cloves garlic minced', '2 cups spinach (80 g)', '4 small tomatoes diced', '1 ½ cups cream (360 mL)', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (100 g) plus more for serving', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes plus more for garnish', '10 oz penne pasta (285 g) cooked until al dente', '3 tablespoons Chopped fresh parsley for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a deep skillet, fry the 4 slices bacon until crispy', '2:  Remove to a paper towel to drain, then chop', '3: In the same skillet, add the 2 chicken and season with salt, ½ teaspoon ½ teaspoon red pepper, Italian seasoning, and 1 teaspoon paprika', '4:  Cook until no longer pink inside', '5: Add the 2 cloves garlic and cook until softened', '6: Add 2 cups spinach and 4 small tomatoes and cook until the 2 cups spinach is wilted', '7: Add the 1 ½ cups cream, Parmesan, an ½ teaspoon red ½ teaspoon ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes and bring to a boil', '8: Add the 10 oz penne and 4 slices bacon, and stir until fully coated in sauce', '9: Serve with 3 tablespoons Chopped fresh parsley, Parmesan, and ½ teaspoon red ½ teaspoon ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes, if desired']

ingredients: ['1 mini watermelon sliced', '6 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 teaspoons rice vinegar', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 lime juiced', '1 tablespoon agave nectar', '2 scallions minced', '2 tablespoons fresh ginger minced', '2 tablespoons white sesame seeds toasted', '1 teaspoon red chile flakes', '1 medium cucumber', '6 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons  sriracha', 'white rice cooked for serving', 'avocado sliced for serving', 'shelled edamame for serving', 'nori sheet for serving', 'pickled ginger for serving', 'fresh cilantro for serving', 'peanut crushed for serving', 'black sesame seed for garnish optional']
instructions: ['1: Using a sharp knife, cut around the 1 mini watermelon slices rind to remove, then dice into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes', '2: Transfer 4 cups (600 g) to a 1 medium bowl, reserving the rest for another use', '3: In a small bowl, combine the 6 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 teaspoons white rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon 2 tablespoons white black sesame oil, 1 lime juice, 1 tablespoon agave, 2 scallions, 2 tablespoons fresh pickled ginger, white 1 tablespoon 2 tablespoons white black sesame seeds, and 1 teaspoon red chile flakes', '4:  Mix well', '5: Pour the marinade over the 1 mini watermelon cubes and stir', '6:  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let marinate in the fridge for 1 hour', '7: Slice the cucumber into thin half moons and set aside', '8: In a small bowl, combine the mayo and Sriracha', '9: To assemble the poke bowls, start with 2 teaspoons white rice as a base and top with cucumbers, avocado, shelled edamame, nori, pickled 2 tablespoons fresh pickled ginger, Sriracha mayo, fresh cilantro, and peanut crushed peanuts', '10: Add a scoop of the marinated 1 mini watermelon and use the marinade as a dressing to drizzle over the bowl', '11: Garnish with black 1 tablespoon 2 tablespoons white black sesame seeds, if desired']

ingredients: ['3 ripe bananas', '⅓ cup butter (75 g) melted', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '1 egg beaten', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon baking soda', 'salt to taste', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour (185 g)', '½ cup mini chocolate chips (85 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: In a bowl, add the 3 ripe bananas and mash until smooth', '3:  Add in the melted ⅓ cup butter and stir until well combined', '4: Add the ½ cup sugar, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1 teaspoon baking soda, salt, and 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour, and stir until the batter is smooth', '5: Add in the ½ cup mini chocolate chips and pour the batter into a greased loaf pan', '6:  Top with additional ½ cup mini chocolate chips', '7: Bake for 50 minutes to an hour, or until a toothpick comes out clean', '8: Cool completely before serving']

ingredients: ['1 head cauliflower', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '¼ cup sour cream (60 g) or greek yogurt', '½ cup shredded cheddar cheese (50 g)', 'fresh parsley chopped optional']
instructions: ['1: Cut 1 head cauliflower into small florets, about 4 cups (1', '2: 2 kg)', '3: Add 1 head cauliflower florets into a 6-quart (6 L) Dutch oven of boiling water and boil for 5 minutes', '4: Drain the 1 head cauliflower in a colander, and return to the pot', '5:  Reduce heat to low', '6: Add in salt, pepper, and ¼ cup sour cream, and stir until thoroughly combined', '7: Stir in ½ cup shredded cheddar cheese until melted', '8: Remove from heat', '9:  Top with fresh parsley (optional)']

ingredients: ['12 graham crackers crushed', '½ cup butter (115 g) melted', '24 oz cream cheese (680 g) at room temperature', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '4 large eggs', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', 'hot water for baking', 'mixed berry for garnish', 'fresh mint for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350ºF (180ºC)', '2:  Grease a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick spray', '3:  In a medium bowl, stir together the crushed graham crackers and melted butter until combined', '4: Transfer the graham cracker mixture to the prepared pan and use the bottom of a dry measuring cup to press into an even layer', '5:  Bake the crust for 20 minutes, or until starting to turn golden brown', '6:  Remove from the oven and let cool completely', '7: In a 4 large bowl, mix together the 24 oz cream cheese and sugar with an electric hand mixer until smooth', '8: Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating between each addition until incorporated', '9:  Add the 1 tablespoon vanilla and beat to combine', '10: Wrap the bottom of the springform pan tightly with aluminum foil', '11:  Place a paper towel in the bottom of a 4 large, high-walled baking dish 4 large enough to fit the springform pan', '12:  Place the springform pan in the baking dish and pour the 24 oz cream cheese filling over the crust', '13:  Fill the baking dish with hot water until it reaches halfway up the sides of the springform pan, being careful not to splash any into the cheesecake', '14: Bake for 1 hour, or until slightly jiggly in the center and set around the edges', '15:  Remove from the oven and let cool completely', '16: Refrigerate the cheesecake for 12 hours, or overnight', '17: Release the springform and transfer the cheesecake to a serving platter', '18:  Garnish the top of the cheesecake with fresh berries, then slice and serve']

ingredients: ['1 ginger 3 in (7 cm) peeled and cut into large chunks', '2 shallots peeled and cut in half ', '2 racks baby back ribs membranes removed ', '2 tablespoons McCormick All Purpose Seasoning Himalayan Pink Salt with Black Pepper and Garlic', '2 cups brown sugar (400 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '½ cup lime juice (120 mL)', '3 tablespoons Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce plus 2 teaspoons divided', '4 tablespoons cold butter', 'fresh cilantro chopped for garnish', 'lime wedge for garnish', 'scallion chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 275ºF', '2: Place 1 ginger in a small food processor', '3:  Process until fully broken down into small pieces', '4:  Add 2 shallots and pulse until 2 shallots are in small pieces', '5:  Set mixture aside', '6: Place ribs on sheet trays covered with aluminum foil', '7:  Generously season both sides of the 2 racks with McCormick All Purpose Seasoning Himalayan Pink Salt with Black Pepper and Garlic', '8:  Spread 1 ginger-shallot mixture over the top of each rib rack', '9:  Cover ribs tightly with foil', '10: Cook ribs in oven for 2½ –3 hours, until tender', '11:  Remove from oven', '12: Preheat broiler', '13: Combine 2 cups brown sugar, ½ cup water, lime juice, and 3 tablespoons Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce in a small pot over medium heat', '14:  Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally to dissolve sugar', '15:  Let simmer until caramel thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 7–10 minutes', '16:  Melt in cold butter and immediately turn off heat', '17:  Stir in the extra 2 teaspoons of fish sauce', '18: Unwrap ribs and brush evenly with caramel sauce', '19: Broil ribs for 1–2 minutes (keeping a close eye because they will burn quickly)', '20: Remove from oven and brush with another layer of caramel sauce', '21:  Broil a second time for 1–2 minutes', '22: Slice ribs and serve with a heavy fresh cilantro chopped for lime wedge for scallion chopped for garnish of fresh cilantro and scallions, with lime wedges on the side']

ingredients: ['Cake', '¾ cup flour (95 g)', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoons McCormick cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '3 eggs', '1 cup sugar (200 g)', '⅔ cup pumpkin puree (150 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'Filling', '12 oz cream cheese (335 g) softened', '8 tablespoons butter softened', '1 ½ cups powdered sugar (180 g) sifted', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', 'powdered sugar for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375ºF (190°C)', '2:  Line a 10 x 15-inch (25', '3: 5 x 38 cm) baking sheet with parchment paper', '4: Cake: In a medium bowl, whisk together ¾ cup flour, baking powder, baking soda, McCormick Cinnamon, ground ginger, ground nutmeg, ground cloves, and salt', '5: In a separate bowl, whisk 3 eggs and 1 cup 1 ½ cups powdered powdered sugar together', '6:  Whisk in ⅔ cup pumpkin puree and vanilla extract until smooth', '7: Add dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and whisk until smooth', '8: Pour batter onto baking sheet and smooth with a spatula', '9:  Bake for 12–13 minutes', '10:  Remove from oven', '11: Carefully remove cake from pan by holding onto the parchment paper', '12:  Move cake to a cutting board covered with a dish towel', '13:  Roll cake up, short end to short end, rolling the dish towel up with the cake', '14:  Let cool completely', '15: Filling: Stir together all ingredients until smooth', '16: Unroll cake and spread with the filling', '17:  Roll cake up, peeling back the parchment paper as you go', '18:  Refrigerate for 1 hour', '19: Dust with powdered 1 cup 1 ½ cups powdered powdered sugar', '20:  Slice and serve!']

ingredients: ['1 head cauliflower', '¾ lb flank steak (340 g) sliced into small strips', '2 cups broccoli floret (350 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons brown sugar']
instructions: ['1: Remove all leaves and cut the 1 head cauliflower into small florets', '2: Place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture', '3:  Be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy', '4:  Set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired', '5: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the ¾ lb flank steak until no pink is showing', '6:  Add the 2 cups broccoli, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and 2 tablespoons brown sugar', '7: Cook for 4-5 minutes until most of the liquid has reduced', '8: Add the 1 head cauliflower rice, then cook for about 3-4 more minutes']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 lb jar peaches (455 g) chopped', '⅓ cup brown sugar (75 g)', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', '¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '2 lb pizza dough (905 g)', 'oil for frying', '½ cup powdered sugar (60 g)']
instructions: ['1: Add the 2 2 1 tablespoons unsalted butter and 1 lb jar peaches to a pan over medium-low heat and cook until the 2 2 1 tablespoons unsalted butter has melted and 1 lb jar peaches are glossy', '2: In a small bowl mix together the ⅓ cup brown sugar, ½ teaspoon cinnamon, 1 2 1 tablespoon flour, and ¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '3:  Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the 1 lb jar peaches', '4:  Mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken', '5:  Remove from heat and set aside to cool', '6: On a floured surface, roll out the 2 lb pizza dough to ¼-inch (6-mm) thick', '7:  Cut the dough into 20 rectangles', '8: Spoon 1 2 1 tablespoon of the peach filling onto a cut piece of dough', '9:  Fold the dough over lengthwise and crimp the edges so the filling is well sealed', '10:  Repeat with remaining dough and filling', '11: Heat oil in a large pot to 350°F (180°C)', '12: Working in batches, fry beignets for 3-4 minutes each, flipping halfway, until puffy and golden ⅓ cup brown', '13: Transfer beignets to a paper towel-lined plate or wired rack to drain', '14: Dust with ½ cup powdered sugar']

ingredients: ['4 boneless chicken thighs', '1 head romaine lettuce chopped', '½ cup cherry tomato (100 g) halved', '½ red onion thinly sliced', '2 avocados chopped', 'Chicken marinade', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 jalapeño pepper minced', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon honey', '4 tablespoons lime juice', 'Dressing', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '4 tablespoons lime juice']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the 4 boneless chicken Chicken marinade', '2: Toss in the 4 boneless chicken thighs and marinate for at least one hour', '3: In a cast-iron skillet, cook 4 boneless chicken on high heat until there is a nice sear on the surface of the 4 boneless chicken, and the inside is no longer pink', '4:  Roughly four minutes each side', '5:  Set 4 boneless chicken aside', '6: Place chopped 1 head romaine lettuce, tomatoes, ½ red onion, and 2 avocados in a large salad bowl', '7: Slice cooked 4 boneless chicken thighs and add to the salad bowl', '8: In a small bowl, combine all the ingredients for the dressing', '9:  Mix well', '10: Toss the salad with the dressing and serve immediately']

ingredients: ['1 lb jumbo shrimp (455 g)', '3 limes', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 head romaine lettuce chopped', '½ cup cherry tomato (100 g) or grape tomato halved', '⅓ cup fresh cilantro (15 g) roughly chopped', '2 avocados chopped', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon honey', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 bag blue corn tortilla chips']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, toss 1 lb jumbo shrimp with salt, pepper, and juice from one lime', '2: Sauté 1 lb jumbo shrimp around 1-2 minutes each side, until the 1 lb jumbo shrimp is pink and cooked through', '3:  Avoid overcrowding the pan, so you may need to sauté the 1 lb jumbo shrimp in batches', '4:  Set aside', '5: Place chopped 1 head romaine lettuce, tomatoes, ⅓ cup fresh cilantro, and 2 avocados, in a large salad bowl', '6: In a small bowl, mix 4 tablespoons olive oil, juice from 2 3 limes, 1 tablespoon honey, ½ teaspoon chili powder, salt and pepper to form the dressing', '7: Toss salad with dressing', '8:  Add Shrimp and toss', '9: Add 1 bag blue corn tortilla chips to the sides of the bowls']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion chopped', '2 bell peppers seeded and chopped', '1 jalapeño seeded and chopped', '4 cloves garlic', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '4 boneless skinless chicken breasts', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon cumin', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '15 oz refried bean (425 g) 1 can', '3 tomatoes seeded chopped', '15 oz black beans (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz tomato sauce (425 g) 1 can', '3 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '¼ cup lime juice (60 mL)', '2 cups cotija cheese (450 g) divided', 'cooked rice to serve', 'avocado to serve', 'sour cream to serve', 'pico de gallo to serve']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Add a tablespoon of olive oil to a skillet over medium-high heat', '3:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the 1 onion, 2 bell 2 bell 3 3 chipotle peppers, jalapenos, 4 cloves 1 tablespoon garlic, salt, and 2 bell 3 3 chipotle pepper', '4:  Cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and caramelized, about 15 minutes', '5:  Set aside to coolPlace 4 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts in a bowl near a wide work surface', '6: Combine the salt, 2 bell 3 3 chipotle pepper, paprika, oregano, cumin, 4 cloves 1 tablespoon garlic powder in a small bowl, and mix together with a fork', '7: Pour half of the spice mixture onto the 4 boneless skinless chicken, set the other half aside to use later', '8: Rub all the spices onto the 4 boneless skinless chicken until completely coated', '9: To pound out the 4 boneless skinless chicken, first take a 4 boneless skinless chicken breast and butterfly it by slicing half way into it to open it like a book, making sure not to slice it all the way through', '10:  Cover the breast with parchment paper or plastic wrap', '11:  Gently pound the meat with a mallet or rolling pin until it is evenly flattened, about ¼ inch (6 mm) in thickness', '12: Onto each pounded 4 boneless skinless chicken breast, rub on about 2 3 tablespoons refried beans, 1 tablespoon 1 onion 2 bell 2 bell 3 3 chipotle peppers seeded and 1 jalapeño seeded and 3 3 tomatoes seeded chopped 3 tomatoes, 1 tablespoon 2 cups cotija cheese, and 1 tablespoon cooked black beans', '13:  Make sure to not overfill the pounded 4 boneless skinless chicken', '14: Carefully roll the 4 boneless skinless chicken breast until the ends overlap and then place the 4 boneless skinless chicken into a greased baking dish', '15: Bake for 20 minutes or until the 4 boneless skinless chicken is fully opaque and reaches at least 165°F (75°C)', '16: For the 3 chipotle sauce, add the tomato sauce, 3 chipotle 2 bell 3 3 chipotle peppers, tomato paste, ¼ cup lime juice, and the remaining spice mixture to a blender and puree until smooth', '17: Pour the sauce over the cooked 4 boneless skinless chicken roll ups and sprinkle with more 2 cups cotija cheese', '18: Broil for 5 minutes or until the sauce bubbles and the cheese melts and browns slightly', '19: Serve with cooked rice, avocado, sour cream, and/or pico de gallo']

ingredients: ['1 can unsalted chickpeas drained and skins removed (15 ounce - 425 grams)', '2 ½ cups hot water (600 mL)', '2 tablespoons lemon juice divided plus 1 teaspoon', '2 teaspoons unrefined coconut oil', '½ cup almond meal (75 g)', '¼ cup dark brown sugar (55 g)', '1 tablespoon granulated sugar', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '⅛ teaspoon baking soda', '⅔ cup vegan dark chocolate (115 g)', 'Special Equipment', 'food processor', 'Preparation', '1 can unsalted chickpeas drained and skins removed (15 ounce - 425 grams)', '2 ½ cups hot water (600 mL)', '2 tablespoons lemon juice divided plus 1 teaspoon', '2 teaspoons unrefined coconut oil', '½ cup almond meal (75 g)', '¼ cup dark brown sugar (55 g)', '1 tablespoon granulated sugar', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '⅛ teaspoon baking soda', '⅔ cup vegan dark chocolate (115 g)', 'Special Equipment', 'food processor', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, mix together the skinned chickpeas, hot water, and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice', '2:  Soak for 10–20 minutes to help remove some of the canned chickpea flavor', '3:  Drain and rinse the chickpeas in cold water to cool', '4: Add the drained chickpeas, remaining teaspoon of lemon juice, and the coconut oil to a food processor', '5:  Blend until completely smooth', '6:  Add the almond meal, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla, salt, and baking soda', '7:  Blend until completely smooth, scraping down the sides as necessary', '8: Transfer the ‘dough’ to a medium bowl and fold in the chocolate chips', '9: Cover the bowl and transfer to the refrigerator to cool for 1 hour (or freeze for 30 minutes), until stiffened to the consistency of cookie dough', '10:  The dough will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days']

ingredients: ['Peaches and Cream', '2 large ripe yellow peaches pitted and thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons granulated sugar', '1 cup whipped cream (240 mL)', 'Fried Chicken Sando', '1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (455 g)', '½ cup pickle brine (120 mL)', '½ cup all purpose flour (60 g)', '1 tablespoon powdered sugar', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon celery salt', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ cup buttermilk', '1 large egg white', '1 tablespoon vodka', '1 qt vegetable oil (1 L) for frying', 'Hot Honey', '½ cup honey (165 g)', '1 habanero pepper seeded and thinly sliced', 'Preparation', 'Peaches and Cream', '2 large ripe yellow peaches pitted and thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons granulated sugar', '1 cup whipped cream (240 mL)', 'Fried Chicken Sando', '1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (455 g)', '½ cup pickle brine (120 mL)', '½ cup all purpose flour (60 g)', '1 tablespoon powdered sugar', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon celery salt', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ cup buttermilk', '1 large egg white', '1 tablespoon vodka', '1 qt vegetable oil (1 L) for frying', 'Hot Honey', '½ cup honey (165 g)', '1 habanero pepper seeded and thinly sliced', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat', '2:  Place the donuts top-side down on the grill and cook until golden brown and caramelized, about 30 seconds', '3:  Remove the donuts from the grill and set aside', '4: Make the peaches and cream: In a medium bowl, toss together the peaches and granulated sugar', '5:  Let macerate for at least 30 minutes at room temperature, or cover and refrigerate overnight', '6: Slice a grilled donut in half', '7:  Place the bottom half on a plate and top with a dollop of whipped cream and some macerated peaches, then finish with the top half of the donut', '8:  Repeat with 2 more grilled donuts and the remaining whipped cream and peaches', '9: Make the fried chicken: Add the chicken and pickle brine to a large zip-top bag', '10:  Let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes', '11: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, powdered sugar, salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, celery salt, and baking powder', '12:   In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, egg white, and vodka', '13: Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat until the temperature reaches 350°F (180°C)', '14:  Place a wire rack over a baking sheet', '15: Remove the chicken from the pickle brine and pat dry with paper towels', '16:  Coat each thigh in the flour mixture', '17:  Dip in the buttermilk mixture, then back in the flour mixture to coat', '18: Working in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the pot, fry the chicken in the hot oil until golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C)', '19:  Transfer to the wire rack', '20: Make the hot honey: In a small skillet over medium heat, combine the honey and habanero and bring to a boil', '21:  Continue cooking until the honey thickens slightly, about 10 minutes', '22: Slice a grilled donut in half', '23:  Place a piece of fried chicken on the donut, drizzle with the hot honey, and finish with the top half of the donut', '24:  Repeat with 2 more grilled donuts and the remaining chicken and hot honey', '25:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 cups non dairy milk (480 mL)', '2 cups all purpose flour (250 g)', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 cauliflower cut into 1 1/2 inch ( 3 cm) florets ', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '3 cloves garlic minced ', '1 piece fresh ginger minced', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ cup orange juice (120 mL)', '½ cup brown sugar (100 g)', '¼ cup distilled white vinegar (60 mL)', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL)', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '2 tablespoons cold water', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', 'white rice for serving', '3 scallions thinly sliced for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 450˚F (230°C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with 2 cups nonstick spray', '3: In a medium bowl, whisk together the 2 cups non-dairy milk, 2 cups all purpose flour, and 2 teaspoons kosher salt', '4: One at a time, dip each 1 cauliflower floret in the batter to coat, letting any excess batter drip off', '5:  Arrange the battered 1 cauliflower on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they aren’t touching one another', '6:  Lightly spray with cooking spray', '7: Bake for 30–35 minutes, until the coating is crispy and beginning to ½ cup brown', '8: While the 1 cauliflower is baking, make the sauce: Heat the 1 tablespoon canola oil in a medium skillet over medium heat', '9:  When the oil is shimmering, add the 3 cloves garlic, 1 piece fresh ginger, and ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '10:  Cook for 2–3 minutes, until fragrant, stirring frequently to prevent burning', '11: Add the ½ cup orange juice, ½ cup brown sugar, ¼ cup distilled white vinegar, and ¼ cup soy sauce', '12:  Cook for 2–3 minutes, until the ½ cup brown sugar is dissolved and the mixture begins to simmer', '13: In a small bowl, stir together the 2 tablespoons cornstarch and 2 tablespoons cold water with a fork', '14: Add the slurry to the sauce, stirring to combine', '15:  Simmer for another 2 minutes, until the sauce thickens', '16:  Mix in the 1 teaspoon sesame oil, then transfer the sauce to a large bowl', '17: Toss the hot 1 cauliflower florets in the sauce until well coated', '18: Serve the 1 cauliflower over white rice and garnish with the 3 scallions']

ingredients: ['¾ lb ground beef (340 g)', '½ tablespoon salt', '½ tablespoon pepper', '2 tablespoons white onion diced divided', '1 slice provolone cheese quartered', '1 sesame bun butter-toasted', '1 green leaf lettuce', '1 tablespoon white onion diced', 'Preparation', '¾ lb ground beef (340 g)', '½ tablespoon salt', '½ tablespoon pepper', '2 tablespoons white onion diced divided', '1 slice provolone cheese quartered', '1 sesame bun butter-toasted', '1 green leaf lettuce', '1 tablespoon white onion diced', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, salt, and pepper', '2: In a ramekin, spread two-thirds of the beef patty evenly along the bottom and the sides', '3: Place half the diced onion and provolone in the well', '4: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)', '5: Place the rest of beef patty on top and pat to flatten', '6: Place the ramekin on a baking sheet along with a sesame bun, face down', '7: Bake for 25 minutes', '8: Assemble the burger with the sesame bun, lettuce, and the rest of the onion']

ingredients: ['1 lb ground turkey (455 g) can use lean ground beef as well', '1 teaspoon garlic powder to season ground turkey/ground beef', '1 teaspoon onion powder to season ground turkey/ground beef', '1 tablespoon olive oil to cook ground turkey/ground beef', '¼ onion chopped', '1 can chili beans', '1 can dark red kidney beans drained', '1 can pinto bean drained', '1 can tomato chopped hot or mild i used mild', '1 can crushed pineapple crushed', '1 package chili seasoning', '1 can sweet corn used small can', '1 tablespoon banana peppers jar', '1 tablespoon jalapeño chopped heaped', '1 tablespoon banana pepper juice', '1 tablespoon jalapeño pepper juice', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper optional', '1 tablespoon brown sugar optional to minimize spiciness of chili']
instructions: ['1: Heat 1 tbsp 1 tablespoon olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat, add chopped onions, and cook until translucent', '2:  Then, add 1 lb 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon garlic powder to season 1 teaspoon onion powder to season 1 tablespoon 1 tablespoon olive oil to cook ground turkey/beef, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and onion powder and cook well', '3: Once done, add meat, onions, and remaining ingredients to a crockpot, cover, and cook on high heat for 5-6 hours', '4:  (Can cook overnight as well)', '5: Serve with desired toppings and bread or rice']

ingredients: ['Xawaash', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cardamom', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon nutmeg', 'Rice Pilaf', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL)', '1 medium yellow onion thinly sliced', '3 cloves garlic thinly sliced', '1 small tomato diced', '1 cinnamon stick', 'salt to taste', '1 vegetable stock cube', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) chopped', '1 tablespoon xawaash xawaash', '2 cups basmati rice (400 g) soaked for at least 1 hour and drained', '2 ½ cups hot water (600 mL)', '1 drop red food coloring mixed with 1 teaspoon of water', '3 drops orange food coloring mixed with 1 teaspoon of water', '¼ cup raisin (40 g)', 'Rice Topping', '1 large russet potato cut into 1/4-in (6-mm) thick matchsticks and patted dry', '⅛ teaspoon orange food coloring mixed with 1/2 teaspoon of water', 'oil for frying', '1 medium yellow onion thinly sliced', '½ red bell pepper sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Make the 1 tablespoon xawaash: In a medium bowl, combine the 1 tablespoon ground cumin, 1 tablespoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon ground turmeric, 1 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1 teaspoon black pepper, cloves, and ¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '3:  Set aside', '4: Heat a medium oven-safe pan over medium-high heat', '5:  Add the vegetable ¼ cup vegetable oil, onion, 1 small tomato, garlic, and 1 cinnamon stick', '6:  Cook until the onions have softened slightly, 5-6 minutes', '7: Season with salt, then add the vegetable stock cube and ¼ cup fresh cilantro', '8:  Cook for 1 minute, breaking up the stock cube', '9: Reduce the heat to medium, then stir in the 1 tablespoon xawaash and soaked 2 cups basmati rice', '10:  Cook for about 3 minutes so 2 cups basmati rice grains lightly toast', '11: Pour in the 2 ½ cups hot water and increase the heat to high to bring to a boil', '12:  Cover the pot, transfer to the oven, and bake for 20 minutes', '13:  Check periodically to be sure the 2 cups basmati rice has enough water', '14: Remove the cooked 2 cups basmati rice from the oven and drizzle the red and orange food colorings on top', '15:  Gently mix so there are different colored grains', '16: Sprinkle the raisins over the 2 ½ cups hot 2 cups basmati rice, cover, and set aside', '17: To prepare the topping, mix the potatoes with the orange food coloring in a medium bowl (wear gloves to avoid stained fingers!)', '18: Heat about 1 inch ( 2 cm) of ¼ cup vegetable oil in a 1 large heavy-bottomed saucepan', '19:  Add the potatoes and cook for 5-6 minutes, then transfer to a baking sheet lined with paper towels to drain the excess ¼ cup vegetable oil', '20: In the same ¼ cup vegetable oil, fry the onion slices until browned and crispy, 2-3 minutes', '21:  Add the red peppers cooking for an additional minute', '22:  Drain on paper towels', '23: To assemble the 2 cups basmati rice, transfer the pilaf to a 1 large serving platter', '24:  Top with the fried potatoes, crispy onions, and red bell peppers']

ingredients: ['½ cup almond flour (50 g)', '1 ½ cups pitted date (255 g) chopped', '1 cup raisin (150 g)', '⅓ cup almond butter (80 g)', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup rolled oats (100 g)']
instructions: ['1: Place almond flour and dates in a food processor and pulse until sticky', '2: Add the raisins, almond butter, 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and ¼ teaspoon salt, and pulse until a sticky dough forms', '3:   Add 1 tablespoon of water if batter seems too dry', '4: Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the 1 cup rolled oats', '5: Roll the mixture into tablespoon-sized balls and let sit at room temperature for 2-4 hours', '6: Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week']

ingredients: ['2 ½ cups raw peanuts (310 g)', '1 ½ cups pitted date (255 g)', '⅓ cup chocolate chips (60 g)', '1 pinch salt', '3 tablespoons milk or water', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'chocolate melted for drizzling']
instructions: ['1: Line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper', '2: Add the 2 ½ cups raw peanuts, dates, chocolate chips, 1 pinch salt, 3 tablespoons milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla to a food processor and pulse until the mixture starts to clump together', '3: Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press into an even layer', '4: Drizzle the top with melted chocolate, if desired', '5: Chill for 1 hour', '6: Remove the bars from the baking dish by lifting the parchment paper', '7:  Cut into 12 individual bars', '8: Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb sweet potato (680 g) preferably japanese diced', '1 bottle white wine', '5 sprigs fresh thyme', '5 sprigs fresh parsley', '2 leeks', '3 tablespoons butter melted', '3 cloves garlic', '12 corn tortillas', '12 oz oaxacan cheese (350 g) or panela cheese', '½ cup feta cheese (110 g) crumbled', '¼ cup toasted pine nut (35 g) or slivered almonds', '1 cup scallion (100 g) green parts only thinly sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2: Trim and discard the tough 1 cup scallion (100 g) green parts from the 2 leeks, then cut them in in half lengthwise', '3:  Swirl in water to remove any sand', '4:  Pat dry', '5: On a large baking tray, place the 2 leeks, 1 ½ lb sweet potatoes and 3 cloves garlic', '6:  Pour melted butter and salt evenly over the vegetables', '7: Bake for 25 minutes', '8: In a large saucepan, bring the 1 bottle white wine, 5 sprigs fresh thyme and 5 sprigs fresh parsley to a boil and cook until it loses the raw alcohol smell, about 5 minutes', '9:  Reduce the heat to a bare simmer', '10: When the 2 leeks are golden take both 2 leeks and 3 cloves garlic off the tray', '11:  Place potatoes back in the oven for another 20 minutes', '12: Add 2 leeks and 3 cloves garlic into the simmering wine sauce', '13:  Cook until 2 leeks are tender, about 30 minutes', '14: Melt 2 3 tablespoons butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat', '15:  Pull the 2 leeks from the cooking liquid, pat them dry and add to the butter to cook briefly on both sides, about 3 minutes total', '16: Remove the stem ends from the 2 leeks and cut into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths', '17: For each taco, heat 2 12 corn tortillas on a griddle or in a large skillet over medium-high heat with a little butter', '18:  Place 2 slices of Oaxaca 12 oz oaxacan ½ cup ½ cup feta cheese next to them on the griddle', '19:  When the 12 corn tortillas are warmed through, stack them on top of the 12 oz oaxacan ½ cup ½ cup feta cheese', '20: When the 12 oz oaxacan ½ cup ½ cup feta cheese has browned on one side, remove the 12 corn tortillas and 12 oz oaxacan ½ cup ½ cup feta cheese to a plate, 12 oz oaxacan ½ cup ½ cup feta cheese-side up', '21: Add 2 to 3 strips of leek and some 1 ½ lb sweet potato', '22:  Spoon over 1½ to 2 teaspoons salsa and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons crumbled ½ cup feta, a few ¼ cup toasted pine nuts, and 1 teaspoon minced 1 cup scallion (100 g) green onions and serve immediately', '23:  Repeat using the remaining ingredients']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons canola oil', '½ medium white onion diced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '2 tablespoons curry powder mixed with 2 tablespoons of cold water', '2 cups vegetable broth (480 mL) or water divided', '3 lb potato (1.3 kg) cubed', '½ cup fresh scallion (50 g) chopped', '2 teaspoons fresh parsley chopped', 'pepper to taste', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 2-cans drained and rinsed', '1 tablespoon ghee mixed with 1 tablespoon of flour']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 2 tablespoons canola oil in a large stockpot over ½ medium-high heat and add the onion and 2 cloves garlic', '2:  Sauté until soft, about 2-3 minutes', '3: Add the 2 tablespoons curry powder mixture to the pot', '4: Add half of the 2 cups vegetable broth and potatoes, and stir to combine', '5: Add the scallions and 2 teaspoons fresh parsley', '6:  Season with pepper', '7:  Cook until the sauce is thick and the potatoes are almost tender, about 20 minutes', '8: Add the 15 oz chickpeas and remaining 2 cups vegetable broth, and mix', '9: Add the 1 tablespoon ghee and flour mixture to the pot and stir to incorporate', '10: Cook on ½ medium-low heat until the potatoes and 15 oz chickpeas are tender and the sauce thickens, about 20 minutes']

ingredients: ['3 tablespoons thai fish sauce', '3 tablespoons tamarind paste', '3 tablespoons light brown sugar', '½ lime juiced', '4 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 eggs beaten', '2 chicken breasts finely sliced', '½ lb raw prawn (200 g) shelled and patted dry', '2 spring onions finely sliced', '1 chilli finely sliced', '⅔ cup fresh coriander (30 g) finely chopped', '1 teaspoon garlic crushed', '3 ½ cups flat rice noodle (600 g) cooked', '1 cup bean sprout (100 g)', '1 handful roasted peanut roughly chopped', 'lime wedge to serve']
