instructions: ['1: Combine the 3 tablespoons tamarind, 3 tablespoons thai fish sauce, 3 tablespoons light brown sugar, and lime juice with 1 tbsp water and set aside', '2: Cook the 2 eggs in 1 tablespoon of 4 tablespoons vegetable oil and set aside', '3: Add 1 tablespoon of 4 tablespoons vegetable oil to the frying pan', '4:  Sear the 2 chicken until golden and 3 ½ cups flat rice noodle (600 g) cooked through', '5: Add the prawns to the pan, and cook for about 2 minutes or until they just turn red', '6: Tip in half of the 2 spring onions, chili, half the ⅔ cup fresh coriander, and 1 teaspoon garlic', '7:  Cook for 1 minute until fragrant, then set asideHeat 1 tablespoon of 4 tablespoons vegetable oil in the wok, then add the noodles and 1 cup bean sprouts', '8:  Stir-fry for 2 minutes until the noodles have separated and everything is heated through', '9: Add the 2 chicken, prawns, 2 eggs and 3 tablespoons tamarind sauce', '10:  Toss with the noodles until well-coated', '11: To serve, scatter over the 1 handful roasted peanuts, remaining 2 spring onions, ⅔ cup fresh coriander leaves, and lime wedges']

ingredients: ['3 cups flour (375 g)', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon cinnamon', '½ teaspoon allspice', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '3 eggs', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '1 tablespoon vanilla', '1 cup apple cider (240 mL)', '1 cup whole milk (240 mL)', 'vegetable oil for frying', 'powdered sugar for dusting', 'ice cream optional']
instructions: ['1: Combine 3 cups flour, ½ teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon cinnamon, ½ teaspoon allspice and 2 teaspoons baking powder in a bowl', '2: In separate bowl, combine 3 eggs, ¼ cup powdered sugar and 1 tablespoon vanilla', '3:  Blend', '4: Add 1 cup apple cider and 1 cup whole milk', '5:  Blend until well incorporated', '6: Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, blend until you have a smooth and creamy batter', '7: Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet', '8: Transfer the batter into a zipper bag and trim the corner', '9: Pour batter in funnel cake shapes into the hot oil', '10:  Once golden brown, flip and cook the other side (1 min max)', '11: Remove and drain on paper towel', '12: Dust with powdered ¼ cup powdered sugar and top with ice cream', '13: Nutrition  Calories: 2301 Fat: 139 grams  Carbs: 249 grams  Fiber: 4 grams  Sugars: 161 grams  Protein: 18 grams']

ingredients: ['olive oil to taste', '½ large yellow onion diced', '1 cup mushroom (75 g) diced', '½ cup sun-dried tomato (100 g) drained', '3 cloves garlic minced', '15 oz white bean (425 g) or cannellini beans 2 cans rinsed and drained', '15 oz fire-roasted tomato (425 g) 1 can', '15 oz artichoke heart (425 g) 1 can drained', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'fresh basil thinly sliced for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a ½ large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, and mushrooms', '2:  Cook 5 minutes, or until the onion begins to turn translucent', '3: Add the sun-dried tomatoes and 3 cloves garlic', '4:  Stir and cook for another 3 minutes, or until fragrant', '5: Add the 15 oz white beans, fire-roasted tomatoes, 15 oz artichoke hearts, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper', '6:  Stir to combine', '7:  Cover and reduce the heat to low', '8:  Let cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally', '9: Garnish with fresh basil and serve']

ingredients: ['1 ribeye steak 2 inch (5 cm) thick preferably USDA Prime', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons canola oil', '3 tablespoons butter', '3 cloves garlic peeled and smashed', '2 sprigs fresh rosemary', '3 sprigs fresh thyme']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 200°F (95°C)', '2: Generously season all sides of the 1 ribeye steak with salt and pepper', '3: Transfer to a wire rack on top of a baking sheet, then bake for about 45 minutes to an hour until the internal temperature reads about 125°F (51° C) for medium-rare', '4:  Adjust the bake time based on if you like your 1 ribeye steak more rare or more well-done (you monster)', '5: Heat the 3 tablespoons canola oil in a pan over high heat until smoking', '6:  Do not use olive oil, as its smoke point is significantly lower than that of 3 tablespoons canola oil and will smoke before reaching the desired cooking temperature', '7: Sear the 1 ribeye steak for 30 seconds on the first side, then flip', '8: Add the 3 tablespoons butter, 3 cloves garlic, 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, and 3 sprigs fresh thyme and swirl around the pan', '9: Transfer the 3 cloves garlic and herbs on top of the 1 ribeye steak and baste the 1 ribeye steak with the 3 tablespoons butter using a large spoon', '10: Baste for about 30 seconds, then flip and baste the other side for about 15 seconds', '11: Turn the 1 ribeye steak on its side and cook to render off any excess fat', '12: Rest the 1 ribeye steak on a cutting board or wire rack for about 10 minutes', '13:  Slicing the 1 ribeye steak before the resting period has finished will result in a lot of the juices leaking out, which may not be desirable', '14: Slice the 1 ribeye steak into ½ -inch (1 cm) strips, then fan out the slices and serve']

ingredients: ['12 bacons depending on bacon width', '⅓ cup Frank’s Red Hot Original (80 mL)', '12 slices white sandwich bread', '1 egg whisked', '¾ lb chicken (340 g) thin deli-sliced', '½ cup ranch dressing (120 g)', '½ lb monterey jack cheese (225 g) thinly sliced', 'baby spinach handful', 'ranch butter', '3 tablespoons butter melted', '3 tablespoons ranch dressing']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400ºF', '2: Lay out 12 bacon 12 slices on a parchment-lined sheet tray', '3:  Generously brush each slice with Frank’s Red Hot Original', '4:  Bake for 15–20 minutes, until 12 bacon is browned and cooked through', '5:  Drain 12 bacon on a paper towel, keeping the hot sauce brushed side facing up', '6:  Set aside', '7: Place a large piece of plastic wrap on a large cutting board (the entire board should be covered with plastic)', '8:  Place 1 slice of bread in the upper left corner of the board', '9:  Brush the right edge of the bread with whisked 1 egg, then place a second slice of bread next to the first so that it overlaps with the 1 egg wash', '10:  Press the two seams of bread together with fingers to seal', '11:  Repeat with the rest of the bread, forming 3 rows of 4 12 slices, brushing with 1 egg wash and pressing to seal wherever the 12 slices overlap', '12:  This will form a large rectangle of bread', '13: Use a rolling pin to roll out the bread rectangle as thinly as possible', '14: In the center of the rectangle, lay out half of the ¾ lb chicken in a row', '15:  Top with a drizzle of ranch dressing', '16:  Arrange half of the 12 bacon 12 slices on top (horizontally), followed by half of the sliced ½ lb monterey jack cheese and half of the baby spinach', '17:  Repeat layering with the rest of the ingredients', '18: Brush the top edge of the sandwich roll with whisked 1 egg', '19:  Roll the entire sandwich up from the bottom to form a long log', '20:  Wrap log tightly with plastic wrap', '21:  Refrigerate for 30 minutes', '22: Lower oven temperature to 350ºF', '23: Mix together melted ranch 3 tablespoons butter and ranch in a small bowl', '24:  Unwrap the sandwich log, place on a sheet tray, and brush sandwich surface with ranch ranch 3 tablespoons butter', '25: Bake for 18–20 minutes, until bread is lightly golden and ½ lb monterey jack cheese is melted', '26: Slice and serve', '27:  (Optional: Serve with more ranch for dipping']

ingredients: ['¼ cup strawberry (40 g)', '¼ cup blueberry (25 g)', '¼ cup raspberry (30 g)', '¼ cup blackberry (40 g)', '2 cups greek yogurt (570 g)', 'Toppings', 'strawberry to taste', 'blueberry to taste', 'raspberry to taste', 'blackberry to taste']
instructions: ['1: In a blender, mix fruit until consistency is smooth', '2:  Add in 2 cups greek yogurt and blend until fully mixed', '3: Pour mixture into a baking pan lined with parchment paper', '4:  Add desired amount of toppings', '5: Freeze for 6 hours, or overnight, until frozen solid', '6: Break 2 cups greek yogurt bark into desired numbers of pieces', '7: Serve cold, or store in a closed container in the freezer']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons rice wine also known as shaoxing', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '2 teaspoons ground five spice', '1 tablespoon salt', '5 cloves garlic crushed', '1 piece fresh ginger sliced 2 in (5 cm)', '2 tablespoons bean curd', '¼ cup bean curd liquid (60 mL)', '¼ cup hoisin sauce (65 g)', '½ cup honey (170 g)', '2 lb boneless pork shoulder (905 g)', '1 cup white rice (230 g) cooked for serving', '2 large bok choys steamed for serving', 'Preparation', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons rice wine also known as shaoxing', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '2 teaspoons ground five spice', '1 tablespoon salt', '5 cloves garlic crushed', '1 piece fresh ginger sliced 2 in (5 cm)', '2 tablespoons bean curd', '¼ cup bean curd liquid (60 mL)', '¼ cup hoisin sauce (65 g)', '½ cup honey (170 g)', '2 lb boneless pork shoulder (905 g)', '1 cup white rice (230 g) cooked for serving', '2 large bok choys steamed for serving', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, Shaoxing, sesame oil, five spice, salt, garlic, ginger, bean curd, bean curd liquid, hoisin, and honey', '2: Place the pork into the marinate, turn to coat completely, and cover with cling wrap', '3: Marinate for at least 3 hours, or preferably overnight', '4: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C)', '5:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set a wire rack on top', '6: Transfer the pork shoulder from the marinade to the wire rack', '7: Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes until the edges are slightly charred', '8: Pour the marinade through a strainer into a medium pot', '9: Heat the marinade on medium heat until it reduces to ¼ of its original volume, about 10 minutes', '10: Glaze the pork with the reduced marinade every 15 minutes', '11: When the pork is done, slice and serve with white rice and bok choy']

ingredients: ['2 russet potatoes sliced', '1 lb skirt steak (455 g)', '4 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons paprika', '1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (100 g)', '½ cup shredded monterey jack cheese (50 g)', 'sour cream', 'salsa optional', '2 green onions minced']
instructions: ['1: Place sliced 2 russet potatoes in a large bowl', '2:  Toss with 4 tablespoons olive oil, salt, pepper, and 2 teaspoons paprika', '3: Lay the 2 russet potatoes on a baking sheet and bake at 450˚F (230˚C) for 20 minutes', '4: Season 1 lb skirt steak with salt and pepper', '5:  Cook on high heat for roughly three minutes each side, for medium-rare', '6: Let the steak rest for 10 minutes, then slice into cubes', '7: In a cast iron skillet or baking sheet, arrange cooked 2 russet potatoes into a heap', '8:  Top with steak, then 1 cup shredded cheddar and ½ cup shredded monterey jack cheese', '9: Broil for five minutes or until the cheese is melted', '10: Serve immediately with sour cream, salsa, 2 green onions or any topping of choice']

ingredients: ['Filling', '1 lb ground pork (455 g)', '2 cups cabbage (200 g) finely chopped', '1 cup nira chives (40 g) finely chopped', '½ cup shiitake mushroom (40 g) finely chopped', '1 clove garlic grated', '1 teaspoon ginger grated', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon sake', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '80 gyoza wrappers', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '1 tablespoon flour', 'dipping sauce optional', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL)', '¼ cup rice vinegar (60 g)', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 teaspoon mirin']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, combine the 1 lb ground pork, 2 cups cabbage, nira chives, shiitake, 1 clove garlic, ginger, 1 tablespoon ¼ cup soy sauce, sesame oil, 1 tablespoon sake, salt, and black pepper', '2:  Mix well with your hands', '3: Place a teaspoon of filling in the middle of a dumpling wrapper', '4:  Using your finger, lightly wet the half of the outer rim with water', '5:  Fold the wrapper in half', '6:  Using your fingertips, make pleats to seal the dumpling', '7:  Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling', '8: In a large nonstick frying pan, heat the sesame oil over medium heat', '9:  Add the 20-22 dumplings in a circle', '10:  Fry for 1-3 minutes', '11: Combine the 1 tablespoon flour and the water in a small bowl or measuring cup', '12:  Pour into the pan and cover', '13:  Steam the dumplings until the water is mostly evapolated, 7-8 minutes', '14:  Remove the lid and continue cooking until the water is completely evaporated', '15: Place a plate on top of 80 gyoza', '16:  Flip the pan upside down while pressing the plate to invert the dumplings', '17:  Cook the remaining dumplings', '18: Serve with dipping sauce']

ingredients: ['2 lb green beans (910 g) trimmed', '8 tablespoons unsalted butter 1 stick divided', '2 medium white onions thinly sliced', '1 ½ lb cremini mushroom (680 g) sliced and stemmed', '5 cloves garlic sliced', '3 tablespoons all purpose flour', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '½ cup heavy cream (120 mL)', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 cup chicken broth (240 mL) or vegetable broth', '½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g)', '1 cup fried onion (250 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: In a large pot of 2 teaspoons kosher salted boiling water, blanch the 2 lb green beans for 3 minutes, until tender and bright 2 lb green', '3:  Drain and transfer to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish', '4: Melt 4 tablespoons of butter in a large pan over high heat', '5:  Add the onions and cook for 8 minutes, until softened and translucent', '6: Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, until browned', '7:  Add the 5 cloves garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 1 minute', '8: Transfer the vegetable mixture to the casserole dish with the 2 lb green beans', '9:  Wipe out the pan', '10: Melt the remaining 4 tablespoons of butter in the same pan', '11:  Add the flour and stir to combine', '12:  Cook until a golden brown roux forms, for 5 minutes', '13: Add the 1 cup milk, ½ cup heavy cream, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 cup chicken broth, and Parmesan cheese, and stir to combine', '14:  Reduce the heat to 2 medium-low and cook until the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes', '15: Pour the sauce evenly over the vegetables in the casserole dish and toss until everything is well coated', '16:  Cover with foil', '17: Bake for 20 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes', '18: Top the casserole with the 1 cup fried onions, then serve']

ingredients: ['2 lb small red potato (910 g) or yellow quartered', '4 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '4 cloves garlic minced', '4 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons fresh thyme', '2 teaspoons ginger', '2 salmon fillets', '1 bunch asparagus roughly 1 pound (455g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Cover a sheet pan with foil or parchment paper', '3:  Spread out potatoes on the pan and drizzle with olive oil', '4:  Season with salt, pepper, 2 4 cloves of garlic, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice', '5: Bake for 30 minutes', '6: Make 2 salmon glaze', '7:  Combine salt, pepper, 1 tablespoon thyme, 2 garlic 4 cloves, 2 teaspoons ginger, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice', '8:  Mix well', '9: Remove potatoes from the oven and push them to the top or side of your pan', '10:  Place your 2 salmon fillets on the pan', '11:  Brush both sides of the 2 salmon with the glaze', '12: Place 1 bunch asparagus on the pan and top with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, salt, and pepper', '13:  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of thyme on the 1 bunch asparagus and potatoes', '14: Bake for 10-12 minutes', '15:  (The 2 salmon should flake easily with a fork when it’s ready']

ingredients: ['broccoli stem from one head', 'cauliflower stem from one head', 'leek top half of one stock', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Shave the stems of the broccoli and cauliflower with a box grater', '2: Chop the top half of the leek', '3: Heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium frying pan until shimmering], then add the broccoli, cauliflower, leeks, salt, and pepper', '4:  Cook the vegetables for 5 minutes until tender', '5: Serve over salad, on bagels, or mixed in with any base you like']

ingredients: ['4 avocados halved pitted and diced', '¼ small red onion finely chopped', '½ jalapeño seeded and finely chopped', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) finely chopped', '2 tablespoons lime juice', 'kosher salt to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, mash the 4 avocados until desired consistency is reached', '2: Add the ¼ small red onion, ½ jalapeño, ¼ cup fresh cilantro, and 2 tablespoons lime juice, and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', '3:  Stir to combine']

ingredients: ['¾ lb skinless pork shoulder (340 g) or pork belly', '1 packet Omsom Lemongrass BBQ Starter', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon neutral oil such as canola or vegetable', 'Mama Pham’s Dipping Fish Sauce', '6 tablespoons warm water', '4 tablespoons sugar', '6 tablespoons fish sauce', '1 lime halved', '3 garlics minced', '1 bird’s eye chile thinly sliced', 'Vermicelli Rice Bowl optional', '12 oz vermicelli rice noodle (360 g) cooked', '½ cucumber thinly sliced', '½ cup bean sprout (50 g)', '½ head lettuce chopped', '½ bunch fresh cilantro leaves', '¼ cup peanuts (30 g) roasted and crushed']
instructions: ['1: Thinly slice the ¾ lb skinless pork into ¼-inch(6 mm) thick slices, then transfer to a medium bowl', '2:  (If the ¾ lb skinless pork is difficult to slice, place in the freezer for 20 minutes to firm up)', '3: Add the Omsom Vietnamese Lemongrass BBQ Starter and toss to coat', '4:  Marinate for at least 15 minutes at room temperature, or refrigerate up to overnight', '5: While the ¾ lb skinless pork marinates, make the dipping 6 tablespoons fish sauce: In a medium bowl, combine the 6 tablespoons warm water and 4 tablespoons sugar and stir until the 4 tablespoons sugar is dissolved', '6:  Add the 6 tablespoons fish sauce and stir to combine', '7:  Squeeze in the 1 lime juice, then use a fork to scrape the 1 lime pulp into the bowl (do not scrape the bitter pith)', '8:  Add the garlic and 1 bird’s eye chile', '9:  Refrigerate until ready to serve', '10: Heat 1 tablespoon 1 teaspoon neutral oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering', '11:  Add the ¾ lb skinless pork to the pan in a single layer and cook without disturbing until caramelized and beginning to cook through, 4–5 minutes', '12:  Toss and cook for another 2–3 minutes, until the ¾ lb skinless pork is fully cooked on all sides', '13:  Remove the ¾ lb skinless pork from the pan and serve as desired', '14: To assemble the 12 oz vermicelli bowls, divide the rice noodles between 2 bowls and top with the ½ cucumber, ½ cup bean sprouts, ½ head lettuce, and ¾ lb skinless pork', '15:  Garnish with ½ bunch fresh cilantro, crushed ¼ cup peanuts, and dipping 6 tablespoons fish sauce']

ingredients: ['2 cups flour (250 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '2 eggs', '1 ½ cups milk (355 mL)', '2 tablespoons maple syrup', '2 tablespoons butter melted', '2 tablespoons chocolate chips', '12 raspberries', '¼ cup blueberry (25 g)', '½ banana sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375ºF (190ºC)', '2: In a large bowl, combine 2 2 1 ½ ¼ cups flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and ¼ teaspoon salt', '3: Add in 2 eggs, melted 2 tablespoons butter, and 2 tablespoons maple syrup', '4:  Whisk', '5:  Add in 1 ½ 1 ½ ¼ cups milk and whisk until all ingredients are incorporated', '6: Evenly distribute the batter in a 12-cup nonstick muffin tin', '7:  Top with fruit and 2 tablespoons chocolate chips', '8: Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean']

ingredients: ['Chocolate Cake', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 cups all purpose flour (250 g)', '1 cup cocoa powder (120 g)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '2 sticks unsalted butter room temperature', '2 cups granulated sugar (400 g)', '2 large eggs room temperature', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 ½ cups sour cream (370 g)', 'Sour Cream Chocolate Frosting', '2 sticks unsalted butter room temperature', '1 ½ cups sour cream (370 g)', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 pinch kosher salt', '2 ¼ cups powdered sugar (245 g)', '⅔ cup cocoa powder (80 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Make the cake: Grease and line 2 8-inch (22 cm) round cake pans with parchment paper', '3: In a 2 large bowl, whisk together the 2 cups all purpose flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda, and baking powder', '4: In a separate 2 large bowl, cream the butter and 2 cups granulated 2 ¼ cups 2 ¼ cups powdered sugar with an electric hand mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes', '5: Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until fully incorporated', '6: Add the vanilla and sour cream and stir with a rubber spatula until starting to incorporate, then beat with the hand mixer until fully combined', '7: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, beating between each addition until just combined', '8: Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans', '9:  Bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean', '10:  Let cakes cool for 10 minutes in the pans, then invert onto a wire rack and let cool completely', '11: Make the frosting: Add the butter, sour cream, vanilla, and salt to a 2 large bowl', '12:  Beat with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until well combined', '13:  Sift in the 2 ¼ cups powdered 2 cups granulated 2 ¼ cups 2 ¼ cups powdered sugar and cocoa powder and beat until well incorporated and the frosting is smooth', '14: Place 1 layer of cake on a cake stand or serving platter lined with strips of parchment paper (for easy removal)', '15:  Spread ¾ cup frosting evenly over the cake', '16:  Place the other cake layer on top and use the rest of the frosting to frost the top and sides of the cake', '17: Slice and serve']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic chopped', '½ onion chopped', '6 hot dog sausages chopped', '4 tomatoes chopped', '½ tablespoon sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '7 oz heavy milk (207 mL)', '½ lb penne pasta raw', '16 oz water (472 mL)', '2 tablespoons green onion chopped', 'parmesan cheese']
instructions: ['1: In a big pot, add the 2 tablespoons olive oil, the 2 cloves garlic, the ½ 2 tablespoons 2 tablespoons green onion and mix it well', '2: Add the 6 hot dog sausages and mix it well', '3:  Add the 4 tomatoes and mix it well', '4: Add the seasoning: ½ tablespoon sugar, 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper', '5:  Mix it well', '6: Add the 7 oz heavy milk and mix it', '7: Add the raw ½ lb penne pasta, the 16 oz water and mix it well', '8: Let it cook for 15 minutes, stirring each 5 minutes for the pasta not to stick on the bottom', '9: Turn off the heat, add the 2 tablespoons green ½ 2 tablespoons 2 tablespoons green onions, mix it and close the pan lid', '10: Wait 5 minutes with the pan closed before serving', '11: Serve with parmesan cheese to taste']

ingredients: ['olive oil drizzle', '1 lb ground beef (455 g)', '2 teaspoons pepper', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 large onion chopped', '30 oz kidney bean (850 g) 1 can', '28 oz crushed tomato (795 g)', '2 tablespoons cumin', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon red pepper flakes', '8 tablespoons chili powder', '¼ cup water (60 mL)', '14.9 fl oz stout beer (425 mL)', 'shredded cheddar cheese', 'sour cream', 'fresh chive chopped']
instructions: ['1: In a 1 large heavy bottomed pot, brown the 1 lb ground beef in a little bit of olive oil', '2:  Season with the 2 teaspoons salt and 2 teaspoons 1 tablespoon 1 tablespoon red pepper', '3: Once browned, remove the 1 lb ground beef and set aside', '4: In the same pot, add the 1 large onion fresh chive chopped onions', '5:  Cook until slightly softened', '6:  Add the browned 1 lb ground beef back to the pan', '7:  Mix to incorporate', '8: Add the 30 oz kidney beans, 28 oz crushed tomato, 2 tablespoons cumin, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1 tablespoon red 2 teaspoons 1 tablespoon 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes, 8 tablespoons chili powder, ¼ cup water and 14', '9: 9 fl oz stout beer', '10:  Give it stir', '11:  Bring to a boil', '12:  Cover and let it simmer for an hour', '13: Serve with shredded cheddar, sour cream and chives', '14: Nutrition  Calories: 4377 Fat: 226 grams  Carbs: 306 grams Fiber: 79 grams  Sugars: 55  grams  Protein: 254 grams']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon oil', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon ginger minced', '6 cloves garlic minced', '1 onion diced', '6 cups vegetable stock (1.4 L)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '1 cup shiitake mushroom (75 g) stems removed and sliced', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon miso paste', 'ramen noodle', 'Toppings', '1 bunch bok choy sautéed', 'bell pepper sliced and sautéed', 'fresh parlsey', 'nori', 'rainbow carrot diced and sautéed', 'radish sliced', 'onion sliced and sautéed', 'spinach', 'bean sprout sautéed', 'corn', 'jalapeño sliced and sautéed', 'green onion sliced']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat', '2:  Add the 6 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon ginger, and onions and sauté until onions become translucent', '3: Add 6 cups vegetable stock, 1 cup water, 1 cup shiitake mushrooms, and 1 tablespoon soy sauce', '4:  Stir and simmer for at least 45 minutes, up to 3 hours', '5:  The longer you simmer, the more flavorful the broth will become', '6: Uncover the pot, add the 1 teaspoon miso paste, and stir', '7: Ladle the broth into a bowl and add noodles and toppings of your choice']

ingredients: ['6 oz skinless salmon (170 g)', '2 cups broccoli floret (300 g)', 'olive oil to taste', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon green onion sliced', 'Honey Soy Marinade', '1 teaspoon garlic', '1 teaspoon ginger', '¼ teaspoon pepper', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon honey']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon honey 1 tablespoon soy marinade ingredients', '3: Lay the 6 oz skinless salmon on a baking sheet', '4:  Pour the marinade over the 6 oz skinless salmon', '5: Lay the 2 cups broccoli beside the 6 oz skinless salmon, but not touching', '6:  Drizzle olive oil over the 2 cups broccoli, then season with salt and pepper', '7: Bake for 10-12 minutes', '8: Top with sliced 1 tablespoon green onions']

ingredients: ['¾ cup self-raising flour (100 g)', '¼ cup water (50 mL)', '1 tablespoon olive oil for frying', 'Suggested Toppings', '3 tablespoons pizza sauce', '1 handful mozzarella cheese grated', '6 slices pepperoni', 'dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon chili flakes']
instructions: ['1: Whizz together the ¾ cup self-raising flour and ¼ cup water in a food processor for a minute or so until it clumps together to form a single ball', '2:  You might need to add a little bit more ¼ cup water or ¾ cup self-raising flour to get the consistency right', '3:  (Dough should be soft, but not sticky!)Preheat the grill (broiler) on high', '4: On a ¾ cup self-raising floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1 cm (½ inch) thick', '5: Place 3 tablespoons pizza dough onto a well-oiled, oven-safe 1 tablespoon olive oil for frying pan on high heat', '6: While the bottom is cooking on the hob, top the 3 tablespoons pizza with the sauce, 1 handful mozzarella cheese, 6 slices pepperoni herbs and whatever else you like', '7:  (Try your best to not over-top it or else it can fall apart or get soggy', '8: )Continue cooking on high until the edges of the crust start browning and crisping', '9: Place the pan under the grill and cook the toppings until the 1 handful mozzarella cheese is bubbly and browning', '10:  Slice', '11: If you’re quick, you can actually have this from-scratch 3 tablespoons pizza on your plate (and in you mouth) quicker than it takes to cook a pre-made frozen 3 tablespoons pizza']

ingredients: ['Hash Brown', '12 oz medium russet potato scrubbed', '2 tablespoons ghee clarified butter', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', 'freshly cracked pepper to taste', 'To Serve', 'fresh chive sliced', 'fresh dill frond', 'crème fraîche', 'salmon or trout roe', 'lemon wedge']
instructions: ['1: Using a food processor fitted with the large grater attachment (or the large holes on a box grated), shred the potato', '2:  Transfer to a 12 oz medium bowl and toss with the ½ teaspoon kosher salt, then let sit for about 5 minutes to draw out excess moisture', '3: Transfer the shredded potato to a clean, lint-free kitchen towel and wring out as much moisture as possible', '4:  Wipe out the bowl, then the potato to the bowl and season with freshly cracked pepper', '5:  Use your fingers to separate the shreds into a fluffy pile', '6: Heat a 6-inch cast iron skillet over 12 oz medium heat until very hot', '7:  Line a wire rack or plate with paper towels and set nearby', '8: Once the skillet is very hot, add 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons ghee and swirl to coat the pan', '9:  Carefully transfer the potato shreds to the skillet and use a spatula to gently pat down into a uniform circle', '10:  Cook for 3–5 minutes, until the bottom is a deep golden brown and crispy', '11:  Set a plate upside-down over the skillet, place your hand on top to hold it in place, and carefully flip the skillet upside down to release the hash brown from the pan', '12:  (Be careful, the skillet will be very hot!)Return the skillet to the heat, then add the remaining tablespoon of 2 tablespoons ghee', '13:  Let the 2 tablespoons ghee warm for about 30 seconds, then slide the hash brown, uncooked side down, back into the skillet', '14:  Cook for another 3–5 minutes, until golden brown, then remove from the skillet and place on the paper towels to drain', '15: Let the hash brown cool for a few minutes, before topping with a generous dollop of crème fraîche, smoked salmon, chives, fresh dill, and roe', '16:  Finish with a squeeze of lemon and serve immediately']

ingredients: ['Honey Sriracha Roasted Chicken', '2 tablespoons  sriracha', '5 tablespoons honey', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '3 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (1.5 kg)', '1 bunch scallion', '2 red peppers thinly sliced', 'Breakfast Chicken Hash', '3 tablespoons olive oil', 'red bell pepper leftover from honey Sriracha chicken', 'scallion leftover from honey Sriracha chicken', '2 russet potatoes shredded', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon pepper', '2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover from honey Sriracha chicken shredded', '4 eggs', '2 oz goat cheese (55 g) crumbled for garnish', 'scallion thinly sliced for garnish', 'fresh parsley to taste chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400ºF (200˚C)', '2: In a small saucepan, whisk together the Sriracha, 5 tablespoons red bell pepper red bell pepper scallion 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover from scallion scallion 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover from 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover from honey, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar, and remaining salt and pepper', '3:  Heat and let simmer for 1-2 minutes', '4: Place chicken thighs in a 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) glass casserole dish and spread out evenly', '5:  Pour sauce over chicken and toss together until chicken is evenly coated', '6:  Place scallions on a pan and place in the oven with the chicken', '7: After 10 minutes add 2 red peppers thinly scallion thinly sliced 2 red peppers to the pan with the scallions', '8: Roast chicken thighs for 25 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165º (75˚C)', '9: Remove from oven and pour the pan juices into a small saucepan', '10:  Simmer until juices have been reduced to a glaze, then pour over chicken', '11:  Chop ½ of the 2 red peppers and scallions and add to chicken', "12: Serve with starch and enjoy!Cover left overs with Glad Press'n Seal and store in the refrigerator for your next meal", '13: Use red bell pepper scallion 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover chicken for Breakfast Chicken Hash', '14:  Preheat oven to 350ºF (180˚C)', '15: Peel the 2 russet potatoes, then shred on the largest holes of a box grater', '16:  Squeeze excess liquid from the shredded 2 russet potatoes and press between paper towels to dry', '17: Shred the red bell pepper scallion 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover chicken thighs', '18: In a large enamel skillet, heat the 3 tablespoons olive oil', '19:  Add the 2 red peppers and scallions and saute for 5 minutes', '20:  Add the shredded 2 russet potatoes, salt and pepper and saute for 10 minutes, stirring every couple minutes', '21:  Add an extra drizzle of 3 tablespoons olive oil if the 2 russet potatoes are sticking too much', '22:  When 2 russet potatoes have crisped a little, fold in the red bell pepper scallion 2 cups boneless chicken thighs (250 g) leftover shredded chicken', '23: Make 4 pockets in the hash mixture', '24:  Drizzle 3 tablespoons olive oil in each pocket and crack an egg in each one', '25:  Top each egg with a sprinkle of salt', '26:  Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until whites are set', '27: Remove from oven and garnish with the 2 oz goat cheese, scallions, and fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['6 tablespoons olive oil divided', '2 teaspoons garlic minced divided', '1 tablespoon shallot minced', '1 cup arborio rice (230 g)', '¼ cup dry white wine (60 g)', '2 cups chicken stock (480 g) boiling', '14.5 oz tomato soup (410 g) 1 can', '6 tablespoons unsalted butter cubed', '¼ cup parmesan cheese (30 g) freshly grated', 'kosher salt to taste', 'white pepper freshly ground to taste', '8 large shrimps peeled deveined tails on  butterflied', '¼ cup green peas (40 g)', '1 tablespoon fresh parsley leaf for garnish minced']
instructions: ['1: In a medium skillet, heat 3 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat', '2:  Add the shallots and 1 teaspoon 2 teaspoons garlic 1 tablespoon shallot 1 tablespoon fresh 1 tablespoon fresh parsley leaf for garnish minced 2 teaspoons garlic, and sauté until soft, but not brown', '3: Add the 1 cup arborio rice and sauté until well-coated with the oil', '4:  Deglaze the pan with the wine and reduce until the pan is almost ¼ cup dry', '5: Using a 4-ounce (115 g) ladle, add one ladle of boiling 2 cups chicken stock to the 1 cup arborio rice', '6:  Stir the 1 cup arborio rice until the 2 cups chicken stock is absorbed and the 1 cup arborio rice is almost ¼ cup dry', '7:  Continue adding 2 cups chicken stock 1 ladle at a time until the 1 cup arborio rice is tender, but still firm', '8:  It should be moist and creamy, but not runny', '9: Add the 14', '10: 5 oz tomato basil bisque and stir to combine', '11: Remove the risotto from the heat, and stir in the butter and the Parmesan cheese', '12:   Season with kosher salt and pepper', '13: Heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat', '14:  Add the remaining teaspoon of 2 teaspoons garlic 1 tablespoon shallot 1 tablespoon fresh 1 tablespoon fresh parsley leaf for garnish minced 2 teaspoons garlic and the shrimp', '15:  Season with kosher salt and ¼ cup dry white pepper', '16:  Add the ¼ cup green peas and cook until the shrimp is pink and opaque, 4-5 minutes', '17: Remove the shrimp from the heat and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon fresh parsley', '18:  Divide the risotto between 2 warm serving plates', '19:  Top each with half the shrimp and ¼ cup green peas', '20:  Serve immediately', '21: Enjoy']

ingredients: ['1 lb beef tenderloin (455 g) cubed', 'canola oil to taste', '½ teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon berbere plus more to taste', '2 cups broccoli rabe (80 g) roughly chopped', '2 teaspoons spiced butter niter kibbeh or clarified butter', '1 medium red onion thinly sliced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 ginger 1 inch (2 cm) piece peeled and minced', '2 jalapeñoes sliced', '2 sprigs fresh rosemary leaves chopped', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ cup crushed tomato (100 g) canned', '2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '2 teaspoons dijon mustard', '2 medium tomatoes chopped', '2 teaspoons fresh cilantro chopped', 'injera for serving', 'cheese fresh - Ayib for serving']
instructions: ['1: Cut the 1 lb beef tenderloin into cubes', '2:  Reserve any fat trimmings and other scraps', '3: Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over high heat', '4:  Add the 1 lb beef scraps and stir to season the pan', '5:  Add the cubed 1 lb beef to the skillet and season to taste with ½ teaspoon kosher salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon berbere', '6:  Sear the meat for 2 minutes, then remove from the pan and let rest', '7:  Keep any meat juices behind in the pan', '8: To the pan, add the 2 cups broccoli rabe and cook until wilted', '9:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '10: Add a drizzle of canola oil and the 2 teaspoons spiced butter niter kibbeh to the same pan over medium heat', '11:  Once the 2 teaspoons spiced butter niter kibbeh is melted, add the onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 ginger, and jalapeños and sauté for 3 minutes, until starting to soften', '12: Add the 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, ½ teaspoon ground cumin, and cook for one minute', '13:  Add the ½ cup crushed tomatoes, 1 medium 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 2 teaspoons dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon berbere, and cooked 2 cups broccoli rabe', '14:  Cook for 3 minutes, until simmeringReturn the 1 lb beef to the pan, along with the chopped tomatoes and 2 teaspoons fresh cilantro', '15:  Simmer for 2 minutes to allow the flavors to meld', '16:  Remove the pan from the heat', '17: Serve the tibs over injera, garnished with 1 tablespoon berbere and ayib']

ingredients: ['2 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs and drunmsticks (910 g)', 'kosher salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '5 garlics minced', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '3 tablespoons harissa paste', '2 lemon juices from 2 lemons plus 1/4 cup (60 ml) divided', '1 ½ lb yukon gold potato (680 g) cubed', '1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '1 cup greek yogurt (285 g)', '½ cup fresh parsley (20 g) chopped', '2 tablespoons honey', '½ cup fresh dill (20 g)', '1 tablespoon sumac', '2 leeks white and light green parts halved lengthwise rinsed and thinly sliced into half-moons', '1 lemon zest', 'Preparation', '2 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs and drunmsticks (910 g)', 'kosher salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '5 garlics minced', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '3 tablespoons harissa paste', '2 lemon juices from 2 lemons plus 1/4 cup (60 ml) divided', '1 ½ lb yukon gold potato (680 g) cubed', '1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '1 cup greek yogurt (285 g)', '½ cup fresh parsley (20 g) chopped', '2 tablespoons honey', '½ cup fresh dill (20 g)', '1 tablespoon sumac', '2 leeks white and light green parts halved lengthwise rinsed and thinly sliced into half-moons', '1 lemon zest', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Marinate the chicken: Add the chicken to a large bowl and season with the salt, pepper, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, harissa paste, and the juice of 2 lemons', '2:  Toss until the chicken is well coated, then cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes', '3: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)', '4: Add the potatoes to half of a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil', '5:  Season with salt, pepper, and the parsley and toss to coat', '6:  Arrange the marinated chicken pieces on the other side of the baking sheet', '7: Roast the chicken and potatoes for 30 minutes', '8: Meanwhile, make the sauce: In a small bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, salt, pepper, parsley, honey, dill, sumac, and remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) lemon juice', '9:  Stir well until smooth, the set aside', '10: Remove the baking sheet from the oven, toss the potatoes, then spread the leeks and lemon zest in an even layer over the potatoes', '11: Return to the oven for another 20 minutes, or until the chicken is browned and cooked through and the vegetables are tender and slightly crispy', '12: Serve the chicken over the potatoes and leeks and drizzle with the yogurt sauce', '13: Nutrition  Calories: 1562 Fat: 72 grams  Carbs: 110 grams Fiber: 44 grams  Sugars: 44 grams  Protein: 122 grams']

ingredients: ['1 cup honey syrup (335 g) see recipe', '1 tablespoon dried lavender buds', 'seltzer water for serving']
instructions: ['1: Add the simple 1 cup honey syrup and lavender to a small saucepan', '2:  Simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced', '3:  Let cool completely, then strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months', '4: To serve, mix 1-2 1 tablespoons of 1 cup honey lavender syrup with 8 ounces of seltzer water in a glass over ice', '5: Nutrition, per 1 1 tablespoon\nCalories: 16 \nSugars: 4 grams']

ingredients: ['4 chicken thighs', '1 cup white rice (200 g)', '1 ½ cups chicken broth (355 mL)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '½ cup fresh cilantro (20 g) chopped', '1 can black beans drained', '1 lime', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Season both sides of the chicken thighs with salt and pepper', '2: In a large skillet, add the 2 tablespoons olive oil and place the chicken skin side down for about 5 minutes or until skin is golden brown', '3:  Flip the chicken and cook for another 3 minutes', '4: Take the chicken out and add the onions and cook until they’re translucent, about 5 minutes', '5: Add the 1 cup white rice, stir to coat in the oil and onions, and toast for 3 minutes', '6: Add the 4 cloves garlic then pour in the chicken stock and place the chicken on top of the 1 cup white rice', '7:  Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until 1 cup white rice is cooked', '8: Once cooked, take the chicken out and add in the ½ cup fresh cilantro, 1 can black beans, and the juice of one 1 lime', '9:  Mix until well-incorporated', '10: Serve the chicken over 1 cup white rice and garnish with ½ cup fresh cilantro']

ingredients: ['Fried Chicken', '1 lb Walmart Chicken Breast Tenderloins (425 g)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt divided', '1 ½ cups all purpose flour (185 g)', '½ cup cornstarch (60 g)', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup buttermilk (240 mL)', '2 teaspoons hot sauce', '1 large egg', '2 cups vegetable oil (480 mL) or as needed', 'Hot Spiced Oil', '2 ½ tablespoons cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'Wraps', '8 flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded iceberg lettuce (200 g)', '1 cup bread and butter pickles (150 g)', '⅓ cup mayonnaise (80 g)', '¼ cup reserved frying oil (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Make the fried chicken: Cut the Walmart Breast Tenderloins into 1-inch (2', '2: 54 cm) cubes and season evenly with ½ teaspoon salt', '3: In a shallow bowl, stir together flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and ¼ teaspoon salt until combined', '4:  In a separate shallow bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, remaining ¼ teaspoon salt, hot sauce, and egg until smooth', '5: Working in batches, coat the chicken in the flour mixture, then in the buttermilk mixture, then again in the flour mixture', '6:  Set on a plate while you heat the oil for frying', '7: Fill a 1 large, high-walled cast iron skillet with about 2 inches of 2 cups vegetable oil', '8:  Heat over medium-high heat until the temperature reaches 360–375°F (182–190°C)', '9:  Set a wire rack on top of paper towels', '10: Working in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan, fry the chicken in the hot oil for about 3 minutes on each side, or until deep golden brown and cooked through', '11:  Transfer to the wire rack to drain', '12:  Reserve the frying oil', '13: Make the hot spiced oil: In a 1 large bowl, whisk together the cayenne, brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, and black pepper', '14:  Carefully pour in ½ cup of the reserved frying oil and whisk to combine', '15: Working in batches if necessary, toss the fried chicken in the spiced oil until evenly coated, adding more oil if the mixture gets too thick', '16:  Return to the wire rack and let cool enough to handle', '17: Assemble the wraps: Roughly chop the chicken', '18: Set a tortilla on a cutting board', '19:  Use a knife to cut from the center of the tortilla down to the bottom edge', '20:  Scoop about ¼ cup of the chopped chicken onto the bottom left quadrant of the tortilla, to the left of the cut', '21:  Working clockwise, add ¼ cup 2 cups shredded lettuce to the top left quadrant, 2 2 ½ 2 ½ 1 tablespoons chopped pickles to the top right quadrant, and drizzle or spread 2 2 teaspoons of mayonnaise over the bottom right quadrant', '22:  Starting from the bottom left and working clockwise, fold each quadrant over the next, pressing gently after each fold', '23: In a 1 large nonstick skillet, heat 1 2 ½ 1 tablespoon of the reserved frying oil over medium-high heat', '24:  Working 2 at a time and adding more oil between batches, fry each wrap on both sides for 1–2 minutes, until golden brown, being careful to keep the fillings inside', '25: Serve warm']

ingredients: ['5 cups cauliflower (1.5 kg) roughly chopped', '1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour (220 g) or gluten-free flour', '¾ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'pesto sauce for serving']
instructions: ['1: Add the 5 cups cauliflower to a steamer basket set over a medium pot of boiling water', '2:  Cover and steam for 10 minutes, or until fork-tender', '3: Transfer the 5 cups cauliflower to a clean dish towel and squeeze the excess water into a bowl', '4: Transfer the squeezed 5 cups cauliflower to a food processor', '5:  Add the 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, ¾ teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon olive oil and pulse until the dough forms a ball', '6: Transfer the dough to a lightly 1 ¾ cups all-purpose floured surface and knead for 3-4 minutes, or until the dough bounces back when poked', '7: Shape the dough into a ball, then cut into 4 equal pieces', '8:  Working 1 piece at a time, cut in half again, then roll out a rope about 6 inches (3-cm) long and 1 inch (2-cm) wide', '9:  Slice each rope into ½-inch (1-cm) pieces', '10: Roll each piece along the back of a fork to create a line pattern', '11: Transfer the gnocchi to a large pot of ¾ teaspoon salted boiling water', '12:  Boil until the gnocchi float to the surface, 3-5 minutes, then remove with a slotted spoon', '13: Toss the gnocchi with pesto sauce and serve immediately']

ingredients: ['½ lime cut into wedges', '5 raspberries a nice handful', '1 teaspoon sugar', '10 fresh mints a good bunch', '¼ cup white rum (60 mL)', 'club soda']
instructions: ['1: Throw the ½ lime wedges, 5 raspberries, mint, and 1 teaspoon sugar into a glass and then, using a muddler or wooden spoon, press down on the ingredients to mush them all together and get all of the juice out of the ½ lime wedges', '2: Add ice and pour in ¼ cup white rum (you can just eyeball the amount, if you don’t have something handy to measure) and then top the glass off with club soda', '3: If you want it a little more or less sweet, you can always add slightly more or slightly less 1 teaspoon sugar', '4:  It’s also delicious with less ¼ cup white rum, or no ¼ cup white rum at all', '5: Stir well and top with 10 fresh mint']

ingredients: ['1 cup Great Value® Almond Milk (240 g)', '1 ½ cups Great Value® Mixed Fruit (260 g)', '¼ cup dried apricot (50 g) diced', '½ teaspoon fresh ginger']
instructions: ['1: In a blender, combine the almond milk, fruit, apricots, and ½ teaspoon fresh ginger', '2:  Blend on high speed until smooth']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '4 cups chicken breast (500 g) diced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 onion diced', '1 teaspoon garlic grated', '1 teaspoon ginger crushed', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon garam masala', '1 teaspoon turmeric', '1 teaspoon coriander powder', '1 ¼ cups water (300 mL)', '½ cup passata sauce (130 mL) or tomato sauce', '1 tablespoon single cream', '4 tablespoons low fat natural yogurt']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over a medium heat', '2: Add the 4 cups chicken and season with the 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper', '3:  Fry for 6-8 minutes or until cooked through', '4: Take the 4 cups chicken out and set aside', '5: Fry the onions with the 1 teaspoon garlic and 1 teaspoon ginger for about 5 minutes', '6: Stir in all the spices and fry for another 2 minutes', '7: Stir in the 1 ¼ cups water and ½ cup passata sauce', '8:  Bring to a boil', '9: Place a lid on top of the pan and simmer for 10 minutes', '10: Stir in the 1 tablespoon single cream and the 4 tablespoons low fat natural yogurt', '11: Add in the 4 cups chicken and cook for another 5 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly', '12: Serve with rice, salad, and naan bread']

ingredients: ['4 tablespoons unsalted butter divided', '1 cup extra virgin olive oil (240 mL) divided', '2 large carrots peeled trimmed and minced', '1 leek white part only trimmed cleaned and minced', '1 large yellow onion minced', '1 red bell pepper cored seeded and minced', '1 small fennel bulb trimmed and minced', '1 green bell pepper cored seeded and minced', '2 celeries minced', '4 cloves garlic finely chopped', '3 cloves garlic crushed', 'salt to taste', 'freshly cracked pepper to taste', '6 oz tomato paste (170 g)', '1 tablespoon dried basil', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon dried thyme', '1 teaspoon cayenne', '2 cups dry white wine (480 mL) divided', '4 cups fish stock (960 mL)', '15 oz crushed italian tomato (425 g) 2 cans', '3 bay leaves', '½ lb sea scallop (225 g)', '½ lb shrimp (225 g) peeled and deveined', '½ lb squid (225 g) sliced', '½ lb halibut fillet (225 g) cut into large pieces', '½ lb manila clam (225 g) scrubbed', '½ lb mussel (225 g) scrubbed', 'sourdough bread grilled for serving', '½ bunch fresh parsley chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot over medium heat, melt together 2 4 tablespoons of butter and 2 4 tablespoons of olive oil', '2:  Add the carrot, 1 leek, onion, 1 red bell 1 red bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper, 1 small fennel, 1 green bell 1 red bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper, celery, and garlic', '3:  Season with salt and 1 red bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper', '4:  Stir and cook until the vegetables are softened, about 15 minutes', '5: Scoop half of the matignon (sautéed 2 large carrots peeled trimmed and 1 leek 1 leek 2 4 cups dry white part only trimmed cleaned and 1 large yellow onion 1 red bell 1 red bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper cored seeded and 1 small fennel bulb trimmed and 1 green bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper cored seeded and 2 celeries minced vegetables) from the pan and set aside', '6:  Stir the 6 oz 15 oz crushed italian tomato paste, 1 tablespoon dried basil, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, 1 tablespoon dried thyme, and 1 teaspoon cayenne into the remaining vegetables and cook until the 6 oz 15 oz crushed italian tomato paste starts to brown, about 10 minutes', '7: Next, add half of the 1 leek 2 4 cups dry white wine to deglaze the pan, stirring to loosen any bits stuck to the bottom of the pot', '8: Add the 4 cups fish stock, crushed 6 oz 15 oz crushed italian tomatoes, and 3 bay leaves', '9:  Stir together, bring to a boil, then 1 reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes', '10: In a large skillet, heat 2 4 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat', '11:  Season all of the seafood with salt and 1 red bell 1 green bell freshly cracked pepper', '12: Add the scallops to the pan and sear the first side until golden brown, 3 minutes', '13:  Flip and sear on the other side for another 3 minutes', '14:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '15:  Wipe out the pan if needed', '16: Add more olive oil as needed, then add the ½ lb shrimp to the pan and cook for 3 minutes on one side', '17:  Flip  and cook on the other side for 3 minutes more', '18:  Set aside', '19: Add more olive oil and the ½ lb squid to the hot pan and sauté until cooked, 5 minutes', '20: Add more olive oil and the ½ lb halibut to the hot pan, along with the crushed garlic and remaining 2 4 tablespoons of butter', '21:  Sear the ½ lb halibut on one side, then flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes', '22:  Baste the 4 cups fish with the melted garlic butter as the second side cooks', '23:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '24: Add the clams and mussels to the pan, pour in the remaining 1 2 4 cup of 1 leek 2 4 cups dry white 1 leek 2 4 cups dry white, then cover the pot and steam for 5 minutes, until the shellfish pop open', '25:  Remove the pan from the heat', '26: Transfer all of the cooked seafood, along with the leftover shellfish steaming liquid and reserved matignon, to the simmering stew; or plate the seafood and reserved matignon artfully in wide bowls and pour the hot stew over the top', '27: Serve with grilled sourdough bread and garnish with ½ bunch fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['Cake', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '1 cup granulated sugar (200 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon almond extract', '4 large egg yolks', '1 ½ cups all purpose flour (185 g) sifted', '⅔ cup milk (160 mL)', '1 oz spiced rum (30 mL) optional', 'Filling', '4 large egg whites', '¾ cup granulated sugar (150 g)', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 sticks unsalted butter cubed chilled but pliable', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon almond extract', 'For Decorating', '10 oz vanilla candy melts (295 g)', '2 tablespoons green sanding sugar', '1 tube red cookie icing', 'Special Equipment', '1 christmas tree-shaped cookie cutter']
instructions: ['1: Make the cake: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Spray 2 9 x 13-inch rimmed 2 teaspoons baking sheets with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper', '3: in a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer on medium speed to cream together the butter, sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, salt, vanilla, and almond extract until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes', '4: With the mixer running on medium speed, add the egg yolks, 1 at a time, beating between each addition until fully incorporated', '5: Add a third of the 1 ½ cups all purpose flour and continue mixing until just incorporated', '6:  In a small bowl, combine the ⅔ cup milk and 1 oz spiced rum, if using', '7:  Add half of the ⅔ cup milk mixture to the batter and mix until nearly combined', '8:  Continue alternating additions of the 1 ½ cups all purpose flour and ⅔ cup milk, using a rubber spatula to finish bringing the batter together', '9: Divide the batter between the prepared 2 teaspoons baking sheets, spreading evenly all the way to the edges', '10:  Bake for 10 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through, until the cakes are pale golden brown and the edges begin to pull from the sides of the pans', '11:  Remove from the oven and let cool', '12: Meanwhile, make the filling: Fill a large pot with 1 inch of water', '13:  Set a large heat-safe bowl over the pot, making sure the bottom is not touching the water', '14:  Add the egg whites, sugar, and salt to the bowl and whisk together until homogenous', '15:  Turn the heat to medium and continue whisking until the mixture thickens', '16:  When you lift the whisk, the mixture should fall into the bowl in ribbons that hold their shape for a moment before disappearing', '17: Remove the bowl from the heat and place on a towel on a flat surface', '18:  With an electric hand mixer on medium-high speed, whip the egg white mixture until doubled in volume, about 5 minutes', '19:  Reduce the mixer speed to medium and, with the mixer running, add the butter, a cube at a time', '20:  As you add the last piece of butter, the mixture will look broken; don’t worry! Continue mixing until the mixture smooths out again, about 1 minute', '21:  Add the vanilla and almond extract and mix until just incorporated', '22: Assemble the cakes: Invert a cake onto a cutting board with a piece of parchment on top and peel away the parchment from the bottom of the cake', '23:  Carefully flip the cake over so the flat side is on the bottom again', '24:  Spread the filling evenly over the cake, then invert the remaining cake on top of the filling', '25:  Peel off the parchment from the top of the cake', '26:  Transfer the cutting board with the cake to the freezer and freeze until the cake is hardened, but not completely frozen, about 1 hour', '27: Line a 2 teaspoons baking sheet with parchment paper', '28: Remove the cake from the freezer', '29:  Use the Christmas tree-shaped cookie cutter to cut out 8 cakes and place on the prepared 2 teaspoons baking sheet', '30:  Discard (or snack on) the cake scraps', '31:  Chill the cakes in the refrigerator while you prepare the decorations', '32: Add the candy melts to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave according to the package instructions until melted', '33: Dip each cake in the melted candy, using a fork to flip until completely coated', '34:  Carefully lift the cake out of the candy and gently scrape the bottom across the side of the bowl to remove any excess', '35:  Return the coated cake to the 2 teaspoons baking sheet', '36:  Repeat with the remaining cakes', '37: Sprinkle the cakes lightly with the 2 tablespoons green sanding sugar, and then decorate with the 1 tube red cookie icing', '38:  Refrigerate until the candy shell hardens, about 5 minutes']

ingredients: ['10 large eggs', '½ cup 2% milk (120 mL)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '4 slices sprouted grain bread cut in rough 1-inch (2 cm) squares', '1 pt cherry tomatoes (400 g) halved', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 1 can rinsed and drained', '¼ cup fresh basil leaf (10 g) roughly chopped', '4 oz goat cheese (125 g) crumbled', '1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil']
instructions: ['1: In a 10 large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, ½ cup 2% milk, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt', '2: Add the 4 slices sprouted grain bread and toss so that all of the 4 slices sprouted grain bread is saturated with liquid', '3: Refrigerate the mixture and let it sit for at least 2 hours and up to overnight', '4: Take the egg and 4 slices sprouted grain bread mixture out of the fridge and add the 1 pt cherry tomatoes, chickpeas, ¼ cup fresh basil, and 4 oz goat cheese to the mixing bowl', '5:  Toss everything together to thoroughly combine', '6: When you’re ready to bake the strata, preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '7: Heat 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil in a 10 large, oven-safe skillet over medium heat', '8:  Swirl the oil to coat the bottom and at least an inch (2 cm) up the sides', '9: Pour the combined ingredients into the skillet, then use a spatula to spread everything evenly over the skillet, pressing the 4 slices sprouted grain bread into a flat, even layer', '10: Bake the strata in the preheated oven until the eggs are completely set and the edges are golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes', '11: Take the strata out of the oven and let it sit in the pan for at least 15 minutes', '12: Flip the cooled strata out of the pan and onto a cutting board, then slice it into four portions', '13: Eat immediately, or let the strata cool completely before storing in an airtight container in the fridge', '14: Note: To reheat the strata: Microwave for 1 minute on high, or reheat in a 375°F (190°C) oven for 5 minutes, just to heat through']

ingredients: ['8 oz reduced fat cream cheese (225 g)', '¼ cup nonfat greek yogurt (70 g)', '2 chicken breasts cooked and shredded', '½ cup low fat cheddar cheese (50 g)', '½ cup light crumbled blue cheese (50 g)', '⅓ cup buffalo sauce (80 g)']
instructions: ['1: Add all ingredients into a slow cooker', '2: Stir until combined', '3: Cook on high for 4 hours or until all cheese is melted']

ingredients: ['1 cup puffed rice cereal (30 g)', '½ cup oats (50 g)', '½ cup pumpkin seeds (65 g)', '1 ⅓ cups almond (185 g) roasted', '½ cup dried apricot (95 g) diced', '⅓ cup corn syrup (80 g)', '½ cup honey (165 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 bar dark chocolate']
instructions: ['1: Combine 1 cup puffed rice, ½ cup oats, rice, and ½ cup dried apricot into a large bowl', '2: In a sauce pan, heat ⅓ cup corn syrup and ½ cup honey until it reaches 260°F (126°C)', '3:  Then carefully add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and remove from heat', '4: Immediately pour the ½ cup honey mixture into the bowl, stir, and transfer it onto a parchment paper–lined baking sheet', '5: Using a spatula press down the mixture to desired thickness', '6:  (Careful - it may still be quite warm!)Refrigerate for 30 minutes', '7: Heat 1 1 bar of dark chocolate for 1 minute, then drizzle over the top', '8:  Refrigerate for 30 minutes', '9: Remove parchment paper and cut into 12 even pieces', '10: Wrap each 1 bar with wax paper and store up to 1 week']

ingredients: ['1 mud crab', '3 shallots', 'ginger 1 in (2.5 cm)', '3 long red chillies', '5 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons ketchup', '1 teaspoon shrimp paste belacan', '2 tablespoons cooking oil', '1 ½ cups chicken stock (360 mL)', '1 ½ cups tomato puree (335 g)', '1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', '½ cup sweet chili sauce (120 g)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons palm sugar', '1 egg', '1 spring onion', '½ cup butter (50 g)', 'To garnish:', '1 bunch coriander', 'To serve:', 'fried bao dough mantou']
instructions: ['1: Prepare the 1 mud crab by removing the base flap, then pull off the head and clear out the cavity', '2:  Keep the head in a bowl', '3:  Moving to the body of the 1 mud crab, remove the gills, which are an opaque brown colour on both sides of the 1 mud crab', '4:  Using a sharp knife, cut the 1 mud crab in half down the middle, then divide into six parts', '5:  Using the knife, crack the 1 mud crab legs open to allow the flavours to enhance while 2 tablespoons cooking', '6:  Add to the bowl with the head then set aside', '7: In a food processor, add 3 shallots, ginger, 3 long red chillies, 5 cloves garlic, 2 tablespoons ketchup, and 1 teaspoon shrimp paste, then pulse until it comes together and forms a paste', '8: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat, then once it comes up to temperature fry add the chilli paste and cook for five minutes, stirring occasionally', '9: Add the 1 mud crab pieces into the wok and stir until they are fully coated', '10:  Give the 1 mud crab time to start turning orange, approximately 5 minutes', '11: Add the 1 ½ cups tomato puree, 1 ½ cups chicken stock, 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar, ½ cup sweet chilli sauce, 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 tablespoons palm sugar, then stir until completely mixed', '12:  The 1 mud crab should be fully orange by now', '13:  Add a lid on top and allow the mixture to simmer for 15 minutes', '14: Remove the 1 mud crab legs and head, and plate up on a shallow dish', '15: Add ½ cup butter, 1 spring onions, and 1 egg', '16:  Let the 1 egg sit for a minute before stirring, then give the sauce a quick stir', '17:  The sauce should thicken up quickly', '18: Pour the sauce on top of the 1 mud crab and garnish with a few sprigs of 1 bunch coriander']

ingredients: ['Vegetables', '1 large carrot cut into coins', '1 ½ cups cherry tomato (300 g)', '1 yellow bell pepper 1 in (2 1/2 cm) dices', '1 large carrot cut into coins', 'medium red onion 1 in (2 1/2 cm) dices', '1 yellow bell pepper 1-inch ( 2 cm) dices', '10 asparagus trimmed and cut in half', '1 medium red onion 1-inch ( 2 cm) dices', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '10 spears asparagus trimmed and halved', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons olive oil', 'pepper to taste', 'salt to taste', '4 cloves garlic', 'pepper to taste', '4 sprigs fresh thyme', '4 cloves garlic', 'Steak', '4 sprigs fresh thyme', '1 lb sirloin steak (455 g)', 'Steak', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 lb sirloin steak (455 g)', '1 clove garlic', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt', '1 clove garlic', 'pepper', 'Preparation', 'Vegetables', '1 large carrot cut into coins', '1 ½ cups cherry tomato (300 g)', '1 yellow bell pepper 1 in (2 1/2 cm) dices', '1 large carrot cut into coins', 'medium red onion 1 in (2 1/2 cm) dices', '1 yellow bell pepper 1-inch ( 2 cm) dices', '10 asparagus trimmed and cut in half', '1 medium red onion 1-inch ( 2 cm) dices', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '10 spears asparagus trimmed and halved', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons olive oil', 'pepper to taste', 'salt to taste', '4 cloves garlic', 'pepper to taste', '4 sprigs fresh thyme', '4 cloves garlic', 'Steak', '4 sprigs fresh thyme', '1 lb sirloin steak (455 g)', 'Steak', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 lb sirloin steak (455 g)', '1 clove garlic', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt', '1 clove garlic', 'pepper', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200˚C)', '2: Prepare the vegetables', '3: Place cherry tomatoes, carrots, yellow bell pepper, red onion, and asparagus evenly on a baking tray', '4:  (Try not to let the vegetables overlap too much, so that they roast properly', '5: )Season with olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste', '6: Add garlic cloves and sprigs of thyme on top of the vegetables', '7:  Bake vegetables for 15 minutes', '8: Roast vegetables for 15 minutes', '9: Bring back the tray and push vegetables to the side to make room for the steak', '10:  Place the steak in the middle of the pan and season both sides with salt and pepper', '11: Top the steak with a sprig of thyme and a clove of garlic', '12:  Place back in oven for 10 more minutes or until desired doneness is reached', '13: Allow the steak to rest for 5-10 minutes', '14:  Plate the vegetables and top with cut steak']

ingredients: ['Cookies', '3 ½ cups all-purpose flour (410 g)', '1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup unsalted butter softened', '¾ cup granulated sugar (150 g)', '1 egg', '½ cup sour cream (115 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'Frosting', '½ cup unsalted butter softened', '2 cups powdered sugar (320 g)', '2 tablespoons milk', 'food coloring for decorating', 'sprinkles for decorating']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, whisk the 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour, 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda, and ¼ teaspoon salt to combine', '2: In a large bowl, cream the butter and ¾ cup granulated 2 cups 2 cups powdered sugar together with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes', '3:  Add the 1 egg and mix until fully incorporated', '4:  Add the ½ cup sour cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla and mix until creamy', '5:  Add the 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour mixture, a third at a time, until fully combined', '6: Lightly 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour a work surface and turn out the dough', '7:  Press the dough together into a disc and wrap in plastic wrap', '8:  Chill for 1 hour in the refrigerator', '9: Preheat the oven to 300˚F (150˚C)', '10:  Line a 1 ½ teaspoons baking sheet with parchment paper', '11: Remove the plastic wrap from the dough and lightly 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour a work surface', '12:  Roll out the dough to about ½-inch thick', '13:  Cut out circles using a glass or cookie cutter', '14: Transfer the cookies to the prepared 1 ½ teaspoons baking sheet, leaving about 1 inch in between cookies', '15:  Bake for 8 minutes, until the cookie bottoms are golden brown and the tops are pale', '16:  Let the cookies cool on a wire rack', '17: Make the frosting: in a large bowl, beat the butter with an electric hand mixer until fluffy', '18:  Sift in the 2 cups powdered ¾ cup granulated 2 cups 2 cups powdered sugar and mix until incorporated', '19:  Add the 2 tablespoons milk and continue to beat until the frosting is smooth and velvety', '20:  Add food coloring, if desired', '21: Frost the cooled cookies and decorate as you wish', '22: Enjoy! ']

ingredients: ['1 cup butter (230 g) softened', '2 ½ cups powdered sugar (300 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '1 pinch salt', '3 eggs', '3 ½ cups flour (440 g)', '¼ teaspoon red food coloring', '¼ teaspoon orange food coloring', '¼ teaspoon yellow food coloring', '¼ teaspoon green food coloring', '¼ teaspoon blue food coloring', '¼ teaspoon purple food coloring']
instructions: ['1: Using a hand mixer or standing mixer, beat 1 cup butter until creamy', '2: Add 2 ½ cups powdered sugar and beat until combined', '3:  Add the 3 eggs, vanilla, and 1 pinch salt', '4:  Beat until well combined', '5: Gradually, add the 3 ½ cups flour until dough is moist and holds together, but doesn’t stick to your hands', '6: Place dough on a cutting board and form into a ball', '7:  Cut in half, then cover one half with plastic wrap and set aside', '8: Divide the other half into 6 pieces', '9:  The outer layers of the rainbow will need a little bit more dough, so make two of them slightly larger than the others', '10: Dye the dough with food coloring by placing a ¼ teaspoon of dye on the ball of dough and kneading it until it is one solid color', '11:  Gloves optional but suggested', '12: Starting with purple, roll the dough into a log about 6-8 inches (15-20 cm) long', '13:  This will be the center of the rainbow', '14: Next, roll out the blue dough with a rolling pin until it’s about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick, slightly longer than the purple, and wide enough to wrap around the purple dough', '15:  Repeat with the green, yellow, orange, and red doughs', '16:  The further away from the purple you get, the wider the dough needs to be to go around the previous color, making the red dough the widest', '17: Wrap the blue dough around the purple, pinching together any cracks that form, cutting off any excess dough', '18:  Repeat with the rest of the colors', '19: Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes', '20: Once chilled, remove the plastic wrap, and cut the dough in half to make 2 rainbow shapes', '21:  Set aside', '22: Cut the reserved dough in half, roll out to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness, and make it slightly longer than the rainbow log', '23: Place the rainbow dough in the center and wrap the plain dough around it, again, pinching together any cracks and smoothing out the surface', '24: Repeat with the other halves', '25:  Wrap with plastic wrap and chill for another 30 minutes', '26: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '27: Once chilled, remove the plastic wrap', '28:  Slice cookies about ½-inch (1 cm) thick and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet', '29: Bake for 20 minutes or until the bottom has browned slightly', '30: Cool on a cooling rack']

ingredients: ['1 cup lentils (200 g) rinsed', '2 cups vegetable broth (480 mL)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons cumin', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '15 oz corn (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz black beans (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '1 lb tortilla chips (455 g)', '1 ½ cups shredded mexican cheese blend (150 g)', '1 cup shredded lettuce (75 g)', '1 cup tomato (200 g) diced', '½ cup red onion (75 g) chopped', '2 jalapeñoes sliced', '⅓ cup fresh cilantro (15 g) chopped']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (175˚C)', '2: In a large pot, over medium-high heat, bring 1 cup lentils, 2 cups vegetable broth, 1 teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon pepper, 2 teaspoons chili powder, 2 teaspoons cumin, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and 1 teaspoon dried oregano to a boil', '3:  Once boiling, ½ cup reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes', '4: Once cooked, mix in the 15 oz corn and 15 oz black beans', '5: On a baking sheet, place a layer of 1 lb tortilla chips, followed by the lentil mixture and 1 ½ cups shredded mexican cheese', '6: Add another layer of 1 lb tortilla chips, 1 cup lentils, and 1 ½ cups shredded mexican cheese', '7: Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the 1 ½ cups shredded mexican cheese has melted', '8: Top with 1 cup shredded lettuce, tomatoes, ½ cup red onion, jalapeños, and guacamole, and ⅓ cup fresh cilantro']

ingredients: ['1 cup oat flour (90 g)', '2 scoops vanilla protein powder', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '¾ cup egg white (180 g)', '4 tablespoons low-fat greek yogurt', '1 teaspoon coconut oil']
instructions: ['1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup oat flour, 2 scoops vanilla protein powder, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon until fully blended', '2: Add ¾ cup egg whites and Greek yogurt to the bowl and mix until a batter-like consistency is reached', '3: Melt 1 teaspoon coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and wipe down to prevent the pancakes from sticking', '4: Pour in some batter and cook pancakes until bubbles form all around the top of the pancake, then flip and cook for a few more minutes, or until cooked through', '5: Top your pancake stack with bananas, blueberries, or honey']

ingredients: ['1 turkey fresh or frozen 1½ pounds (680 g) per person', '½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey', '1 cup unsalted butter (230 g) 2 sticks cubed and softened', '½ cup fresh sage leaf (20 g) plus more for garnish', '4 cloves garlic chopped', '1 tablespoon dried thyme', '1 tablespoon dried rosemary', '½ lemon cut into wedges plus more for garnish', '1 medium white onion skin-on cut into wedges', '1 large carrot chopped', '1 stalk celery chopped', '32 oz low-sodium chicken broth (945 mL) 1 carton', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour optional']
instructions: ['1: Defrost the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey', '2:  Place the wrapped 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey on a baking sheet and set on the bottom shelf of the fridge', '3:  Defrost for 1 day if 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey ½ cup fresh, or 4-5 days, if frozen', '4:  For a quicker defrost, submerge the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey in a 1 large sink or cooler filled with cold water and defrost for 30 minutes per pound of 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey', '5: 1 day before cooking, brine the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey', '6:  Measure the ½ teaspoon kosher salt into a small bowl', '7:  Set up your work station with kitchen shears, a plastic bag, a 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey ½ cup fresh baking sheet with a wire rack set over it, and a garbage can nearby', '8: Cut the packaging off the defrosted 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey, being careful not to cut the skin or flesh, and remove from the bag', '9:  Set the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey on the baking sheet with the wire rack', '10:  Cut off any excess skin around the neck and release the plastic holder securing the legs', '11:  Remove any innards and giblets from the cavity and discard', '12:  Thoroughly pat the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey dry with paper towels', '13: Sprinkle the ½ teaspoon kosher salt all over the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey, making sure to get in the cavity, under the skin, and between any crevices', '14: Refrigerate the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey, uncovered, for 1 day', '15:  If brining for more than 1 day, cover the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey with plastic wrap, then remove for the last day to let the skin dry out before roasting', '16: A few hours before serving, prepare the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey for roasting', '17:  Set an oven rack at the lowest height and the other in the middle of the oven', '18:  Preheat the oven to 325˚F (160˚C)', '19: Add the 1 cup unsalted butter to a 1 medium bowl', '20:  Chop the sage leaves and add to the bowl, along with the 4 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon dried thyme, and 1 tablespoon dried rosemary', '21:  Mash the herbs into the 1 cup unsalted butter', '22:  Set aside', '23: Set a roasting pan or single-use aluminum pan over a baking sheet near your work station', '24: Trim off the wing tips of the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey and add to the roasting pan', '25:  Cut off any excess skin to expose the wishbone, then use a paring knife to cut out the bone', '26:  Use your hands or kitchen shears if the bone is hard to remove', '27:  Add to the roasting pan', '28: Turn the bird so the legs are facing you', '29:  Tug out the plastic holder', '30:  Loosen the skin around the breasts, using your fingers to create a pocket', '31:  Be careful not to tear the skin', '32:  Rub the herb 1 cup unsalted butter under the skin, then all over the rest of the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey', '33:  Make sure to get in any crevices and the cavity', '34: Stuff the ½ lemon wedges and ¼ of the onion inside the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey cavity', '35:  Add the rest of the onion wedges to the roasting pan, along with the carrot and 1 stalk celery', '36:  Pour the 32 oz low-sodium chicken broth into the pan', '37: Use the wire rack to rest the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey over the roasting pan, then pour any accumulated juices from the baking sheet into the pan', '38: Set the roasting pan on the lowest oven rack', '39:  Place the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey on the wire rack on the middle oven rack, directly over the roasting pan to catch any juices', '40: Roast the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey for about 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 160˚F (71˚C)', '41:  Start checking the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey about 90 minutes into roasting to ensure it does not overcook', '42: Remove the 1 ½ teaspoon kosher ½ teaspoon kosher salt per pound (455g) of turkey from the oven and set the wire rack over a baking sheet to catch any juices', '43:  Let rest for about 30 minutes while the internal temperature climbs to 165˚F (74˚C)', '44: Meanwhile, make the gravy: Remove any solids from the roasting pan', '45:  Strain the liquid into a 1 large pot and bring to a boil, then let reduce to your desired consistency', '46:  The gravy can be served as is or, for a thicker gravy, ladle a few spoonfuls of stock into a small bowl with the 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '47:  Whisk until no lumps remain, then stir a bit of the 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour mixture at a time back into the pot', '48:  Return to a boil and let cook for 5 minutes, until thickened', '49:  Repeat as needed until the gravy has reached your desired consistency', '50:  Reduce the heat to low, whisking occasionally, until ready to serve, or remove
