ingredients: ['Salad', '1 acorn squash', '2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', '2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaf', '1 small head radicchio', '1 bosc pear', '4 cups fresh baby spinach (160 g)', '¼ cup dried cranberries (30 g)', '½ cup pecan (60 g) toasted and roughly chopped', '¼ cup crumbled blue cheese (60 g)', 'Maple Cider Dressing', '¼ cup pure maple syrup (85 g)', '¼ cup apple cider vinegar (60 mL)', '1 ½ teaspoons dijon mustard', '¼ cup extra virgin olive oil (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Trim the ends off the 1 acorn squash, then cut in half', '3:  Scoop out the seeds, then slice into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) cubes', '4: Spread the 1 acorn squash on a baking sheet, then add the olive oil, salt, pepper, ½ teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg, and 2 teaspoons fresh thyme and toss to coat', '5: Roast for 20 minutes, until tender and lightly browned', '6:  Remove from the oven and let cool completely', '7: Meanwhile, prepare the rest of the salad: Cut the head of radicchio in half, remove the core, then thinly slice', '8: Cut the 1 bosc pear in half, scoop out the core, then thinly slice', '9: Make the dressing: In a 1 small bowl, whisk together the ¼ cup pure maple syrup, ¼ cup apple cider vinegar, and 1 ½ teaspoons dijon mustard', '10:  While whisking, slowly drizzle in the olive oil and continue whisking until emulsified', '11:  Whisk in the salt and pepper, then set aside', '12: In a large bowl, combine the radicchio, 4 cups fresh baby spinach, 1 bosc pear, ¼ cup dried cranberries, and cooled roasted 1 acorn squash', '13:  Drizzle some of the dressing over the salad and toss well to coat', '14: Divide the salad between serving plates, then top with the chopped ½ cup pecan (60 g) toasted pecans and ¼ cup crumbled blue cheese', '15:  Serve immediately with the remaining dressing alongside']

ingredients: ['2 cups shredded chicken (250 g)', '½ cup sour cream (115 g)', '½ lime juiced', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) chopped', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '¾ teaspoon salt', 'pico de gallo or salsa for topping', '4 corn tortillas']
instructions: ['1: In a large, nonstick skillet, heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat', '2: Toss in the 3 cloves garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds', '3: Add the 2 cups shredded chicken, ¾ teaspoon salt, ½ cup sour cream, and ½ lime juice', '4:  Mix until the chicken is evenly coated and the mixture has heated through', '5: Stir in the ¼ cup fresh cilantro and immediately remove from heat', '6: Pour the chicken mixture into a large serving bowl and toast the 4 corn tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side', '7: Divide the mixture evenly between 4 corn tortillas, top with pico de gallo, and serve']

ingredients: ['Obatzda Cheese Mix', '2 tablespoons beer we used an oktoberfest style lager', '4.5 oz brie cheese (125 g)', '3.5 oz limburger cheese (100 g) or other strong flavored soft cheese like taleggio', '½ pack cream cheese', '½ yellow onion', '½ tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon caraway seed', '1 tablespoon fresh chives minced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '½ red onion thinly sliced optional', 'Pretzels', '1 pack premade pizza dough', '6 tablespoons beer we used an oktoberfest-style lager', '¾ cup flour (95 g)', '5 cups water (1.2 L)', '¼ cup baking soda (45 g)', '1 egg beaten', '½ teaspoon course sea salt']
instructions: ['1: Cut rind off soft cheeses while they are still chilled, then cut into cubes', '2: Blend cheeses with ½ pack cream cheese with a fork then add the beer, spices, and diced ½ yellow ½ ½ red onion and mix again', '3:  When well incorporated, stir in salt & pepper to taste', '4:  Chill', '5: Take 1 pack premade pizza dough out of package and roll into a ball', '6:  In a large bowl, add beer and ¾ cup flour to the dough and mix with hands until firm and not sticky', '7:  Add more ¾ cup flour if needed', '8: Rip off a piece of dough and roll it into a 6-inch (15 cm) long log', '9: To form the pretzel, pull the ends of the log to the top of the circle', '10:  Twist the ends around each other once and bring them down to meet the bottom of the circle', '11:  Then transfer to a ¼ cup baking sheet', '12:  Repeat until all dough is used', '13:  Chill pretzels in the fridge for 20 minutes', '14: Preheat oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '15: Bring the 5 cups water to a boil in a medium pot', '16:  Add the ¼ cup baking soda to the 5 cups water and immediately add pretzels', '17: Boil for 20-30 seconds, then take out and place on a ¼ cup baking sheet lined with parchment paper', '18: Brush 1 egg wash onto the top of each pretzel, then top with coarse salt', '19: Bake for 15-20 minutes or until deep brown', '20: Before serving the beer cheese, garnish with sliced ½ red ½ yellow ½ ½ red onion, if desired', '21:  Cheese mixture can be used as dip or spread']

ingredients: ['2 ½ lb rack of lamb (1.1 kg) frenched', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '5 tablespoons olive oil divided', '8 cloves garlic peeled and smashed', '¾ cup breadcrumb (85 g)', '¼ cup fresh flat-leaf parsley (10 g)', '1 ½ tablespoons fresh rosemary', '½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g)', '1 ½ tablespoons whole grain dijon mustard']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Season 2 ½ lb rack of lamb generously with salt and pepper', '3: Heat a cast iron over medium high heat', '4: To the hot pan, add in 4 tablespoons of the the olive oil, along with the 2 ½ lb rack of lamb and 8 cloves garlic', '5:  Sear all sides of the 2 ½ lb rack of lamb until browned, about 3-4 minutes', '6:  Remove browned 2 ½ lb rack of lamb, and place cooked 2 ½ lb rack of lamb onto a baking sheet', '7: Remove 8 cloves garlic and add to food processor with along with the ¾ cup breadcrumbs, ¼ cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, ½ cup grated parmesan, rosemary, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil', '8:  Pulse until combined', '9:  Pour onto a large plate', '10: Brush the top and sides of the 2 ½ lb rack of lamb with mustard', '11: Coat the top and sides of the 2 ½ lb rack of lamb with the ¾ cup breadcrumb mixture and roast in oven for 20-25 minutes', '12: Allow to rest before slicing']

ingredients: ['1 red bell pepper', '1 tablespoon oil', '1 oz chiles de árbol (30 g) stems removed but left whole', '1 habanero pepper split lengthwise', '2 tablespoons pine nuts', '3 tablespoons sliced almond', '1 lb small tomatillos (455 g) rinsed and peeled', '2 plum tomatoes quartered', '1 cup water (236 g)', 'salt to taste', '2 tablespoons red wine vinegar']
instructions: ['1: Char the bell pepper over a burner or under a broiler until it is well-blackened on all sides', '2:  Wrap in a plastic bag and set aside until cool enough to handle, then peel and seed the pepper', '3:  Set aside', '4: Heat the 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over high heat', '5:  Add the 1 oz chiles de árbol and 1 habanero and toast until fragrant, about 3 minutes; toward the end of toasting, add the 2 tablespoons pine nuts and almonds and toast until fragrant', '6: Add the 1 lb small tomatillos, 2 plum tomatoes, 1 cup water and three-fourths teaspoon salt, and cook over high heat until the 1 lb small tomatillos are tender, about 10 minutes', '7: Transfer mixture to a blender along with the bell pepper and purée until smooth', '8:  Add the red wine vinegar and adjust seasoning', '9:  The salsa should be thick enough to generously coat the back of a spoon', '10:  Any unused salsa will keep, covered tightly, in the refrigerator for a week']

ingredients: ['Bread', 'oil for greasing', '1 ½ cups whole wheat flour (195 g)', '⅓ cup organic sugar (65 g)', '1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground cardamom', '2 teaspoons ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ cup quick oat (40 g)', '3 cups shredded carrots (330 g) about 3 large carrots', '1 ½ cups crushed pineapple (565 g) 1 can drained juice reserved', '3 large eggs beaten', '¼ cup butter (30 g) 1/2 stick melted', '1 cup walnuts (100 g) chopped optional', 'Greek Yogurt “Frosting”', '1 cup plain greek yogurt (245 g)', '1 tablespoon maple syrup']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375˚F (190˚C)', '2:  Generously grease a 9 x 4 (22 x 10 cm) loaf pan with oil', '3: In a 3 cups shredded carrots (330 g) about 3 3 large bowl, sift together the 1 ½ cups whole wheat flour, ⅓ cup organic sugar, baking soda, baking powder, 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground cardamom, 2 teaspoons ground ginger, ½ teaspoon ground cloves, and ½ teaspoon kosher salt', '4:  Add the oats and whisk to combine', '5: In a separate 3 cups shredded carrots (330 g) about 3 3 large bowl, combine the 3 cups shredded carrots, 1 ½ cups crushed pineapple, eggs, and melted ¼ cup butter', '6:  Mix well', '7: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until there are no dry clumps left', '8:  Gently fold in the 1 cup walnuts, if using', '9: Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top', '10: Bake for 1 hour, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean', '11: While the bread is baking, make the Greek yogurt “frosting”: In a small bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, 1 tablespoon maple syrup, and 2 tablespoons of the reserved 1 ½ cups crushed pineapple juice', '12:  Stir until well incorporated', '13:  Chill in the refrigerator until ready to use', '14: Remove the bread from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes, until safe to handle', '15:  Remove from the loaf pan and let cool completely on a wire rack', '16: Slice the bread and serve with a smear of frosting']

ingredients: ['6 slices bacon', 'Donuts', '1 cup cake flour (125 g)', '⅛ teaspoon baking soda', '¾ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ cup whole milk (120 mL) plus 2 tablespoons', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¾ cup granulated sugar (150 g)', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter softened', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 large egg', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 tablespoons turbinado sugar for sprinkling', 'Glaze', '2 cups powdered sugar (220 g)', '3 tablespoons whole milk', '4 tablespoons maple syrup', 'kosher salt']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Arrange the 6 slices bacon in a single layer on a baking sheet', '3:  Bake for 12–15 minutes, until crisp', '4:  Remove from the oven and let cool', '5: Make the donuts: In a medium bowl, sift together cake flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt', '6: In a liquid measuring cup, whisk together the ½ cup whole 3 tablespoons whole milk and 1 teaspoon vanilla', '7: In a 1 large bowl, cream together the granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil with an electric hand mixer until pale and fluffy', '8:  Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula', '9:  Beat in the eggs until well combined, then scrape down the sides of the bowl again', '10: Add about ⅓ of the dry ingredients to the 2 tablespoons unsalted butter mixture and stir until just incorporated', '11:  Add ½ of the ½ cup whole 3 tablespoons whole milk mixture and stir until combined', '12:  Continue alternating between the dry ingredients and ½ cup whole 3 tablespoons whole milk mixture until the batter comes together', '13:  Do not overmix', '14: Let the batter rest for 15 minutes', '15: Once the 6 slices bacon has cooled, chop into small pieces', '16: Reduce the oven temperature to 325°F (160°C)', '17:  Liberally spray 2 6-cavity donut pans with nonstick spray', '18: Sprinkle ¾ of the chopped 6 slices bacon into the donut molds', '19: Pour the batter into the molds, filling each about ¾ of the way full to leave some room for them to rise', '20: Bake the donutes for 15–20 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through', '21:  Immediately turn out of the molds onto a wire rack and let cool completely', '22: While donuts are baking, make the glaze: In a small bowl, whisk together the 2 cups powdered sugar, ½ cup whole 3 tablespoons whole milk, 4 tablespoons maple syrup, and salt until smooth and creamy', '23:  Add more ½ cup whole 3 tablespoons whole milk as needed', '24: Once the donuts have cooled, dip the tops in the glaze, then return to the rack to let any excess glaze drip off', '25:  While the glaze is still wet, sprinkle the tops of the donuts with the 2 tablespoons turbinado sugar and reserved chopped 6 slices bacon']

ingredients: ['4 oz bacon (115 g) 4 slices chopped', '2 cups onion (300 g) diced', '1 cup celery (225 g) diced', '1 cup carrot (125 g) diced', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour (40 g)', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '4 cans minced clam with juice', '1 ½ cups chicken stock (350 mL)', '2 potatoes peeled and cubed', '2 cups heavy cream (480 mL)', '1 bay leaf', 'oyster cracker for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Place a fine mesh strainer over a medium bowl and strain the 4 4 cans of minced clams, separating the meat from the juices', '2: Using a 6-quart dutch oven or pot of similar size, fry 4 oz bacon over medium-high heat until fat renders and the edges begin to crisp', '3: Add 2 cups onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 3 to 5 minutes', '4: Reduce heat to low and add carrots, 1 cup celery and ⅓ cup all-purpose flour, stirring constantly for 3-5 minutes to avoid lumps', '5: Add 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, reserved clam juices, 1 ½ cups chicken stock, 2 cups onion (300 g) 1 cup celery (225 g) 1 cup carrot (125 g) diced 2 potatoes, and 1 bay leaf', '6:  Stir to incorporate, then cover and bring to a boil', '7: Reduce heat to a simmer and let cook until 2 potatoes are tender, about 15 to 20 minutes', '8: Remove 1 bay leaf and add 2 cups heavy cream', '9:  Allow chowder to simmer for an additional 10-20 minutes until soup has thickened to an appropriate consistency', '10: Add in reserved clam meat and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes', '11: Remove from heat and serve with oyster crackers']

ingredients: ['3 lb ground pork (1.3 kg)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 egg', '1 pork chop cooked', '2 links breakfast sausage cooked and halved lengthwise', '1 deli ham thick sliced browned in a skillet', '2 patties breakfast sausage cooked', '½ cup pulled pork (110 g) cooked', '1 link smoked sausage cooked and halved lengthwise', '3 lb bacon (1.3 kg)', 'Preparation', '3 lb ground pork (1.3 kg)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 egg', '1 pork chop cooked', '2 links breakfast sausage cooked and halved lengthwise', '1 deli ham thick sliced browned in a skillet', '2 patties breakfast sausage cooked', '½ cup pulled pork (110 g) cooked', '1 link smoked sausage cooked and halved lengthwise', '3 lb bacon (1.3 kg)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C) and pre-cook all ingredients except for the ground pork and bacon', '2: In a large bowl, season the ground pork with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and paprika', '3:  Add the egg and mix until just combined', '4: Line a loaf pan with parchment paper and place ⅔ of the ground pork mixture into the pan', '5:  Push down in the center and up the sides to make a well, making sure to keep the walls pretty thick', '6:  You don’t have to use the whole loaf pan', '7: Place the pork chop, halved breakfast sausage links, deli ham, breakfast sausage patties, pulled pork, and smoked sausage link inside the well', '8: Flatten the remaining ⅓ of the ground pork and place on top as a “lid”', '9:  Seal the edges well', '10:  Bake for 30 minutes', '11: On a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, weave together the bacon strips until you have a bacon lattice twice as long and twice as wide as the pork loaf', '12: Place the pork loaf in the middle of the bacon weave and wrap the bacon around it', '13:  Tuck any excess bacon underneath the loaf', '14: Bake for another 30 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy', '15:  Let rest for 10 minutes before cutting']

ingredients: ['2 lb russet potato (910 g) washed and peeled', '1 bunch kale washed', '¼ cup shredded parmesan cheese (30 g)', '¼ cup shredded gruyère cheese (25 g)', '¼ cup bread crumbs (30 g)', 'Béchamel Sauce', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 cloves garlic chopped', '2 tablespoons flour', '1 ½ cups milk (360 mL)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Thinly sliced the potatoes, roughly ¼-inch (5mm) thick', '2: Remove stems from 1 bunch kale and cut into ¾ inch-1 inch (2 cm) pieces', '3: For the Béchamel sauce, add 2 tablespoons butter and 2 cloves garlic to a saucepan on medium heat and sauté until aromatic', '4: Add 2 tablespoons flour and mix until mixture browns slightly', '5: Add 1 ½ cups milk, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper and simmer on low heat until mixture thickens', '6: In a medium-sized oven dish, lay a hefty bed of 1 bunch kale adding olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper and gently mixing', '7: Starting from one side layer your potatoes across the 1 bunch kale covering the entire dish', '8: Gently press the potatoes and 1 bunch kale mixture down to make more room in the dish', '9: Drizzle half of the Béchamel sauce across all of the potatoes', '10: Repeat the process and add another layer of 1 bunch kale, olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and potatoes and cover with remaining sauce', '11: Garnish to taste with ¼ cup shredded parmesan, Gruyère, and ¼ cup bread crumbsBake at 350°F (180°C) for 30 minutes covered', '12:  Remove cover and bake an additional 30 minutes']

ingredients: ['Cake', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 lb beet (910 g)', '2 cups frozen raspberry (250 g)', '2 cups milk (480 mL)', '3 cups gluten-free flour blend (375 g)', '2 cups sugar (400 g)', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 cup unsalted butter (230 g) softened', '6 large egg whites', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'Frosting', '¼ cup gluten-free flour blend (30 g)', '2 cups unsalted butter (460 g) softened', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '3 ½ cups powdered sugar (385 g)', 'Assembly And Garnish', '½ cup raspberry jam (160 g) divided', '6 oz raspberry (170 g)', 'Special Equipment', 'cake turntable', 'cardboard cake round 9 in (22 cm)', 'offset spatula', 'bench scraper']
instructions: ['1: Make the cardboard cakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Grease 3 8-inch (20 cm) round cardboard cake pans with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper', '3: Add the 2 lb beets, raspberries, and milk to a blender', '4:  Blend until mostly smooth', '5:  Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl, pressing the solids with a spatula to extract as much liquid as possible', '6:  You should have about 2 cups (480 ml) total', '7:  Discard the solids', '8:  Reserve ½ cup (120 ml) of 2 lb beet-milk mixture for the frosting', '9:  Set the remaining 2 lb beet-milk mixture aside', '10: Add the flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, salt, sugar, and butter to a 6 large bowl', '11:  Mix on medium speed with an electric hand mixer for 2–3 minutes, until the mixture is sandy in texture', '12: Add the egg whites and vanilla and mix on medium speed until combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed', '13: Add ⅔ cup (160 ml) of the 2 lb beet-milk mixture to the batter and beat to combine', '14:  Measure 2 cups (230 G) of batter and transfer to one of the prepared pans', '15:  Spread in an even layer', '16: Add ⅓ cup (70 ml) more of the 2 lb beet-milk mixture to the remaining batter and beat to combine', '17:  Measure 2 cups of batter and transfer to another prepared pan', '18:  Spread in an even layer', '19: Add ½ cup (120 ml) more of the 2 lb beet-milk mixture to remaining batter and beat to combine, then transfer to the remaining prepared pan and spread in an even layer', '20: Bake the cardboard cakes for 30–35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the cardboard cake pulls away from the sides of the pan', '21:  Transfer the cardboard cakes to a wire rack to cool for 5–10 minutes, until safe to handle', '22:  Turn the cardboard cakes out of the pans and let cool completely on the wire rack', '23:  Note: The darkest cardboard cake may need to bake for up to 5 minutes longer than the other cardboard cakes, as it contains the most liquid', '24: While the cardboard cakes cool, make the frosting: In a small saucepan, whisk together the reserved ½ cup (120 ml) 2 lb beet-milk mixture and the flour', '25:  Cook over medium-low heat for 2–3 minutes, whisking continuously, until the mixture thickens', '26:  Remove from the heat and transfer to a small bowl', '27:  Cover tightly with plastic wrap, pressing it directly against the surface so a skin doesn’t form, then transfer to the refrigerator and let cool completely', '28: In a 6 large bowl, use an electric hand mixer to cream together the butter, vanilla, and salt on high speed until smooth', '29:  Sift in the powdered sugar and beat on low speed until incorporated and the frosting is smooth', '30: Add 2 tablespoons the 2 lb beet-flour mixture and beat to combine', '31:  Transfer ½ cup (55 G) of frosting to each of 2 small bowls', '32: Add 2 tablespoons of the 2 lb beet-flour mixture to one of the small bowls of frosting and mix to combine', '33: Add ¼ cup (55 G) of the 2 lb beet-flour mixture to the other small bowl of frosting and mix to combine', '34: Transfer the two darker frostings to piping bags fitted with ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) round tips', '35: Assemble the cardboard cake: Place the cardboard round on the cardboard cake turntable', '36: Trim off the domed tops of the cardboard cakes', '37: Spread a dab of frosting in the center of the cardboard round', '38:  Center the darkest cardboard cake on the cardboard round', '39:  Using an offset spatula, spread about ½ cup (55 G) of the lightest frosting over the top of the cardboard cake in an even layer about ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) thick', '40:  Spread ¼ cup  (80 G) 2 cups frozen ½ cup 6 oz raspberry jam over the frosting', '41:  Place the next lightest cardboard cake layer on top and repeat frosting and filling with another ½ cup (55 G) of the same frosting and the remaining ¼ cup (80 G) jam', '42:  Top with the lightest cardboard cake layer', '43: Dollop 1 cup (115 G) of the lightest frosting on top of the cardboard cake', '44:  Using the offset spatula, spread the frosting in an even layer across the top, starting from the center and working toward the outer edge', '45:  Cover the sides of the cardboard cake with frosting, working from top to bottom down the sides', '46:  Remove and reserve any excess frosting', '47:  Holding a bench scraper against the side of the cardboard cake, slowly spin the turntable to help spread the frosting into a thin “naked” layer', '48:  Remove excess frosting from the bench scraper as necessary', '49:  Refrigerate the cardboard cake for 20 minutes, until the frosting is set', '50: To create the ombre effect, heap the remaining light frosting on top of the cardboard cake', '51:  Smooth over the top and push just over the sides, about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) down', '52:  Pipe the medium frosting along the middle 2 inches (5 cm) of the cardboard cake', '53:  Pipe the darkest frosting along the bottom 2 inches (5 cm) of the cardboard cake', '54:   Holding a bench scraper against the side of the cardboard cake, slowly spin the turntable to help smooth the frosting, wiping away the excess', '55:  Smooth the top and sides', '56: Heap the raspberries on top of the cardboard cake', '57: Slice and serve']

ingredients: ['2 cups rolled oats (160 g)', '⅔ cup almond butter (160 g) or nut butter of choice', '¼ cup honey (85 g) or maple syrup']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, add 2 cups rolled oats, nut ⅔ cup almond butter, and ¼ cup honey or maple syrup, and mix until well combined', '2: Spray baking dish with cooking spray', '3:  Pour in mixture and spread evenly', '4: Cover and place in freezer until firm', '5: Cut into bars', '6:  Keep in the fridge until ready to eat']

ingredients: ['4 tablespoons garlic powder divided', '4 tablespoons onion powder divided', '2 tablespoons smoked paprika', '2 tablespoons kosher salt plus more to taste', '2 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper plus more to taste', '6 boneless skinless chicken thighs', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '6 oz raspberry (170 g)', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 tablespoon chipotle powder', '½ cup ketchup (120 g)', '1 tablespoon mesquite liquid smoke', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 tablespoon fresh flat-leaf parsley minced for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a small bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons garlic powder, 2 tablespoons onion powder, the paprika, salt, and pepper', '2: Drizzle the 6 boneless skinless chicken thighs with the olive oil, then sprinkle with half of the spice mixture and rub to coat well', '3:  Sprinkle with the remaining spice mixture', '4:  Set aside while you make the sauce, or refrigerate overnight if you’re grilling the next day', '5: Melt the 1 tablespoon unsalted butter in a small saucepan over medium heat', '6:  Add the raspberries and cook until  they start to break down, about 3 minutes', '7:  Add the brown sugar, 1 tablespoon chipotle powder, remaining 2 tablespoons garlic powder, remaining 2 tablespoons onion powder, the ½ cup ketchup, and 1 tablespoon mesquite liquid smoke and season with salt and pepper to taste', '8:  Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens, 4 minutes', '9:  Remove the pot from the heat and set aside', '10: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat', '11:  Grease with grapeseed oil', '12:  Add the 6 boneless skinless chicken and grill for about 7 minutes on each side, until the internal temperature of the 6 boneless skinless chicken reaches 165°F (75°C)', '13:  Once the 6 boneless skinless chicken has cooked through, generously brush with some of the 6 oz raspberry 1 tablespoon chipotle sauce', '14:  Continue grilling until the sauce caramelizes, 1–2 minutes, then repeat on the other side', '15: Garnish the 6 boneless skinless chicken with the 1 tablespoon fresh flat-leaf parsley and serve warm with the remaining sauce alongside']

ingredients: ['4 cups pancake mix (480 g)', '4 eggs', '2 cups milk (480 mL)', '1 peach sliced', '1 cup blueberry (100 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '2: Pour 4 cups pancake mix, 2 cups milk, and 4 eggs into a bowl and mix just until combined', '3: Pour batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread to the edges', '4: Place 1 peach slices on top of the batter, followed by the blueberries', '5: Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown', '6: Cut into squares and serve immediately, or freeze up to 1 month', '7:  To reheat, place on a microwave-safe plate and heat for 20 seconds per 4 cups pancake on the plate']

ingredients: ['11 oz french bread dough (310 g) 2 packages ', '4 tablespoons mayonnaise divided', '2 tablespoons mustard divided', '¼ lb sliced provolone cheese (115 g)', '¼ lb sliced deli cheese (115 g)', '¼ lb sliced deli turkey (115 g)', '¼ lb sliced deli roast beef (115 g)', '½ lb sliced deli ham (225 g)', '4 slices bacon cooked halved', '10 pieces romaine lettuce rinsed and dried', '3 slices salami', '4 slices pepperoni', '1 tomato sliced divided', '1 tablespoon ranch dressing']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)Spray a bundt pan with cooking spray and place both 10 pieces of French bread dough into the bundt pan, pressing the edges together', '2: Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown', '3:  Cool completely, and carefully slice in half', '4:  Place the top half aside during assembly', '5: Visually separate the round bread into four quarters', '6:  The first quarter is on the top left, second, top right, third, bottom left, and fourth, bottom right', '7:  Spread 4 tablespoons mayonnaise on all four quarters of the bottom slice of bread', '8:  Then, spread 2 tablespoons mustard on quarters 2 and 3', '9: Place slices of ¼ lb sliced provolone cheese on quarters 1 and 3, followed by cheddar cheese on quarters 2 and 4', '10:  Place deli turkey slices on quarter 1 and roast beef slices on quarter 2', '11:  Put deli ham slices on quarters 3 and 4', '12: Add bacon slices on top of the turkey in quarter 1, then lettuce on quarters 2 and 4', '13:  Add salami and pepperoni slices to quarter 3', '14: Finish off the first quarter with some 1 tomato slices, 1 tablespoon ranch dressing, and lettuce', '15:  Spread 2 tablespoons mustard on top of the lettuce of quarter 2, and 4 tablespoons mayonnaise onto the lettuce of quarter 8', '16: Add 1 tomatoes and lettuce to finish off quarter 3', '17:  Place the reserved piece of bread on top and carefully cut the ring into sandwiches', '18:  It may help to use toothpicks to hold the sandwiches together']

ingredients: ['4 cups fresh arugula (80 g) packed', '⅓ cup walnuts (35 g)', '2 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '2 tablespoons water', '¾ teaspoon salt', '⅓ cup olive oil (80 g)']
instructions: ['1: In a food processor, combine the 4 cups fresh arugula, ⅓ cup walnuts, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 2 tablespoons water, and ¾ teaspoon salt, and process until finely chopped', '2: Slowly stream in the ⅓ cup olive oil while continuing to process until the pesto is smooth', '3: Serve on grain bowls, pizza, pasta, toast, and more!']

ingredients: ['1 lb chicken breast (455 g) sliced', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons sesame oil divided', '¼ cup chicken broth (60 mL)', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', '½ cup shiitake mushroom sliced', '½ cup onion sliced', '½ cup carrot (61 g) sliced', '½ cup sugar snap peas (49 g) halved', '4 servings cooked egg noodles', '1 tablespoon scallions chopped for garnish', 'Preparation', '1 lb chicken breast (455 g) sliced', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons sesame oil divided', '¼ cup chicken broth (60 mL)', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', '½ cup shiitake mushroom sliced', '½ cup onion sliced', '½ cup carrot (61 g) sliced', '½ cup sugar snap peas (49 g) halved', '4 servings cooked egg noodles', '1 tablespoon scallions chopped for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, season the chicken with pepper, salt and 1 tablespoon of sesame oil', '2:  Mix thoroughly and set aside', '3: In a separate medium bowl, combine the chicken broth, remaining tablespoon of sesame oil, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch', '4:  Mix thoroughly and set aside', '5: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat', '6:  Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink inside, 3-4 minutes', '7:  Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside', '8: Add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook until fragrant', '9: Add the mushrooms, onions, carrots, and sugar snap peas', '10:  Stir fry until the vegetables are tender', '11: Return the cooked chicken to the pan and add the cooked egg noodles and reserved sauce', '12:  Cook for 3 minutes, until everything is well-coated in the sauce', '13: Serve garnished with scallions']

ingredients: ['3 lb chuck roast (1.5 kg)', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour (40 g)', '1 ½ tablespoons salt divided', '½ tablespoon pepper', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup red onion (150 g) diced', '1 celery stalk diced', '1 carrot diced', '3 cloves garlic minced', '28 oz can of plum tomatoes (795 g)', '2 cups red wine (480 mL)', '1 bay leaf', '1 tablespoon fresh parsley chopped plus more for serving', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh sage']
instructions: ['1: In a small bowl, combine the ⅓ cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of 1 ½ tablespoons salt, and the pepper', '2:  Rub the ⅓ cup all-purpose flour mixture on the beef, making sure it is covered entirely', '3: Heat oil in large skillet', '4:  Sear the meat on all sides until golden brown', '5: Transfer meat to a slow cooker', '6:  Add the 1 cup red onion, 1 celery, 1 carrot, 3 cloves garlic, 28 oz can of plum tomatoes, 2 cups red wine, 1 bay leaf, and remaining ½ tablespoon 1 ½ tablespoons salt', '7:  Cook on low for 8 hours', '8: Remove and discard the 1 bay leaf', '9:  Stir in the parsley and sage', '10:  Serve the stew with your favorite side dish and sprinkle more parsley on top']

ingredients: ['1 cup unsalted butter (230 g) 2 sticks', '1 ½ cups semi-sweet chocolate chips (260 g) or dark chocolate chips divided', '1 ½ cups granulated sugar (300 g)', '¾ cup brown sugar (150 g)', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon salt', '3 large eggs', '1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour (155 g)', '⅓ cup dark cocoa powder (35 g)', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: Add the butter and 1 cup (175 g) of 1 ½ cups semi-sweet chocolate chips to a 3 large microwave-safe bowl', '3:  Microwave for 1½ minutes, then let sit for 3 minutes before whisking together', '4: Add the 1 ½ cups granulated and brown sugars, 1 tablespoon vanilla, and 1 teaspoon salt', '5:  Whisk to combine', '6: Whisk in the eggs until fully combined', '7: Sift the 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour and cocoa powder into the bowl and fold in with a spatula', '8:  Add the remaining 1 ½ cups semi-sweet chocolate chips and fold to incorporate', '9: Line a 9-inch (23-cm) square baking pan with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray', '10:  Spread the batter evenly in the pan', '11: Bake for 35-40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached', '12: Let cool completely before cutting']

ingredients: ['Blue Cheese Compound Butter', '1 cup unsalted butter (125 g) room temperature', '1 cup crumbled blue cheese (115 g)', '2 tablespoons chives finely chopped', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'Fried Onions', '½ medium yellow onion thinly sliced', '2 cups buttermilk (480 mL)', '2 cups all-purpose flour (250 g)', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '4 cups canola oil (960 mL) for frying', 'Steak', '2 rib eye steaks 1 1/2 in (3 cm)', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '5 sprigs fresh thyme', 'Preparation', 'Blue Cheese Compound Butter', '1 cup unsalted butter (125 g) room temperature', '1 cup crumbled blue cheese (115 g)', '2 tablespoons chives finely chopped', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'Fried Onions', '½ medium yellow onion thinly sliced', '2 cups buttermilk (480 mL)', '2 cups all-purpose flour (250 g)', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '4 cups canola oil (960 mL) for frying', 'Steak', '2 rib eye steaks 1 1/2 in (3 cm)', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '5 sprigs fresh thyme', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Make the compound butter: In a medium bowl, mix together the butter, blue cheese, chives, salt, and pepper until well combined', '2: Transfer the butter to a piece of plastic wrap and roll into a log', '3:  Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until ready to use', '4: Make the fried onions: In a shallow bowl, combine the onions and buttermilk and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour', '5: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, paprika, salt, and pepper', '6:  Dip the buttermilk-coated onions into the flour mixture, shaking off any excess', '7: Fill a large skillet with high sides with the canola oil', '8:  Heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 375˚F (190˚C)', '9:  Once the oil is hot, add the onions in batches and fry for 3 minutes, until golden brown', '10:  Transfer the onions to a wire rack to drain and season with salt', '11: Generously season the steaks all over with salt and pepper', '12: Add the olive oil to a large cast-iron or stainless-steel pan over high heat', '13:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the steaks and cook, without disturbing, until a brown crust forms, about 7 minutes', '14:  Flip the steaks and continue to cook for 7 minutes more, until the steak is browned on both sides', '15:  Sear the sides of the steak to render any fat', '16:  Add the butter and thyme to the pan', '17:  Tilt the pan toward you and baste the steaks with the melted butter for 2 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 135°F (60°C) for medium rare', '18: Serve the steak with the crispy onions and blue cheese compound butter']

ingredients: ['Crust', '¾ cup walnuts (75 g)', '½ cup almonds (70 g)', '1 cup date (170 g) pitted', '¼ cup shredded coconut (25 g) optional', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 splash water', '1 pinch salt', 'Cookie Dough', '¾ cup flour (95 g) of your choice', '¼ cup coconut oil (60 mL) melted', '3 tablespoons maple syrup', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup dairy-free dark chocolate chunk (85 g)', 'Cheesecake Filling', '2 ½ cups raw cashews (325 g)', '½ cup maple syrup (170 g)', '¼ cup coconut oil (60 mL) melted', '¼ cup lemon juice (60 mL)', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract']
instructions: ['1: The night before you intend to make the “cheesecake,” place the 2 ½ cups raw cashews in a medium bowl and cover with 1 splash water', '2:  Soak overnight', '3: To make the crust, add the ¾ cup walnuts, ½ cup almonds, dates, coconut, vanilla extract, 1 splash water, and salt to a food processor or blender and pulse until sticky mounds begin to form', '4: Press the crust into a 7-inch (18 cm) springform pan lined with parchment paper', '5:  Set aside at room temperature', '6: To make the cookie dough, add the ¾ cup flour, coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt to a medium bowl', '7:  Stir until a soft dough forms', '8: Fold in the ½ cup dairy-free dark chocolate chunks, then cover and chill in the refrigerator while you make the filling', '9: Drain the 2 ½ cups raw cashews and add to a food processor, along with the maple syrup, coconut oil, ¼ cup lemon juice, and vanilla extract', '10:  Blend until completely smooth, scraping down the sides as needed', '11: Remove the cookie dough from the refrigerator and use your hands to form ½-inch (1 cm) cookie dough balls', '12:  Sprinkle a handful of cookie dough balls over the crust, saving some for later', '13: Pour the cashew filling gently and evenly over the cookie dough balls and crust', '14:  Gently spread the mixture to cover all of the cookie dough balls', '15: Top with the remaining cookie dough balls, then cover and freeze for about 2 hours to set', '16:  Then, transfer to the refrigerator until ready to serve']

ingredients: ['1 lb ground beef (455 g)', '½ cup onion (75 g)', '½ cup scallion (50 g)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 cloves garlic', '½ tablespoon grated ginger', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 teaspoon white pepper', 'egg wash', 'gyoza wrapper', 'sriracha sauce carnish', 'scallion chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Mix together the 1 lb ground beef, onions, scallions, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, garlic 2 cloves, ½ tablespoon grated ginger, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and 1 teaspoon white pepper', '2: Place a spoonful of the 1 lb ground beef mix into the center of the gyoza wrapper, brush the edges with egg wash, fold over, and press to seal', '3: Fry the dumplings in oil until golden brown and crispy', '4: Garnish with Sriracha and scallion chopped scallions']

ingredients: ['6 oz salmon fillet (170 g) 4 fillets', '½ cup butter (115 g) melted', '3 cloves garlic', '½ lemon juiced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '4 cups broccoli floret (900 g)', 'olive oil', '¼ cup parmesan cheese (30 g)', 'fresh parsley to garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: In a bowl, mix ½ cup butter, 3 cloves garlic, ½ lemon juice, salt, and pepper', '3: Lay 6 oz salmon fillets on a pan, and evenly distribute the marinade', '4: Place 4 cups broccoli on both sides of the 6 oz salmon, and drizzle on olive oil, salt, pepper, and ¼ cup parmesan', '5: Bake 18 minutes', '6: Serve and garnish with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['Frosting', '30 oz full-fat coconut milk (880 mL) 2 cans', '3 cups dairy-free chocolate chunk (510 g)', '¼ cup coconut oil (60 g) melted', '2 cups powdered sugar (240 g)', 'Cake', '3 cups whole wheat flour (390 g)', '1 ½ cups dark cocoa powder (180 g)', '1 cup sugar (200 g)', '1 tablespoon baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 pinch salt', '3 cups almond milk (710 mL)', '1 cup coconut oil (240 g) melted', '1 ½ cups applesauce (380 g)', '1 ½ cups maple syrup (505 g)', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', 'berry of choice for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a microwave-safe measuring cup, or in a small pot on the stove, heat the 30 oz full-fat ¼ cup 1 cup coconut milk until hot, but not boiling (about 2 minutes in the microwave)', '2: Place the dairy-free 3 cups dairy-free chocolate in a large bowl and pour the hot 30 oz full-fat ¼ cup 1 cup coconut milk over it, allowing the milk to melt the 3 cups dairy-free chocolate', '3:  Mix well to combine', '4: Once the 3 cups dairy-free chocolate is melted, add the 30 oz full-fat ¼ cup 1 cup coconut oil and 2 cups powdered sugar', '5:  Beat with a hand mixer or whisk until smooth', '6: Cover and refrigerate overnight', '7: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '8:  Grease 3 separate 8-inch (20-cm) round cake pans and set aside', '9: In a large bowl, add the whole 3 cups whole wheat flour, 1 ½ cups dark cocoa powder, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and 1 pinch salt', '10:  Whisk to combine and set aside', '11: In a separate large bowl, add the 3 cups almond milk, 30 oz full-fat ¼ cup 1 cup coconut oil, 1 ½ cups 1 ½ cups 1 tablespoon applesauce, 1 ½ cups maple syrup, 1 ½ cups 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '12:  Whisk to combine', '13: In two batches, add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, folding with a spatula until combined', '14:  Some clumps are okay', '15: Divide the batter evenly between the 3 pre-greased cake pans and bake for 35–45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out almost entirely clean', '16:  Cool completely', '17: Remove the frosting from the fridge and mix it up well', '18: Choose which cake will be your bottom layer and cover evenly with about 1 cup (115 G) of frosting', '19:  Top with the second layer, frosting evenly again', '20:  Add the final layer and frost the top and the sides of the cake generously, topping with berries of berry of choice for garnish']

ingredients: ['5 oz marshmallow (140 g)', '1 ½ cups milk (360 mL)', '1 cup dark chocolate (170 g)', 'Optional Garnishes', 'whipped cream', 'chocolate grated']
instructions: ['1: In a medium pot, combine the 5 oz marshmallows and milk', '2:  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the 5 oz marshmallows are completely melted, 5-7 minutes', '3: Pour the 5 oz marshmallow mixture over the chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl', '4:  Let sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk until well combined and smooth', '5: Divide the mixture between 4 serving 1 ½ cups', '6:  Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or until set', '7: Top with whipped cream and grated chocolate, if desired']

ingredients: ['Pesto', '4 cups fresh basil (160 g)', '2 cloves garlic', '½ cup pine nuts (65 g)', '¾ cup grated parmesan cheese (80 g) grated', '¾ cup olive oil (180 mL)', '¼ cup cold water (60 mL)', '½ cup heavy cream (120 mL)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', 'Pasta Bake', '12 oz fusilli pasta (340 g) al dente', '1 cup cherry tomato (200 g) halved', '1 cup grated parmesan cheese (110 g)', '8 oz mozzarella ball (225 g)']
instructions: ['1: To make the pesto, mix basil, 2 cloves garlic, ½ cup pine nuts, parmesan, ¼ cup cold water, ½ cup heavy cream, 1 teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper in a food processor for about 30 seconds', '2:  Add in ¾ cup olive oil', '3:  Process until combined, set aside', '4: Cook 12 oz fusilli to very al dente, or about 3-4 minutes before the package instructs for cook time, then drain pasta', '5: Halve 1 cup cherry tomatoes', '6: In a skillet or casserole pan, mix 12 oz fusilli, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, and pesto', '7: Top with grated parmesan and 8 oz mozzarella balls', '8: Bake at 400° Fahrenheit for 10-15 minutes, or until 8 oz mozzarella has melted', '9: Garnish with additional parmesan and 4 cups fresh basil', '10:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['10 sheets phyllo dough thawed', '1 wheel brie cheese', 'raspberry preserve', 'butter melted']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) degrees', '2: Lay a sheet of phyllo dough horizontally on a smooth, dry surface', '3:  Brush with melted butter', '4:  Place another sheet on top', '5:  Layer with butter', '6:  Continue until you have four 10 sheets  on top of each other', '7: Layer the remaining 10 sheets vertically', '8:  Make sure to butter each sheet', '9: Place 1 wheel brie in the center of the 10 sheets and top with raspberry preserves', '10: Fold sheet corners over the 1 wheel brie', '11:  Brush with more melted butter and place on a cookie sheet', '12: Bake at  400°F (200°C) between 25-30 minutes', '13: Serve warm, with bread or crackers']

ingredients: ['Starter', '3 tablespoons water', '3 tablespoons whole milk', '2 tablespoons bread flour', 'Dough', '3 ¼ cups bread flour (410 g) divided', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon instant yeast', '1 cup whole milk (240 mL) warm to the touch', '¼ cup unsalted butter (60 g) 1/2 stick melted', '1 large egg', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 ¼ cups pulled pork (310 g)', '1 large egg mixed with 1 tablespoon milk']
instructions: ['1: Make the starter: In a small pot over low heat, combine the water, milk, and flour', '2:  Stir continuously until a loose paste forms', '3:  Remove the pot from the heat and transfer the mixture to a small bowl', '4:  Cover with plastic wrap, pressing it directly onto the surface of the starter, and refrigerate for 1 hour, or until cool', '5: Make the dough: In a large bowl, add 2½ cups (300 g) of flour, the sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon instant yeast, and whisk to combine', '6: In a large measuring cup, whisk together the milk, egg, butter, and chilled starter mixture', '7: Gradually pour the milk mixture into the bowl of dry ingredients, using your hands to combine', '8:  The dough will be very sticky at this point', '9:  If the dough is too wet to knead, gradually add ¾ cup (90 g) of flour, a few tablespoons at a time, until you can knead the dough into a loose ball', '10:  Continue to knead the dough for 20 minutes', '11: Cover your hands with the 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and form the dough into a taut ball', '12:  Place the dough into a clean large bowl', '13:  Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, 60-90 minutes', '14: Transfer the dough to a clean surface and press out to a 9-inch (23 cm) square', '15:   Divide the dough into 9 equal squares', '16: Flatten a portion of dough into a circle', '17:  Place 2 tablespoons of pulled pork in the center', '18:  Pinch the edges of the dough together to seal', '19:  Gently roll the dough into a ball and place in a greased 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish', '20:  Repeat with the remaining dough', '21:  Cover with a towel and let rise for 45 minutes', '22: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '23: Brush the buns with the egg and milk mixture', '24: Bake the buns for 25 minutes, or until golden brown', '25: Let the buns sit in the pan for 10 minutes', '26: Invert the buns onto a serving plate, and pull apart']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon oil', '1 onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '15 oz black beans (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz kidney bean (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz corn (425 g) 1 can drained', '30 oz diced tomato (425 g) 2 cans', '¼ cup tomato paste (55 g)', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons honey', '4 cups vegetable stock', '¾ cup lentils (125 g)', 'sour cream for serving', 'shredded cheddar cheese for serving', 'sliced scallions for serving']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot, heat the 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat', '2:  Add 1 onion and cook until translucent', '3:  Add the 4 cloves garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally', '4:  Transfer to a slow cooker', '5: Add the 15 oz black beans, 15 oz kidney beans, 15 oz chickpeas, 15 oz corn, 1 onion 30 oz diced 30 oz diced ¼ cup tomatoes, and 30 oz diced ¼ cup tomato paste to the slow cooker', '6:  Season with the 3 tablespoons chili powder, 2 tablespoons cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons honey, 4 cups vegetable stock, and ¾ cup lentils', '7: Stir and slow cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours, until the ¾ cup lentils have softened', '8: Enjoy right away or freeze up to 6 months in an airtight container', '9:  Defrost in the refrigerator and reheat when ready to eat', '10:  Serve with shredded cheese, sour cream, and sliced scallions']

ingredients: ['Base:', '½ packet cookies or digestive biscuits', '½ cup butter (70 g)', '½ teaspoon almond extract', 'Cake:', '1 cup yoghurt (200 mL)', '½ cup sugar (150 g)', '2 lb cheese (900 g)', '3 tablespoons flour', '3 large eggs and one egg yolk', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 180°F', '2:  Then, to prepare the 2 lb cheesecake base: Beat ½ packet cookies into crumbs and place into a greaseproof lined cake tin', '3: Pour in 70g (½ cup) melted butter and add in ½ teaspoon almond extract', '4:  Bake the base for 10 minutes, retrieve, and let cool', '5: To prepare the cake, beat cream 2 lb cheese, yogurt, 3 tablespoons flour, and sugar together till soft', '6: Gradually stir in 3 3 large eggs and one egg yolk, keeping an eye on the consistencyAdd ½ tsp of ½ teaspoon vanilla extract to the above mixture and combine', '7: Pour mixture into two tins, one medium and one small', '8: Place tins into the top shelf of the oven for 45 minutes at 160 degrees°F and bake', '9: Chill for half an hour in the fridge, then carefully remove both cakes from the tins and layer slowly', '10: Slice and serve']

ingredients: ['1 lb flank steak (455 g)', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon pepper divided', '2 teaspoons salt divided', '2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '3 large white onions sliced', '3 green bell peppers sliced', '6 red bell peppers', '15 slices provolone cheese', '2 tablespoons fresh parsley chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Cut the 1 lb flank steak against the grain into ⅛-inch (3-mm) thick 15 slices', '3: In a 3 large skillet over medium heat, heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil, until shimmering', '4:   Add the steak, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, ½ 1 2 teaspoon of pepper, 1 1 2 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons salt, and the Worcestershire sauce', '5: Mix to coat the meat with the spices and cook until the meat is cooked through, about 3 minutes', '6:  Transfer the meat a bowl, leaving the juices in the pan', '7:  Cover and set aside until ready to use', '8: Add the 2 tablespoons unsalted butter to the pan with the meat juices', '9:  Add the onions and cook until tender and shiny, about 10 minutes', '10:  Add the 3 green bell peppers and the remaining ½ 1 2 teaspoon of pepper and 1 2 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons salt, and cook until the onions and peppers are caramelized, about 10 minutes', '11: Cut the top off of a 6 red bell pepper', '12:  Cut around the seed pod, then pull it out of the pepper', '13:  Remove any remaining seeds', '14:  Repeat with the rest of the peppers', '15: Cut 9 of the provolone 15 slices in half', '16: Place the peppers in a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish, cut side up', '17:  Scoop a bit of steak filling into each pepper, followed by the peppers and onions, then 3 half 15 slices of provolone', '18:  Repeat with the rest of the steak, then the rest of the peppers and onions', '19:  Place a whole slice of provolone on top of each pepper', '20: Bake for 30 minutes, until the skin of the peppers is shriveling, and the cheese is golden', '21: Top with 2 tablespoons fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['½ cup walnuts (50 g) roughly chopped', '1 pear thinly sliced', '5 oz mixed greens (140 g)', '3 beets cooked halved and thinly sliced', '¼ red onion thinly sliced', 'Lemon Vinaigrette', '1 lemon juiced', '1 tablespoon water', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 teaspoon fresh thyme', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons oil']
instructions: ['1: In a non-stick skillet, toast the ½ cup walnuts over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally', '2:  Remove from heat and set aside', '3: In a small bowl, mix the 1 lemon juice, 1 tablespoon water, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon fresh thyme, salt, and pepper', '4: While whisking, slowly add the 2 tablespoons oil to the bowl to create a vinaigrette', '5: In a large salad bowl, add the 5 oz mixed greens, pears, 3 beets, onions, ½ cup walnuts, and 1 lemon vinaigrette', '6:  Toss to combine all ingredients and serve']

ingredients: ['2 eggs', '½ bell pepper diced', '2 slices ham diced', '¼ cup fresh spinach (10 g) chopped', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Combine all ingredients in a microwaveable mug', '2: Cook for 2-3 minutes, making sure the egg doesn’t bubble over', '3:  Stir halfway through the cooking process']

ingredients: ['6 boneless skinless chicken thighs', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '1 tablespoon butter', '6 large onions thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon fresh thyme', '1 cup beef stock (235 mL)', '2 cups gruyère cheese (200 g) shredded', 'bread sliced and toasted to serve']
instructions: ['1: In a bowl, add the 6 boneless skinless chicken thighs, salt, pepper, 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 tablespoon dried parsley, and olive oil, and toss until evenly coated', '2: Add the 6 boneless skinless chicken to a skillet on medium-high heat', '3:  Sear until golden brown, about 4 minutes', '4:  Flip and cook the other side of the 6 boneless skinless chicken, 2 minutes', '5:  Remove the 6 boneless skinless chicken from the pan and set aside', '6: Preheat oven to broil', '7: Add the 1 tablespoon butter, sliced 6 large onions, salt, and pepper to the same pan, stirring occasionally until softened', '8:  Reduce heat to low and cook until they are deeply caramelized, about 1 hour', '9: Add 1 tablespoon fresh thyme and 1 cup beef broth and bring the mixture to a simmer', '10: Add the 6 boneless skinless chicken on top of the 6 large onions, and sprinkle with Gruyère cheese', '11: Broil for 5 minutes, until the cheese is melted and golden brown', '12: Serve over bread']

ingredients: ['3 large eggs', '1 cup cream-style cottage cheese (225 g)', '1 tablespoon molasses', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ cup oat flour (45 g)', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon allspice', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 pinch of kosher salt', '1 tablespoon chia seeds', 'oil of choice for greasing the skilled', 'whipped cream for serving', 'orange segments for serving', 'syrup sweetener of choice for serving']
instructions: ['1: In a blender, combine the eggs, cottage cheese, 1 tablespoon molasses, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon vanilla, oat flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg, ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon allspice, ¼ teaspoon ground cloves, and 1 pinch of kosher salt', '2:  Blend until well combined', '3: Pour the mixture into a medium bowl and fold in the 1 tablespoon chia seeds', '4: Heat the oil in a 3 large skillet over medium-high heat', '5:  Pour ¼ cup of batter into the pan and cook for 3 minutes, until bubbles start to form and the edges become golden brown', '6:  \xa0Flip and cook for 3 minutes more, until golden brown on the other side', '7:  Repeat with the remaining batter', '8: Top the pancakes with whipped cream, orange segments, and your syrup sweetener of choice']

ingredients: ['12 oz Simple Truth® Organic Brussels Sprouts (350 g)', '12 medium Simple Truth® Organic Whole Baby Bella Mushrooms', '¼ cup Simple Truth® Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil (60 mL)', '1 packet Simple Truth® Organic Mild Chorizo Spice Blend', '6 corn tortillas lightly charred', '1 Simple Truth® Organic Hass Avocado  pitted peeled and sliced', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco (55 g)', 'Simple Truth® Organic Salsa Verde', '¼ cup Simple Truth® Organic cilantro (10 g)', 'Chipotle Crema', '¼ cup mexican crema (55 g)', '2 tablespoons adobo sauce from canned chipotles in adobo', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'pickled red onion', '½ cup Simple Truth® Organic Distilled White Vinegar (120 mL)', '2 tablespoons Simple Truth® Organic Cane Sugar', '¼ cup red onion (40 g) thinly sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: Trim the ends off the Simple Truth® Organic Brussels Sprouts and cut into quarters', '4:  Remove the stems from the mushrooms and cut into quarters', '5: On the prepared baking sheet, toss the Brussels sprouts and mushrooms with the olive oil and Simple Truth® Organic Mild Chorizo Spice Blend until well coated', '6:  Bake for about 25 minutes, or until the Brussels sprouts and mushrooms are crispy and brown', '7: Meanwhile, make the chipotle crema: In a small bowl, stir together the Mexican crema, 2 tablespoons adobo sauce, and 1 pinch kosher salt until well combined', '8:  Refrigerate until ready to use', '9: Make the pickled pickled ¼ cup red onions', '10:  Add the white vinegar and sugar to a small saucepan', '11:  Bring to a simmer over 12 medium-high heat, then add the pickled ¼ cup red onions', '12:  Boil for 5–10 minutes, or until the onions have softened and the liquid is bright pink', '13:  Remove the pot from the heat and set aside', '14:  Drain pickled onions before using', '15: Assemble the tacos: Arrange the 6 corn tortillas on a plate and smear with some of the chipotle crema', '16:  Divide the Brussels sprout and mushroom mixture evenly between the 6 corn tortillas', '17:  Top with the avocado, ½ cup crumbled queso fresco, Simple Truth® Salsa Verde, pickled pickled ¼ cup red onions, and Simple Truth® Organic ¼ cup Simple Truth® Organic cilantro', '18:  Serve immediately', '19: Meal prep instructions: If not serving right away, store roasted vegetables, crema, and pickled ¼ cup red onions in separate containers in the refrigerator', '20:  Warm up vegetables in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for 5–10 minutes, then assemble']

ingredients: ['1 large spaghetti squash', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'olive oil', '2 boneless skinless chicken breasts cubed', '3 cloves garlic minced', '4 roma tomatoes diced', '8 oz spinach (225 g)', '24 oz marinara sauce (680 g) 1 jar', '½ cup fresh basil (20 g)', '¼ teaspoon red pepper crushed']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375˚F (190˚C)', '2: With a sharp knife, slice the squash in half', '3:  (If the squash is too tough - puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash', '4:  Microwave 3-5 minutes to soften', '5:  Allow to cool before cutting in half - following the dotted line)', '6: Scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, salt, and ¼ teaspoon ¼ teaspoon red pepper, and place face down on a baking tray', '7:  Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a fork can easily pierce the skin', '8: Heat olive oil in a 1 large pan', '9:  Add 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts (seasoned with salt and ¼ teaspoon ¼ teaspoon red pepper) and 3 cloves garlic, and fully cook', '10: Add 4 roma tomatoes and 8 oz spinach', '11:  Cook until 8 oz spinach has wilted', '12:  Add 24 oz marinara sauce', '13: Stack the basil leaves and roll them up', '14:  Cut into slices and add to pan', '15: Add crushed ¼ teaspoon red ¼ teaspoon ¼ teaspoon red pepper, and stir until the ingredients are fully incorporated', '16: Once the squash has finished roasting, remove from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before turning over and pulling at it with a fork', '17:  (Careful, there will be some steam!)Shred the inside of each squash, being careful not to poke through the skin', '18:  Pour the sauce over the shredded squash, top with ½ cup fresh basil, and serve']

ingredients: ['½ cup sashimi grade salmon (80 g) cubed', '½ teaspoon sesame seeds', '1 cup white crab meat (100 g) cooked', '1 tablespoon crème fraîche', '¼ teaspoon dijon mustard', '1 tablespoon fresh tarragon finely chopped', '½ lemon', '1 avocado cubed', 'watercres for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Mix 1 cup white crab, creme fraiche, shallot, ¼ teaspoon dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon fresh tarragon, salt & pepper', '2: Mix ½ cup sashimi grade salmon cubes with ½ teaspoon sesame seeds', '3: Mix 1 avocado cubes with ½ lemon, chili, salt & pepper', '4: Place 1 avocado cubes at the bottom of the ring', '5: Top with ½ cup sashimi grade salmon cubes', '6: Top with 1 cup white crab mixture and refrigerate until ready to serve', '7: Garnish with watercress']

ingredients: ['12 oz broccoli floret (340 g)', '½ white onion sliced', '1 ½ lb flank steak (680 g)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 cups wild rice (920 g) cooked to serve', 'Steak Seasoning', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 ½ teaspoons pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon onion powder']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: In a small bowl, add the 1 ½ teaspoons salt, 1 ½ teaspoons pepper, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, and onion powder', '3:  Stir until well combined', '4: Place 12 oz broccoli, onions, and 1 ½ lb flank steak on a baking tray', '5: Coat 12 oz broccoli and onions with 2 tablespoons olive oil', '6: Sprinkle seasoning mix on 1 ½ lb flank steak, 12 oz broccoli, and onions until coated', '7: Bake for 15 minutes', '8: Broil for 2 minutes', '9: For medium, internal temperature of steak should reach 145°F (65°C)', '10:  Let steak rest 10 minutes before cutting', '11: Serve now with 4 cups wild rice or refrigerate in airtight containers up to 3-4 days']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '½ white onion thinly sliced', '1 pinch salt', '1 sprig fresh thyme', '2 large croissants', '4 tablespoons apricot preserve', '½ wheel of brie sliced', '10 slices Castle Wood Reserve® Uncured Honey Ham', '1 cup baby arugula (40 g)', '2 strawberries cut on half for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350ºF', '2: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a medium pan over medium heat', '3:  Add ½ white onion and 1 pinch salt and cook until ½ white onion is golden brown, about 10 minutes', '4:  Add in the 1 sprig of thyme and cook for another 2 minutes', '5: Slice 2 large croissants in half and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet, 2 strawberries cut side up', '6:  Spread 4 tablespoons apricot preserves on the top half and place 3 pieces of ½ wheel of brie cheese', '7:  On the bottom croissant half, place caramelized ½ white onions and folded slices of Castle Wood Reserve® Uncured Honey Ham', '8:  Repeat with the other croissant', '9: Bake open-face for 10 minutes', '10: Remove from the oven and add 1 cup baby arugula', '11:  Close the sandwiches and serve with a skewered strawberry for a garnish']

ingredients: ['2 cups BBQ sauce (580 g)', '¼ cup brown sugar (55 g)', '4 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', '3 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '3 lb baby back pork rib (1.3 kg)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Combine bbq 2 cups BBQ 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce, ¼ cup brown sugar, 4 tablespoons apple cider vinegar, 3 teaspoons dried oregano, Worcestershire 2 cups BBQ 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper, and 1 tablespoon chili powder in a small bowl', '2: Salt and pepper the ribs', '3:  Place ribs in slow cooker, and cover in 2 cups BBQ 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce', '4: Cook low and slow for eight hours or high for four hours', '5: After the ribs are done, spoon the bbq 2 cups BBQ 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce in the slow cooker over the ribs before removing', '6: Cut the ribs, serve with bbq 2 cups BBQ 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce']

ingredients: ['7 oz semi-sweet chocolate chips (175 g)', '8 tablespoons unsalted butter cubed plus 1 tablespoon', '1 ½ teaspoons peppermint extract', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 tablespoons dutch processed cocoa  powder', '1 tablespoon black cocoa powder', '2 large eggs room temperature', '¾ cup sugar (150 g)', '½ cup dark brown sugar (110 g) packed', '¼ cup candy cane (30 g) crushed', '2 cups water (480 mL) for melting chocolate']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180˚C)', '2:  Line 2 2 large 1 teaspoon baking sheets with parchment paper or nonstick 1 teaspoon baking mats', '3: Bring a small pot of 2 cups water to a simmer', '4:  Add the 7 oz semi-sweet 2 cups 2 cups water (480 mL) for melting chocolate chips, butter, and 1 ½ teaspoons peppermint extract to a medium heatproof bowl and place over the simmering 2 cups water', '5:  Melt, stirring often until smooth, about 10 minutes', '6:  Remove the bowl from the heat and set aside', '7: In a 2 large bowl, sift together the 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, ¼ teaspoon kosher salt, Dutch-process cocoa powder, and 1 tablespoon black cocoa powder', '8:  Whisk to combine', '9: Add the eggs to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment or a 2 large bowl with an electric hand mixer and whip on high speed until foamy, about 1 minute', '10:  Continue mixing while slowly adding the granulated and ½ cup dark brown ¾ cup ½ cup dark ½ cup dark brown sugar until the mixture is pale and falls into ribbons, about 9 minutes', '11: Add the melted 7 oz semi-sweet 2 cups 2 cups water (480 mL) for melting chocolate mixture to the whipped eggs and mix on low speed until just combined', '12: Add the dry ingredients and mix again until smooth', '13: Using an ice cream scoop, immediately scoop the cookies onto the prepared 1 teaspoon baking sheets and smooth the tops with your finger', '14: Bake for 8 minutes, then remove the cookies from the oven and sprinkle the tops with crushed ¼ cup candy canes', '15:  Return the cookies to the oven and bake for another 4 minutes, until the tops are cracked and shiny', '16:  Remove from the oven and immediately smack the 1 teaspoon baking sheets against the countertop, then let the cookies cool completely on the pans', '17: Note: If 1 tablespoon black cocoa powder is not available in your grocery store, cookies can be made using 3 tablespoons of Dutch-process cocoa powder; simply swapping the 1 tablespoon black cocoa for the Dutch-process']

ingredients: ['2 cups watermelon (300 g) chilled and cubed', '1 cup coconut water (240 mL)', '1 lime lime juice', 'ice cube']
instructions: ['1: Place 2 cups watermelon, 1 cup coconut water, and 1 lime juice in blender and blend until smooth', '2: Serve over ice']

ingredients: ['oil to taste', '1 lb raw shrimp (455 g) peeled and deveined', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons garlic minced separate in half', '¼ cup honey (85 g)', '1 lime juiced', '1 lb asparagus (455 g) sliced', '1 red bell pepper sliced']
instructions: ['1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat', '2: Add 1 lb raw shrimp, salt, 1 red 1 red bell pepper, 1 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons garlic, ¼ cup honey and 1 lime juice', '3:  Mix well', '4:  Cook for 2 minutes, or until bottom of 1 lb raw shrimp turns pink and opaque', '5: Flip the 1 lb raw shrimp and cook an additional 2 minutes or until 1 lb raw shrimp are fully pink and there are no gray bits', '6:  Remove 1 lb raw shrimp from skillet and set aside', '7: In a fresh skillet (or you can clean out the same one), add oil and sauté the 1 lb asparagus and 1 red bell 1 red 1 red bell pepper with salt, 1 red 1 red bell pepper, and the remaining 2 teaspoons garlic', '8: When the 1 lb asparagus and 1 red bell 1 red 1 red bell pepper have reached your desired doneness, add the 1 lb raw shrimp back into the skillet and combine', '9: Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['1 lb shrimp (455 g) peeled and deveined', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '1 ½ cups milk (355 mL)', '1 ½ cups chicken broth (355 mL)', '8 oz fettuccine pasta (230 g)', '4 cups spinach (900 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '½ teaspoon italian seasoning', '¼ cup grated parmesan cheese (30 g) extra to garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a heated pot, melt 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil', '2:  Add 2 cloves garlic and 1 lb shrimp, ½ teaspoon italian seasoning with salt and pepper', '3: Cook until 1 lb shrimp is pink, then put aside', '4: In the same pot, add 1 ½ cups milk, 1 ½ cups chicken broth, and 8 oz fettuccine pasta', '5: Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, so that the 8 oz fettuccine pasta does not stick to each other', '6: Once 8 oz fettuccine pasta is al dente, add in 4 cups spinach, salt, pepper, ½ teaspoon italian seasoning, and cheese, and mix until 4 cups spinach is wilted and everything is coated in the sauce', '7: Add the 1 lb shrimp back in and give it a stir until fully incorporated', '8: Serve with some extra ¼ cup grated parmesan cheese, if desired']

ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '12 flour tortillas street taco-size', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil', '½ can black beans plus their liquid', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground chili powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 jar Pace® Chunky Salsa divided', '3 large eggs', '¼ cup whole milk (60 mL)', '1 cup avocado (145 g) diced for topping', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco (55 g) for topping', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) chopped for topping']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray', '3: Warm the tortillas in the microwave for 1 minute, until soft', '4:  Place each tortilla in a prepared muffin cup, folding the sides of the tortillas over each other slightly to fit flush in the cups', '5:  Bake for 10 minutes, or until the cups hold their shape', '6: Heat 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a medium skillet over medium-low heat', '7:  Add the ½ can black beans and their liquid, the ½ teaspoon ground cumin, ½ teaspoon ground chili powder, and ½ teaspoon garlic powder, and cook, stirring frequently, until steam begins to rise, about 4 minutes', '8:  Mash the beans', '9:  Continue cooking for 2 minutes, until the liquid reduces slightly', '10: Scoop about ½ tablespoon of the bean mixture into each tortilla cup, smoothing evenly', '11:  Spoon a heaping tablespoon of the Pace® Chunky Salsa into each cup over the beans', '12: In a small bowl, whisk together the 3 large eggs and milk', '13:  Pour the egg mixture over the salsa, filling the cups just below the edges of the tortillas', '14: Bake the tortilla cups for 18–22 minutes, until 3 large eggs are cooked through', '15: Remove the cups from the oven and garnish with the avocado, queso fresco, and cilantro', '16:  Top with the remaining Pace® Chunky Salsa or serve alongside for dipping']

ingredients: ['Ribs', '3 lb baby back ribs (1.5 kg)', '3 tablespoons McCormick® Smoky Spice Blend', '1 tablespoon kosher salt plus more to taste', 'Smoky Barbecue Sauce', '½ cup ketchup (120 g)', '⅓ cup honey (115 g)', '¼ cup dijon mustard (60 g)', '1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce', '¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '½ cup white onion (75 g) roughly chopped', '2 tablespoons McCormick® Smoky Spice Blend']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 300˚F (150°C)', '2:  Arrange a rack in the center of the oven', '3: Using a paring knife, cut a small slit in the membrane of the 3 lb baby back ribs', '4:  Slide the blade underneath the membrane and over the bone', '5:  Lift the membrane with the knife until it tears away from the bone', '6:  Grip the released membrane with a paper towel or kitchen towel and pull away to remove', '7: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and arrange the 3 lb baby back ribs in the center', '8:  Season the 3 lb baby back ribs on both sides with the smoky spice blend and 1 tablespoon kosher salt', '9:  Tightly wrap the 3 lb baby back ribs in foil', '10: Transfer the 3 lb baby back ribs to the oven and cook for 2 hours and 40 minutes to 3 hours, until the meat is tender and falling off the bone', '11: While the 3 lb baby back ribs are cooking, make the smoky barbecue sauce: In the bowl of a food processor, combine the ½ cup ketchup, ⅓ cup honey, Dijon, Worcestershire sauce, ¼ cup apple cider vinegar, ½ cup white onion, and smoky spice blend', '12:  Process on high speed for 45–60 seconds, until the ½ cup white onion is completely broken down', '13:  Transfer the sauce to a bowl and refrigerate until ready to use', '14: Remove the 3 lb baby back ribs from the oven and turn the broiler on high', '15: Unwrap the 3 lb baby back ribs and generously baste the tops with the barbecue sauce', '16:  Return the 3 lb baby back ribs to the oven and broil for 1–2 minutes, until the sauce is beginning to caramelize', '17: Remove the 3 lb baby back ribs from the oven and baste again with more barbecue sauce', '18: Serve the 3 lb baby back ribs with more barbecue sauce on the side']

ingredients: ['Seared Duck Breast', '4 duck breasts', '4 teaspoons sea salt', '4 teaspoons pepper', '8 cloves garlic', '4 sprigs fresh rosemary', 'Mashed Potato', '1 ½ cups potato (400 g)', '2 teaspoons butter (10 g)', '1 oz milk (20 mL)', 'orange zest half an orange', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', 'Red Wine Jus', '½ teaspoon flour', '½ cup red wine (100 mL)', '3 teaspoons cranberry sauce', '2 teaspoons honey', '1 orange juice of', '¼ cup chicken stock (60 mL)', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', 'orange zest of half an orange to serve', 'fresh rosemary to serve']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 180˚C (350˚F)', '2: Lightly score the 4 duck skin with a sharp knife', '3:  Make sure not to cut through to the flesh', '4: Season each side of the 4 duck breast with 1 teaspoon of 4 teaspoons sea 1 teaspoon ½ teaspoon salt and 4 teaspoons 1 teaspoon ½ teaspoon pepper each', '5: Fry the 4 duck breast skin side down on medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes with the 8 cloves garlic and rosemaries', '6:  Flip and fry the other side  for 1 minute', '7: Put the 4 duck breast in the oven for 6-8 minutes for medium rare; 10 minutes for medium well', '8:  Rest for 6 minutes before serving', '9: For the mashed 1 ½ cups potato, chuck all the ingredients in the boiled 1 ½ cups potato, mix well', '10: For the Red Wine Jus, use the pan you fried the 4 duck breasts in', '11:  Take out the rosemary stalks, crush the 8 cloves garlic with a fork', '12: Fry the 8 cloves garlic for a minute or two on medium low heat', '13:  Add in the flour and fry for another minute or until all the fat in the pan have binded to the flour', '14: Add in the rest of the ingredients, mix well and keep simmering on a low heat for 10 minutes or until it becomes a glossy thick 3 teaspoons cranberry sauce', '15: To impress your guests with your presentation game, pipe the mashed 1 ½ cups potato with a piping bag into a golf ball size mound', '16:  Shape using the back of a spoon', '17: Place the 4 duck breast, drizzle with the jus and decorate with orange zest and rosemary']

ingredients: ['1 ⅓ cups caster sugar (270 g)', '½ cup water (160 mL)', '1 stick cinammon sticks', '1 cup milk (250 mL)', '½ cup double cream (150 mL)', '5 egg yolks', '1 egg', '2 tablespoons vanilla extract', '¼ cup corn flour (30 g)', '18 oz puff pastry (500 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F)', '2: In a small pan, place the 1 ⅓ cups caster sugar, ½ cup water, and cinnamon 1 stick', '3:  Simmer for 3 minutes and set aside', '4: Combine 1 cup milk and ½ cup double cream in a saucepan and place over a medium heat', '5:  Bring mixture to a boil, then remove from the heat and set aside', '6: To a large bowl, add the egg yolks, whole egg, 2 tablespoons vanilla extract, and ¼ cup corn flour', '7:  Whisk until fully combined and no lumps remain', '8: Temper the egg mixture by introducing the hot 1 cup milk and ½ cup double cream in two 100 milliliter batches, then whisk', '9: Return mixture to the saucepan and place over a low-medium heat', '10:  Whisk continually until mixture thickens', '11:  Turn off heat', '12: Remove cinnamon 1 stick from the syrup and slowly trickle into the custard, whisking continually', '13: Lightly flour a work surface and cut 18 oz puff pastry into 12 equal pieces', '14: To a lightly greased muffin tin, push each piece of 18 oz puff pastry down and up into the sides of the muffin holes until evenly distributed', '15: Pour custard into each muffin tin so each one is three quarters full', '16:  Bake for 16-20 minutes until golden and brown', '17: Serve warm with a dusting of icing 1 ⅓ cups caster sugar and a sprinkle of cinnamon']

ingredients: ['Savory Ratatouille Filling', '½ cup yellow onion (75 g) thinly sliced', '½ yellow bell pepper seeded and diced into 1/4 in (6 mm) pieces', '½ cup roma tomato (100 g) seeded and diced', '½ cup zucchini (75 g) diced', '¾ cup japanese eggplant (270 g) about 1 small - diced', '2 cloves garlic unpeeled', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 teaspoons fresh thyme plus more for garnish', '½ teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper plus more to taste', '¼ cup goat cheese (55 g) room temperature', 'Sweet Crepe Filling', '1 cup whole milk ricotta cheese (250 g)', '½ cup strawberry (75 g) finely chopped plus more for garnish quartered', '¼ cup blackberry (35 g) halved plus more for garnish', '1 teaspoon lemon zest', '1 tablespoon honey plus more for garnish', 'whipped cream for garnish', 'Crepes', '6 large eggs', '1 ½ cups unsweetened coconut milk (360 mL) full-fat canned', '½ cup coconut flour (60 g)', '1 tablespoon coconut oil melted plus more for greasing', '½ teaspoon kosher salt']
instructions: ['1: If making the savory filling, preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C)', '2: In a 6 large bowl, toss together the onion, ½ yellow bell pepper, tomato, zucchini, eggplant, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, salt, and pepper', '3:  Spread in an even layer on a 6 large baking sheet', '4: Roast the vegetables until they are soft and caramelized, about 18 minutes, flipping halfway through', '5:  Set aside to cool', '6: When cool enough to handle, pick the 2 cloves garlic from the vegetables and remove the skin', '7:  Add to a 6 large bowl and mash into
