instructions: ['1: In a small mixing bowl, combine 1 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and ½ teaspoon salt with a spatula', '2:  Form a well in the middle of the dry mixture and add 2 4 tablespoons olive oil and ½ cup warm water', '3:  Mix until dough forms in to a sticky ball', '4:  Cover with a dish towel and set aside', '5: In large pot or Dutch oven, add the olive oil over medium heat', '6:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the 1 onion and carrot and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until the 1 onions are semi-translucent', '7: Add in the 2 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon dried dill, ½ teaspoon dried sage, ½ teaspoon dried thyme, and ½ teaspoon pepper, and cook for 2-3 more minutes until herbs are fragrant', '8: Stir in potatoes, 6 cups vegetable broth, and bay 2 leaves, and bring to a boil', '9:  5', '10:  Reduce heat to medium-high and simmer about 8 minutes or until potatoes are about 75 percent cooked through', '11: Carefully drop in dollops of the dumpling dough, about 1 inch (2-cm) in diameter', '12: Let dumplings simmer for about 10 minutes, or until chewy and cooked through', '13: To serve, garnish with lots of fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['1 lb skirt steak (455 g) room temperature ', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 ½ tablespoons olive oil', '¼ cup beef broth (60 mL)', '2 tablespoons dijon mustard', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 ½ tablespoons capers in brine', 'rice cooked for serving', 'broccoli steamed for serving']
instructions: ['1: Cut 1 lb skirt steak in half crosswise', '2:  Season with the 1 teaspoon kosher salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper', '3: Heat the 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil in a nonstick or stainless steel pan over medium heat for 1 minute', '4:  Add 1 portion of 1 lb skirt steak and cook until a golden brown crust has formed, 4-5 minutes per side', '5:  Transfer the seared 1 lb skirt steak to a plate and repeat with the remaining portion of 1 lb skirt steak', '6:  If the pan is getting too dry, add a bit more 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil', '7:  Let the 1 lb skirt steaks rest for 3 minutes', '8: After the 1 lb skirt steak has rested, transfer to a cutting board and pour any accumulated meat juices from the plate back into the pan and return to medium heat', '9: Add the ¼ cup beef broth and scrape up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan', '10:  Add the 2 tablespoons dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon unsalted butter and stir until combined', '11:  Stir in the 1 ½ tablespoons capers and cook until the sauce thickens slightly, 1-2 minutes', '12: Slice the 1 lb skirt steak into ¼-inch (6 mm) pieces and transfer to serving plates', '13:  Pour the sauce over the 1 lb skirt steak and serve with rice and broccoli']

ingredients: ['14 oz firm tofu', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 ½ teaspoons sesame oil divided', '3 cups broccoli florets', '3 tablespoons vegetable broth', '2 garlic cloves minced', '1 teaspoon grated ginger', '¼ cup soy sauce', '2 tablespoons agave syrup', '1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon water', '¹¹⁄₂ teaspoon toasted sesame seeds plus more for serving', 'cooked white rice for serving', 'sliced scallions for serving']
instructions: ['1: Wrap the 14 oz firm tofu in 2 layers of paper towels and place on a plate', '2:  Put another plate on top of the 14 oz firm tofu to weigh it down and microwave for 2-3 minutes, or until drained', '3: After microwaving, carefully unwrap the 14 oz firm tofu and slice into ½-1 inch cubes', '4:  Pat each cube dry', '5: In a large nonstick skillet, heat the 1 teaspoon 3 tablespoons vegetable oil and 1 teaspoon of 1 ½ teaspoons ¹¹⁄₂ teaspoon toasted sesame oil over medium-high heat', '6:  Once the oil is hot, add the 14 oz firm tofu and cook on all sides until golden brown, 2-4 minutes per side, then remove from the pan and set aside', '7: Add 3 cups broccoli to the hot pan with the 1 teaspoon 3 tablespoons vegetable broth', '8:  Cover and reduce the heat to medium-low', '9:  Steam for 5 minutes', '10: Remove the lid and increase the heat to medium-high', '11: Add the 2 garlic, ginger, and remaining ½ teaspoon of 1 ½ teaspoons ¹¹⁄₂ teaspoon toasted sesame oil', '12:  Stir until softened', '13: Add the ¼ cup soy sauce, 2 tablespoons agave, 1 tablespoon cooked cooked white rice vinegar, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch slurry', '14:  Stir until thickened to your desired consistency', '15:  Add the 1 ½ teaspoons ¹¹⁄₂ teaspoon toasted sesame seeds and stir to incorporate', '16: Return the 14 oz firm tofu to the pan and toss to coat in the sauce', '17: Serve over cooked white 1 tablespoon cooked cooked white rice and garnish with sliced scallions and 1 ½ teaspoons ¹¹⁄₂ teaspoon toasted sesame seeds']

ingredients: ['6 tablespoons butter melted', '10 graham crackers crushed', '32 oz cream cheese (905 g) at room temperature', '4 eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '1 ½ cups sugar (300 g)', '15 oz pumpkin puree (425 g) 1 can', 'Crumble Topping', '½ cup butter (115 g)', '1 cup flour (125 g)', '½ cup brown sugar (110 g)', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, combine the melted butter and crushed 10 graham crackers', '2:  Stir until the mixture develops a wet sand texture', '3: Cover the bottom of a greased 9 x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking pan with the 10 graham cracker mixture and spread evenly', '4:  Chill', '5: In a large bowl, combine the 32 oz cream cheese, 4 eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and 1 ½ cups ½ cup ½ cup brown sugar', '6:  Stir until mixture is smooth', '7: Spread half of the cheesecake batter into the chilled baking pan, smoothing the top,  and freeze', '8: Preheat the oven to 325˚F (160˚C)', '9: Add the 15 oz pumpkin puree to the remaining cheesecake batter and stir until incorporated', '10: Spoon the 15 oz pumpkin cheesecake mixture over frozen cheesecake mixture and spread evenly', '11: Bake for 30 minutes', '12: Make the crumb topping: in a medium bowl, combine the butter, 1 cup flour, ½ cup brown 1 ½ cups ½ cup ½ cup brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', '13:  Stir until all ingredients are evenly incorporated and the mixture develops a wet sand texture', '14: Top the cheesecake with the crumble topping and bake for another 25 minutes', '15: Allow the cheesecake to cool at room temperature', '16:  For best results refrigerate overnight once completely cooled, then slice and serve']

ingredients: ['½ cup ice (70 g)', '1 tablespoon peach jam', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 fl oz whiskey (60 mL)', 'lemon twist for garnish', 'Special Equipment', 'cocktail shaker']
instructions: ['1: In a cocktail shaker, combine the ½ cup ice, 1 tablespoon peach jam, lemon juice, and 2 fl oz whiskey', '2: Cover with the lid and shake vigorously for 30 seconds', '3: Strain into desired serving glass', '4: Garnish with a lemon twist']

ingredients: ['Chicken', '2 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (905 g)', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon white pepper', '1 cup cornstarch (125 g)', '3 cups flour (375 g)', '1 egg', '1 ½ cups water (360 mL)', '2 tablespoons oil', '6 cups oil (1 ½ L) for frying', 'Orange Sauce', '1 tablespoon oil', '¼ teaspoon chili flake', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '½ teaspoon ginger minced', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '¼ cup brown sugar (55 g)', '¼ cup orange juice (60 mL)', '¼ cup white distilled vinegar (60 mL)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons water', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', 'Preparation', 'Chicken', '2 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (905 g)', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon white pepper', '1 cup cornstarch (125 g)', '3 cups flour (375 g)', '1 egg', '1 ½ cups water (360 mL)', '2 tablespoons oil', '6 cups oil (1 ½ L) for frying', 'Orange Sauce', '1 tablespoon oil', '¼ teaspoon chili flake', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '½ teaspoon ginger minced', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '¼ cup brown sugar (55 g)', '¼ cup orange juice (60 mL)', '¼ cup white distilled vinegar (60 mL)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons water', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: On a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside', '2: In a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour', '3:  Whisk to combine', '4: Add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter', '5: Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes', '6: Heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350˚F (180˚C)', '7: Gently add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until lightly golden brown', '8: Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate', '9: Set a heavy bottomed pot over medium- high heat and add the oil', '10: Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, and garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly', '11: Add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine', '12: Add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally', '13: Add in the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine', '14: Add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine', '15:  Add to the pan and stir', '16: Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved', '17: Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce', '18: Top with sesame oil']

ingredients: ['3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ½ lb boneless skinless chicken breast (680 g) cut into chunks', '2 cups white mushroom (150 g) or button mushrooms sliced', '1 white onion sliced', '3 cups chicken stock (720 mL)', '1 ½ cups heavy cream (360 mL)', '1 cup marsala wine (240 mL)', '3 cups penne pasta (300 g) uncooked', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (100 g)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon fresh parsley optional garnish']
instructions: ['1: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat', '2: Add 2 3 3 1 tablespoons of olive oil and chicken breast', '3:  Season with salt and pepper to taste', '4: Cook until chicken is no longer pink', '5:  Remove and set aside', '6: Add the remaining 3 1 tablespoon of oil, and the mushrooms and onion', '7:  Season with salt and pepper to taste', '8:  Cook until onions are browned, stirring occasionally', '9: Return the chicken to the pot', '10:  Add the stock, 1 ½ cups heavy cream, wine, and 3 cups penne pasta, bring up to a simmer, and cover', '11: *Marsala wine can be purchased at most grocery stores near the dessert or sweet wines and gives the dish a distinct flavor', '12:  However, if you can’t get your hands on Marsala, you can substitute 1 cup of white wine (240 ml) plus 1 ½ 3 3 1 tablespoons of brandy', '13: Simmer until 3 cups penne pasta is tender, about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally', '14: When 3 cups penne pasta is tender, stir in parmesan cheese until smooth', '15:  Remove from heat', '16: Garnish with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['1 ripe avocado', 'oil for brushing', 'salt to taste', '1 egg scrambled', '1 strip bacon cooked and crumbled', 'sriracha sauce to taste']
instructions: ['1: Preheat gas grill on high heat', '2: Using a sharp knife, slice the avocados in half by cutting in a straight line around the pit', '3: Place the avocado half containing the pit in your hand and face it away from you', '4:  Gently stick the tip of the knife into the side of the pit and carefully pry it out of the avocado', '5:   For a 1 ripe avocado, the pit will pop out with little effort', '6:  You can hold a kitchen towel in your hand and place the avocado in the towel for added protection from the edge of your knife', '7: Place the avocado halves on a tray', '8:  Using a pastry brush, brush oil on each of the avocado halves', '9: Season avocados with salt', '10: Place the avocados on the grill, flesh side down, and grill for 3-4 minutes, until grill marks appear', '11: Remove the avocados and stuff with 1 egg scrambled eggs, 1 strip bacon crumbles, and Sriracha sauce']

ingredients: ['3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion sliced', '5 strips bacon diced', '8 oz wild mushrooms (225 g) such as porcini or shiitake sliced', '1 ½ cups arborio rice (300 g)', '½ cup dry white wine (120 mL) such as Sauvignon Blanc', '5 cups chicken broth (1.17 L)', '½ cup parmesan cheese (55 g) plus more for garnish', 'Preparation', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion sliced', '5 strips bacon diced', '8 oz wild mushrooms (225 g) such as porcini or shiitake sliced', '1 ½ cups arborio rice (300 g)', '½ cup dry white wine (120 mL) such as Sauvignon Blanc', '5 cups chicken broth (1.17 L)', '½ cup parmesan cheese (55 g) plus more for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a 5-quart Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat', '2: Add the onion and cook 3-4 minutes until soft and slightly transparent', '3: Add the bacon and stir constantly until it starts to crisp', '4: Add the mushrooms and cook for an additional 2 minutes', '5: Add the arborio rice and cook for one minute, stirring constantly so the oil coats the grains', '6: Stir in the white wine and simmer 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally', '7: Add one cup (235ml) of the chicken stock and simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally', '8: Once the rice absorbs most of the liquid, continue to add 1-2 cups (235-470ml) of stock at a time until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through, about 25-30 minutes total', '9: NOTE: The risotto should be al dente and fall back in on itself when you run the spoon along the bottom of the pot', '10: Stir in the Parmesan cheese and remove from the heat', '11: Serve and garnish with extra Parmesan cheese']

ingredients: ['Sauce', '¼ cup yogurt (60 g)', '2 tablespoons spicy dijon', '1 tablespoon fresh dill chopped', '2 tablespoons fresh chives chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons honey', 'Salmon Mixture', '16 oz fresh skinless salmon (455 g)', '½ red onion minced', '1 tablespoon fresh dill chopped', '1 tablespoon prepared horseradish optional', '½ teaspoon honey', '1 ½ teaspoons sea salt', '½ teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: In a small bowl, combine ¼ cup yogurt, 2 tablespoons spicy dijon, dill, 2 tablespoons fresh chives, and honey', '2:  Set aside', '3: Cut 16 oz fresh skinless salmon into ½ inch (1¼ cm) cubes and transfer to a food processor', '4: Pulse 5 times', '5: Add ½ red onion, dill, 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, honey, 1 ½ teaspoons sea salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper and pulse a few more times to combine', '6: Form mixture into 4 patties', '7: Drizzle small amount of olive oil into frying pan and heat pan to medium-high', '8: Cook patties for 3-4 minutes until browned', '9:  Flip and cook another 3-4 minutes until browned', '10: Serve on your favorite multi-grain bread with ¼ cup yogurt dill sauce']

ingredients: ['1 cup pineapple (165 g) cubed', '1 cup mango (165 g) cubed', '1 banana sliced', '2 cups milk (480 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Mix fruits together in a plastic bag', '2: Seal bag and place in freezer for up to 6 months', '3: When ready, mix 2 cups milk and fruit in a blender until consistency is smooth']

ingredients: ['1 lb elbow macaroni (455 g) cooked al dente', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '1 cup cauliflower florets (300 g)', '1 cup butternut squash (205 g) diced', '1 cup carrot (120 g) sliced', '2 cups milk (480 mL)', '2 cups cheddar cheese (200 g) shredded', '4 oz cream cheese (115 g)']
instructions: ['1: Add ½ cup water, 1 cup cauliflower, 1 cup butternut squash, and carrots in a pot over medium heat', '2:  Cover and cook until vegetables are tender', '3: Add everything into a blender, including cooking ½ cup water, and blend until smooth', '4: Return blended veggies to the pot over medium heat, and add the 2 cups milk, 2 cups cheddar 4 oz 4 oz cream cheese, and 4 oz cream 2 cups cheddar 4 oz 4 oz cream cheese', '5:  Stir until smooth', '6: Add 1 lb elbow macaroni, reduce heat, mix thoroughly, and cover for 20 minutes']

ingredients: ['3 beets', '1 cup olive oil (240 mL) divided', '1 ½ teaspoons salt divided', '1 red onion cut into wedges', '4 carrots peeled and chopped', '2 parsnips peeled chopped', '1 sweet potato peeled chopped', '¾ teaspoon pepper divided', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 tablespoon dijon mustard', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '3 tablespoons fresh parsley chopped', '6 cups mixed greens (600 g)', '1 cup walnuts (100 g) chopped', '½ cup crumbled feta cheese (55 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '2: On a 1 red onion cutting board, 1 red onion cut the root end of the beet so it lays flat on the surface', '3:  Place the beet on a piece of aluminum foil', '4:  Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and season with ¼ teaspoon 1 ½ teaspoons salt', '5:  Wrap the foil around the beet and pinch the top of the foil together until the beet is sealed in', '6:  Repeat with the other 2 3 beets', '7: On a sheet pan, place the onions, 4 carrots, 2 parsnips, and 1 sweet potato', '8: Drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil and season with ½ teaspoon pepper and ½ teaspoon 1 ½ teaspoons salt', '9:  Toss the the vegetables until coated and spread them evenly in the pan', '10: Create 3 circular spaces for the 3 beets', '11:  Place the 3 3 beets on the pan', '12: Bake for 1 hour until with vegetables begin to crisp and caramelize', '13: In a large bowl, add ½ cup (120 ml) of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and garlic powder, and whisk until emulsified', '14:  Add the parsley and season with 1 ½ teaspoons salt and pepper, stirring to combine', '15: Add the 6 cups mixed greens, roasted vegetables, and the 3 beets to the bowl with the vinaigrette and toss until evenly incorporated', '16: Serve with walnuts and feta']

ingredients: ['1 lb large shrimp (455 g) peeled and deveined', '3 cloves garlic minced', '2 cups broccoli floret (500 g)', '½ onion diced', '1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce', '2 tablespoons sesame oil divided', '½ teaspoon salt divided']
instructions: ['1: Heat 1 1 2 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons sesame oil in a 1 lb large, nonstick skillet over medium heat', '2: Pour in the shrimp and season with ¼ ½ teaspoon of the salt', '3: Fry the shrimp for 1 minute on each side', '4: Remove the shrimp from the pan and pour in the remaining 1 1 2 tablespoon of oil', '5: Toss in the ½ onion and remaining ¼ ½ teaspoon of salt and sauté for a few minutes until they begin to soften', '6: Add in the 2 cups broccoli, 3 cloves garlic and soy sauce and sauté until the 3 cloves garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds', '7: Toss the shrimp back into the pan and mix until everything is well incorporated and the shrimp is fully cooked, about 1 minute', '8: Divide the mixture evenly between 4 bowls']

ingredients: ['¼ cup raspberry (30 g)', '¼ cup blueberry (25 g)', '½ cup strawberry (75 g)', '½ cup fresh spinach (20 g)', '2 tablespoons chia seed', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', '1 tablespoon almond butter', '1 cup milk (235 mL) of choice or water']
instructions: ['1: Layer the raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, 2 tablespoons chia seeds, ½ cup fresh spinach, ½ teaspoon cinnamon, and 1 tablespoon almond butter in a mason jar', '2: Store in the freezer for up to 5 days', '3: When ready to serve, add the 1 cup milk or water to a blender then add the contents of the mason jar', '4: Blend until smooth', '5: Pour smoothie back into the jar']

ingredients: ['1 onion sliced', '3 boneless skinless chicken breasts', '1 ½ teaspoons seasoned salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon dijon mustard', '⅓ cup honey (115 g)', '6 cloves garlic minced', '12 slider buns']
instructions: ['1: Add all ingredients to a slow cooker and stir until 3 boneless skinless chicken and onions are coated with seasonings', '2: Cook on high for 3-4 hours, or until 3 boneless skinless chicken is cooked and shreddable', '3: With a set of tongs or two forks, shred the 3 boneless skinless chicken and stir into the juices', '4: Distribute evenly between 12 slider buns']

ingredients: ['14 oz extra firm tofu (400 g)', '¾ cup pinto bean (130 g)', '6 tablespoons nutritional yeast', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL)', '1 tablespoon poultry seasoning', '3 cloves garlic chopped', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 cup low sodium vegetable broth (240 mL)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 ½ cups vital wheat gluten (310 g)', '½ cup vegan stuffing (100 g)', 'gravy for serving', 'Special Equipment', '2 wooden skewers']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Soak the 2 wooden skewers in water to prevent them from burning when baking', '3: Crumble the 14 oz extra firm tofu into a medium bowl lined with a dish towel', '4:  Gather the sides of the dish towel and squeeze out as much liquid as possible from the 14 oz extra firm tofu', '5: To a food processor, add the ¾ cup pinto beans, drained 14 oz extra firm tofu, 6 tablespoons nutritional yeast, ¼ cup soy sauce, 1 tablespoon poultry seasoning, 3 cloves garlic, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon onion powder, and 1 cup low sodium vegetable broth and puree until smooth', '6:  With the processor running, pour in the 2 tablespoons olive oil and continue blending until incorporated', '7: Add the 2 ½ cups vital wheat gluten to a large bowl, add the mixture from the food processor, and stir until the dough comes together enough that it can be kneaded', '8:  Knead for 1-2 minutes, until most of the cracks have disappeared, then turn out onto a clean surface and shape into a ball', '9:  Cut off about ¼ of the dough with a bench scraper and set aside', '10: Transfer the remaining dough to a small glass bowl', '11:  Using your hands, form a hole in the center and evenly stretch the edges to help it expand to about 3-4 inches (8 cm) in diameter', '12: Scoop the ½ cup vegan stuffing into the well, then stretch the sides of the dough over the ½ cup vegan stuffing to encase completely', '13: Wrap the 14 oz extra firm tofu turkey in parchment paper, then in foil', '14: Divide the reserved dough in half and shape into 2 drumsticks', '15:  Insert a 2 wooden skewer in each one', '16:  Wrap the drumsticks in parchment paper, then foil', '17: Set the 14 oz extra firm tofu turkey and drumsticks on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour, flipping every 20 minutes', '18:  Remove the drumsticks after 40 minutes', '19: Serve with gravy']

ingredients: ['⅓ cup white tea leaves (5 g)', '¼ cup dried lemon (30 g) diced', '¼ cup dried white peach (30 g) diced', '¼ cup dried rose petal (5 g)', '½ tablespoon dried ginger']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, combine the ⅓ cup ¼ cup dried white tea leaves, dried lemon, dried ⅓ cup ¼ cup dried white peach, dried rose petals, and dried ginger', '2:  Mix well', '3: Store in an airtight container for up to 1 month', '4: To brew, steep 1-2 teaspoons of the tea blend in 8 ounces (240ml) of hot water for 5 minutes', '5:  Serve warm or over ice']

ingredients: ['2 cups basmati rice (400 g)', '3 cups water (720 g) plus 3 tbsp divided', '1 medium white onion chopped plus 2 thinly sliced divided', '5 tablespoons slivered almonds divided', '4 cloves garlic chopped', '1 ginger 1 inch (2 cm) peeled and coarsely chopped', '6 tablespoons vegetable oil', '3 tablespoons golden raisin', '1 ½ lb boneless lamb shoulder (680 g) cut into chunks', '1 ¼ teaspoons salt plus an additional 1 1/2 tbsp divided', '1 cup plain yogurt (245 g)', '1 teaspoon saffron thread', '2 tablespoons milk', '1 cinnamon stick 1 inch (2 cm)', '5 cloves', '½ teaspoon black peppercorn', '½ teaspoon cardamom seeds removed from pods', '1 teaspoon coriander seeds', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ lemon juiced', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into 8 pieces', '3 eggs hard boiled peeled and halved for garnish', '3 tablespoons fresh cilantro chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Soak the rice in 2 2 3 1 cups (480 ml) of water for about 2 hours', '2: Add the chopped onion, 2 tablespoons slivered almonds, garlic, 1 ginger, and 3 tablespoons of water to a food processor', '3:  Blend into a paste', '4: Heat the oil in a large nonstick pan over 1 medium heat', '5:  Add the sliced onions and fry until browned and crisp, about 10 minutes', '6:  Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels', '7: Add the raisins to the pan', '8:  Stir until they become plump, about 2 minutes, then remove and drain on paper towels', '9: Add the 1 ½ lb boneless lamb to the pan, in batches if necessary, and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes', '10:  Transfer the browned meat to a bowl and set aside', '11: Reduce the heat to 1 medium', '12:  Add the onion paste to the pan', '13:  Cook, stirring constantly, until the paste turns light brown', '14:  If it sticks to the bottom of the pan, add a bit of water and keep stirring', '15: Return the meat and any accumulated juices to the pan', '16:  Add 1¼ 1 ¼ teaspoons of salt, the yogurt, and 1 2 3 1 cup (240 ml) of water', '17:  Cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes', '18: Add the 1 teaspoon saffron threads to a small bowl with the milk and set aside', '19: Bring a large pot of water to boil and add 1½ tablespoons of salt', '20:  Drain the rice and add to pot', '21:  Boil for 5 minutes, then immediately drain and rinse', '22: In a spice grinder or mortar and pestle, finely grind the 1 cinnamon stick, cloves, peppercorns, cardamon, 1 teaspoon coriander, and 1 teaspoon cumin', '23: Add the spices to the meat, along with the 1 teaspoon nutmeg and ¼ teaspoon cayenne', '24:  Cover and continue cooking until the meat is tender, about 10 minutes', '25:  If there is too much sauce, increase the heat to high, uncover, and stir to evaporate some of the liquid (there should about 1 2 3 1 cup (240 g) of sauce left in the meat)', '26: Preheat the oven to 300˚F (150˚C)', '27: In a large Dutch oven or deep casserole dish, layer half of the rice, the meat with its sauce, and the rest of the rice', '28:  Squeeze the ½ lemon juice over rice', '29: Using the end of a wooden spoon, poke holes all the way through the layers', '30:  Spoon a bit of the 1 teaspoon saffron and milk into each hole', '31: Distribute the butter over the rice and sprinkle over most of the fried onions, reserving some for garnish', '32:  Cover the dish with foil, then top with a lid', '33: Bake for 1 hour', '34: Remove the biriyani from the oven and set aside for at least 15 minutes', '35: Garnish with the 3 eggs, raisins, remaining 3 tablespoons of slivered almonds, reserved fried onions, and cilantro']

ingredients: ['36 chocolate sandwich cookies', '8 oz cream cheese (225 g) softened', '12 oz white chocolate (340 g) melted']
instructions: ['1: In a food processor, finely crush the cookies, reserving about 2 tablespoons of the mixture for sprinkling on top of the truffles', '2: In a large bowl, combine the cookie crumbs and 8 oz cream cheese, stirring until evenly mixed', '3:  Chill the mixture for about an hour or until it can be rolled into a ball and hold its shape', '4: Divide and roll the mixture into golf ball-sized balls', '5:  Dip the truffles in the melted 12 oz white 36 12 oz 12 oz white chocolate and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper', '6:  Sprinkle the reserved cookie crumbs on top of the  truffles before the 36 12 oz 12 oz white chocolate hardens']

ingredients: ['Sushi Rice', '2 cups short grain white rice (420 g)', '2 cups water (470 mL)', '1 tablespoon sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ cup rice vinegar (60 mL)', 'Spicy Tuna', '¼ lb sushi-grade tuna (115 g)', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon sriracha sauce', 'Imitation Crab', '4 imitation crabs', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', 'Chicken Teriyaki', '2 chicken thighs', 'teriyaki sauce to marinade', 'Assembly', '1 cucumber', '1 carrot', '2 avocados', 'sushi grade nori seaweed', 'soy sauce', 'wasabi', 'ginger']
instructions: ['1: In a bowl wash the rice 3 times with 2 cups water', '2: In a pot add rice and 2 cups water and cover and bring it to boil', '3:  Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes', '4:  Then take off heat and rest for another 15 minutes', '5: In a microwave safe bowl heat 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 teaspoon salt and vinegar for a minute or until the 1 tablespoon sugar is completely melted', '6: Transfer the rice onto a serving bowl and pour the vinegar over the rice', '7: Using a spatula fold in the vinegar and cut into the rice', '8:  Have another person fan the rice while mixing to get it down to room temperature', '9: Prep the fix-ins', '10:  Slice ¼ lb ¼ lb sushi-grade tuna and chop until the meat is mashed together', '11:  Transfer into a small bowl', '12: Mix in mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon sriracha 1 tablespoon sriracha teriyaki soy sauce', '13:  Set asideIn a medium bowl marinate 2 chicken with your favorite teriyaki 1 tablespoon sriracha teriyaki soy sauce', '14:  Fully cook 2 chicken and slice and set aside in a bowl', '15: Cut 4 imitation crab into small pieces', '16:  Mix in mayonnaise until fully coated', '17:  Set aside', '18: Cut veggies into thin slices', '19:  Cut avocado into bite size pieces as well', '20: Set up the table: After placing your rice and fix-ins place each ¼ lb sushi rolling station with a bamboo rolling mat', '21:  Set out a bowl of 2 cups water so the rice does not stick to your hands', '22:  Have a cutting board close by with a knife', '23:  Let’s roll', '24: On the rolling mat place one sheet of nori', '25:  There is a smooth side and a rough side', '26:  The rough side will face up', '27: Wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on your nori', '28:  Spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without smushing the rice down', '29:  LEAVE SPACE AT THE BOTTOM', '30:  (This extra sliver of nori will stick onto the rice when rolling', '31: )Place the fix-in at the bottom row of the rice', '32: Grabbing both nori and the mat roll the mat over so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side', '33: Squeeze down to make a nice tight roll', '34: Grab the mat and continue rolling over the rice until your roll is complete', '35:  Squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape', '36: Transfer your roll onto a cutting board', '37:  Have a damp towel close by for your knife', '38:  Before you cut give you knife a wipe', '39: NOTE: This will prevent the rice from sticking to the knife', '40: Cut your roll into desired sizes', '41: NOTE: Wrap mat with plastic wrap for inside out rolls', '42: Repeat steps 13-20 for your veggie roll', '43: Repeat steps 13-20 for your teriyaki 2 chicken roll', '44: Repeat steps 13-20 for your California roll']

ingredients: ['4 chicken breasts', '8 burger buns', 'BBQ Sauce', '1 ½ cups ketchup (340 g)', '¾ cup apple cider vinegar (175 mL)', '½ cup dark brown sugar (110 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '2 teaspoons paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce', 'Slaw', '¾ cup mayonnaise (175 g)', '2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', '2 tablespoons sugar', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '2 cups green cabbage (200 g)', '2 cups red cabbage (200 g)', '1 cup shredded carrot (110 g)']
instructions: ['1: Place the 4 chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker', '2: Cover the 4 chicken with 1 ½ cups ketchup, apple cider vinegar, ½ cup dark brown ½ cup dark brown 2 tablespoons sugar, salt, pepper, 2 teaspoons paprika, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and Worcestershire sauce', '3:  Mix well', '4: Cover, and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 6 hours', '5: In a large bowl, whisk together ¾ cup mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, ½ cup dark brown 2 tablespoons sugar, salt, and pepper', '6: Add both kinds of cabbage and carrots to the bowl and gently toss with the dressing', '7: Shred the 4 chicken breasts with 2 forks in the slow cooker', '8: Serve on a 8 burger bun with slaw', '9: Also great for BBQ Pulled Chicken Pizza, BBQ Pulled Chicken Nachos, and BBQ Pulled Chicken Mac ’n’ cheese']

ingredients: ['1 ½ cups short grain rice (300 g)', '2 cups water (480 mL)', '3 tablespoons sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup coconut milk (240 mL)', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla', 'A variety of fruit', 'pineapple', 'strawberry', 'mango', 'kiwi', '1 pt blackberry (475 g)', 'raspberry']
instructions: ['1: In a medium pot combine the 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice, 2 2 1 cups water, 3 tablespoons sugar and ¼ teaspoon salt', '2:  Cook on low heat for about 20 minutes or until all the 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice absorbs the 2 2 1 cups water', '3: Add the coconut milk and 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla', '4:  The mixture should be moldable', '5:  Cook a few minutes longer if it’s too runny', '6: Slice A variety of fruit of choice into long pieces', '7: *Note: Use a potato peeler to shave thin slices off the mango', '8: Lay a bamboo rolling pad on a counter top, and place a square of wax paper over top', '9:  Spread the 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice about ½ inch (1 cm) thick over the paper into approximately a 7x5 inch (17x12 cm) rectangle', '10: Toast a ¼ 1 ½ 2 1 cup (25g) of coconut shreds for 3 minutes', '11: Lay the A variety of fruit pieces on the 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice, and roll up carefully', '12:  If 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice sticks to the paper too much, try spreading it a little thicker', '13: Coat the rolls with either the mango slices, or the toasted coconut', '14: Slice each roll into 6 pieces', '15: With the rest of the 1 ½ 1 ½ 2 1 cups short grain rice, roll into balls (like nigiri)', '16: Place thin slices of kiki or strawberries over top with half a 1 pt blackberry on top to look like fish eggs', '17: Blend ¼ 1 ½ 2 1 cup (25 g) raspberries with ¼ 1 ½ 2 1 cup (60 ml) 2 2 1 cups water to make a dipping sauce']

ingredients: ['4 king oyster mushrooms caps removed and tough bottoms trimmed', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '⅓ teaspoon black pepper', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL)', '⅓ cup liquid aminos (80 mL)', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 tablespoons maple syrup', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar']
instructions: ['1: Use a mandolin to cut the mushroom stems lengthwise into ¼-inch thick planks', '2: In a large bowl, whisk together the 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 1 tablespoon smoked paprika, ¼ teaspoon kosher salt, ⅓ teaspoon black pepper, ¼ cup vegetable oil, ⅓ cup liquid aminos, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 tablespoons maple syrup, and 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '3: Gently toss the 4 king oyster mushrooms in the marinade until evenly coated', '4:  Transfer to the refrigerator and marinate for at least 1 hour, up to overnight', '5: Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C)', '6:  Set a wire rack over a baking sheet', '7: Arrange the marinated 4 king oyster mushrooms in a single layer on the wire rack', '8: Bake for 90–120 minutes, until the 4 king oyster mushrooms have dehydrated and are slightly crisp on the edges, but still flexible', '9:  They will harden slightly as they cool', '10: Serve the mushroom bacon as desired, such as on a “BLT” sandwich, in tofu scramble or breakfast burrito, as a salad topper or soup garnish, or as a topping for baked vegan mac and cheese']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon avocado oil', '2 whole dry chili peppers', '2 whole bay leaves', '½ cinnamon stick broken into big pieces', '1 large onion finely chopped', '2 roma tomatoes diced', '1 cup crushed tomatoes (200 g)', '4 garlics finely chopped', '1 teaspoon ginger grated', '2 teaspoons paprika', '½ teaspoon red chili powder', '½ teaspoon turmeric hardar', '2 teaspoons pav bhaji spice pack', '¼ teaspoon garam masala (optional for spicy heat)', '2 cups water (480 mL) (adjust to desired consistency)', '1 head cauliflower coarsely chopped', '1 medium eggplant coarsely chopped', '3 medium potatoes coarsely cubed', '2 cups frozen mixed vegetable (300 g)']
instructions: ['1: Press "Saute" mode on Instant PotHeat 1 tablespoon avocado oil and whole spices', '2: Add onions and 2 roma 1 1 2 2 cup crushed tomatoes and saute until onions are translucent', '3:  Then, add garlic, 1 teaspoon ginger, crushed 2 roma 1 1 2 2 cup crushed tomatoes, salt, 2 teaspoons paprika, ½ teaspoon red 2 whole dry ½ teaspoon ½ teaspoon red chili powder, ½ teaspoon turmeric, 2 teaspoons pav bhaji spice pack, ¼ teaspoon garam masalo', '4:  Add 1 1 2 2 cup 2 2 cups water', '5:  Mix well', '6:  Let gravy cook for approximately 5 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent gravy from burning', '7: Add all the vegetables and mix well with gravy', '8: Add the remaining 2 2 cups water and mix well', '9:  Water level should be about ¾ to the top of the veggies, so adjust as necessary', '10: Close the lid of the Instant Pot and press \'Cancel\' and then press "Steam" and adjust time to 12 minutes', "11:  Set valve to 'Sealing' mode", '12: Once the Instant Pot completes the cycle, it will beep', "13:  Either switch the valve to 'Venting' position (be careful as steam will come out of the top of the IP), or allow the Instant Pot to manually vent", '14:  Carefully open the lid once it is safe to do so', '15: Using a potato masher or handheld immersion blender, mash all the cooked veggies and mix well to incorporate with the gravy', '16: Serve with buttered and toasted bread', '17:  For a low carb option, you can serve on romaine or butter lettuce', '18: Garnish with chopped cilantro, lemon and finely chopped onions']

ingredients: ['Balsamic Soy Salmon', '½ cup soy sauce (120 mL)', '½ cup balsamic vinegar (120 mL)', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', '2 cloves garlic minced', '12 oz salmon (345 g) 2 fillets', 'Garlic Paprika', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '12 oz salmon (345 g) 2 fillets', 'Vegetables', '1 large carrot thinly sliced on bias', '5 oz green beans (140 g) ends trimmed', '5 oz asparagus (140 g) ends trimmed chopped', '1 medium yellow squash chopped', 'olive oil to taste', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: In a square baking dish, combine the ½ cup soy sauce, ½ cup balsamic vinegar, oil, and garlic, and whisk to combine', '2: Put 2 of the salmon fillets in the ½ cup soy and ½ cup balsamic mixture, making sure all sides are coated', '3: Transfer to the refrigerator, marinading for 30 minutes to 2 hours', '4: Preheat oven to 450˚F (230˚C)', '5: In a small bowl, mix together the 1 teaspoon paprika, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon onion powder, salt, and pepper', '6: Evenly coat the remaining 2 salmon filets with the spice rub', '7: Place the salmon and vegetables on a parchment paper-lined baking tray', '8: Drizzle olive oil and sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over the vegetables', '9: Bake for 11 minutes per inch (2', '10: 5 cm) of salmon thickness', '11: Divide the salmon and vegetables into 4 containers, mix and matching the vegetables to your liking', '12: Refrigerate for up to 3 days']

ingredients: ['Cake', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 cups whole milk (480 mL)', '3 tablespoons earl grey tea divided', '2 ½ sticks unsalted butter softened', '1 cup honey (335 g)', '3 large eggs room temperature', '3 cups all purpose flour (375 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ vanilla bean split lengthwise and seeds scraped', 'Frosting', '6 oz blackberry (170 g)', '3 sticks unsalted butter softened', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3 cups powdered sugar (360 g)', 'Assembly', '18 oz blackberry (540 g) halved lengthwise plus 6 ounces (170 G) whole and halved divided', '10 edible flowers such as purple and white pansies', 'earl grey tea for garnish', 'Special Equipment', 'cake turntable', 'parchment paper round 9 in (22 cm)', 'offset spatula', 'bench scraper', 'Preparation', 'Cake', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '2 cups whole milk (480 mL)', '3 tablespoons earl grey tea divided', '2 ½ sticks unsalted butter softened', '1 cup honey (335 g)', '3 large eggs room temperature', '3 cups all purpose flour (375 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ vanilla bean split lengthwise and seeds scraped', 'Frosting', '6 oz blackberry (170 g)', '3 sticks unsalted butter softened', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3 cups powdered sugar (360 g)', 'Assembly', '18 oz blackberry (540 g) halved lengthwise plus 6 ounces (170 G) whole and halved divided', '10 edible flowers such as purple and white pansies', 'earl grey tea for garnish', 'Special Equipment', 'cake turntable', 'parchment paper round 9 in (22 cm)', 'offset spatula', 'bench scraper', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2:  Grease 3 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray and line the bottoms with parchment paper', '3: Make the cake: In a small pot over medium heat, combine the milk and 2 tablespoons of Earl Grey tea', '4:  Bring to a simmer, then remove from the heat, cover, and set aside to steep for at least 30 minutes, up to 1 hour', '5: Strain the steeped milk through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl and discard the tea leaves', '6:  Let cool to room temperature', '7: In a large bowl, beat the butter with an electric hand mixer until pale and fluffy, 2-3 minutes', '8:  Add the honey and beat to combine', '9:  Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating to incorporate before adding the next', '10:  The mixture will look curdled at this point, but will come together', '11:  Sift in half of the flour, the baking powder, baking soda, and salt and beat just until combined', '12:  Add the steeped milk and beat to incorporate', '13:  Sift in the remaining flour and beat until just combined', '14:  Add the vanilla bean seeds and remaining tablespoon of Earl Grey tea and beat to incorporate', '15:  The batter will be relatively thick', '16: Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and smooth the tops with an offset spatula', '17: Bake the cakes for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean', '18:  Transfer the cakes to a wire rack to cool for 5-10 minutes, until safe to handle', '19:  Turn the cakes out of the pans and let cool completely on the wire rack, 25-30 minutes', '20: Make the frosting: In a small food processor, blend the blackberries into a smooth puree, about 30 seconds', '21:  Strain the blackberry puree through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl, using a rubber spatula to push the mixture through', '22:  Discard the seeds and set the puree aside', '23: In a large bowl, cream the butter with an electric hand mixer until pale and fluffy, 2-3 minutes', '24:  Mix in the vanilla', '25:  Sift in the powdered sugar, 1 cup (120 G) at a time, and beat to incorporate', '26:  Mix in the blackberry puree', '27: Assemble the cake: Place the cardboard round on the cake turntable', '28:  Spread a dab of frosting in the middle and center 1 of the cakes on the round', '29:  Using an offset spatula, spread about 1 cup (115 G) of frosting evenly over the top of the cake', '30:  Spread evenly into a layer about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick', '31:  Arrange half of the halved blackberries, cut sides down, on top of the frosting, pressing down gently into the frosting', '32:  Place another cake layer on top and repeat frosting with another cup of frosting and filling with the remaining halved blackberries', '33: Top with the remaining cake layer', '34:  Dollop 1-1½ cups (115 G) of frosting on top', '35:  Using the offset spatula, spread the frosting in an even layer across the top, starting from the center and working toward the outer edge', '36:  Cover the sides of the cake with more frosting, working from top to bottom down the sides', '37:  Remove and reserve any excess frosting', '38:  Holding a bench scraper against the side of the cake, slowly spin the turntable to help spread the frosting into a thin “naked” layer', '39:  Remove excess frosting from the bench scraper as necessary', '40:  Use the offset spatula to add more frosting to the sides to cover up any particularly bare spots and to smooth out the top and edges of the cake', '41:  Refrigerate cake for 20 minutes, until the frosting is set', '42: Pile the whole and halved blackberries in the center of the cake and decorate with the edible flowers', '43:  Sprinkle lightly with loose Earl Grey tea leaves', '44: Slice and serve']

ingredients: ['1 lb strawberry (455 g)', '¼ cup honey (85 g)']
instructions: ['1: Hull the strawberries by using a straw to push out the stem of each 1 lb strawberry', '2: Cut strawberries in half and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze until hardened', '3: Add the frozen strawberries and ¼ cup honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed', '4: Transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely frozen']

ingredients: ['Ethiopian Salad', '1 tablespoon garlic grated', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 cup diced tomato (200 g)', '2 tablespoons red onion finely chopped', '2 tablespoons jalapeño finely chopped', 'kosher salt to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'black pepper to taste', 'kosher salt to taste', '4 cups iceberg lettuce (400 g) shredded', 'Siga Tibs', '2 lb ribeye steak (910 g) cubed', '3 tablespoons red onion finely chopped', '2 tablespoons clarified butter Ethiopian butter', '2 tablespoons jalapeño finely chopped', 'For Serving', 'pita bread or Injera', '¼ cup Suf fitfit (60 g) pureed sunflower seeds', 'timatim fitfit pureed tomatoes', 'green lentil azifa', '1 beet', 'shiro orange split peas', '¼ cup alicha kik (55 g) yellow split peas', 'misir wot red lentils', '¼ cup gomen (50 g) collard greens', 'tikil goman cabbage and carrots', 'shimbra asa chickpea paste', '¼ cup atkilt (40 g) potatoes green beans carrots and onions', 'tofu tib', '¼ cup doro wot (30 g) stewed chicken']
instructions: ['1: Make the Ethiopian salad: In a large bowl, combine the 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, timatim fitfit pureed tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño', '2:  Season with salt, the 2 tablespoons olive oil, and black pepper', '3:  Toss well', '4: Add the 4 cups iceberg lettuce and toss again', '5: Make the siga tibs: Heat a large nonstick pan over high heat', '6:  Add the 2 lb ribeye steak and season with salt', '7:  Cook until nicely browned, or 7-8 minutes', '8: Add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes', '9:  Add the 2 tablespoons clarified butter and let it melt, then add the jalapeño and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant', '10:  Remove the pan from the heat', '11: Serve the salad and siga tibs with injera pita bread and your desired accompaniments']

ingredients: ['Chicago Dog', '4 beef hot dogs', '4 poppy seed buns', 'tomato slices', '1 tablespoon celery salt', '4 dill pickle spears', 'sport pepper', 'sweet onion chopped', 'green pickle relish', "French's yellow mustard"]
instructions: ['1: Grill 4 beef hot dogs and place in 4 poppy seed buns', '2:  Top dogs with tomatoes, 1 tablespoon celery salt, 4 dill green pickle spears, sport peppers, chopped sweet onion, green 4 dill green pickle relish, and French’s  "Frenchs yellow mustard']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion diced', '3 garlics minced', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 cups mashed potato (500 g)', '2 small heads broccoli including stems chopped', '2 ½ cups low sodium vegetable broth (600 mL)', '2 ½ cups milk (600 mL) of your choice', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium heat', '2:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the 1 small onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent', '3:  Add the garlic, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes more, until the garlic is fragrant', '4: Add the 2 cups mashed potatoes, 2 small heads broccoli, vegetable broth, and 2 ½ cups milk and bring to a boil', '5:  Cover and reduce the heat to 2 ½ cups low', '6:  Simmer for 20 minutes, or until the 2 small heads broccoli is tender', '7: Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth', '8: Stir in the ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg, then ladle into bowls']

ingredients: ['10 oz frozen pitted cherry (285 g) 1 bag', '2 tablespoons sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch', '¼ teaspoon almond extract', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 lb frozen puff pastry (455 g) 2 sheets', '1 egg beaten', 'raw sugar']
instructions: ['1: Combine cherries, 2 tablespoons raw sugar, 1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch, ¼ teaspoon almond extract, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice in a saucepan', '2:  Cook over low heat for 5-10 minutes, crushing the cherries with a spoon and stirring occasionally', '3: Remove from heat and let cool', '4: Preheat oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '5: Roll out the 1 lb frozen puff pastry', '6:   Using a cookie cutter, cut 9 rounds out of each sheet of pastry', '7: Fill each round with a spoonful of cherry filling', '8:  Fold in half over the filling and pinch closed with your fingers, followed by a fork', '9: Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper', '10:  Brush with 1 egg wash and sprinkle with raw 2 tablespoons raw sugar', '11: Bake 10-12 minutes until golden brown and 1 lb frozen puffy', '12: Cool slightly and serve with a cup of coffee']

ingredients: ['½ red bell pepper thinly sliced', '½ yellow bell pepper thinly sliced', '½ green bell pepper thinly sliced', '½ white onion thinly sliced', '2 chicken breasts', '2 tablespoons oil divided', 'Fajita Seasoning', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: In a small bowl, mix together all of the fajita seasoning ingredients and set aside', '3: Heat 1 tablespoon of the 2 tablespoons oil in a large, ovenproof skillet', '4:  Toss in the bell ½ red bell ½ yellow bell ½ green bell ½ teaspoon black peppers and onions and sprinkle on 2 1 ½ teaspoons of the fajita seasoning', '5:  Sauté until the veggies have softened, about 6 minutes', '6: Using a sharp knife, slice into the side of a 2 chicken breast to form a large pocket, being careful not to cut all the way through', '7: Spoon in some of the fajita ½ red bell ½ yellow bell ½ green bell ½ teaspoon black pepper mixture so that the breast is comfortably stuffed', '8: Season the 2 chicken on both sides with fajita seasoning', '9: Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in the skillet and brown the 2 chicken, about 4-5 minutes per side', '10: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, until the meat is cooked through', '11: Let the 2 chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing']

ingredients: ['Marinade Ingredients', '3 teaspoons corn starch', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon rice wine', '½ teaspoon white pepper', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 stalk scallion shredded', '2 slices ginger', '4 chicken thighs chopped into bite-sized pieces', 'Other Ingredients', 'vegetable oil as needed for frying', '2 tablespoons szechuan peppercorn', '5 red chilis chopped', '50 dried red chilis whole', '4 slices ginger', '1 stalk scallion chopped', '⅓ cup peanuts (40 g)', '½ teaspoon sugar', '½ tablespoon rice wine', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', 'scallion chopped for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Marinade Ingredients', '3 teaspoons corn starch', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon rice wine', '½ teaspoon white pepper', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 stalk scallion shredded', '2 slices ginger', '4 chicken thighs chopped into bite-sized pieces', 'Other Ingredients', 'vegetable oil as needed for frying', '2 tablespoons szechuan peppercorn', '5 red chilis chopped', '50 dried red chilis whole', '4 slices ginger', '1 stalk scallion chopped', '⅓ cup peanuts (40 g)', '½ teaspoon sugar', '½ tablespoon rice wine', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', 'scallion chopped for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Combine marinade ingredients in a bowl, add the chopped chicken', '2:  Marinate for 10 minutes', '3: In about 1 ½ inch (4 cm) of oil, fry the chicken until browned and crispy', '4:  Remove and set aside', '5: Heat oil in a wok or a large pan', '6:  Add the Szechuan peppercorn and dried red chilies', '7:  Fry until fragrant', '8: Add the rest of the dried red chilies, ginger, scallion, and peanuts', '9:  Fry for a minute', '10: Add the fried chicken pieces, sugar, rice wine and sesame oil', '11:  Toss to coat', '12: Garnish with chopped scallions', '13: Nutrition  Calories: 2870 Fat: 303 grams  Carbs: 29 grams Fiber: 11 grams  Sugars: 9 grams  Protein:  26 grams']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '4 cloves garlic minced', '2 cups chicken broth (470 mL)', '1 cup milk (235 mL)', '8 oz fettuccine (225 g)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '¼ cup grated parmesan cheese (25 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh parsley chopped']
instructions: ['1: Heat 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium high heat', '2:  Add 4 cloves garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes', '3: Add in the 2 cups chicken broth, 1 cup milk, and 8 oz fettuccine', '4:  Season with salt and pepper', '5: Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes', '6: Stir in Parmesan', '7:  If the mixture is too thick, add more 1 cup milk as needed until desired consistency is reached', '8: Serve immediately, and top with 2 tablespoons fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['1 small watermelon', '3 cups fresh arugula (60 g)', '4 oz feta cheese (115 g) crumbled', 'Honey Lime Dressing', '3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 tablespoon water', '2 tablespoons honey', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil']
instructions: ['1: Using a sharp knife, cut off the top and bottom of the 1 small 1 tablespoon watermelon to reveal the red flesh and create flat surfaces on both sides', '2:  Stand the 1 small 1 tablespoon watermelon upright, and slice off the remaining peel so only the red core remains', '3: Cut the 1 small 1 tablespoon watermelon into roughly 1-inch (2 cm) cubes and transfer to a large bowl', '4: In a 1 small bowl, whisk together the 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 1 small 1 tablespoon water, 2 tablespoons honey, and salt', '5: While whisking, gradually add the 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil in a very slow, steady stream to create an emulsification', '6:  Set aside', '7: Add the 3 cups fresh arugula, 4 oz feta, and 2 tablespoons honey 3 tablespoons fresh lime dressing to the large bowl with the 1 small 1 tablespoon watermelon', '8: Toss the salad until well-combined, then divide between serving bowls']

ingredients: ['10 habanero peppers seeded halved', '6 cloves garlic smashed', '2 tablespoons olive oil divided', '1 cup carrot (120 g) chopped', '1 onion chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '2 cups water (240 mL)', '¼ cup lime juice (60 mL)', '¼ cup white vinegar (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: Place the habanero peppers and 6 cloves garlic on the baking sheet', '4:  Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons olive oil and toss with tongs to coat', '5:  NOTE: Do not touch the peppers with your bare hands', '6: Roast for 10 minutes, until the edges of the peppers are brown', '7: Add the remaining tablespoon of 2 tablespoons olive oil to a large pot over high heat', '8:  Add the 1 cup carrot, 1 onion, and 1 ½ teaspoons salt', '9:  Cook for 4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and glossy', '10: Add the 2 cups water, ¼ cup lime juice, ¼ cup white vinegar, and the roasted peppers and stir', '11:  Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes', '12: Remove the pot from the heat and let cool', '13: Pour the vegetable mixture into a blender and puree until smooth', '14: Using a funnel, pour the sauce into a bottle or jar and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks']

ingredients: ['3 bananas sliced', '12 oz fresh strawberry  (340 g) quartered', '12 oz fresh raspberry (340 g)', 'Dressing', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon maple syrup']
instructions: ['1: Combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl', '2: Mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well']

ingredients: ['⅓ cup chia seed (55 g)', '¾ cup water (180 mL)', '¾ cup quinoa (125 g) cooked', '⅓ cup pumpkin seeds (45 g)', '⅓ cup sesame seed (50 g)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'hummu to serve']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C', '2: )In a medium bowl, add the ⅓ cup chia seeds and ¾ cup water', '3: Mix until well combined then let stand for 5 minutes until a gelatinous texture is reached', '4: In a large bowl add the ¾ cup quinoa, ⅓ cup pumpkin seeds, ⅓ cup sesame seeds, salt, pepper, and ⅓ cup chia seed mixture', '5: Transfer the mixture onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet with spatula', '6: Spread into an even layer', '7: Bake for 30 minutes', '8: Remove from oven then cut into desired cracker shapes', '9: Carefully flip each cracker', '10: Bake for 25 minutes', '11: Remove and allow to cool for 10 minutes', '12: Store in an airtight container for up to one month', '13: Add hummus, if desired']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon cooking oil', '1 teaspoon fenugreek', '½ teaspoon turmeric', '¼ teaspoon asafoetida', '1 teaspoon mustard seed', '12 leaves dried curry', '2 lb fresh king prawn (1 kg)', '1 cup coconut milk (200 mL)', '¼ cup water (50 mL)', 'salt to season', 'pepper to season', '1 lime juiced', 'Paste', '1 onion chopped', '1 red chili', '⅔ cup ginger (30 g)', '4 cloves garlic']
instructions: ['1: In a food processor, blitz the 1 onion, 1 red chili, ⅔ cup ginger and 4 cloves garlic together to make a paste', '2:  Set aside', '3: In a large pan, heat the 1 tablespoon cooking oil over a medium heat', '4: Add the 1 teaspoon fenugreek, ½ teaspoon turmeric, ¼ teaspoon asafoetida, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, and curry 12 leaves to the pan, and fry for a couple of minutes', '5: Add the paste and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes', '6: Add the prawns and ¼ cup water', '7:  Cook until they start to turn pink', '8: Pour in the 1 cup coconut milk, salt, pepper, and 1 lime juice, and cook for another few minutes', '9: Serve with parathas, naan bread, and rice']

ingredients: ['4 hot dogs', '4 thin slices of cheddar cheese room temperature', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '1 cup yellow cornmeal (140 g)', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '4 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 egg', '1 jalapeño minced', '1 qt peanut or vegetable oil (960 mL) for frying', 'mustard for serving', 'Special Equipment', 'wooden skewer', 'Preparation', '4 hot dogs', '4 thin slices of cheddar cheese room temperature', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '1 cup yellow cornmeal (140 g)', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '4 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 egg', '1 jalapeño minced', '1 qt peanut or vegetable oil (960 mL) for frying', 'mustard for serving', 'Special Equipment', 'wooden skewer', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Place a hot dog on a slice of cheese, then roll the cheese slice around it', '2:  Push a wooden skewer through the cheese-wrapped hot dog, then place seam side down on a baking sheet', '3:  Repeat with the remaining hot dogs', '4:  Freeze for 20 minutes', '5: In a large bowl, add the dry ingredients and stir to combine', '6:  Once fully combined, mix in the milk, egg, and jalapeño', '7:  Stir until the batter is smooth and without lumps', '8:  You may need to add 1 or 2 tablespoon of flour; the batter should be thick enough to cling to the hot dog', '9:  Pour it into a tall glass for easier dipping', '10: Heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°F (180°C)', '11: Holding the tip of the skewer, take a frozen hot dog and dip it fully into the batter, lifting it out, then rotating it to let excess batter drip off', '12:  Using tongs, carefully place the battered dog into the hot oil', '13:  Hold it fully submerged for 30-60 seconds until a crust forms, then rotate it so that it fries evenly', '14:  Cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown', '15:  Repeat with the remaining hot dogs', '16:  Serve with mustard for dipping']

ingredients: ['4 boneless skinless chicken thighs', '½ cup Frank’s RedHot® Buffalo Sauce (120 mL) divided plus 3 tablespoons', 'Buttermilk Blue Cheese Dressing', '½ cup full-fat greek yogurt (145 g)', '¼ cup mayonnaise (60 g)', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '⅓ cup buttermilk (80 mL)', '2 tablespoons fresh chives thinly sliced', '4 oz crumbled blue cheese (450 g)', '½ teaspoon kosher salt plus more taste', '1 pinch freshly ground black pepper', 'For Serving', '1 large head romaine lettuce chopped', '3 celeries thinly sliced leaves reserved for garnish', '3 medium carrots peeled and thinly sliced', '1 cup grape tomato (200 g) halved', '1 oz crumbled blue cheese (30 g)', 'fresh chive thinly sliced', 'fresh dill chopped']
instructions: ['1: In a 3 medium bowl, combine the 4 boneless skinless chicken thighs and ½ cup (120 ml) Frank’s RedHot® Buffalo sauce', '2:  Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, up to 2 hours', '3: Make the buttermilk blue cheese dressing: In a 3 medium bowl, whisk together the yogurt, mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, buttermilk, and chives', '4:  Whisk to incorporate before folding in the bleu cheese and seasoning with ½ teaspoon kosher salt and 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper', '5:  Cover and chill until ready to use', '6:  The dressing will keep in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 5 days', '7: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '8:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '9: Transfer the 4 boneless skinless chicken to the prepared baking sheet', '10:  Bake for 25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C)', '11:  Remove from the oven and let sit until cool enough to handle', '12: Cut 4 boneless skinless chicken into cubes and toss with the remaining 3 ½ cup Frank’s RedHot® Buffalo Sauce (120 mL) divided plus 3 2 tablespoons of Frank’s RedHot® Buffalo Sauce', '13: Assemble the salads: Add ½ cup (55 G) of the bleu cheese dressing to the 1 large head romaine lettuce and toss to coat', '14:   Divide the 1 large head romaine lettuce in between 4 bowls', '15:  Top with the 4 boneless skinless chicken, celery, carrots, and tomatoes', '16:  Drizzle the remaining bleu cheese dressing on top', '17:  Garnish with the crumbled bleu cheese, chives, and fresh dill', '18:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['raspberry sliced in half', 'blueberry', 'fresh mint chopped or torn', 'water', 'Preparation', 'raspberry sliced in half', 'blueberry', 'fresh mint chopped or torn', 'water', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Fill each compartment of an ice cube tray with 2-3 raspberry slices, a few sprigs of mint, and 2-3 blueberries each', '2: Fill each to rim with water and freeze', '3: When ready to use, fill glass with however many cubes you’d like, and add your favorite beverage', '4: Serve, feel fancy, and enjoy!']

ingredients: ['1 large leek rinsed well cut into ½-inch (1.24 cm) thick half-moons', '1 large parsnip peeled and chopped into ½-inch (1.24 cm) pieces', '1 cup acorn squash (205 g) peeled and chopped into ½-inch (1.24 cm) pieces', '½ cup small brussels sprouts (50 g) quartered', '1 large purple carrot chopped into ½-inch (1.24 cm) pieces', '4 tablespoons olive oil divided', '1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaf', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '¾ cup crumbled goat cheese (95 g) divided', '1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', '2 garlic cloves minced', '1 box frozen pie dough (2 sheets) thawed', '1 large egg', '1 tablespoon water', '2 sprigs fresh rosemary']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: On the prepared baking sheet, toss the leek, parsnip, squash, Brussels sprouts, and carrot with 2 4 tablespoons olive oil, the thyme, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, and ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper until well coated', '4:  Spread in an even layer', '5: Roast the vegetables for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until they are browned', '6: Transfer the roasted vegetables to a large bowl and add ½ cup (60 G) crumbled goat cheese, the balsamic vinegar, and 2 garlic, and toss a few times to combine', '7: Cut out a 9-inch circle from each sheet of 1 large parsnip peeled and chopped into ½-inch (1', '8: 24 cm) 1 cup acorn squash (205 g) peeled and chopped into ½-inch (1', '9: 24 cm) 1 large purple carrot chopped into ½-inch (1', '10: 24 cm) 1 box frozen pie dough, rolling out the dough slightly if needed', '11:  Place the dough circles on a baking sheet lined with a clean sheet of parchment', '12: Pile the roasted vegetables in the centers of the dough circles, dividing evenly, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges', '13:  Fold the edges of the dough up and around the vegetables, pleating as needed', '14:  Sprinkle each tart with 2 4 tablespoons of the remaining goat cheese', '15: In a small bowl, whisk together the egg and water', '16:  Brush a thin layer egg wash over the dough', '17: Bake the tarts for 20–25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and cooked through', '18: Let the tarts rest for 5 minutes, then drizzle each with 1 tablespoon of the remaining olive oil and top with a sprig of 2 sprigs fresh rosemary', '19: Serve the tarts with Caramel Frappuccinos']

ingredients: ['Shrimp', '1 lb medium shrimp (455 g) peeled and deveined', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '4 large eggs', '1 ½ cups soda water (360 mL) cold', '2 cups cake flour (200 g)', 'oil for frying', '3 cups panko bread crumbs (150 g)', 'Glaze', '1 tablespoon oil', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon ginger minced', '1 cup soy sauce (240 mL)', '2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', '⅓ cup light brown sugar (75 g)', '1 pinch red pepper flakes', '¼ cup water (60 mL)', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', 'For Serving', 'white rice cooked', 'scallion thinly sliced', 'sesame seed']
instructions: ['1: Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels, then transfer to a 1 lb medium bowl and season with salt and 1 pinch 1 pinch red pepper', '2: In a separate 1 lb medium bowl, whisk the eggs and 1 ½ cups soda 1 ½ cups soda ¼ cup water until combined', '3:  Add the 2 cups cake flour and gently whisk, making sure the batter is still clumpy', '4:  Do not overmix', '5: Heat the oil in a 4 large pot until it reaches 350˚F (180˚C)', '6: Add the 3 cups panko bread crumbs to a shallow bowl', '7: Using a slotted spoon, dip the shrimp in the tempura batter, then toss in the 3 cups panko, making sure to fully coat', '8: Fry the shrimp in the hot oil, 5-6 at a time, until golden ⅓ cup light brown, about 2-3 minutes', '9:  Transfer to a wire rack to drain', '10: Make the glaze: Heat the oil in a 1 lb medium saucepan over 1 lb medium-high heat', '11:  Add the 4 cloves garlic and 1 tablespoon ginger and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds, stirring frequently', '12: Add the 1 cup soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, ⅓ cup light brown sugar, and 1 pinch red 1 pinch 1 pinch red pepper flakes', '13:  Stir until the mixture begins to simmer', '14: In a small bowl, combine the 1 ½ cups soda ¼ cup water and 1 tablespoon cornstarch', '15:  Add the 1 tablespoon cornstarch slurry to the saucepan and stir to combine', '16:  Cook until the glaze is 1 pinch reduced by half and looks thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes', '17: Transfer the shrimp to a 4 large bowl and pour the glaze over', '18:  Toss the shrimp gently to coat with the glaze', '19: Serve the shrimp over rice and garnish with scallions']

ingredients: ['1 chicken breast', '1 cup seasoned bread crumbs (120 g)', '1 cup BBQ sauce (290 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Slice the 1 chicken into even strips', '3: Dip the 1 chicken strips into the BBQ 1 cup BBQ sauce, then coat them in the 1 cup seasoned bread crumbs', '4: Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes', '5: Brush the remaining BBQ 1 cup BBQ sauce evenly on both sides of the 1 chicken strips and bake for another 10 minutes and serve']

ingredients: ['1 small fennel bulb', '3 blood oranges', '3 cara cara oranges', '1 grapefruit', '1 tablespoon fresh mint torn', 'kosher salt to taste', 'olive oil to taste', '½ cup uncooked farro (50 g) rinsed', '1 ½ cups water (360 mL)', '¼ cup pistachio (30 g)', 'Honey Tarragon Dressing', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 tablespoon honey', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 tablespoon fresh tarragon finely chopped', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Trim the fronds and stalks off of the fennel bulb', '2:  Cut the bulb in half crosswise, remove the core, then thinly slice', '3:  Add the sliced fennel to a medium bowl and set aside', '4: Slice off the top and bottom of a 3 blood orange so it sits flat on your cutting board', '5:  Carefully cut off the peel and pith in downward strips around the orange, removing as little fruit as possible', '6:  Carefully cut between the membranes to remove the segments', '7:  Repeat with the rest of the 3 blood oranges, the Cara Cara oranges, and the 1 grapefruit', '8: Add the citrus segments to the bowl with the fennel, along with the 1 tablespoon fresh mint', '9:  Season with salt and toss to combine', '10:  Set aside while you make the dressing and ½ cup uncooked farro', '11: Make the dressing: In a medium bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, 1 tablespoon honey, salt, and 1 tablespoon fresh tarragon', '12:  Add the olive oil, a bit at a time, and whisk until fully incorporated', '13:  Set aside', '14: Heat a bit of olive oil in a 1 small pot over medium heat', '15:  Add the ½ cup uncooked farro and toast until just slightly golden brown', '16:  Pour in the 1 ½ cups water and bring to a boil', '17:  Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, until the ½ cup uncooked farro is tender and has absorbed the 1 ½ cups water', '18: Add 2 2 tablespoons of the 1 tablespoon honey 1 tablespoon fresh tarragon dressing to the warm ½ cup uncooked farro and toss well', '19: In a 1 small pan over medium heat, toast the pistachios until slightly brown and aromatic', '20: Divide the citrus fennel mixture between serving bowls and top with the ½ cup uncooked farro and pistachios', '21:  Add more dressing to taste, if desired', '22: Enjoy!Nutrition - Salad, with dressing - Calories: 415, Total fat:  15 grams, Sodium: 429 mg, Total carbs: 70 grams, Dietary fiber: 11 grams, Sugars: 33 grams, Protein: 6 grams']

ingredients: ['1 sweet potato', 'ricotta cheese to taste', '2 slices pear', 'honey to taste', 'Preparation', '1 sweet potato', 'ricotta cheese to taste', '2 slices pear', 'honey to taste', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick', '2: Place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time', '3:  When it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time', '4:  Depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that', '5: Remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle', '6: Spread ricotta evenly across sweet potato toast', '7: Slice pear thinly and place on top of ricotta', '8:  Drizzle with honey']

ingredients: ['Pumpkin Juice', '30 oz unsweetened pumpkin puree (895 g)', '30 oz water (895 g)', 'Spiced Syrup', '1 cup sugar (200 g)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '4 whole cinnamon sticks', '3 whole nutmeg pods split in half', 'Spiced Pumpkin Juice', '¾ cup apricot juice (180 mL)', '¾ cup apple juice (180 mL)', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', '1 teaspoon freshly grated cinnamon']
instructions: ['1: Make the pumpkin juice: In a medium pot, combine the pumpkin purée and water', '2:  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then remove the pot from the heat', '3:  Strain through a cheesecloth into a large jar or container', '4:  Cover and transfer to the refrigerator to chill for about 30 minutes', '5:  You should have about 4 cups', '6: Make the spiced syrup: In a small saucepan, combine the sugar, water, 4 whole 1 teaspoon freshly grated cinnamon sticks, and 3 whole 1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg pods', '7:  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves and the syrup thickens, 3–4 minutes', '8:  Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use, up to 1 month', '9: Make the juice: In a large pitcher, combine the pumpkin juice, apricot juice, apple juice, ½ cup of the spiced syrup, the 1 tablespoon lime juice, grated 3 whole 1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg, and grated 4 whole 1 teaspoon freshly grated cinnamon', '10:  Mix well to combine', '11:  Serve chilled']

ingredients: ['French Toast', '4 eggs', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 tablespoon vanilla', '1 tablespoon cinnamon', '1 tablespoon butter', '4 slices bread', 'Cream Cheese Mixture', '4 oz cream cheese (115 g)', '¼ cup heavy cream (60 mL)', '¼ cup powdered sugar (40 g) plus extra for garnish', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '1 teaspoon nutmeg', '2 teaspoons vanilla']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, whisk together the 4 eggs, 1 cup milk, vanilla, and cinnamon', '2: Melt the 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat', '3: Dunk 2 4 slices of bread at a time in the egg mixture', '4: In medium bowl mix 4 oz ¼ cup ¼ cup heavy cream cheese, ¼ cup heavy 4 oz ¼ cup ¼ cup heavy cream, ¼ cup powdered sugar, cinnamon, 1 teaspoon nutmeg and vanilla', '5: Stack and drizzle with 4 oz ¼ cup ¼ cup heavy cream cheese mixture']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 small yellow onion finely chopped', '3 celery stalks finely chopped', '1 medium orange bell pepper seeded and finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic minced', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 ½ teaspoons Old Bay® seasoning', '3 cups crumbled herb stuffing (600 g)', '3 cups cornbread stuffing cubes (600 g)', '¼ cup mayonnaise (60 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh parsley divided', '3 green onions finely chopped', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 ¼ cups chicken stock (360 mL)', '1 lb Kroger® Golden King Crab legs (425 g) meat removed and shells discarded', '½ lb raw shrimp (225 g) peeled deveined and cut into bite-sized pieces', 'Preparation', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 small yellow onion finely chopped', '3 celery stalks finely chopped', '1 medium orange bell pepper seeded and finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic minced', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 ½ teaspoons Old Bay® seasoning', '3 cups crumbled herb stuffing (600 g)', '3 cups cornbread stuffing cubes (600 g)', '¼ cup mayonnaise (60 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh parsley divided', '3 green onions finely chopped', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 ¼ cups chicken stock (360 mL)', '1 lb Kroger® Golden King Crab legs (425 g) meat removed and shells discarded', '½ lb raw shrimp (225 g) peeled deveined and cut into bite-sized pieces', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat', '3:  Add the onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes', '4: Add the salt and Old Bay seasoning and stir for another minute, until fragrant', '5:  Remove the pan from the heat', '6: Add the herb stuffing, cornbread stuffing cubes, sautéed vegetables, mayonnaise, 1½ tablespoons of parsley, the green onions, paprika, and chicken stock to a large bowl', '7:  Stir to combine', '8: Fold the crab and shrimp into the stuffing mixture', '9: Transfer the stuffing to a 9 x 11-inch baking dish and spread in an even layer', '10:  Sprinkle the remaining ½ tablespoon parsley evenly over the top', '11:  Cover with foil', '12: Bake the stuffing for 30 minutes, or until warmed through and the shrimp is fully cooked', '13: Remove from the oven and let cool for about 10 minutes before serving']

ingredients: ['Doughnuts', '1 ½ cups powdered milk (200 g)', '¾ cup flour (100 g)', '1 tablespoon semolina', '1 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '3 tablespoons butter melted', '1 ¼ cups milk (300 mL)', 'Syrup', '1 ½ cups sugar (300 g)', '1 cup water (200 mL)', 'saffron few strands', 'Garnish', 'almond toasted and chopped', 'pistachio toasted and chopped']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, mix the 1 ½ cups powdered 1 ½ cups powdered 1 ¼ cups milk, ¾ cup flour, 1 tablespoon semolina, 1 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 3 tablespoons butter, and 1 ½ cups powdered 1 ¼ cups milk until thoroughly combined', '2: Cover with plastic wrap and leave to rest for 15 minutes, until all the moisture is absorbed', '3: Take a golf ball-sized portion of dough and roll into a ball', '4:  Repeat with remaining dough', '5: In a deep pot, heat the sunflower oil until it reaches 360°F (160°C)', '6: Fry the doughnuts for about 4 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden brown on all sides', '7: Use a slotted spoon to transfer the fried doughnuts to a paper towel-lined plate', '8: Add the 1 ½ cups sugar, 1 cup water, and saffron to a saucepan over a medium heat, and stir', '9: Once the 1 ½ cups sugar has dissolved and is syrupy (about 5-7 minutes), add the doughnuts to the pan, stirring to coat in the syrup', '10: Let the doughnuts soak in the syrup for an hour', '11: Remove the doughnuts and garnish with the almonds and pistachios']

ingredients: ['Sage Simple Syrup', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '2 large fresh sage leaves', 'Cocktail', '1 cup ice (150 g)', '6 tablespoons pomegranate juice or tart cherry juice', '4 tablespoons mezcal', '2 tablespoons simple syrup', '1 tablespoon lime juice', 'dry ice', '2 fresh sage leaves', '1 cinnamon stick']
instructions: ['1: Make the sage 2 tablespoons simple syrup: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the ½ cup sugar, ½ cup water, and sage leaves', '2:  Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, for 3-5 minutes, until the ½ cup sugar is dissolved', '3:  Remove the pot from the heat and let cool for about 10 minutes', '4: Add the 1 cup dry ice to a cocktail shaker', '5:  Pour in the 6 tablespoons pomegranate juice, 4 tablespoons mezcal, 2 tablespoons simple syrup, and 1 tablespoon lime juice', '6:  Shake well', '7: Add the dry 1 cup dry ice to a lowball glass and pour the cocktail over the top', '8: Garnish with a 1 cinnamon stick and fresh sage leaf']

ingredients: ['Pesto', '2 cups fresh basil leaf loosely packed', '1 cup fresh parsley (40 g) loosely packed', '½ cup fresh chives (20 g) cut into 2 in (5 cm) pieces loosely packed', '¼ cup pine nuts (30 g)', '1 small garlic clove', '2 ½ tablespoons lemon juice', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', 'Zucchini Pasta Salad', '½ cup vegetable oil (120 mL)', '2 Walmart Zucchinis medium sliced in 1/4 in (6 mm) in rounds', '1 cup spinach (40 g) roughly chopped loosely packed', '1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', '1 lb penne pasta (425 g) cooked according to package instructions drained and still warm', '1 medium lemon', '1 ½ tablespoons caper', '6 oz fresh mozzarella cheese (180 g) torn into bite-size pieces', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', '¼ cup fresh basil (10 g) torn']
