ingredients: ['Strawberry Jam', '2 ½ cups frozen strawberry (375 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL) plus 2 tablespoons', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Raspberry Jam', '2 cups frozen raspberry', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey or to taste', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Blackberry Jam', '2 cups frozen blackberry (300 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey or to taste', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Preparation', 'Strawberry Jam', '2 ½ cups frozen strawberry (375 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL) plus 2 tablespoons', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Raspberry Jam', '2 cups frozen raspberry', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey or to taste', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Blackberry Jam', '2 cups frozen blackberry (300 g)', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '3 tablespoons chia seeds', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons honey or to taste', '1 pinch kosher salt', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Combine the berries and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat', '2:  Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring frequently, until the fruit is broken down and the mixture is saucy', '3: Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the chia seeds, lemon juice, honey (start with a small amount and add more as needed, depending on how sweet the fruit is), and salt', '4: Let sit for 10 minutes to allow the chia seeds to hydrate and thicken the jam', '5: Then transfer to a resealable jar', '6:  The jam will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 month']

ingredients: ['12 lasagna noodles', '2 cups ricotta cheese (500 g)', '1 cup spinach (40 g)', '1 cup artichoke heart (170 g) chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 cloves garlic minced', '2 cups marinara sauce (520 g)', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (100 g)', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (110 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', 'fresh parsley for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Boil the 12 lasagna noodles until they are soft but not fully cooked, for about 10 minutes', '2:  Drain and set aside', '3: In a sauté pan over medium heat, saute the 1 cup spinach with the 1 tablespoon olive oil and a pinch of 1 teaspoon salt', '4:  Set aside', '5: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '6: In a medium-sized bowl, mix the 2 cups ricotta, cooked 1 cup spinach, 1 cup artichoke heart (170 g) chopped artichokes, 2 cloves garlic, ½ of the 1 cup shredded mozzarella, ½ of the 1 cup shredded parmesan, 1 teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper', '7: Spoon some of the mixture onto the 12 lasagna noodle and roll tightly', '8: Spread the 2 cups marinara on the bottom of the baking dish', '9:  Place the 12 lasagna rolls right side up to fill the dish', '10: Top with the rest of the 1 cup shredded mozzarella and 1 cup shredded parmesan', '11: Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the cheese is brown and crispy', '12: Serve and top with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['Xawaash Spice Mix', '1 whole cinnamon stick', '½ cup whole cumin seeds (55 g)', '½ cup whole coriander seeds (40 g)', '2 tablespoons whole black peppercorn', '6 whole cardamom pods', '1 teaspoon whole clove', '2 teaspoons ground turmeric', 'Suugo Suqaar', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 small green bell pepper seeded and finely diced', '1 small red onion finely diced', '1 lb ground beef (425 g) 80/20', '1 teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 can tomato diced', 'For Serving', '1 lb spaghetti (425 g) cooked according to package instructions', 'fresh cilantro leaf minced', 'banana']
instructions: ['1: Make the xawaash spice mix: Place the 1 whole cinnamon stick in a small zip-top bag', '2:  Seal the bag and use a heavy skillet or rolling pin to smash the 1 whole cinnamon stick into smaller pieces', '3: Transfer the 1 whole cinnamon to a medium heavy-bottomed skillet and add the ½ cup whole cumin, ½ cup whole coriander, peppercorns, 6 whole cardamom, 2 cloves, and turmeric', '4:  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the spices are lightly toasted and very aromatic, about 2 minutes', '5:  Remove the pan from the heat and set aside to cool', '6: Once cooled, transfer the toasted spices to a clean spice grinder or mortar and pestle and grind into a fine powder', '7:  Sift the ground spices through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium airtight container', '8:  Grind any large pieces left behind in the sieve, then sift into the container', '9:  Cover and store in a cool, dark place until ready to use, up to 6 months', '10: Make the suugo suqaar: Heat the olive oil in a large, high-walled skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat', '11:  Once the oil is shimmering, add the garlic, bell pepper, and onion', '12:  Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables begin to soften, about 8 minutes', '13:  Add the beef, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, and 3 tablespoons of the Xawaash spice mixture, and cook, stirring occasionally to break up the beef, until the meat is browned, about 15 minutes', '14: Add the 2 tablespoons 1 can tomato paste and diced 2 tablespoons 1 can tomatoes', '15:  Fill the 2 tablespoons 1 can tomato can halfway with water and add to the pan', '16:  Stir well to combine, being sure to scrape up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pan', '17:  Increase the heat to high and bring the sauce to a boil, then decrease the heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes, until the sauce is thickened and the beef is tender', '18:  Season with more 1 teaspoon kosher salt to taste', '19: Serve the sauce hot over 1 lb spaghetti, garnished with cilantro', '20:  Serve with fresh banana', '21:  Any leftover sauce will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days', '22:  Rewarm in a heavy pot over low heat']

ingredients: ['12 oz strawberry (340 g) quartered', '12 oz raspberry (340 g)', '12 oz blueberry (340 g)', '8 oz blackberry (225 g)', '3 cups watermelon (455 g) cubed', 'Dressing', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon maple syrup']
instructions: ['1: Combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl', '2: Mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well']

ingredients: ['Cereal Milk', '1 cup Lucky Charms™ Cereal (125 g)', '1 ½ cups whole milk (360 mL)', 'Cupcakes', '1 ¾ cups cake flour (215 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '1 cup granulated sugar (200 g)', '2 large eggs room temperature', '⅓ cup sour cream (80 g) room temperature', '2 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', 'Cereal Milk Buttercream', '¼ cup all purpose flour (30 g)', '¼ cup granulated sugar (50 g) plus 3 tablespoons', '1 pinch kosher salt', '1 ½ sticks unsalted butter room temperature', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'Toppings', '½ cup Lucky Charms™ Marshmallows (30 g)', '2 sheets edible gold leaf']
instructions: ['1: Make the cereal 1 ½ cups whole milk: Separate the marshmallows and cereal from the Lucky Charms™ and set the marshmallows aside for assembling the cupcakes', '2: Add the cereal and 1 ½ cups whole milk to a 2 large liquid measuring cup', '3:  Let the cereal soak for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally', '4:  Drain the cereal 1 ½ cups whole milk through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean liquid measuring cup', '5:  Discard the cereal and set the cereal 1 ½ cups whole milk aside', '6: Make the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '7:  Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners', '8: In a medium bowl, whisk together the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and salt', '9: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium speed for about 3 minutes, or until light and fluffy', '10: Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating between each addition until incorporated', '11:  Add the sour cream and vanilla, and beat until combined', '12: With the mixer running on low speed, alternate additions of the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour mixture and ¾ cup of the cereal 1 ½ cups whole milk until incorporated', '13:  Do not overmix', '14: Fill each cupcake liner with the batter to about ⅔ of the way full', '15:  Bake for 18–20 minutes, or until the tops of the cupcakes feel springy to the touch', '16:  Remove from the oven and let cool completely', '17: While the cupcakes are cooling, make the buttercream: Add the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour and remaining ¾ cup cereal 1 ½ cups whole milk to a small saucepan and whisk until all of the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour is incorporated', '18:  Place the saucepan over medium heat', '19:  Cook, whisking continuously, for about 2 minutes, or until thickened', '20:  Immediately remove the pot from the heat and add the sugar and salt', '21:  Stir until the sugar has completely dissolved; the mixture will thin out after the sugar is added', '22: Transfer the mixture into a shallow dish and cover with plastic wrap, pressing directly against the surface to prevent a skin from forming', '23:  Transfer to the refrigerator for about 1 hour, until cool, but not fully chilled', '24: Once the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour mixture has cooled, beat the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes', '25:  Slowly add the 1 ¾ cups cake ¼ cup all purpose flour mixture, 1 spoonful at a time, until completely incorporated', '26:  Add the vanilla, then increase the mixer speed to medium-high and whip until the frosting is light and fluffy', '27:  (It should hold its shape on the whisk', '28: ) If the frosting is too runny, chill the bowl for 30 minutes before whipping again', '29:  If it is too thick and chunky, let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes before whipping again', '30:  Transfer the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a 2 large open star tip', '31: Assemble the cupcakes: Cut out the center of each cupcake and fill each with 5–6 Lucky Charms™ Marshmallows', '32:  Pipe the buttercream in a swirl on top of each cupcake', '33:  Crush some of the remaining marshmallows between your fingertips and sprinkle on top of the cupcakes', '34:  Use a small, food-safe brush to apply small bits of 2 sheets edible gold leaf to the tops of the cupcakes, then place a whole marshmallow atop each cupcake', '35: Serve the cupcakes at room temperature', '36:  Leftover cupcakes will keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days']

ingredients: ['3 cups carrot (450 g) hand-grated', '2 ½ cups all-purpose flour (310 g) plus 1 tablespoon divided ', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon allspice', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 cup light brown sugar (200 g) packed', '½ cup granulated sugar (100 g)', '3 large eggs room temperature', '1 cup vegetable oil (240 mL)', '1 cup raisin (150 g)', '1 cup crushed pineapple (225 g) canned', 'Icing', '1 cup unsalted butter (225 g) (2 sticks) room temperature', '12 oz cream cheese (340 g) room temperature', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '2 cups powdered sugar (240 g)', '2 cups walnuts (200 g) crushed']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2:  Grease 3 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans and line with parchment paper', '3: Grate the carrots on the small holes of a box grater', '4:  Set aside', '5: In a 3 large bowl, sift together 2½ cups (310 G) of flour, the 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon allspice, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, baking powder, and baking soda', '6:  Whisk together', '7: In a separate 3 large bowl, beat the brown sugar, granulated sugar, and eggs together with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until just combined', '8: With the mixer running, gradually pour in the vegetable oil', '9: With the mixer on medium-low speed, add ⅓ of the flour mixture at a time to the wet ingredients', '10:  Beat just to incorporate', '11:  Stop mixing when there is just a small amount of flour visible', '12: In a small bowl, toss the raisins with the remaining tablespoon of flour', '13: Add the raisin, grated carrots, and pineapple to the batter and fold to incorporate with a rubber spatula', '14: Divide the cake batter evenly between the prepared pans and smooth the tops', '15: Bake for 25-30 minutes, until a fork inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean', '16: Cool the cakes on a wire rack until the pans are cool to the touch', '17:  Remove the cakes from the pans and let cool completely on the rack', '18: Make the icing: In a 3 large bowl, beat together the butter, 12 oz cream cheese, and 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla with an electric hand mixer on medium-low speed', '19:  Once combined, mix on medium-high speed for 30 seconds, until light and fluffy', '20: Add the powdered sugar, ½ cup (60 G) at a time, beating on medium-low speed to incorporate each addition', '21: Assemble the cake: Check to see if the top of each cake is flat', '22:  If not, use a serrated knife level off the cakes', '23: Place 1 cake layer on a serving platter or cake stand', '24:  Spoon ¼ of the icing on top and spread in an even layer', '25:  Add another layer of cake and spread with another ¼ of the icing', '26:  Set the last cake layer on top with the bottom up to ensure a very flat surface', '27:  Spread the rest of the icing over the top and sides', '28: Gently press the walnuts into the icing around the sides of the cake', '29: Chill for 30-60 minutes to let the icing set, then slice and serve']

ingredients: ['32 oz biscuit dough (905 g) 2 cans', '1 lb brie cheese (455 g) cubed', '14 oz cranberry sauce (395 mg) 1 can', '1 teaspoon fresh thyme', '1 teaspoon fresh rosemary']
instructions: ['1: Cut 1 lb brie into cubes', '2:  Open 32 oz biscuit dough and separate into individual 32 oz biscuit pieces', '3:  Using your hands (or a knife for extra precision), tear each piece of 32 oz biscuit dough into 2-3 pieces', '4: Flatten the torn dough in the palm of your hand and place 1-2 pieces of 1 lb brie in the middle', '5:  Pinch dough around the cheese, then roll together until it forms a small ball with the cheese inside', '6:  Repeat until all of the dough and cheese have been rolled together', '7: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '8: Place cheese-filled doughballs into a standard bundt pan that has been generously coated with nonstick spray, spacing them out evenly', '9:  Once a layer of dough has been placed into the pan, sprinkle generously with ⅓ of the 1 teaspoon fresh thyme and 1 teaspoon fresh rosemary', '10: After the sprinkling of herbs, spoon in about ⅓ of the can of 14 oz cranberry sauce', '11:  Repeat this (dough, herbs, sauce) pattern until all of the ingredients have been layered evenly in the pan', '12: Bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes', '13:  Loaf should be fragrant with cheese and 14 oz cranberry sauce should be bubbling on top when removed', '14: Let cool for 10 minutes before covering and inverting the bread onto a large serving dish']

ingredients: ['Charred Vegetable Salad', '2 zucchinis halved lengthwise and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) half moons', '1 yellow bell pepper seeded and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces', '1 red onion quartered root left intact', '2 ears corn husked', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '3 cups baby arugula (120 g)', '1 cup cherry tomato (200 g) halved', '½ cup crumbled goat cheese (55 g)', 'Lemon Basil Dressing', '½ cup extra virgin olive oil (120 mL)', '¼ cup fresh lemon juice (60 mL)', '½ cup fresh basil leaves (20 g)', '1 tablespoon honey', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 small clove garlic peeled']
instructions: ['1: Char the vegetables: Arrange an oven rack in the top third of the oven', '2:  Turn the oven to high broil', '3: On a rimmed baking sheet, arrange the zucchini, 1 yellow bell pepper, 1 red onion, and 2 ears corn', '4:  Drizzle with the olive oil and season with the salt and pepper', '5: Broil the vegetables for 8–10 minutes, until softened and nicely charred in spots', '6:  Remove from the oven and let vegetables cool enough to handle, about 20 minutes', '7: While the vegetables cool, make the dressing: In a blender or food processor, combine the olive oil, ¼ cup fresh lemon juice, ½ cup fresh basil, 1 tablespoon honey, pepper, salt, and garlic and blend until fully combined and bright green in color', '8:  Transfer to a bowl or jar, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use', '9:  The dressing will keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 days', '10: Once the vegetables have cooled, 2 zucchinis halved lengthwise and 1 yellow 1 yellow bell pepper seeded and cut the 2 ears corn kernels from the cobs and 2 zucchinis halved lengthwise and 1 yellow 1 yellow bell pepper seeded and cut the onion quarters into 1 small pieces', '11:  Add to a large bowl with the remaining charred vegetables and the 3 cups baby arugula, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, and ½ cup crumbled goat cheese', '12:  Drizzle with several spoonfuls of the dressing and toss well', '13: Serve the salad with the remaining dressing alongside']

ingredients: ['3 boneless skinless chicken breasts cubed', 'Marinade', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 g)', '2 tablespoons orange juice', '¼ cup cornstarch (30 g)', 'Sauce', '2 tablespoons oil', '¾ cup orange juice (180 mL)', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', '1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 tablespoon cornstarch']
instructions: ['1: Slice 3 boneless skinless chicken breast into cubes', '2: In a bowl, combine marinade ingredients', '3:  Add 3 boneless skinless chicken and stir to coat', '4: Let marinate at least 1 hour', '5: In a pan, heat 2 tablespoons oil on medium-high heat', '6:  Remove 3 boneless skinless chicken from marinade with a slotted spoon, and cook all sides until golden 2 tablespoons brown, about 5 minutes', '7: Add sauce ingredients to pan and bring to a boil, mixing continuously, until mixture thickens, about 5 minutes', '8: Serve over 1 tablespoon rice if desired']

ingredients: ['9 oz swiss cheese (255 g) grated', '9 oz gruyère cheese (255 g) grated', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 clove garlic', '¾ cup white wine (180 g)', '½ lemon juiced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Dipping Options', 'vegetable', '1 cup bread cubes (35 g)', '12 oz cured meat (340 g)', 'assorted fruit']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, toss the Swiss and Gruyère cheeses with the 1 tablespoon cornstarch', '2: Smash the garlic 1 clove, but leave it whole', '3: Add the cheese, ¾ cup white wine, ½ lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper to the slow cooker', '4: Cover, turn the slow cooker on high, and cook for 15 minutes', '5:  Remove the garlic and stir', '6:  Cover again and cook for 45 minutes more on high, stirring every 15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and smooth', '7:  Be careful not to overcook or the fondue will seize', '8: Turn the slow cooker to warm and serve the fondue with your favorite items for dipping']

ingredients: ['3 egg whites room temperature', '¼ cup granulated sugar (50 g)', '1 ¾ cups powdered sugar (210 g)', '1 cup superfine almond flour (100 g)', '3 drops red food coloring', 'Filling', '8 oz cream cheese (225 g) softened', '1 cup powdered sugar (120 g)', '2 tablespoons milk', 'strawberry jam']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, beat the 3 egg whites until frothy', '2:  Keep beating and slowly add the ¼ cup granulated 1 ¾ cups powdered 1 cup powdered sugar until stiff peaks form', '3:  Sift the powdered ¼ cup granulated 1 ¾ cups powdered 1 cup powdered sugar and 1 cup superfine almond flour over the 3 egg whites', '4:  Fold the dry mixture into the 3 egg whites, giving the bowl a quarter turn every third fold', '5:  Once the batter reaches a lava-like consistency, transfer half to another bowl and add the 3 drops red food coloring', '6:  Mix until just combined', '7:  Do not overmix!Working quickly, put the white and pink batters into separate small zip-top bags', '8:  Cut a corner off of each bag and squeeze the 2 batters evenly into a larger gallon-size bag or piping bag to create a multicolor effect', '9: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '10:  (Tip: use a little batter to “glue” down the edges of the parchment paper so it stays put)', '11:  In a circular motion, pipe 1½-inch (4-cm) dollops onto the baking sheet', '12:  Lift the baking sheet and gently tap on the counter to settle the batter', '13:  Let the cookies rest for 1 hour, until they are no longer wet to the touch and a skin forms on top', '14: Preheat the oven to 285ºF (140ºC)', '15: Make the filling by mixing the 8 oz cream cheese, powdered ¼ cup granulated 1 ¾ cups powdered 1 cup powdered sugar, and 2 tablespoons milk in a medium bowl until smooth', '16:  Transfer to a piping bag and set aside until ready to fill the cookies', '17: When the cookies are dry to the touch, bake for 13-15 minutes, until they have risen', '18:  Let them cool for 10 minutes', '19:  To fill, pipe a circle of the 8 oz cream cheese mixture around the edge of 1 cookie and place a small dollop of strawberry jam in the center', '20:  Sandwich with another cookie', '21:  Macarons are best kept refrigerated until serving']

ingredients: ['3 cups chicken stock', '1 pinch saffron thread', '½ lb shrimp (225 g) peeled and deveined', '2 teaspoons kosher salt divided', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ½ cups chorizo (205 g) thinly sliced', '1 medium yellow onion finely chopped ', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 ½ cups arborio rice (300 g)', '14 ½ oz diced tomato (410 g) 1 can drained', '½ lb mussels (225 g) scrubbed and debearded', '½ cup frozen peas (75 g) thawed', '½ lemon juiced', '¼ cup fresh parsley leaves (10 g) finely chopped']
instructions: ['1: Add the 3 cups chicken stock to a microwave-safe liquid measuring cup and microwave on high power for 3 minutes, until hot', '2:  Stir in the 1 pinch saffron threads and set aside', '3: On a cutting board, pat the ½ lb shrimp dry with paper towels', '4:  Season with 1 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons kosher salt and the pepper on both sides and set aside', '5: Heat the 2 tablespoons olive oil in a 12-inch (30 cm) cast-iron skillet over 1 medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer', '6:  Add the 1 ½ cups chorizo and cook, stirring, until browned in spots, 3 minutes', '7:  Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes', '8:  Add the 3 cloves garlic and paprika and cook, stirring, until aromatic, about 30 seconds', '9:  Add the 1 ½ cups arborio rice and stir until lightly toasted, 1 minute', '10: Add the tomatoes and reserved 3 cups chicken stock and stir to combine', '11:  Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid', '12:  Cook without stirring until the 1 ½ cups arborio rice is al dente, 15 minutes', '13: Remove the lid and arrange the ½ lb shrimp, ½ lb mussels, and peas on top of the 1 ½ cups arborio rice', '14:  Cover and increase the heat to 1 medium-high', '15:  Cook until the ½ lb shrimp are opaque and the ½ lb mussels are open, 5 minutes', '16:  Discard any ½ lb mussels that do not open', '17: Remove the lid and pour the ½ lemon juice over the paella', '18:  Sprinkle with the remaining teaspoon of 2 teaspoons kosher salt and the parsley and serve']

ingredients: ['8 clementines', '2 cups calvados (480 mL)', '8 cups apple juice (1.9 L)', '½ cup dark brown sugar (100 g)', '1 tablespoon whole cardamom pods', '8 cinnamon sticks', '8 whole star anises', '1 teaspoon whole clove']
instructions: ['1: Using a vegetable peeler, peel the skins from the 8 clementines, making sure not to include any of the white pith', '2:  Set the peels aside', '3:  Cut each clementine in half crosswise and juice', '4: In a medium pot over medium-low heat, combine the clementine peels and juice, 2 cups calvados, 8 cups apple juice, ½ cup dark brown sugar, 1 tablespoon whole cardamom pods, 8 cinnamon sticks, 8 whole star anise pods, and cloves', '5:  Simmer for 20–25 minutes, without letting the mixture come to a boil', '6:  Remove the pot from the heat', '7: Ladle the cocktail into mugs and serve warm']

ingredients: ['1 block camembert cheese', 'salt to taste', '1 teaspoon dried thyme to taste', '1 teaspoon dried rosemary to taste', 'Dough Balls', '3 ⅓ cups bread flour (400 g) plus extra for dusting', '2 teaspoons instant dry yeast', 'salt to taste', '1 cup warm water (250 mL)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'Garlic Butter', '¼ cup butter (50 g) melted', '4 cloves garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', 'Garnish', 'pomegranate seed', '1 tablespoon fresh rosemary']
instructions: ['1: For the dough balls, mix together the 3 ⅓ cups bread flour, 2 teaspoons instant dry yeast, and salt in a large bowl', '2: Make a well in the middle and pour in the 1 cup warm water plus 1 tablespoon of the 2 tablespoons olive oil', '3: Knead the dough for 7-8 minutes until springy to the touch and a smooth soft dough has formed', '4: Wipe a bowl with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, place the dough inside and cover with cling film', '5: Leave to rest for 1 hour', '6: On a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper, place the lid of the 1 block camembert in the middle', '7: Roll the dough into balls and dot around the lid to make a wreath-shape', '8: Cover and leave to rest for 30 minutes', '9: Pre-heat the oven to 180°C (350°F)', '10: Mix the ¼ cup butter, 4 cloves garlic, and parsley together and coat over the dough balls', '11: Sprinkle on some salt over the dough balls', '12:  Replace the lid with the 1 block camembert and sprinkle the 1 teaspoon dried 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary and 1 teaspoon dried thyme over the 1 block camembert', '13: Bake for 15 minutes', '14: Garnish with the pomegranate seeds and 1 teaspoon dried 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary sprigs']

ingredients: ['2 cups mango (330 g) cubed', '½ cup strawberry (75 g) sliced', '½ cup orange juice (120 mL)', '1 lime lime juice', '1 ½ cups sparkling water (360 mL)', 'ice cube']
instructions: ['1: Place ½ cup orange juice, 2 cups mango, strawberries, and 1 lime juice in a blender, and blend until smooth', '2: Turn off blender before stirring in 1 ½ cups sparkling water', '3: Serve over ice']

ingredients: ['8 medium potatoes peeled cut into medium-sized chunks', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 cup ham (150 g) chopped into small pieces', '¾ cup cheese (75 g) chopped into small pieces', '½ green onion chopped ', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 tablespoon milk', '1 cup flour (125 g)', '4 eggs beaten', '2 cups panko breadcrumbs (100 g)', 'oil for frying', 'green cabbage shredded to serve', 'tonkatsu sauce to serve']
instructions: ['1: Heat water in a pot to a simmer, then add the 8 medium potatoes, 1 2 1 teaspoon 2 2 1 teaspoons salt, and stir', '2: Cover and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, until a fork can easily pierce the 8 medium potatoes', '3: Dry the 8 medium potatoes on a towel, allowing them to steam to remove excess moisture, then transfer to a large bowl', '4: Mash the 8 medium potatoes until no large chunks remain', '5: Add the 1 cup ham, ¾ cup cheese, onions, the other 2 1 teaspoon of 2 2 1 teaspoons salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon milk', '6: Mix until evenly incorporated', '7: Shape the potato mixture into 2-inch (3cm) discs', '8: Separate the 1 cup flour, 4 eggs, and bread crumbs into separate bowls', '9: Dredge the croquettes into the 1 cup flour, shaking off any excess, then dip them into the 4 eggs, and then coat them evenly in the bread crumbs', '10: Heat oil in a pot to 350°F (180°C)', '11: Fry 2-3 croquettes at a time until golden brown, then drain on a rack or paper towels with a sprinkle of 2 2 1 teaspoons salt', '12: Cool, then serve with the green cabbage and tonkatsu sauce!']

ingredients: ['2 lb yukon gold potato (905 g)', '½ cup whole milk (120 mL)', '½ cup heavy cream (120 mL)', '8 cloves garlic crushed', '½ cup unsalted butter (115 g) cubed cold', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', 'chive finely chopped for serving']
instructions: ['1: On a cutting board, peel the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes', '2:  Place the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes in a large bowl of cold water after peeling to avoid discoloration', '3: Cut the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes', '4: Add the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water', '5:  Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12 minutes', '6: In a small saucepan, bring the ½ cup whole milk, ½ cup heavy cream, and 8 cloves garlic to a simmer over low heat', '7: Remove the pot from the heat and strain the cream through a fine mesh sieve', '8: Drain the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes in a colander and transfer back to the pot', '9: Mash the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes with a 2 lb yukon gold potato masher, 2 lb yukon gold potato ricer, or by pushing through a fine mesh sieve with a spatula', '10: Add the cubed cold ½ cup unsalted butter and 2 teaspoons kosher salt', '11:  Stir to combine', '12: Gradually add the cream mixture to the 2 lb yukon gold potatoes, little by little, until fully incorporated', '13: Top with freshly ground black pepper and sprinkle with chives and serve']

ingredients: ['2 large eggplants', '1 teaspoon sea salt plus more to taste', 'olive oil to taste', '5 cloves garlic minced', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '28 oz crushed san marzano tomato (795 g) 2 can', '6 leaves fresh basil thinly sliced plus more for garnish', '1 large egg', '15 oz ricotta cheese (425 g) 1 container', '2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese (200 g) divided', '1 cup grated parmesan cheese (110 g) divided', '2 teaspoons italian seasoning']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Cut off the ends of the 2 large 1 large eggplant, then slice lengthwise about ⅛-inch (3-mm) thick', '3: Sprinkle the 2 large 1 large eggplant slices with sea salt on both sides and let sit for 10 minutes to draw out moisture', '4:  Pat dry with paper towels to remove excess liquid', '5: Lightly grease a griddle pan with olive oil and heat over medium heat', '6:  Grill the 2 large 1 large eggplant slices for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until grill marks are visible', '7:  Remove from the pan and set aside', '8: In a medium saucepan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium-low heat, then add the 5 cloves garlic and red pepper flakes', '9:  Sauté for about 3 minutes, until the 5 cloves garlic is fragrant but not browned', '10:  Add the 28 oz crushed tomatoes and 1 teaspoon of salt, stirring well to incorporate the 5 cloves garlic and red pepper', '11:  Simmer for 10 minutes, reducing the heat if the sauce begins to bubble too much', '12:  Add the basil and stir to combine', '13:  Remove from the heat and set aside', '14: In a medium bowl, beat the 2 large 1 large egg, then add the ricotta, 1½ 2 2 1 cups (150 g) of mozzarella, ¾ 2 1 cup (80 g) of Parmesan, and the Italian seasoning', '15:  Mix well to combine', '16: Assemble the lasagna', '17:  In a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish, add enough sauce to cover the bottom of the dish and spread in an even layer', '18:  Add a layer of 2 large 1 large eggplant slices, covering the bottom of the dish completely', '19:  It’s okay if the 2 large 1 large eggplant slices overlap slightly', '20:  Add a layer of the ricotta mixture and spread in a thin, even layer', '21:  Repeat with the remaining ingredients, finishing with a layer of sauce', '22:  Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan on top', '23: Bake for 45 minutes, until cheese is fully melted', '24: Turn the broiler on high and broil for 5 minutes, or until the cheese on top is browned and bubbly', '25: Remove the lasagna from the oven and let rest for 15-20 minutes before serving to give the lasagna time to set', '26: Serve garnished with 6 leaves fresh basil']

ingredients: ['16 oz cremini mushroom (455 g)', '3 tablespoons olive oil divided plus more as needed', '1 onion thinly sliced', '¼ cup vegetable broth (60 mL)', '3 cloves garlic minced', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme', '4 oz spinach (115 g)', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 sheet puff pastry sheet', 'flour for rolling out puff pastry', '2 medium potatoes thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon non-dairy milk', 'vegan gravy for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Add the 16 oz cremini mushrooms to a food processor and pulse until crumbly, 10-12 times', '3:  Be careful not to over-process', '4: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a 2 medium pan over 2 medium heat', '5:  Add the 1 onion and sauté for 3-5 minutes', '6:  Add the ¼ cup vegetable broth and sauté until the 1 onions are translucent and most of the broth has evaporated', '7: Add the 3 cloves garlic and sauté for 3 minutes more, or until fragrant', '8: Add the 16 oz cremini mushrooms and soy sauce and sauté until most of the liquid has released from the 16 oz cremini mushrooms and evaporated, 10-12 minutes', '9: Push the sautéed veggies to the sides of the pan and add a bit more olive oil to the center', '10:  Sauté the thyme in the oil until fragrant, then incorporate into the rest of mixture', '11: Add the 4 oz spinach and sauté until wilted', '12: Grease an 18 x 13-inch baking 1 sheet with nonstick spray', '13:  On a lightly floured surface, use a flour for rolling pin to roll out puff pastry 1 sheet to fit the baking 1 sheet', '14:  Transfer the puff pastry to the pan', '15: In center third of the pastry, add a layer of potato slices', '16:  Top with half of the 16 oz cremini mushroom mixture and spread in an even layer, about ¾-inch thick', '17:  Add another layer of potatoes and the rest of the 16 oz cremini mushrooms, and top with a final layer of potatoes', '18: Fold one side of pastry over the filling, then the other side', '19:  Seal the top and bottom ends over the filling', '20:  Score the top of the Wellington diagonally with a sharp knife', '21: In a ramekin or small bowl, combine the non-dairy milk with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil', '22:  Brush over the Wellington', '23:  Decorate with more pastry, if desired', '24:  Poke air vents in the side of the Wellington', '25: Bake for 35-40 minutes', '26:  until golden brown and puffed', '27: Let rest for 10 minutes before cutting into thick slices', '28: Serve with vegan gravy']

ingredients: ['1 package yellow cake mix', '1 cup chocolate chips (175 g)', '½ cup oil (120 mL)', '2 eggs']
instructions: ['1: Combine 1 package yellow cake mix, 1 cup chocolate chips, ½ cup oil, and 2 eggs in a mixing bowl', '2: Using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet', '3: Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 10-12 minutes']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons avocado oil', '1 medium yellow onion thinly sliced', '7 cloves garlic minced', '2 lb boneless pork shoulder (910 g) cut into 2 inch (5 cm) pieces', '½ cup soy sauce (120 mL)', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon whole black peppercorn', '2 teaspoons brown sugar', '3 dried bay leaves', '½ cup Datu Puti cane vinegar (120 mL)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', 'rice jasmine steamed for serving']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 2 tablespoons avocado oil in a deep, large skillet or 1 medium Dutch oven over 1 medium-high heat until shimmering', '2:  Add the onion and 7 cloves garlic and sauté until fragrant and the onion is translucent, 2–4 minutes', '3: Add the 2 lb boneless pork and 2 teaspoons brown on all sides, 4–5 minutes', '4: Add the ½ cup soy sauce, 1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper, whole peppercorns, sugar, and 3 dried bay leaves and stir to combine', '5:  Pour in the ½ cup Datu Puti cane vinegar without stirring, then cover the pot with a lid and let come to a boil', '6: Uncover the pot, gently stir the 2 lb boneless pork, then add the 1 cup water', '7:  Cover again and simmer for 45–60 minutes, until the 2 lb boneless pork is fork-tender', '8: Remove the lid and cook for 15 minutes more, until the sauce has reduced', '9:  The color should be dark 2 teaspoons brown and the sauce should taste slightly tangy', '10: Serve the 2 lb boneless pork over steamed Jasmine rice']

ingredients: ['1 cup sugar (200 g)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '1 cucumber sliced', 'ice', '2 oz gin (60 mL)', '1 ½ oz watermelon (45 mL) juiced', '½ oz lime juice (15 mL)', '1 oz cucumber  simple syrup (30 mL)', 'club soda to taste', '1 slice cucumber for garnish', 'Preparation', '1 cup sugar (200 g)', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '1 cucumber sliced', 'ice', '2 oz gin (60 mL)', '1 ½ oz watermelon (45 mL) juiced', '½ oz lime juice (15 mL)', '1 oz cucumber  simple syrup (30 mL)', 'club soda to taste', '1 slice cucumber for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a small pot over medium heat, combine the sugar and water', '2:  Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar completely', '3: Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the cucumber', '4:  Let steep, covered, for at least 4 hours or up to overnight', '5: Strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth, pushing to extract as much syrup as possible', '6:  Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month', '7: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, watermelon juice, lime juice, and simple syrup', '8:  Shake vigorously for 20 seconds', '9: Strain into a glass filled with ice and top with club soda', '10: Garnish with the cucumber slice']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb boneless pork shoulder (680 g) or pork belly chilled or frozen for easier slicing', '½ onion sliced into thin strips', '3 stalks green onion sliced into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon ginger minced', '¼ cup korean red chili paste (55 g) gochujang', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL)', '3 tablespoons rice wine', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon sugar', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 tablespoon canola oil', 'sesame seed to garnish', 'rice to serve']
instructions: ['1: Slice the 1 ½ lb boneless pork into extremely thin slices, then transfer to a large bowl', '2:  This works best when the 1 ½ lb boneless pork is super cold or partially frozen', '3: Add in all of the ingredients besides the 1 tablespoon canola oil, then mix until the 1 ½ lb boneless pork and the vegetables are evenly coated with the marinade', '4: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes', '5: Heat the oil in a pan over high heat, add 1 ½ lb boneless pork, being sure not to crowd the pan, stir-fry the 1 ½ lb boneless pork in batches until slightly crispy on the edges, about 3-4 minutes', '6:  If you’re using 1 ½ lb boneless pork belly, cook for a bit longer, around 6-7 minutes', '7: Sprinkle a bit of sesame seeds on top, then serve with rice!']

ingredients: ['1 cup flour (125 g)', '3 eggs', '1 ½ cups milk (360 mL)', '1 pinch salt', '1 tablespoon butter', '½ onion sliced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 cup spinach (40 g)', '4 slices mozzarella cheese or swiss cheese', '8 slices ham', '4 fried eggs']
instructions: ['1: In a bowl, mix the flour, 3 4 4 fried eggs, ½ cup (120 ml) of 1 ½ cups milk, and 1 pinch salt, until smooth', '2: Add in the remaining 1 ½ cups milk and mix again until the batter is thin and smooth', '3: Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat', '4: Add the 1 tablespoon butter and onions to the pan', '5:  Cook until browned', '6: Add 2 cloves garlic, spinach, and 1 pinch salt, and stir until spinach is wilted', '7: Remove the spinach mixture and clean the pan', '8: Return the pan to medium heat and add ¼-½ cup (60-125 g) of the batter into the pan', '9: Swirl the batter to coat the pan and leave on the heat until the sides start to lift up from the pan', '10: Using a spatula flip the crepe over and cook through, about 2 minutes', '11: Repeat with remaining batter', '12: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '13: Lay the crepes on a baking sheet', '14: Place one slice of cheese in the middle of a crepe', '15: Top the cheese with 2 slices of ham and the spinach mixture', '16: Top with a 4 fried egg and fold the edges over the egg, pressing down to make sure the sides stay in place', '17:  Repeat with other crepe', '18: Bake the crepes for 5 minutes or until yolk is at the desired consistency']

ingredients: ['3 medium sweet potatoes', '⅓ cup olive oil (80 mL)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 tablespoons fresh rosemary finely chopped']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Thoroughly wash 3 medium sweet potatoes', '3:  Slice in half, then into wedges', '4: Toss wedges in ⅓ cup olive oil and seasonings', '5: Place on a baking sheet, skin side down', '6: Bake 30-40 minutes']

ingredients: ['2 cups self-rising flour (250 g)', '¼ cup butter (40 g)', '¼ cup sugar (35 g)', '¼ cup milk (125 mL)', '1 teaspoon cinnamon']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 275°F', '2: Mix the ¼ cup sugar and ¼ cup butter together until it has a sandy texture', '3:  Then, add the self-rising 2 cups self-rising flour and mix until cohesive and sticks to the bowl', '4: Shape scones in the shape of your choice and bake for 10 minutes', '5: Serve warm']

ingredients: ['1 eggplant', '1 cup marinara sauce (260 g)', 'tomato sliced', 'fresh basil', 'mozzarella cheese sliced', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 cloves garlic minced', 'olive oil', '¼ cup panko breadcrumbs (10 g)', '2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Cut 1 eggplant lengthwise, keeping it connected at the stem', '3: In a baking dish, place 1 cup marinara sauce and spread to cover the bottom', '4: Place the 1 eggplant directly on the sauce', '5: Slice the tomato and mozzarella into thin slices', '6:  Alternate tomatoes, fresh basil, and mozzarella 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese in each 1 eggplant slice', '7: Sprinkle salt, pepper, 2 cloves garlic, and olive oil, and cover with foil and bake for 50 minutes until 1 eggplant is tender', '8: In a small bowl, combine ¼ cup panko, mozzarella 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper', '9: Place the ¼ cup panko mixture on top of the 1 eggplant and bake uncovered for another 5 minutes', '10:  Or until the bread crumbs are golden brown', '11: Cut into your desired size pieces']

ingredients: ['Mint Chocolate Cakes', '2 ¼ cups all purpose flour (280 mL)', '½ cup cocoa powder (55 g)', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon espresso powder optional', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '¾ cup light brown sugar (150 g)', '¼ cup granulated sugar (50 g)', '1 large egg room temperature', '1 teaspoon peppermint extract', '1 cup whole milk (240 mL) room temperature', 'Marshmallow Filling', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '14 oz marshmallow cream (420 g)', '2 ½ cups powdered sugar (280 g) plus more as needed', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', 'Assembly', '40 crushed peppermint candies', 'Preparation', 'Mint Chocolate Cakes', '2 ¼ cups all purpose flour (280 mL)', '½ cup cocoa powder (55 g)', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon espresso powder optional', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '¾ cup light brown sugar (150 g)', '¼ cup granulated sugar (50 g)', '1 large egg room temperature', '1 teaspoon peppermint extract', '1 cup whole milk (240 mL) room temperature', 'Marshmallow Filling', '1 stick unsalted butter room temperature', '14 oz marshmallow cream (420 g)', '2 ½ cups powdered sugar (280 g) plus more as needed', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', 'Assembly', '40 crushed peppermint candies', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2:  Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper', '3: Make the cakes: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder, if using', '4: In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar with an electric hand mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, 1–2 minutes', '5:  Add the egg and peppermint extract and beat until smooth and lightened in color, about 1 minute', '6: Add about a third of the dry ingredients and mix on medium-low speed until combined, then add half of the milk and mix until incorporated', '7:  Continue alternating additions of the dry ingredients and milk, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed', '8: Use a 1½-ounce ice cream scoop to portion out the batter onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing at least 2 inches apart', '9: Bake the cakes for 12–14 minutes, until firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean', '10:  Remove from the oven and let cool completely', '11: Make the marshmallow filling: Add the butter and marshmallow creme to a large bowl and beat with an electric hand mixer on medium-high speed until fully combined, 2–3 minutes', '12:  Sift in the powdered sugar and salt, then beat for another 2–3 minutes, until combined', '13:  The mixture should be stiff; if not, add a few more tablespoons of powdered sugar', '14:  Transfer the filling to a piping bag or zip-top bag', '15:  Place the piping bag in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes before assembling the whoopie pies', '16: When ready to assemble, cut a 1-inch (2', '17: 5 cm)-wide opening from the corner of the piping bag', '18: Pipe a thick spiral of the filling (¼–⅓ cup) onto the flat sides of half of the cakes, leaving a ¼-inch (½ cm) border around the edge', '19:  Place the remaining cakes on top of the filling, domed sides up, and press down lightly to adhere', '20: Add the crushed peppermint candies to a bowl', '21:  Roll the sides of each whoopie pie into the peppermint candies to coat', '22:  (For a more polished look, use a spoon to tilt the crushed peppermints onto the exposed filling)', '23: Refrigerate the whoopie pies until ready to serve, then remove from the refrigerator at least 10 minutes prior to serving']

ingredients: ['Gingerbread Cookies', '¾ cup butter (170 g) melted', '¾ cup brown sugar (165 g)', '¾ cup molasses (250 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons cinnamon', '2 teaspoons ground ginger', '1 teaspoon allspice', '1 egg', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '3 ½ cups flour (440 g)', 'Icing', '3 cups powdered sugar (360 g)', '6 tablespoons milk', 'red food coloring', 'green food coloring']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, whisk the melted ¾ cup butter, ¾ cup brown sugar, ¾ cup molasses, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 2 teaspoons ground ginger, and 1 teaspoon allspice until smooth', '2: Whisk in the 1 egg until combined', '3: Fold in the baking powder, baking soda, and half of the 3 ½ cups flour', '4: Add the rest of the 3 ½ cups flour until dough comes together', '5: Wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes', '6: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '7: Roll out the dough to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness', '8:  Cut into the desired shape using small knife', '9: Take the extra dough and roll out again to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness', '10:  Continue to cut shapes until dough is used', '11:  If dough gets too soft, transfer to fridge before rolling out', '12: Transfer shapes to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes', '13: Carefully transfer the cookies to a baking rack and cool completely', '14: Equally divide the 3 cups powdered sugar in three bowls', '15: Add two 6 tablespoons of milk to each and whisk until smooth', '16:  If too runny add more 3 cups powdered sugar, if too thick add more milk', '17: Add red food coloring to one bowl and green to the other', '18: Transfer icings to three different piping bags with a thin tip', '19: Decorate the cookies and allow to set before assembling', '20: Fit the cookie pieces into each other to allow the cookies to stand']

ingredients: ['2 medium eggplants washed', '1 tablespoon coarse salt', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon dried basil', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 cups vegetable oil (480 mL)', '2 ½ cups marinara sauce (650 g) divided', '2 tablespoons fresh basil minced plus more for garnish', '2 cups low-moisture mozzarella (200 g) shredded', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (100 g)', '8 slices fresh mozzarella cheese', 'Preparation', '2 medium eggplants washed', '1 tablespoon coarse salt', '1 cup all-purpose flour (125 g)', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon dried basil', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon pepper', '2 cups vegetable oil (480 mL)', '2 ½ cups marinara sauce (650 g) divided', '2 tablespoons fresh basil minced plus more for garnish', '2 cups low-moisture mozzarella (200 g) shredded', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (100 g)', '8 slices fresh mozzarella cheese', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Cut each eggplant into about ½-inch (1-cm) thick round slices', '2: Arrange the slices in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with paper towels', '3: Sprinkle the eggplant with half of the coarse salt', '4:  Flip the slices over and sprinkle with the rest of the salt', '5: Put another baking sheet on top of the eggplant and place something heavy, like a cast-iron skillet, on the top baking sheet to help release moisture from the eggplant', '6:  Let sit for 30 minutes', '7: Uncover the eggplant slices and pat dry with paper towels', '8:  Brush most of the salt from the eggplant with a paper towel, then transfer to a medium bowl', '9:  Set aside', '10: In a separate medium bowl, combine the flour, oregano, basil, garlic powder, and pepper', '11:  Mix well', '12: Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan until it reaches 375°F (190°C)', '13: Coat each eggplant slice in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess flour', '14: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '15: Fry the eggplant in batches until golden brown on both sides, 2-3 minutes per side', '16:  Drain on a paper towel-lined baking sheet and pat dry using more paper towels to absorb excess oil', '17: Pour about 1 cup (260 g) of marinara sauce into a 2½-quart (2 L) baking dish and spread evenly to cover the bottom of the dish', '18: Add about 8 eggplant slices (it’s okay if they overlap) and cover with ½ cup (130 g) of marinara', '19:  Sprinkle with a third of the fresh basil, then top with about a third of the shredded mozzarella and Parmesan', '20:  Repeat to make 2 more layers', '21:  Finish with the fresh mozzarella cheese and a final sprinkling of Parmesan', '22: Bake for 30 minutes, until the mozzarella is bubbling and golden brown', '23: Let cool for 10 minutes, then serve garnished with fresh basil']

ingredients: ['Rice Crispy Bars', '3 cups brown rice cereal (75 g)', '1 cup natural peanut butter (240 g)', '½ cup honey (170 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'Chocolate Drizzle', '½ cup dark chocolate (85 g) melted', '2 tablespoons coconut oil']
instructions: ['1: In a microwave safe bowl, heat the 1 cup natural peanut butter, ½ cup honey, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract for 1 minute', '2:  Mix well', '3: Add the 3 cups brown rice cereal to the mixture and combine', '4: After well combined, pour into a greased or parchment lined baking dish and evenly spread', '5: Chill until solid', '6: In a microwave safe bowl, heat the ½ cup dark chocolate and 2 tablespoons coconut oil', '7:  Mix well', '8: After the crispy mixture is solid, cut into pieces', '9: Dip the bottoms of the bars into the ½ cup dark chocolate', '10:  Drizzle remaining chocolate on top', '11: Chill again until solid', '12:  Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container']

ingredients: ['Raspberry Jam', '2 cups raspberry (250 g)', '½ cup granulated sugar (100 g)', '2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', 'Sliders', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 package sweet hawaiian dinner rolls 12 count', '¼ lb roasted turkey (115 g) sliced', '¼ lb honey ham (115 g) sliced', '¼ lb swiss cheese (110 g) grated', '1 large egg beaten', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter melted', 'powdered sugar for dusting']
instructions: ['1: Make the 2 cups raspberry jam: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook the raspberries for about 4 minutes, until they start to burst and become very fragrant', '2:  Add the ½ cup granulated powdered sugar and cook, stirring constantly, for 10-15 minutes, until running a spoon through the jam leaves an open trail at the bottom of the pot', '3:  Stir in the 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', '4:  Remove the pot from the heat and let the jam cool completely', '5:  Transfer to the refrigerator and chill for at least 2 hours or overnight', '6: Make the sliders: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C)', '7:  Line a small baking sheet with foil, leaving enough overhang so the sides can be used as handles', '8:  Grease with nonstick spray', '9: Slice the sheet of Hawaiian rolls in half horizontally, leaving the individual rolls connected', '10:  Place the bottom half in the prepared baking sheet', '11: Layer the ¼ lb roasted turkey and ¼ lb honey ham on top, making sure to fold the meat to fit inside the individual squares of the rolls, then top with the Swiss cheese', '12: Spread the 2 cups raspberry jam over the top half of the rolls and place on top of the cheese layer, pressing down lightly', '13: In a small bowl, mix together the 1 large egg and melted 4 tablespoons unsalted butter', '14:  Liberally brush on top of the rolls', '15: Bake the sliders until the cheese is completely melted and the buns are toasted, 25-30 minutes', '16:  If the tops begin to brown too quickly, cover loosely with foil', '17: Remove the sliders from oven and let cool for about 10 minutes, then transfer to a serving platter', '18:  Dust lightly with powdered ½ cup granulated powdered sugar and serve whole so the sliders can be pulled apart']

ingredients: ['½ cup water (120 mL)', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '¼ cup soy sauce (60 mL)', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 teaspoon white pepper', '1 lb flank steak (455 g) thinly sliced', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons cooking oil divided', '6 oz chow mein noodle (170 g) hong kong style pan fried noodles par cooked according to package instructions', '½ cup onion (75 g) sliced', '1 cup broccoli floret (150 g)', '2 teaspoons sesame oil', 'scallion sliced for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a 2-cup (480 ml) liquid measuring cup, combine the water, cornstarch, soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon white pepper', '2: In a medium bowl, season the 1 lb flank steak strips with salt', '3:  Pour half of the sauce over the meat and set the rest aside for later', '4:  Mix the sauce with the 1 lb flank steak, cover with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour', '5: In a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 3 tablespoons of cooking oil, then add the par-cooked 6 oz chow mein noodle (170 g) hong kong style pan fried noodles', '6:  Cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the 6 oz chow mein noodle (170 g) hong kong style pan fried noodles to crisp, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes', '7:  Transfer to a plate and set aside', '8: In the same wok, add 1 tablespoon of cooking oil and the marinated beef', '9:  Cook the beef for 3-4 minutes, then flip and cook for another 2 minutes, or until slightly crispy', '10:  Remove from the wok and set aside', '11: In the same wok, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil and add onion and broccoli', '12:  Season with salt, then stir and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the onions are translucent', '13: Return the 1 lb flank steak to the wok, followed by the crispy 6 oz chow mein noodle (170 g) hong kong style pan fried noodles and 2 teaspoons sesame oil', '14:  Mix well and pour in the reserved sauce', '15:  Toss gently and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until everything is well-combined', '16:  Garnish with 1 lb flank steak (455 g) thinly ½ cup onion (75 g) scallion sliced scallions']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '2 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon flour', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '3 yukon potatoes peeled', '2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese', 'fresh parsley chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: In a small pot, melt the 1 tablespoon butter and fry the 2 cloves garlic until it’s just starting to brown', '3:  Add the 1 tablespoon flour, 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper', '4:  whisk until there are no lumps', '5: Slowly drizzle in the 1 cup milk while constantly whisking to make sure the mixture is smooth', '6: Bring to a boil, then remove from heat', '7: Slice the 3 yukon potatoes into about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick slices, then fan them out in a small baking dish', '8: Pour the sauce on top of the 3 yukon potatoes, then sprinkle with 2 tablespoons grated parmesan', '9: Bake for about 1 hour, until the top is bubbly and golden brown', '10: Sprinkle chopped fresh parsley on top, then serve']

ingredients: ['½ sweet potato', '½ lb brussels sprouts (250 g)', '1 carrot', '½ head broccoli', '1 ½ lb chicken breast (750 g)', 'olive oil to taste', '2 tablespoons fresh rosemary chopped', '2 tablespoons fresh thyme chopped', '4 cloves garlic minced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '2: Cut vegetables', '3:  Place each in a separate corner of a baking pan lined with parchment paper', '4: NOTE: Broccoli and Brussels sprouts cook faster, keep the cuts thicker for those', '5:  Sweet potato and carrots take more time - dice them, or cut them thinner', '6: Season veggies with olive oil, salt, pepper, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, 2 tablespoons fresh thyme, and 4 cloves garlic', '7: Season both sides of the 1 ½ lb chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and the remaining 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, 2 tablespoons fresh thyme, and 4 cloves garlic over parchment paper', '8: Seal parchment paper to keep 1 ½ lb chicken moist, and place on the center of the baking pan', '9: Bake for 25-30 minutes, until 1 ½ lb chicken is fully cooked and veggies are done to your liking', '10: This meal works great with brown rice, so feel free to add some to your meal prep as well', '11: Unwrap and slice the 1 ½ lb chicken', '12: Separate veggies into each tupperware with 1 ½ lb chicken', '13: NOTE: If using plastic tupperware, allow food to cool down firstCan be refrigerated up to 4 days', '14: Nutrition  Calories: 1556 Fat: 39 grams  Carbs: 261 grams Fiber: 19 grams  Sugars: 52 grams  Protein: 44 grams']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium yellow onion minced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 yellow bell pepper cut into strips', '1 red bell pepper cut into strips', '1 cup green beans (360 g) halved', '1 ½ cups short grain white rice (300 g)', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ teaspoon sweet paprika', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', 'salt to taste', 'black pepper to taste', '14 oz diced tomato (395 g)', '3 cups vegetable broth (720 mL)', '½ teaspoon saffron thread crumbled or 1/2 tablespoon ground turmeric', '2 bay leaves', '½ cup frozen peas (75 g)', '½ cup canned artichoke heart (85 g)', '½ cup vegan chorizon (75 g) optional', '½ cup fresh flat-leaf parsley (15 g) chopped', '1 lemon quartered for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over 1 medium heat', '2: Add the onion and cook until translucent, 3-4 minutes', '3: Add the 4 cloves garlic and cook for about 2 minutes until it is fragrant', '4: Add the 1 medium 1 yellow bell 1 yellow bell 1 red bell black peppers, 1 red bell 1 yellow bell 1 red bell black peppers, and 1 cup green beans', '5:  Cook stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes until tender', '6: Add the 1 ½ cups short grain white rice, ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, ½ teaspoon sweet paprika, tomato paste, salt, and 1 yellow bell 1 red bell black pepper', '7:  Stir until incorporated', '8:  Cook for 1-2 minutes until the 1 ½ cups short grain white rice starts to sizzle', '9: Add the ½ cup canned tomatoes', '10:  Cook for 5 minutes until the liquid has evaporated slightly', '11: Add the 3 cups vegetable broth, ½ teaspoon saffron threads (crush the ½ teaspoon saffron threads between your fingertips), and 2 bay leaves', '12:  Bring to a boil on high heat', '13:  Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is absorbed by the 1 ½ cups short grain white rice, about 10 minutes', '14: Add in the ½ cup frozen peas, artichokes, and sausage, if using', '15:  Cover the pan, 1 reduce the heat to low, and cook for 10 minutes', '16: Remove the pan from the heat and let sit covered for 10 minutes', '17: Sprinkle the ½ cup fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['½ lb chicken sausage (225 g)', '½ cup onion (75 g) chopped', '½ cup mushroom (35 g) chopped', '4 oz fresh spinach (110 g) chopped', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '6 eggs', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 premade pie crust thawed', 'parmesan cheese grated']
instructions: ['1: Cook ½ lb chicken sausage over medium-high until lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes, being sure to break up the meat into a fine mince', '2: Remove cooked ½ lb chicken sausage from pan and wipe away excess fat with a paper towel', '3: Add ½ cup onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes', '4:  Add ½ cup mushrooms, ½ teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon black pepper and continue to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes', '5: Add chopped 4 oz fresh spinach and cook until wilted and no extra liquid has accumulated in the bottom of the pan', '6: NOTE: Do your best to use the excessive moisture of the 4 oz fresh spinach and ½ cup mushrooms to deglaze the bottom of the pan, scraping away any browned bits from cooking the ½ lb chicken sausage earlier', '7: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '8: Once cooked, remove the 4 oz fresh spinach and ½ cup mushroom mixture from the pan and combine it with the reserved cooked ½ lb chicken sausage', '9:  Stir to mix evenly', '10: Combine 6 eggs and 1 cup milk', '11:  Lightly whisk until just combined', '12: Add ½ lb chicken sausage and 4 oz fresh spinach mixture to the bottom of a prepared 9-inch (23cm) 1 premade pie crust, making sure to spread it evenly', '13: Pour in beaten 6 eggs to fill the rest of the 1 premade pie crust and top with a generous sprinkle of parmesan cheese', '14: Bake at 350˚F (180˚C) for 25 minutes or until the 6 eggs are set and the top is lightly browned', '15:  Allow to cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving']

ingredients: ['2 cloves garlic whole', '⅔ cup kimchi (100 g) chopped', '1 tablespoon gochujang', '2 cups dashi stock (450 mL)', '¼ cup enoki mushroom (40 g)', '½ cup shirataki noodles (100 g) rinsed and washed', '¼ cup potato starch (30 g) Mung Bean noodles', '2 stalks bok choy', '1 egg', 'salt and pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: Lightly char the 2 cloves garlic in a hot pot (no oil needed)', '2:  When it starts sizzling, add ⅔ cup kimchi and stir-fry until aromatic', '3:  Then, incorporate the 1 tablespoon gochujang until well-combined', '4: Slowly add the 2 cups dashi stock and bring to a boil', '5: Add ¼ cup enoki mushrooms, ½ cup shirataki noodles, and ¼ cup potato starch or mung bean noodles and continue to boil', '6:  Then, lower heat and cover', '7:  Let cook for 10 minutes', '8: Season to taste with salt and pepper', '9:  Then, add 2 stalks bok choy', '10:  Cover and let cook', '11: Crack the 1 egg into a separate small bowl and beat it', '12:  Add some liquid from the stew to make it more light', '13: Once vegetables are 75% cooked in the stew, pour the 1 egg into it in a circular motion and let simmer for 5 minutes while occasionally stirring', '14: Serve hot']

ingredients: ['2 boneless strip steaks or shell steaks about 1-inch (2 cm) thick', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons canola oil', '1 bunch asparagus']
instructions: ['1: Season the 2 boneless strip steaks on all sides with the salt and pepper', '2: Heat 3 tablespoons canola oil in a pan or a skillet over high heat until smoking', '3: Sear the 2 boneless strip steaks for about a minute to a minute and a half on each side, depending on the thickness of your steak for medium-rare', '4:  If you would like your steak rarer or more well-done, cook your steak shorter or longer accordingly', '5: In the same pan, cook the 1 bunch asparagus with salt and pepper until tender but still slightly crunchy', '6:  Remove from heat', '7: After the 2 boneless strip steaks have rested for about 5 minutes, slice, then serve with the 1 bunch asparagus!']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 chicken breasts cubed', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '4 cloves garlic minced', '2 ½ cups chicken broth (600 mL)', '2 ½ cups heavy cream (600 mL)', '½ lb penne pasta (200 g) uncooked', '2 cups parmesan cheese (220 g)', '2 cups mozzarella cheese (200 g)', '1 handful fresh parsley chopped']
instructions: ['1: In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and add 3 2 ½ cups chicken', '2: Season 3 2 ½ cups chicken with salt and pepper', '3: Add 4 cloves garlic, then brown the 3 2 ½ cups chicken', '4: Add broth, heavy cream, and ½ lb penne pasta, and bring to a boil', '5: Cover and reduce the heat to a simmer for 15-20 min', '6: Turn off heat and stir in 1 ½ cups (165 grams) of parmesan cheese', '7: Pour half of the ½ lb penne pasta into a greased 11×7 inch or 9×13 inch (28x18 cm or 33x23 cm) baking dish', '8: Sprinkle evenly with 1 cup (115 grams) of mozzarella cheese', '9: Layer the remaining half of the ½ lb penne pasta evenly on top', '10:  Sprinkle evenly with 1 cup of mozzarella (115 grams) and ½ cup (55 grams) of parmesan', '11: Broil 10 - 15 minutes, or until the cheese is golden brown', '12:  Remove and sprinkle with 1 handful fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['5 potatoes peeled', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '8 slices ham', '7 slices mozzarella cheese', '5 slices bacon cooked and crumbled', '¼ cup fresh parsley (10 g) chopped', '2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese (200 g)', '1 cup heavy cream (240 mL)', '2 eggs']
instructions: ['1: Slice the peeled 5 potatoes into ¼ inch (½ cm) slices', '2: Season the 5 potatoes with 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper, tossing them to make sure they’re coated evenly', '3: Press a layer of 5 potatoes evenly into the bottom of a greased, square baking pan', '4: Place half of the ham slices evenly on top of the 5 potatoes, followed by half of the sliced cheese', '5: Follow with another layer of 5 potatoes, then the remaining ham and sliced cheese', '6: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '7: Sprinkle the bacon and ¼ cup fresh parsley evenly on top of the sliced cheese, and place one final layer of 5 potatoes on top', '8: Sprinkle the 2 cups shredded cheese on top of the 5 potatoes, then press it into an even layer', '9: In a small bowl, mix the 1 cup heavy cream and 2 eggs', '10:  Pour on top of the 2 cups shredded cheese', '11: Bake for about 40 minutes, until the cheese is a deep golden brown', '12: Cool slightly, slice, then serve!']

ingredients: ['1 spaghetti squash', '2 tablespoons oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 jar marinara sauce', 'Meatballs', '1 lb ground turkey (453 g)', '⅓ cup parsley (10 g) chopped plus more for garnish', '¼ cup white onion (37 g) finely diced', '1 clove garlic cloves minced', '½ cup parmesan cheese (100 g) grated', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon black pepper']
instructions: ['1: Use a fork to pierce holes down the side of the 1 spaghetti squash', '2:  Microwave for 5 minutes', '3: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '4: When the squash is cool enough to touch (5-10 minutes), slice the squash open, length-wise, with a sharp knife', '5: Scoop out the seeds and drizzle the squash with 2 tablespoons oil', '6:  Season with salt and pepper', '7: Roast the squash cut-side down for 40 minutes, until easily pierced with a knife', '8: In a large bowl, gently mix together the 1 lb ground turkey, ¼ cup white onion, ⅓ cup parsley, ½ cup parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper', '9:  Form meatballs, and transfer to a greased baking sheet', '10: Bake in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes, until fully cooked', '11: Using a fork, pull the strands from the cooled 1 spaghetti squash and transfer to serving dish', '12: Top with hot 1 jar marinara sauce, and a sprinkle of chopped ⅓ cup parsley']

ingredients: ['Tomato Sauce', '1 onion peeled and halved', '28 oz crushed tomato (795 g) 1 can', '½ cup unsalted butter (115 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Meatballs', '1 lb ground pork (455 g)', '1 lb ground beef (455 g)', '1 onion finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (100 g)', '1 cup panko breadcrumbs (50 g)', '¾ cup fresh parsley (25 g) finely chopped', '2 tablespoons worcestershire', '1 egg', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 lb spaghetti (455 g)', 'parmesan cheese to serve']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Add the 28 oz crushed tomatoes, ½ cup unsalted butter, onion, and salt to a pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat', '3: Lower the heat and cook for 45 minutes, until the onions are soft and starting to break apart', '4:  Remove onion', '5: In a bowl, mix the ground beef, ground pork, 1 cup panko, Parmesan, 1 egg, 2 cloves garlic, onion, Worcestershire, salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, and ¾ cup fresh parsley until fully combined', '6: Take a golf ball-sized handful of the meat mixture and roll it into a ball', '7:  Transfer to a baking sheet', '8:  Repeat with the remaining meat', '9: Bake the meatballs for 16 minutes', '10: Bring a pot of water to a boil, and cook the 1 lb spaghetti according to the packaging instructions', '11: Drain pasta and toss lightly in about a tablespoon of oil (optional)', '12: Pour the sauce over the pasta', '13:  Transfer the cooked meatballs and top with Parmesan']

ingredients: ['Griot', '3 lb pork shoulder (1.5 kg) cubed', 'salt to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly cracked pepper to taste', '1 onion chopped', '2 shallots chopped', '5 scallions chopped', '1 bell pepper sliced', '6 cloves garlic sliced', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '4 cloves garlic', '2 oranges juiced', '2 limes juiced', '1 tablespoon white wine vinegar', '10 sprigs fresh thyme', '½ bunch fresh parsley', '1 scotch bonnet pepper sliced', '2 cups water (480 mL)', '4 cups oil (1 L) for frying', 'brown rice to serve', 'red bean to serve', '3 fried plantains to serve', 'Pikliz', '2 cups cabbage (200 g) shredded', '1 cup carrot (110 g) grated', '1 bell pepper sliced', '1 onion sliced', '3 scallions dliced', '1 shallot sliced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'scotch bonnet pepper divided', '2 cups white wine vinegar (480 mL)', 'Preparation', 'Griot', '3 lb pork shoulder (1.5 kg) cubed', 'salt to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly cracked pepper to taste', '1 onion chopped', '2 shallots chopped', '5 scallions chopped', '1 bell pepper sliced', '6 cloves garlic sliced', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '4 cloves garlic', '2 oranges juiced', '2 limes juiced', '1 tablespoon white wine vinegar', '10 sprigs fresh thyme', '½ bunch fresh parsley', '1 scotch bonnet pepper sliced', '2 cups water (480 mL)', '4 cups oil (1 L) for frying', 'brown rice to serve', 'red bean to serve', '3 fried plantains to serve', 'Pikliz', '2 cups cabbage (200 g) shredded', '1 cup carrot (110 g) grated', '1 bell pepper sliced', '1 onion sliced', '3 scallions dliced', '1 shallot sliced', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'scotch bonnet pepper divided', '2 cups white wine vinegar (480 mL)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: For the griot, add the cubed pork shoulder, salt, pepper, chopped onion, chopped shallots, chopped scallions, sliced bell pepper, sliced garlic, chicken bouillon cube, cloves, orange juice, lime juice, white wine vinegar, thyme sprigs, parsley, and the sliced Scotch bonnet peppers to a large dutch oven off the heat', '2: With gloves on, mix the mixture thoroughly', '3:  Cover the pot and place in the refrigerator to marinate overnight', '4: For the pikliz, combine the shredded cabbage, grated carrot, 1 sliced bell pepper, 1 sliced onion, 3 sliced scallions, 1 sliced shallot, and 2 sliced Scotch bonnets in a large bowl', '5:  Add the salt and freshly cracked black pepper', '6: Put on gloves, and thoroughly mix using your hands', '7:  Pack the pikliz down into sterilized mason jars', '8:  Cover with the white wine vinegar', '9:  Put on the lid and store in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours to marinate', '10: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '11: Place the Dutch oven with the marinated pork on the stove', '12:  Add the 2 cups (480 ML) of water, and bring to a boil', '13:  Transfer the pork to the the oven to braise for 1½ hours or until cooked through and tender', '14: Pick out all the pieces of pork and place on a paper towel-lined tray lined with paper towel to dry', '15:  Pat down the  surface of the pork to make sure there is no moisture', '16: Heat a pot of oil to 350°F (180°C)', '17: Add the pork in batches and fry until deep golden brown color, about 5-7 minutes', '18: Transfer the pork to a paper towel-lined plate to drain', '19: Serve with rice, beans, fried plantains, and the pikliz', '20: Nutrition  Calories: 1859 Fat: 172 grams  Carbs: 36 grams Fiber: 7 grams  Sugars: 10 grams  Protein: 50 grams']

ingredients: ['2 lb chicken thighs (910 g) boneless with skin on', '½ lb bacon (225 g) chopped', '1 lb asparagus (455 g) trimmed and chopped', '1 red onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '6 cups chicken broth (1.4 L)', '1 cup milk (240 mL)', '1 lb fusilli pasta (455 g)', '8 oz goat cheese (225 g)', '½ cup sun-dried tomato (25 g) chopped', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot on medium-high heat, add ½ lb bacon', '2:  Cook until the fat has rendered and the ½ lb bacon is crispy', '3:  Remove ½ lb bacon from pot and set aside', '4:  Leave ½ lb bacon fat in pan', '5: Season chicken with salt and pepper and place skin-side down in the pot', '6:  Cook until the chicken gets a dark golden crispy skin', '7:  Flip and cook on the other side until the chicken is cooked through', '8:  Remove from pot and set aside', '9: Add the 1 red onion, 1 lb asparagus, and 4 cloves garlic to the pot and until the 1 lb asparagus is almost tender', '10:  Remove from pot', '11: Add the 1 lb fusilli pasta and chicken broth to the pot', '12: Bring to a boil, and cook for 9-12 minutes or until the 1 lb fusilli pasta is al dente', '13:  Stir occasionally', '14: When the 1 lb fusilli pasta is almost tender', '15:  Lower the heat and add in the 1 cup milk, 8 oz goat cheese, cooked vegetables, cooked ½ lb bacon, and sun-dried tomatoes', '16:  Stir to incorporate', '17: Add the chicken back to the pot', '18:  Sprinkle with ½ lb bacon (225 g) 1 lb asparagus (455 g) trimmed and ½ cup sun-dried tomato (25 g) chopped parsley and bring to the table to serve']

ingredients: ['12 chicken drumsticks', 'Marinade', '6 cloves garlic crushed', '3 tablespoons ginger', '1 red chili', '3 tablespoons honey', '½ cup soy sauce (100 mL)', 'Garnish', 'sesame seed', 'spring onion']
instructions: ['1: In a mixing bowl, combine the 6 cloves garlic, 3 tablespoons ginger, 1 red chili, 3 tablespoons honey, and ½ cup soy sauce', '2: Mix in the 12 chicken drumsticks', '3: Cover with cling film and leave to marinate in the fridge for 4-6 hours, or overnight', '4: Fry the 12 chicken in a large pan, on all sides for about 10-15 minutes, stirring often to prevent the marinade from burning, until golden brown', '5: Remove from the pan and pour in the marinade', '6: Bring to a boil and stir, until the marinade is thick and resembles a sauce', '7: Throw the 12 chicken back in the pan and fry for a further 5-10 minutes in the sauce, making sure each drumstick is evenly coated and cooked through', '8: Garnish with sesame seeds and spring onions']

ingredients: ['14 oz full fat coconut milk (415 mL) room temperature', '⅓ cup sugar (65 g)', '½ cup fresh baby spinach (15 g) loosely packed', '½ teaspoon peppermint extract', '14 oz coconut cream (415 mL) chilled', '1 tablespoon refined coconut oil melted', '⅓ cup cacao nibs (30 g) plus more for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners', '2: In a small pot over medium heat, whisk together the coconut milk and sugar', '3:  Cook for 20–25 minutes, until thickened and reduced by nearly half', '4:  Remove the pot from the heat and let cool completely, about 20 minutes', '5: Once cooled, transfer the coconut milk mixture to a high-speed blender and add the spinach and mint ½ teaspoon peppermint extract', '6:  Blend on high speed for 30–60 seconds, until the spinach is completely broken down and the mixture has a minty green hue', '7: Add the coconut cream to a chilled metal bowl', '8:  Using an electric hand mixer, beat the coconut cream on high speed for 3 minutes, until soft peaks form', '9:  Add the melted coconut oil and briefly whip to combine', '10: Add the spinach mixture to the whipped coconut cream mixture and beat on medium speed for 1 minute, until well combined and fluffy', '11:  Fold in the cacao nibs', '12: Distribute the mixture evenly between the prepared muffin cups', '13:  Top with more cacao nibs', '14: Freeze the cups for 30–60 minutes, until set but not too hard to bite through', '15:  Serve immediately, or keep in the freezer to let harden completely, then let sit at room temperature for 15–20 minutes to soften before serving']

ingredients: ['250 g cream cheese (250 g)', '2 ½ cups mature cheddar (250 g) grated', '¼ cup blue cheese (30 g)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 red pepper finely chopped divided', '2 spring onions finely chopped', '¾ cup chopped pecans (100 g) divided', '4 slices cooked bacon chopped divided', '¾ cup fresh parsley (25 g) chopped', '1 teaspoon poppy seed', 'cracker for serving']
instructions: ['1: Add the 250 g cream cheese, 2 ½ cups mature cheddar cheese, ¼ cup blue cheese, salt, and 1 1 red pepper to a large bowl and mix well with a fork', '2: Add ½ of the 1 red pepper finely 2 spring onions finely ¾ cup 4 slices cooked 4 slices cooked bacon ¾ cup fresh ¾ cup fresh parsley (25 g) chopped 1 red 1 1 red pepper, the 2 spring onions, ½ of the pecans and ½ of the 4 slices cooked bacon to the bowl and mix to combine', '3: Transfer the cheese mixture to a sheet of cling film and wrap it up', '4:  Shape into a ball and refrigerate for at least 1 hour', '5: In a shallow bowl, mix together the rest of the 1 red 1 1 red pepper, the ¾ cup fresh parsley, remaining pecans and 4 slices cooked bacon, and the 1 teaspoon poppy seeds', '6: Remove the cheese ball from the cling film and roll it around the topping mixture until completely covered', '7: Serve with a selection of crackers']

ingredients: ['Crust', '¾ cup rolled oats (75 g)', '6 tablespoons unsalted butter 3/4 stick', '¾ cup all-purpose flour (95 g)', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '3 tablespoons water', 'Apple Tart', '2 ½ lb honeycrisp apple (1 kg) peeled cored and thinly sliced (4 apples)', '½ lemon juiced', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 cup unsweetened applesauce (260 g)', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter melted', '1 tablespoon apricot jam optional']
