instructions: ['1: Make the crust: In a food processor, blend the ¾ cup rolled oats into a coarse powder', '2: Add the butter to a medium saucepan over medium heat and cook until nutty brown in color, 5-6 minutes', '3:  Once the butter has browned, add the ground ¾ cup rolled oats, ¾ cup all-purpose flour, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, and 3 tablespoons water, and mix to combine', '4:  Let cool for 5 minutes', '5: Transfer the crust mixture to a 9-inch (20 cm) tart pan, spreading evenly across the bottom and up the sides', '6:  Chill for 30 minutes', '7: Preheat the oven to 375˚F (190˚C)', '8: Make the filling: Place the apples in a large microwave-safe bowl and squeeze the ½ lemon juice over, then toss to coat', '9:  Microwave for 4 minutes', '10:  Cover with a plate and let steam for 5 minutes', '11: Season the apples with the cinnamon and nutmeg, and toss to coat', '12: Spread the 1 cup unsweetened applesauce over the bottom of the crust', '13: Starting from the outside and working inward, arrange the apples in the pan in a circular pattern with the curved side up', '14:  Begin with the larger slices, overlapping slightly, and continue until the entire crust is filled', '15:  Brush the apples with the melted butter', '16: Bake for 1 hour, checking occasionally', '17:  If the edges are browning too quickly, cover gently with foil to prevent further browning as the tart cooks through', '18: If using, microwave the 1 tablespoon apricot jam for 20-30 seconds to melt', '19:  Use a pastry brush to paint the 1 tablespoon apricot jam over the warm tart for a nice, shiny finish', '20: Let the tart cool to room temperature before slicing and serving']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup onion (150 g) diced', '1 lb ground beef (455 g)', '2 teaspoons salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '⅓ cup shredded cheddar cheese (35 g)', '2 tablespoons ketchup', '1 tablespoon yellow mustard', '½ teaspoon worcestershire sauce', '2 sheets pie dough', 'Topping', 'egg', 'sesame seed']
instructions: ['1: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet', '2: Cook down onions until translucent', '3: Add meat, 1 teaspoon 2 teaspoons salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper, and cook until meat is fully cooked', '4:  Transfer into a large bowl', '5: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '6: Combine ⅓ cup shredded cheddar cheese, 2 tablespoons ketchup, 1 tablespoon yellow mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and 1 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons salt', '7:  Mix thoroughly', '8: Roll out the 2 sheets pie crust and cut into 4 2 sheets pieces', '9: Place a spoonful of the stuffing on one side of the dough, leaving ¼ inch (6 mm) from the edge and fold over, creating a triangle', '10: With a fork, crimp down the 2 sides so the stuffing stays in', '11: Transfer onto baking sheet', '12:  Brush on egg and sprinkle on sesame seeds', '13: Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown and 2 sheets pie crust is thoroughly cooked', '14: Let it cool for a few minutes']

ingredients: ['1 cup water (240 mL)', '⅓ cup butter (75 g)', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', 'salt to taste', '1 cup flour (125 g)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 eggs', 'cinnamon sugar to coat', 'chocolate melted to taste']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350°F (180˚C)', '2: In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the ⅓ cup butter and 2 tablespoons brown sugar in the 1 cup water and bring to a boil', '3: Turn off the heat and stir in the 1 cup flour', '4: Take the pot off of the heat source, and mix in the 1 teaspoon vanilla, then the 2 eggs one at a time', '5: Transfer mixture to a piping bag with a 5 point, or star, tip', '6: Pipe out thick 3-inch (8 cm) strips of churro batter onto a baking sheet covered with parchment, using a knife to release each piece from the piping tip, if needed', '7: Bake for 10 minutes, then broil until golden 2 tablespoons brown', '8: Dredge each churro in melted ⅓ cup butter, then cinnamon sugar', '9: Serve with melted chocolate if desired']

ingredients: ['Crust', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '½ cup raw pistachios (60 g)', '9 graham crackers', '¾ stick unsalted butter melted', '1 tablespoon granulated sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', 'Mango Purée', '4 mangoes cubed packed - preferably Alphonso', 'Mango Lassi Cheesecake Layer', '½ cup cold water (120 mL)', '2 packets gelatin powder', '12 oz cream cheese (360 g) softened', '¾ cup granulated sugar (150 g) plus 1 tablespoon', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 ½ cups plain full-fat greek yogurt (360 g)', 'Mango Jelly Layer', '½ cup cold water (120 mL)', '2 packets gelatin powder', '½ cup hot water (120 mL)', '½ cup granulated sugar (100 g)', '1 cup mango purée (235 g)', 'Saffron Whipped Cream', '1 ½ cups heavy cream (360 g) divided', '8 saffron threads', '3 tablespoons powdered sugar', 'Topping', '½ fl oz mango cubed', '¼ cup raw pistachios (30 g) coarsely chopped']
instructions: ['1: Make the crust: Grease the bottom and sides of a 9-inch (20 cm) round springform pan with nonstick spray', '2: Add the pistachios to a food processor', '3:  Pulse until coarsely ¼ teaspoon ground, 20–30 seconds', '4:  Add the 9 graham crackers and pulse for 30–40 seconds, until finely crushed', '5:  Add the melted ¾ stick unsalted butter, 1 tablespoon ¾ cup ½ cup granulated sugar, and cardamom and pulse until evenly combined', '6: Transfer the crust mixture to the prepared pan and use a spatula or measuring cup to press evenly against the bottom', '7:  Clean the food processor bowl and blade', '8: Make the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango purée: Add the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango to the food processor', '9:  Purée until completely smooth, 2–3 minutes', '10:  Transfer the purée to a medium bowl', '11:  You should have about 2 cups', '12: Make the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango lassi cheesecake layer: In a small bowl, combine the cold water and gelatin, stirring with a fork to dissolve and break up any clumps', '13:  Let the gelatin bloom for 5 minutes, until the water is mostly absorbed', '14:  Microwave for 15–20 seconds, or until the gelatin is melted', '15: In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese, 1 tablespoon ¾ cup ½ cup granulated sugar, and 1 teaspoon lemon juice with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until combined, about 1 minute', '16: Add the melted gelatin and Greek yogurt and beat for another 2–3 minutes, until well combined and fluffy', '17:  Add 1 cup of the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango purée and mix until smooth and distributed, scraping down the sides of the bowl with a spatula as needed', '18: Pour the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango lassi layer over the crust', '19:  Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes', '20: Make the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango jelly layer: In a medium bowl, combine the cold water and gelatin, stirring with a fork to dissolve and break up any clumps', '21:  Let the gelatin bloom for 5 minutes, until the water is mostly absorbed', '22:  Microwave for 15–20 seconds, or until the gelatin is melted', '23: Add the hot water and 1 tablespoon ¾ cup ½ cup granulated sugar to the melted gelatin and stir until the sugar is dissolved', '24:  Slowly stream in 1 cup of 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango purée, stirring continuously, until completely combined', '25: Remove the cheesecake from the refrigerator', '26:  Hold a large spoon about 2 inches above the center of the cheesecake with the back side facing up', '27:  Slowly pour the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango purée layer over the back of the spoon so that it gently falls over the 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango lassi layer', '28: Carefully return the cheesecake to the refrigerator', '29:  Chill at least 6 hours, or overnight, until set', '30: Make the 8 saffron whipped cream: Combine ½ cup of heavy cream and the 8 saffron threads in a small saucepan over medium-low heat', '31:  Steep for 3–4 minutes, until the cream is bubbling around the edges of the pot', '32:  Transfer to a medium bowl, stir in the remaining cup of heavy cream, cover loosely with plastic wrap, and refrigerate at least 1 hour, until completely cooled', '33: Once cooled, beat the 8 saffron cream with an electric hand mixer on medium speed for 3–4 minutes, until medium peaks form', '34:  Add the 3 tablespoons powdered sugar and mix until just combined', '35: Once the cheesecake has set, remove from the refrigerator', '36:  Dollop the 8 saffron whipped cream onto the center of the cheesecake and use a spoon to spread to about 1 inch from the edges', '37:  Use the back of the spoon to create divots and peaks in the whipped cream', '38:  Scatter the 4 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mangoes ½ fl oz ½ fl oz mango cubed 4 1 cup ½ fl oz mango evenly over the whipped cream and sprinkle the chopped pistachios on top', '39: Use a sharp knife to slice the cheesecake into 12 pieces, wiping the blade clean with a wet cloth after each cut']

ingredients: ['4 slices thick cut bacon cut into ½-inch (1 1/4 cm) strips', '10 oz white onion (285 g) diced', 'kosher salt to taste', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 pinch cayenne optional', '3 tablespoons all purpose flour', '4 cups chicken stock (960 mL)', '1 ¼ cups red potato (565 g) chopped', '4 large ears fresh yellow corn kernels', '1 cup red bell pepper (100 g) diced', '¾ cup heavy cream (180 g)', 'fresh chive chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Turn the Instant Pot to sauté mode and set the time for 20 minutes', '2:  Add 4 slices thick cut bacon to the pot and cook until crispy and the fat has rendered, stirring occasionally to prevent burning, 10–12 minutes', '3:  Transfer the 4 slices thick cut bacon to a baking sheet or plate lined with paper towels and set aside until ready to serve', '4:  Leave the rendered fat behind in the pot', '5: To the Instant Pot, add the onion and season with kosher salt', '6:  Sauté for 3 minutes, until translucent', '7:  Add the 4 cloves garlic and 1 pinch cayenne, if using, and sauté for 2 minutes, until fragrant', '8: Whisk in the 3 tablespoons all purpose flour, making sure to break up any clumps', '9:  Cook for 3 minutes, until the 3 tablespoons all purpose flour is light golden in color', '10:  Turn off sauté mode by pressing cancel', '11: Pour in the 4 cups chicken stock to deglaze the pot, scraping the bottom with a wooden spoon to loosen any browned bits', '12:  Add the potatoes and 4 large ears fresh yellow corn', '13: Secure the lid of the Instant Pot and set the valve to sealing', '14:  Select pressure cooking and set the timer for 10 minutes', '15:  Manually release the pressure from the Instant Pot after the cooking time has elapsed and let vent naturally for 15 minutes', '16:  Be careful when releasing the valve, as hot steam will come out', '17:  Remove the lid of the Instant Pot carefully, as the soup will be very hot', '18: Stir in the red bell pepper and ¾ cup heavy cream', '19: Ladle the warm soup into bowls and top with the 4 slices thick cut bacon and chives']

ingredients: ['Salmon Marinade:', '1 lb salmon fillet (455 g) center-cut', '½ clove garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon oregano', '1 pinch saffron', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Harissa:', '½ cup red bell pepper (50 g) diced', '1 teaspoon garlic pureeed', '1 tablespoon fresh mint chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ teaspoon lemon juice', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon caraway seed', '1 teaspoon red chili flakes', 'pepper to taste', 'salt to taste']
instructions: ['1: Add the 1 lb salmon, ½ clove 1 teaspoon garlic ½ clove, lemon juice, olive oil, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1 pinch saffron, salt, and pepper to a large bowl and stir until the 1 lb salmon is well coated', '2: Marinate for at least 20 minutes, and up to 24 hours', '3: Add the ½ cup red bell pepper, ½ clove 1 teaspoon garlic, 1 tablespoon fresh mint, olive oil, lemon juice, ½ teaspoon ground cumin, ½ teaspoon caraway, pepper, chile 1 teaspoon red chili flakes and salt to a blender or food processor and blend until well combined', '4: Heat a pan over high heat with a drizzle olive oil', '5:  Once the oil is glistening, add the 1 lb salmon', '6:  Cook for 2 minutes', '7: Gently flip the 1 lb salmon over and turn off the heat', '8:  Put the lid on the pan and let it continue to cook for 5 minutes', '9: Serve 1 lb salmon with harissa']

ingredients: ['2 cups chicken (250 g)', '1 tablespoon flour', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 tablespoon garam masala', '1 tablespoon turmeric', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 onion chopped', '4 cloves garlic minced', '2 green chiles chopped', '½ cup tomato (100 g) in their juices', '2 tablespoons tomato puree', '¾ cup plain yogurt (200 g)', 'Garnish', 'rice', 'coriander']
instructions: ['1: Place the 2 cups chicken pieces in the slow cooker and coat well with the 1 tablespoon flour and 2 teaspoons salt', '2: Throw in the 1 tablespoon garam masala, 1 tablespoon turmeric, 1 tablespoon paprika, onions, 4 cloves garlic, chillies, chopped tomatoes and tomato puree and mix together', '3: Slow cook on high for 3 hours', '4: After 3 hours, stir in the ¾ cup plain yogurt', '5:  Serve with rice and top with chopped coriander']

ingredients: ['1 sweet potato', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon fresh rosemary chopped', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', 'Greek Yogurt Chive Dip', '1 cup plain greek yogurt (285 g)', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '2 tablespoons chives', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2: Cut 1 sweet potato into fries and combine in a large bowl with 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, salt, and pepper', '3: Place in a single layer on a baking sheet lined in parchment paper', '4:  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, flipping halfway through', '5: Prepare dip while fries are baking', '6:  Combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use']

ingredients: ['⅓ cup whole wheat flour (50 g) plus more for feeding', '⅓ cup bread flour (50 g) plus more feeding', '⅓ cup warm water (100 g) plus more for feeding', 'cool water for testing', 'Special Equipment', 'clear lidded pint container or larger', 'food scale or cups and measuring spoons', 'rubber band or tape']
instructions: ['1: Day 1: Add 50 grams whole wheat flour, 50 grams bread flour, and 100 grams warm water to a clear lidded container with a capacity of 1 pint or more', '2:  Mix until there are no dry spots', '3:  Scrape down the sides of the container with a spatula', '4:  Cover with a lid', '5: Use a rubber band or piece of tape to mark the mixture level', '6:  This will allow you to track any movement (eventually it will grow!) Set the starter in a warm spot', '7:  Let sit for 24 hours', '8: Day 2: After 24 hours, open the container and look for signs of fermentation in the form of bubbles on top, volume growth, and/or a funky, slightly sweet acidic smell', '9:  If you see some of these signs, proceed to the next step', '10:  If not, cover the starter again and let sit for another 12–24 hours, until these signs appear', '11:  If the temperature in your house is cool, it may take a bit longer', '12: Once the starter has gotten a bit bubbly and funky, it is time to discard and feed', '13:  Discard all but about 25 grams (2 tablespoons) of starter (see Note below on how to minimize waste!)', '14:  Add another 100 grams warm water and stir to dissolve the remaining starter', '15:  Add 50 grams of bread flour and 50 grams of whole wheat flour and stir until there are no dry spots', '16:  Cover and let sit in a warm spot for another 24 hours', '17: Days 3–15: Repeat the feeding process every day for 7–14 days', '18:  Eventually, a few hours after feeding, the starter will begin to grow, almost doubling in size, then deflate again', '19:  Once your starter is rising and falling regularly, it is in a good place', '20: To test the readiness of the starter, do a float test: Fill a cup with cool water', '21:  Use a clean spoon to take a scoop of the starter (be careful not to stir the starter and deflate the air bubbles that make it float) and carefully plop it in the water', '22:  If it floats, it is gassy and alive and ready to make some bread! If not, don’t despair, it can take a while to get going', '23:  Either wait longer if it has only been a few hours since feeding, or if it has been closer to 24 hours since feeding, discard and feed again', '24: After passing the float test, the starter is ready to use for baking! You may find you like to use your starter when it is young, only a few hours after feeding when it just passes the float test', '25:  At this point it will smell sweet', '26:  If you want a more sour taste, use the starter 6–12 hours after feeding, when it will be more mature and smell a bit more vinegary and funky', '27:  This is up to you!Mold: If you see any fuzzy moldy spots on your starter that are black, red, or blue, unless it is very easy to scrape them off the top, unfortunately you need to start over', '28:  Sometimes, a while after feeding or being in the refrigerator, the starter will develop a dark, clear liquid on top', '29:  This is called hooch and is harmless', '30:  Just pour the liquid off!Flour: Use what you have', '31:  If you only have all-purpose flour, you can use that', '32:  If you only have bread flour, use that', '33:  If you only have whole wheat flour, you can use that, just know that you may need to feed more often because it gets funky more quickly', '34: Discard: It may be tempting not to discard most of your starter every time you feed it because you don’t want to waste, but we discard for a variety of reasons', '35:  We are giving the starter a lot of fresh food and water to eat', '36:  If we don’t discard, the starter will retain a lot of that funkiness and also eventually grow to be huge if you just keep adding water and flour to it', '37:  I like to discard into another container and keep that container in the refrigerator until I need it for other baking projects', '38:  You can fold the discard into banana bread, pancakes, cookies, etc', '39: Storage: Once your starter is up and running, you can either keep it at room temperature and feed it daily, or store it in the refrigerator', '40:  To store in the refrigerator, do a regular discard and feed, then place in the refrigerator', '41:  A day before you want to begin making bread, pull the starter out and let it come to room temperature', '42:  Then, discard and feed as usual', '43: Scaling: This starter recipe calls for equal amounts of water and total flour by weight', '44:  You can scale this recipe up or down as needed, depending on how much starter the recipe you are going to make calls for']

ingredients: ['Simple Syrup', '1 cup water (240 mL)', '1 cup sugar (200 g)', '½ cup lime juice (120 g)', '1 tablespoon lime zest', '2 cups honeydew melon (354 g) diced', '½ cup lime juice (120 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Combine 1 cup water, 1 cup sugar, lime juice, and lime zest in a pot over medium heat', '2:  Once the 1 cup sugar has dissolved, simmer for 30 minutes and reduce', '3: Pour simple syrup through a strainer and remove excess liquid, then let it cool to room temperature', '4: In a blender, combine simple syrup, 2 cups honeydew, and the remaining lime juice', '5:  Blend until well-combined', '6: Pour into an 8×8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish and freeze for at least 12 hours', '7: Take out of the freezer and let sit for 5-10 minutes before scooping', '8: Serve']

ingredients: ['Sofrito', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', '1 bunch fresh culantro', '1 medium green bell pepper seeded and roughly chopped', '5 garlics ends trimmed', '1 small yellow onion roughly chopped', '1 teaspoon adobo seasoning', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'Beef Filling', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 ½ lb ground beef (680 g) 80/20', '¼ cup spanish olive (180 g) with pimentos', '1 ½ teaspoons dried adobo seasoning', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 packet Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning 1.4 ounce (35 G)', '¼ cup tomato sauce (55 g)', 'Masa', '3 unripe bananas peeled and chopped into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces', '1 green plantain peeled and chopped in 1 in (2.5 cm) pieces', '2 lb yucca root (910 g) peeled and chopped in 1 in (2.5 cm) pieces', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 packet Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning 1.4 ounce (35 G)', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '6 cups vegetable oil (1.4 g) or neutral oil of choice for frying', 'hot sauce of choice for serving', 'Preparation', 'Sofrito', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', '1 bunch fresh culantro', '1 medium green bell pepper seeded and roughly chopped', '5 garlics ends trimmed', '1 small yellow onion roughly chopped', '1 teaspoon adobo seasoning', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'Beef Filling', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 ½ lb ground beef (680 g) 80/20', '¼ cup spanish olive (180 g) with pimentos', '1 ½ teaspoons dried adobo seasoning', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 packet Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning 1.4 ounce (35 G)', '¼ cup tomato sauce (55 g)', 'Masa', '3 unripe bananas peeled and chopped into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces', '1 green plantain peeled and chopped in 1 in (2.5 cm) pieces', '2 lb yucca root (910 g) peeled and chopped in 1 in (2.5 cm) pieces', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 packet Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning 1.4 ounce (35 G)', 'nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '6 cups vegetable oil (1.4 g) or neutral oil of choice for frying', 'hot sauce of choice for serving', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Make the sofrito: Add the cilantro, culantro, bell pepper, garlic, onion, adobo seasoning, garlic powder, and pepper to a food processor and pulse until the vegetables are broken down and the mixture has the texture of a chunky salsa', '2:  Reserve ⅓ cup (75 G) for the filling, then set aside the remaining sofrito for another use', '3:  It will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 4 months', '4: Make the filling: Heat the vegetable oil in a large, high-walled skillet over medium-high heat', '5:  When the oil is shimmering, add the reserved ⅓ cup (75 G) sofrito and cook, stirring frequently, for 1–2 minutes, until fragrant', '6: Add the ground beef, olives, adobo seasoning, garlic powder, pepper, and Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning', '7:  Cook until the beef is no longer pink, 5–6 minutes', '8: Add the tomato sauce and stir to combine', '9:  Use a slotted spoon to transfer the filling to a large bowl and set aside', '10: Make the masa: Add the bananas, plantain, and yucca to a food processor and pulse until completely smooth, stopping the push the larger pieces to the bottom as you go', '11:  Transfer to a  large bowl and add the garlic powder, salt, and Sazón Culantro and Achiote seasoning', '12:  Mix well to combine', '13: To assemble, grease an 8 x 12-inch (20 x 30 cm)  sheet of parchment paper with nonstick spray', '14:  Add about ⅔ cup (155 G) masa to the center of the parchment paper', '15:  Using a rubber spatula, spread the masa into an oval about ⅓-inch thick, leaving a 1–2-inch (2', '16: 5-5 cm) border of parchment around the edges', '17: Scoop ⅓ cup (75 G) beef filling onto the center of the masa, leaving a 2-inch (5 cm) border of masa around the meat', '18:  Lift a long edge of the parchment paper up and over the filling to enclose with the masa, then repeat with the other side, then the short edges', '19:  The masa should stick to itself', '20:  Patch any holes with more masa, then use the parchment to gently roll the alcapurria from side to side to seal, making sure the filling is completely enclosed', '21:  Repeat with the remaining ingredients', '22: Heat the vegetable oil in a large, high-walled skillet to 350°F (180°C) over medium heat', '23:  Working with 1 wrapped alcapurria at a time, lower a long edge of the parchment into the oil and very gently roll the alcapurria off so it sits flat-side down, being careful not to splatter the oil', '24:  Add another alcapurria and fry for 2–3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy', '25:  Use tongs or a slotted spoon to transfer to a paper-towel lined plate to drain and cool slightly while you repeat with the remaining alcapurrias', '26: Serve immediately with hot sauce for dipping']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '10 oz baby bella mushroom (275 g) quartered', '1 yellow onion diced', '3 carrots chopped', '2 celery stalks chopped', '2 cloves garlic minced', '½ teaspoon dried rosemary', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon pepper', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce', '¼ cup flour (30 g)', '¾ cup dry red wine (180 mL)', '4 cups red potato (900 g) diced', '4 cups vegetable broth (960 mL)', '2 leaves bay leaf']
instructions: ['1: In large pot or Dutch oven, heat the 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat', '2:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, or until most of their juices have been released', '3: Add the onions, 3 carrots, and 2 celery, and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until onions are semi-translucent', '4: Add the 2 cloves garlic, ½ teaspoon dried rosemary, ½ teaspoon dried thyme, ½ teaspoon pepper, 3 tablespoons tomato paste, and soy sauce, and cook for 2-3 more minutes, until the herbs are fragrant', '5: Add the ¼ cup flour and stir until fully incorporated', '6:  Add the ¾ cup dry red wine and stir until mostly absorbed', '7: Add the potatoes, 4 cups vegetable broth, and bay 2 leaves, and bring to a boil', '8:  Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and the stew has thickened', '9: Remove the bay 2 leaves']

ingredients: ['1 lb chicken (400 g) cut into cubes', '1 egg', '4 teaspoons garlic chopped', '2 teaspoons pepper', '2 teaspoons cornflour', '3 green chiles', '2 coriander roots chopped', '2 lemongrass chopped', '1 large onion cut into cubes', '1 teaspoon dark soy sauce', '1 chicken stock cube', '1 teaspoon light soy sauce', '4 teaspoons green chilli sauce', '2 teaspoons vinegar', '4 button mushrooms cut into pieces', 'For green chili sauce:', '4 green chiles', '½ green bell pepper', '2 tablespoons onion chopped', '2 tablespoons ginger chopped', '½ tablespoon cumin', '2 tablespoons tamarind pulp', '4 teaspoons sugar (or 2 tsp sugar syrup)', 'salt to taste', '2 teaspoons oil', '1 teaspoon rice vinegar']
instructions: ['1: At first, for the chili sauce, put the 2 teaspoons oil in a pan and add the green chillies, half of one green 2 teaspoons ½ green bell pepper, onion, 2 tablespoons ginger, and ½ tablespoon cumin and pan-fry', '2:  After the 2 teaspoons ½ green bell pepper has softened and cooked a little, add the 2 tablespoons tamarind pulp and mix', '3:  Add the 4 teaspoons sugar and salt simultaneously and let simmer for about five minutes', '4: After the mixture has simmered, add 2 teaspoons 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon rice vinegar and blend', '5: Then, add the 1 egg, salt, 4 teaspoons garlic, 2 teaspoons ½ green bell pepper and 2 teaspoons cornflour and mix well', '6: Take the mix and put in a hot pan, without any 2 teaspoons oil', '7:  The 1 egg will start thickening up', '8: In another pan, take some 2 teaspoons oil and add the chillies, 2 coriander roots, 2 lemongrass, onion, 4 teaspoons garlic and saute', '9: Add the chicken cubes and 1 teaspoon lightly stir', '10:  Then, add 1 teaspoon light soy sauce, 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce, green chilli sauce, stock cube and the mushroom', '11: Let simmer for about 10 minutes', '12:  Then add 2 teaspoons 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon rice vinegar', '13: Garnish with lemon and serve alongside 1 teaspoon rice, naan, or roti']

ingredients: ['8 oz pad thai noodle (250 g) or noodles of your choice', '2 tablespoons sesame oil divided', '2 eggs', '1 chicken breast diced', '¼ cup shallot (25 g)', '¾ cup pad thai sauce (175 mL) we used 2 tablespoons each of fish sauce rice vinegar soy sauce brown sugar lime juice and sriracha', '1 cup bean sprout (100 g)', '½ cup peanuts (65 g) crushed plus more for garnish', '¼ cup green onion (25 g) plus more for garnish', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g) plus more for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Cook the noodles according to the package instructions', '2: Toss with 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons sesame oil and set aside', '3: Add ½ teaspoon of 2 tablespoons sesame oil to a pot with the lightly beaten 2 eggs', '4:  When the 2 eggs are finished cooking, set aside', '5: Pour the remaining ½ tablespoon of 2 tablespoons sesame oil into the pot and add the diced 1 chicken breast', '6:  Cook until no longer pink in the middle, then set aside', '7: Add the shallots to the pot and cook until lightly browned and fragrant', '8:  Then, add the noodles, 2 eggs, and 1 chicken back into the pot', '9: Pour in the pad Thai sauce and toss to coat', '10: Top with the 1 cup bean sprouts, crushed ½ cup peanuts, ¼ cup green onions, and ¼ cup fresh cilantro, and stir until well blended', '11: Dish up and garnish with extra ½ cup peanuts, ¼ cup green onions, and ¼ cup fresh cilantro']

ingredients: ['10 oz rice noodle (285 g) dried narrow and flat', 'warm water for soaking ', '1 tablespoon whole black peppercorn', '1 tablespoon coriander seed', '4 pods whole star anise', '1 piece fresh ginger 2 inch (5 cm) piece', '1 bunch green onion', '4 cups hot water (960 mL)', '8 cups chicken broth (2 L)', '1 lb chicken breast (455 g) halved crosswise', '¼ cup fish sauce (60 mL)', 'For Serving', '2 limes', '1 jalapeño', '1 bean sprout', '1 bunch fresh thai basil', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', '1 siracha', 'hoisin sauce', 'Preparation', '10 oz rice noodle (285 g) dried narrow and flat', 'warm water for soaking ', '1 tablespoon whole black peppercorn', '1 tablespoon coriander seed', '4 pods whole star anise', '1 piece fresh ginger 2 inch (5 cm) piece', '1 bunch green onion', '4 cups hot water (960 mL)', '8 cups chicken broth (2 L)', '1 lb chicken breast (455 g) halved crosswise', '¼ cup fish sauce (60 mL)', 'For Serving', '2 limes', '1 jalapeño', '1 bean sprout', '1 bunch fresh thai basil', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', '1 siracha', 'hoisin sauce', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Place the rice noodles in a large heatproof bowl', '2:  Cover with warm water and soak for 20 minutes, until softened', '3: While the noodles are soaking, heat a large pot over medium-high heat', '4:  Toast the black peppercorns, coriander seeds, and star anise pods for 2 minutes, until fragrant', '5: While the seeds are toasting, peel the ginger and cut into pieces', '6:   Trim the ends off the green onions, then chop 5 inches off the bases and save the remaining green tops for later', '7: Add the ginger and green onion bases to the pot and cook for 2 minutes, or until fragrant', '8: Add the water, chicken broth, and chicken breasts', '9:  Increase the heat to high, cover, and bring to a simmer', '10:  Cook for 5 more minutes, then check the chicken every minute until cooked through', '11:  Remove from the heat', '12: While the broth heats up, thinly slice the green onion tops', '13:  Cut the lime into wedges', '14:  Thinly slice the jalapeño', '15: After 20 minutes of soaking, drain the rice noodles, then return to the bowl', '16: Remove the chicken from the broth', '17: Strain the broth over the noodles', '18:  Pour the noodles and broth back into the pot over high heat, then add the fish sauce', '19:  Cover and cook for 3 minutes', '20: Shred the chicken', '21: Divide the noodles between four serving bowls and top with the shredded chicken, jalapeño, bean sprouts, and Thai basil', '22:  Ladle the hot pho broth over the noodles', '23:  Add a squeeze of lime, green onions, and any other favorite toppings']

ingredients: ['1 teaspoon grated ginger', '2 cloves garlic minced', '3 tablespoons ketchup', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons oyster sauce', '2 chicken breasts diced', '1 red bell pepper chopped', '½ cup spring onion (50 g) chopped', '2 ½ cups bean sprout (250 g)', '1 pack fresh egg noodle', 'muffin tin']
instructions: ['1: To make the sauce, mix the 1 teaspoon grated ginger, 2 cloves garlic, 3 tablespoons ketchup, 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 tablespoons oyster sauce in a small bowl until combined', '2:  Set asideFry the 2 chicken until cooked through', '3: Add the 1 red pepper and ½ cup spring onion and fry for 2 minutes', '4: Add the beansprouts and fry for a further 3-4 minutes', '5: Add the sauce and fry for another minute or two', '6: Add noodles to each hole of the muffin tin and pat down to make a small indent', '7: Bake for 15 minutes at 180°C (350°F)', '8: Remove nests from muffin tin', '9: Spoon the chow mien onto the baked noodles']

ingredients: ['2 lb yukon gold potato (910 g) peeled and cut into 1/2 in (1 1/2 cm)', 'cold water for cooking potatoes', '1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt divided', '1 top sirloin steak', '1 ½ teaspoons freshly ground black pepper divided', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter divided', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '½ small yellow onion thinly sliced', '8 oz cremini mushroom (225 g) steemed and quartered', '1 small red bell pepper seeded and diced', '1 teaspoon fresh oregano chopped', '1 cup cherry tomato (200 g) halved', '4 large eggs', '1 tablespoon fresh parsley minced']
instructions: ['1: Add the potatoes to a 4 large pot and fill with enough cold water to cover by 1 inch (2 ½ cm)', '2:  Season with 1½ 1 ½ 1 ½ 1 teaspoons of 1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat', '3:  Boil for 5 minutes, then drain and run under cold water to stop the potatoes from cooking further', '4:  Dry the potatoes with paper towels and set aside', '5: Place a rack in the lower third of the oven', '6:  Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)Blot the 1 top sirloin steak dry with a paper towel and season on both sides with 1½ 1 ½ 1 ½ 1 teaspoons of 1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt and 1 1 ½ 1 teaspoon black pepper', '7: Heat a 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet over high heat until smoking', '8:  Reduce the heat to medium-high', '9:  Add 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons unsalted butter and the canola oil to the pan and melt the 2 tablespoons unsalted butter completely, about 1 minute', '10:  Add the seasoned 1 top sirloin steak and cook, without disturbing, for 2 minutes on each side', '11:  The 1 top sirloin steak will be rare, but will finish cooking in the oven', '12:  Transfer to a cutting board to rest for at least 5 minutes before slicing into ¼-inch (6 mm) strips', '13: Reduce the heat to medium and melt the remaining tablespoon of 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in the same skillet', '14:  Add the ½ small yellow onion, mushrooms, 1 small red bell pepper, and ½ 1 ½ 1 teaspoon of 1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt', '15:  Cook, stirring occasionally, until the ½ small yellow onions are slightly caramelized and the mushrooms have released their liquid, 8–10 minutes', '16: Add the potatoes to the skillet and season with the remaining 1 ½ 1 teaspoon of 1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt, ¼ 1 ½ 1 teaspoon black pepper, and the oregano', '17:  Stir to combine and cook, without disturbing, for 4 minutes, until the potatoes are golden brown and crisp on one side', '18:  Add the 1 cup cherry tomatoes and stir to combine', '19: Make 4 wells in the hash using the back of a spoon and carefully crack an egg into each well', '20: Scatter the sliced 1 top sirloin steak on top of the hash and transfer to the oven', '21:  Bake for 10 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny', '22: Remove the hash from the oven and season with the remaining ¼ 1 ½ 1 teaspoon pepper', '23:  Garnish with the parsley', '24: Serve warm']

ingredients: ['Pie Dough', '2 ½ cups flour (315 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ½ sticks butter 1 1/2 sticks cold cubed', '8 tablespoons ice water or as needed', 'Filling', '2 ½ lb granny smith apple (1 kg) cored sliced peeled', '¾ cup sugar (150 g)', '2 tablespoons flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '½ lemon', '1 egg beaten', '1 tablespoon sugar', 'Topping', '1 scoop vanilla ice cream']
instructions: ['1: In a medium-sized bowl, add the flour and salt', '2:  Mix with fork until combined', '3: Add in cubed 1 ½ sticks butter and break up into flour with a fork', '4:  Mixture will still have lumps about the size of small peas', '5: Gradually add the ice water and continue to mix until the dough starts to come together', '6:  You may not need all of the water, but if the dough is too dry then add more', '7:  The dough should not be very tacky or sticky', '8: Work the dough together with your hands and turn out onto a surface', '9:  Work into a ball and cover with cling wrap', '10:  Refrigerate', '11: Peel the 2 ½ lb granny smith apples, then core and slice', '12: In a bowl, add the sliced 2 ½ lb granny smith apples, sugar, flour, salt, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon nutmeg, and juice from the ½ lemon', '13: Mix until combined and all 2 ½ lb granny smith apples are coated', '14:  Refrigerate', '15: Preheat the oven to 375°F (200°C)', '16: On a floured surface, cut the pie dough in half and roll out both halves until round and about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick', '17: Roll the dough around the rolling pin and unroll onto a pie dish making sure the dough reaches all edges', '18:  Trim extra if necessary', '19: Pour in 2 ½ lb granny smith apple filling mixture and pat down', '20: Roll the other half of the dough on top', '21: Trim the extra dough from the edges and pinch the edges to create a crimp', '22:  Make sure edges are sealed together', '23: Brush the pie with the beaten 1 egg and sprinkle with the sugar', '24: Cut four slits in the top of the pie to create a vent', '25: Bake pie for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and no greyish or undercooked pastry remains', '26: Allow to cool completely before slicing', '27: Top with ice cream and serve']

ingredients: ['2 eggs', 'salt to taste', '1 tablespoon shredded parmesan cheese', '½ tablespoon butter', '3 slices ham', '2 tablespoons scallion sliced', '¼ cup shredded cheddar cheese (25 g)']
instructions: ['1: In a medium size bowl, whisk the 2 eggs, salt, and Parmesan until well combined', '2: In a medium size saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the ½ tablespoon butter and pour the egg mixture into the pan', '3:  Let the egg cook just until it starts to set, then add the 3 slices ham, scallions, and ¼ cup shredded cheddar cheese in the center of the egg wrap', '4: Cover with a lid and cook for another 3 minutes, or until the egg is fully cooked through and the cheese is melted', '5: Remove from the pan and fold in the egg wrap’s left and right sides, then roll from the bottom to the top to form a burrito']

ingredients: ['1 head cauliflower', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese (50 g)', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon dried basil', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 egg']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 500˚F (260˚C)', '2: Remove the leaves and stem of the 1 head cauliflower', '3: Transfer pieces to a food processor and rice the 1 head cauliflower by pulsing it in the food processor, or by shredding it on a box grater', '4: Once riced, transfer to a large bowl and microwave for 4 minutes', '5:  Let it cool down for a few minutes before handling!Transfer cooked 1 head cauliflower to a clean towel and wring out as much liquid as possible', '6: Place wrung 1 head cauliflower in a bowl and combine with ½ cup shredded mozzarella, ½ teaspoon dried oregano, ½ teaspoon dried basil, ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, and an 1 egg', '7:  Mix well', '8: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '9: Place 1 head cauliflower mixture in the middle', '10:  Spread out the mixture and form a circle out of the 1 head cauliflower mixture, pushing along the edge to raise a “crust', '11: ”Bake for 15 minutes, or until the crust has become golden brown in the center and on the edges', '12: Top with your favorite pizza sauce and toppings, being careful not to overload the pizza', '13: Bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese has fully melted']

ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour (250 g)', '3 eggs', '¼ cup butter (55 g) melted', '3 tablespoons granulated sugar', '3 cups milk (710 mL)', '1 cup raspberry (125 g)', '1 cup blueberry (100 g)', '1 cup blackberry (150 g)', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '¼ cup powdered sugar (40 g)', '8 oz cream cheese (225 g) 1 block softened', 'powdered sugar to garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, combine 2 cups all-purpose flour, 3 eggs, butter, and 3 tablespoons granulated ¼ cup ¼ cup ¼ cup powdered powdered sugar, stirring until ingredients are slightly mixed', '2: Add the 3 cups milk ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure the 3 cups milk is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more 3 cups milk', '3: Repeat with the rest of the 3 cups milk', '4:  The batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps', '5: In a pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (95 g) of the batter in the center and swirl the batter around the edges of the pan until set', '6: To know when the crepe is ready to flip, lift up one of the edges about ⅓ of the way', '7:  The bottom side should be golden brown', '8:  Flip the crepe', '9: Cook until the edges are starting to slightly crisp', '10: Remove from heat and cover with a paper towel to make sure the crepes stay moist', '11: In a pot over medium heat, combine all the berries with the 2 tablespoons lemon juice and the 3 tablespoons granulated ¼ cup ¼ cup ¼ cup powdered powdered sugar, stirring until the mixture comes to a boil', '12: Cook for about 2 minutes, then remove from heat and cool completely', '13: Mix the 8 oz cream cheese with the ¼ cup powdered 3 tablespoons granulated ¼ cup ¼ cup ¼ cup powdered powdered sugar until smooth', '14: Spread half of the 8 oz cream cheese mixture on one side of the crepe', '15: Spread half of the berries on top of the 8 oz cream cheese', '16: Fold the crepe over the berries, then fold in half', '17: Repeat with the other crepe', '18: Serve with ¼ cup powdered 3 tablespoons granulated ¼ cup ¼ cup ¼ cup powdered powdered sugar']

ingredients: ['1 lb fresh strawberry  (455 g)', '1 cup white chocolate (175 g)', '1 cup milk chocolate (175 g) or dark', '2 tablespoons coconut oil', '1 ½ cups crushed peanut (190 g)', '1 ½ cups chocolate cookie crumb (190 g)']
instructions: ['1: To make Striped Strawberries, melt 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons coconut oil with chocolate chips, repeat with the 1 cup white chocolate chips', '2: Insert toothpick into the top of a 1 lb fresh strawberry', '3: Coat 1 lb fresh strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between 1 cup white and dark', '4: Chill strawberries for about 15 minutes or until hardened', '5: For 1 cup white chocolate strawberries drizzle dark chocolate over the top in a quick back and forth motion', '6:  For dark chocolate strawberries, do the same with 1 cup white chocolate drizzle', '7: Chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened', '8: To make Peanut Strawberries', '9:  Melt 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons coconut oil with the chocolate chips, repeat with the 1 cup white chocolate chips', '10:  Insert toothpick into the top of a 1 lb fresh strawberry', '11:  Put 1 ½ cups crushed peanuts in a bag and smash with rolling pin or cast-iron pan until they are crumbly', '12: Coat 1 lb fresh strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between 1 cup white and dark', '13: Dip 1 lb fresh strawberry, while the chocolate is still warm, into a bowl of nuts', '14: Chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened', '15: To make Cookie-Coated Strawberries', '16:  Melt 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons coconut oil with  the chocolate chips, repeat with the 1 cup white chocolate chips', '17:  Insert toothpick into the top of a 1 lb fresh strawberry', '18:  Separate chocolate sandwich cookies in a bag and smash with rolling pin or cast iron pan until they are crumbly', '19: Coat 1 lb fresh strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between 1 cup white and dark', '20: Dip 1 lb fresh strawberry, while the chocolate is still warm, into a bowl of cookie crumbs', '21: Chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened', '22: To make Tuxedo Strawberries', '23:  Melt 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons coconut oil with the chocolate chips, repeat with the 1 cup white chocolate chips', '24:  Insert toothpick into the top of a 1 lb fresh strawberry', '25: Coat strawberries entirely in 1 cup white chocolate', '26: Chill strawberries for about 15 minutes or until hardened', '27: To form the tuxedo, dip one side of the 1 cup white chocolate coated 1 lb fresh strawberry into dark chocolate at an angle, going to the top of 1 cup white chocolate coating', '28:  Repeat on the other side, leaving a 1 cup white “V” in the center of the 1 lb fresh strawberry', '29: With a toothpick, draw a bowtie and buttons with remaining melted dark chocolate', '30: Chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened']

ingredients: ['½ red onion', '½ large english cucumber', '½ cup fresh parsley', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz kidney bean (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '15 oz cannellini bean (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', '¼ cup red wine vinegar (60 mL)', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Thinly slice the ½ ¼ cup red onion and add to a ½ large bowl', '2: Quarter the cucumber, remove the seeds and dice, then add to the bowl with the ½ ¼ cup red onion', '3: Use a fork to remove the leaves from the parsley, then finely chop and add to the bowl', '4: Add the 15 oz chickpeas, 15 oz kidney beans, and 15 oz cannellini beans to the bowl', '5: In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the olive oil, ½ ¼ cup red wine vinegar, ½ teaspoon dried oregano, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper, and whisk together', '6: Pour the dressing over the salad and mix well until evenly distributed']

ingredients: ['2 cups long grain white rice (400 g)', '1 can black beans', '4 cloves garlic crushed with salt', '½ lb pork belly (225 g) diced as small as possible', '1 piece bacon cut in small pieces', '1 piece sausage diced', '1 onion diced', '½ green bell pepper chopped as small as possible', 'oregano', 'cumin', '1 bay leaf', '½ tablespoon sugar', '½ tablespoon white vinegar', 'vegetable oil', 'salt to taste']
instructions: ['1: In a pressure cooker on medium heat, saute ½ lb pork belly (225 g) 1 piece sausage 1 onion diced ½ lb pork belly until pieces are crunchy and have released all the grease', '2: Increase heat to medium-high, add 1 piece sausage and 1 piece bacon, and cook thoroughly', '3:  Once cooked through, add the ½ green pepper, fry, and add onions and stir until transparent', '4: Lower heat to Medium, add crushed 4 cloves garlic and rice, and mix thoroughly', '5:  To this add cumin, oregano, and any other desired spices', '6: Next, add the 1 can black beans (without draining), 2 2 cups of water, 1 bay leaf, and ½ tablespoon white vinegar and mix', '7:  Season with 4 cloves garlic crushed with salt or seasoning as necessary', '8: Cover and cook on medium for 15-20 minutes, then let rest', '9: Serve warm']

ingredients: ['3 chicken breasts cubed', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon garlic crushed', '½ cup soy sauce (118 mL)', '⅓ cup honey (113 g)', '1 ½ tablespoons sesame seed more to garnish', '1 onion sliced', '2 small bell peppers thinly sliced', '2 cups broccoli (500 g)', '1 green onion thinly sliced', 'white rice cooked']
instructions: ['1: In a pan, cook cut 3 chicken over medium-high heat until almost done', '2:  Salt and 2 small bell pepper to taste', '3: Reduce heat to medium and stir in the crushed 1 teaspoon garlic', '4: Add in the ½ cup soy sauce, ⅓ cup honey, and 1 tablespoon of the 1 ½ tablespoons sesame seeds', '5:  Stir until thickened', '6: Remove the 3 chicken from the pan, leaving the sauce, and add the vegetables to the pan', '7: Cover the pan for several minutes and cook until the vegetables begin to soften, then remove the lid and stir until the sauce is thick again', '8: Split the white rice, vegetables, and 3 chicken evenly between 4 containers', '9:  Top with a sprinkle of 1 ½ tablespoons sesame seeds and 1 1 1 green onion 2 small bell peppers thinly 1 1 green onion thinly sliced 1 green 1 1 1 green onion', '10:  Refrigerate for up to 4 days']

ingredients: ['2 butternut squashes peeled seeded and cut into 2 in (5 cm) cubes', '4 tablespoons olive oil divided', '2 ½ teaspoons kosher salt divided', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter divided', '1 large white onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon fresh sage chopped', '1 cup dry white wine (240 mL)', '8 cups vegetable broth (1.9 L)', '½ cup heavy cream (120 mL) plus more for serving', '½ cup walnuts (50 g) toasted', '8 teaspoons chive oil for serving', 'Chive Oil', '2 cups ice (280 g)', '8 cups water (1.9 L) divided', '½ oz fresh chives (15 g)', '¾ cup neutral oil (180 mL)', 'Preparation', '2 butternut squashes peeled seeded and cut into 2 in (5 cm) cubes', '4 tablespoons olive oil divided', '2 ½ teaspoons kosher salt divided', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter divided', '1 large white onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon fresh sage chopped', '1 cup dry white wine (240 mL)', '8 cups vegetable broth (1.9 L)', '½ cup heavy cream (120 mL) plus more for serving', '½ cup walnuts (50 g) toasted', '8 teaspoons chive oil for serving', 'Chive Oil', '2 cups ice (280 g)', '8 cups water (1.9 L) divided', '½ oz fresh chives (15 g)', '¾ cup neutral oil (180 mL)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200°C)', '2: In a large bowl, toss the butternut squash with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 teaspoon of salt until well coated', '3:  Spread the squash in a single layer on an unlined baking sheet', '4: Roast the squash for 60–70 minutes, until completely tender and just beginning to brown on the edges', '5: Once the squash has been roasting for 40 minutes, start the soup: In a large stock pot, melt 2 tablespoons of butter and the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat', '6:  Add the onion and season with 1 teaspoon of salt', '7:  Sauté for 8–10 minutes, until the onion is translucent and fragrant', '8: Add the garlic and sage and stir to combine', '9:  Sauté for another 8–10 minutes, until the onions are beginning to caramelize slightly', '10:  Add the white wine and cook for 2–4 minutes, until reduced by about half', '11: Add the squash to the pot, along with the vegetable broth', '12:  Increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil', '13:  Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium-low', '14:  Simmer for 15–20 minutes, until the squash is completely broken down', '15: Remove the pot from the heat', '16:  Stir in the heavy cream and remaining 2 tablespoons of butter', '17:  Using an immersion blender, blend until the soup is completely smooth and creamy', '18:  Season with the remaining ½ teaspoon of salt,  plus more to taste', '19: Ladle the hot soup into bowls', '20:  Top with the toasted walnuts, a drizzle of heavy cream, and a drizzle of chive oil', '21: To make the chive oil, combine the ice and 3 cups (720 ml) of water in a medium bowl', '22:  Set near the stovetop', '23: Add the remaining 3 cups (720 ml) of water to a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat', '24:  Add the chives to the simmering water and blanch for 30 seconds, then strain', '25:  Transfer the strainer directly to the ice bath to halt the cooking process', '26:  Let the chives cool for 1 minute, then drain on paper towels', '27: Add the chives and oil to a liquid measuring cup or other tall, narrow container', '28:  Using an immersion blender, blend until the chives are completely broken down', '29:  Do not overblend, as the chives can turn brown', '30: Place a damp paper towel inside a strainer and set over a medium bowl', '31:  Pour the chive oil through the strainer to remove any remaining solids', '32: Use the chive oil as desired', '33:  It will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 months']

ingredients: ['4 cups chickpeas (800 g)', '1 medium onion finely diced', '½ cup crushed tomato (100 g) (or 2 fresh Roma tomatoes diced)', '2 tablespoons ginger grated', '3 cloves garlic', '1 cup water (240 mL) (adjust as needed)', '2 tablespoons avocado oil', '2 whole bay leaves', '2 whole dry chili peppers', 'cinnamon stick piece', '½ teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon turmeric', '2 teaspoons paprika', 'red chili powder (optional to add spice)', '2 teaspoons chana masala powder (optional not required)']
instructions: ['1: Heat 2 tablespoons avocado oil in a pan', '2:  To this, add 2 whole bay leaves, 2 whole dry chili pepper, cinnamon sticks and whole ½ teaspoon cumin seeds', '3: Once ½ teaspoon cumin seeds start to sizzle, add diced 1 medium onion and cook until slightly brown and translucent', '4: Lower the heat and add the ½ cup crushed or fresh tomatoes, 2 tablespoons ginger and 3 cloves garlic and mix well', '5: Add 1 teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon turmeric, 2 teaspoons paprika, red chili powder, 2 teaspoons chana masala mix and 1 cup water', '6:  Mix well', '7: Let simmer for about 5 minutes with lid on', '8: Add cooked 4 cups chickpeas, mix well and let cook for 7-10 minutes until 4 cups chickpeas are softened', '9: Serve alongside basmati (white) rice, naan or roti']

ingredients: ['3 medium eggplants', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', 'sea salt to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly ground pepper plus more to taste', '¼ cup coconut oil (60 mL)', '½ medium white onion chopped', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cardamom', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 tablespoon ground turmeric', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon ginger peeled and minced', '3 roma tomatoes Ripe Diced Medium size', '15 oz coconut milk (425 mL)', '½ cup water (120 mL)', 'cooked rice for serving', 'fresh cilantro chopped for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400ºF (200ºC)', '2: Slice the tops off the eggplants, then slice them in half lengthwise', '3:  Cut each half once more lengthwise', '4:  Lay the slices on their flat sides and cut lengthwise into thirds', '5:  Finally, slice horizontally to form cubes', '6: Transfer to a baking sheet, drizzle with the ¼ cup olive oil, sea salt, and pepper', '7:  Bake for 25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden brown', '8: In a large saucepan, heat the coconut oil over high hat', '9:  Add the onions, stir for 1 minute, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are golden brown, about 8 minutes', '10: Stir in the chili powder, cardamom, and smoked paprika', '11:  Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute', '12:  Stir in the ground coriander, ½ teaspoon of black pepper, turmeric, 3 cloves garlic, and ginger', '13:  Cook for a few minutes more, stirring constantly', '14: Add the chopped 3 roma tomatoes, coconut milk, ½ cup water, and the roasted eggplant', '15: Bring the curry to a simmer, then reduce to low heat, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes', '16:  The sauce should reduce and thicken slightly', '17: Serve the curry warm over cooked rice, topped with chopped fresh cilantro']

ingredients: ['Pesto Sauce', '2 cups fresh basil leaves (80 g)', '½ cup olive oil (120 mL)', '½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g)', '1 tablespoon almond butter', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '2 cloves garlic smashed', '2 teaspoons lemon zest', 'kosher salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Pasta', 'kosher salt to taste', '4 cups pasta (800 g) short such as farfalle or penne', '1 cup grape tomato (200 g) halved', '1 cup yellow cherry tomato (200 g) halved', '¼ cup red onion (35 g) sliced', '8 oz mozzarella ball (225 g) drained']
instructions: ['1: Add the 2 cups fresh basil, ½ cup olive oil, Parmesan, 1 tablespoon almond butter, lemon juice, 2 cloves garlic, lemon zest, salt, and pepper to a blender', '2:  Blend until smooth and set aside', '3: Cook the 4 cups pasta according to the package instructions', '4: Drain and transfer the 4 cups pasta to a large serving bowl', '5: Add the 1 cup grape tomatoes, 1 cup yellow tomatoes, ¼ cup red onion, and 8 oz mozzarella balls to the 4 cups pasta', '6: Pour the pesto sauce over the 4 cups pasta', '7: Toss the ingredients together', '8: Serve warm in a bowl', '9: Enjoy!\n\nAdapted from The Minimalist Kitchen by Melissa Coleman', '10:  Copyright © 2018 Oxmoor House', '11:  Reprinted with permission from Time Inc', '12:  Books, a division of Meredith Corporation', '13:  New York, NY', '14:  All rights reserved']

ingredients: ['Octopus Salad', '1 teaspoon orange zest', '2 tablespoons fresh orange juice', '1 teaspoon ginger juice', '1 small clove garlic grated', '2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce', '1 ½ teaspoons toasted sesame oil', '2 tablespoons unsweetened mirin', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 fresno chilie seeded and minced', '½ teaspoon sugar', '1 tablespoon olive oil plus 1½ teaspoons', '1 ¼ teaspoons kosher salt', '¾ lb frozen cooked octopus (340 g) thawed cut into ¼-inch (6 mm) rounds', 'micro cilantro for serving', 'Mignonette Sauce', '1 small shallot minced', '½ cup red wine vinegar (120 mL)', '½ teaspoon crushed black peppercorns', 'Crab Dip', '2 tablespoons cream cheese', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons old bay seasoning', '⅛ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 ½ teaspoons prepared horseradish', '1 teaspoon lemon zest', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '3 dashes worcestershire sauce', '½ lb fresh crab meat (225 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh chives plus more for garnish', '1 ¼ teaspoons kosher salt', 'Oysters', '8 fresh oysters', 'Assembly', '6 cups crushed ice (840 g) plus more as needed', '2 butter lettuce leaves', '½ lb prepared ahi poke salad (225 g)', '1 lb lox (455 g)', '1 lb cocktail shrimp (455 g) tails on', '½ cup cocktail sauce (160 g)', '2 tablespoons prepared horseradish', '½ cup seaweed salad (70 g)', '4 slices grilled bread', '8 crackers of choice', '1 english cucumber sliced on the diagonal into 1/4 in (6mm) rounds', '½ lb crab claws (225 g)', '1 blood orange sliced', '1 cup pickled vegetable (150 g) such as peppadews and onion', '1 tablespoon caper drained', 'decoratively cut lemon', 'Special Equipment', 'oyster knife', '2 baking sheets 26 x 18-inch (66 x 45 cm)', 'brown butchers paper']
instructions: ['1: The day before serving, make the ¾ lb frozen cooked octopus salad: In a large bowl, whisk together the orange zest, orange juice, 1 teaspoon ginger juice, 1 small clove ⅛ teaspoon garlic, 2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce, 1 ½ teaspoons toasted sesame oil, 2 tablespoons unsweetened mirin, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, jalapeño, ½ teaspoon sugar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and salt', '2:  Add the ¾ lb frozen cooked octopus and toss to coat', '3:  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate the ¾ lb frozen cooked octopus in the refrigerator overnight', '4: Make the mignonette sauce: In a small serving bowl, stir together the shallot, ½ cup red wine vinegar, and crushed black peppercorns', '5:  Refrigerate until ready to serve', '6: Make the crab dip', '7:  In a medium bowl, stir together the 2 tablespoons cream cheese, 1 tablespoon mayonnaise, Old Bay seasoning, 1 small clove ⅛ teaspoon garlic powder, horseradish, lemon zest and juice, Worcestershire sauce, and salt', '8:  Mix well', '9:  Gently fold in the crab meat and 2 tablespoons fresh chives, then season with the salt', '10:  Refrigerate until ready to serve', '11: Shuck the 8 fresh 8 fresh oysters: Wrap a kitchen towel around your hand and an 8 fresh oyster, leaving the pointed end of the 8 fresh oyster exposed', '12:  Using an 8 fresh oyster knife, carefully wedge the knife into one side of the point and use firm, even pressure to twist to open the 8 fresh oyster', '13:  Unwrap the 8 fresh oyster from the towel, then use the knife to work around the top shell, disconnecting the muscle', '14:  Remove the top shell and gently run the knife along the bottom shell to release the 8 fresh oyster', '15:  Repeat with the remaining 8 fresh 8 fresh oysters', '16:  Arrange the 8 fresh 8 fresh oysters in the bottom shells on a small platter of crushed ice with the mignonette sauce and a lemon half', '17: Assemble the board: Spread the crushed ice on a 26 x 18-inch 2 baking sheet', '18:  Top with the other 2 baking sheet', '19:  Line with butcher’s brown butchers paper', '20: Transfer the ¾ lb frozen cooked octopus salad to a serving dish and garnish with the micro cilantro, then place on the pan, along with the 8 fresh oyster platter', '21:  Transfer the crab dip to a serving dish and place on the pan, then garnish with 2 tablespoons fresh chives', '22:  Add the 2 butter lettuce leaves, then top with the ahi poke salad', '23:  Arrange the 1 lb lox, cocktail shrimp, cocktail sauce, prepared horseradish, ½ cup seaweed salad, grilled bread, 8 crackers, 1 english cucumber, crab claws, 1 blood orange 4 slices, and 1 cup pickled vegetables', '24:  Top the 1 lb lox with the capers', '25:  Add the lemons to the pan', '26: Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['4 chicken breasts', '4 rashers bacon chopped', '2 spring onions chopped', '½ cup cream cheese (100 g)']
instructions: ['1: Slice into the 4 chicken several times, about ½ cm (¼ inch) apart, but only cut about 85% of the way through, leaving the bottom intact', '2: Cook the 4 rashers bacon over a medium heat until it starts to get crispy', '3: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '4: Stir in the 2 spring onions and cook for another minute or so', '5: Add the ½ cup cream cheese and cook until melted', '6: Allow filling to cool to the touch, and then fill each segment of the 4 chicken breast with about 1 teaspoon of the mixture', '7: Bake in the centre of the oven for 18-22 minutes until the 4 chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear']

ingredients: ['1 ½ cups sweet potato (300 g) diced', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 teaspoons paprika', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'olive oil to taste', '½ cup pumpkin seeds (65 g)', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons maple syrup divided', '½ cup tahini (110 g)', '1 ½ tablespoons lemon juice', '3 tablespoons water', '1 bunch kale stemmed and torn into large pieces', '3 cups quinoa (510 g)', '½ cup red onion (75 g) diced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Add the 1 ½ cups sweet potatoes to a baking sheet', '3:  Sprinkle with the ½ teaspoon garlic powder, 2 teaspoons paprika, salt, and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil', '4:  Toss until the 1 ½ cups sweet potato is well-coated in the spices, then spread out evenly', '5:  Bake for 15 minutes, or until tender', '6: In a small bowl, add the pumpkin seeds, 2 teaspoons chili powder, 1 tablespoon 2 tablespoons maple syrup, and salt, and mix until well-combined', '7:  Spread the pumpkin seeds out on a baking sheet so they’re not touching each other', '8: Add to the oven with the 1 ½ cups sweet potato and bake for 10 minutes, stirring halfway through, until toasted', '9: In a liquid measuring cup, combine the tahini, remaining tablespoon of 2 tablespoons maple syrup, 1 ½ tablespoons lemon juice, salt, and pepper', '10:  Mix well, then add 1 tablespoon of 3 tablespoons water at a time until desired consistency is reached', '11: In a large bowl, drizzle the 1 bunch kale with olive oil', '12:  Massage with your hands until the 1 bunch kale is tender and has reduced in volume by about a third', '13: Add the 3 cups quinoa, roasted 1 ½ cups sweet potatoes, red onion, and pumpkin seeds', '14:  Drizzle with tahini dressing and toss well', '15: Serve with more dressing if desired']

ingredients: ['2 sweet potatoes', '2 bunches asparagus ends trimmed', '1 ¼ lb chicken breast tender (565 g)', 'olive oil', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Sauce', '⅓ cup balsamic vinegar (80 mL)', '2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', '5 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '2 cloves garlic minced', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Cut 2 sweet potatoes into medium julienne', '3: Spread 2 sweet potatoes evenly onto parchment paper-lined baking tray', '4: Season with olive oil, pepper, and salt', '5: Bake for 20 minutes', '6:  Set aside', '7: Trim 2 bunches asparagus and cut into pieces diagonally', '8: Spread evenly on the baking tray next to the 2 sweet potatoes', '9:  Season with olive oil, pepper, and salt', '10: Season 1 ¼ lb chicken with pepper and salt', '11:  Place on top of the veggies', '12: Bake for 15 minutes or until the internal temperature of the 1 ¼ lb chicken reaches 165˚F (75˚C)', '13: While 1 ¼ lb chicken is baking, reduce ⅓ cup balsamic vinegar, 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar, olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 2 cloves garlic, pepper, and salt in a small saucepan for 5-7 minutes until the sauce slightly thickens', '14: Distribute veggies and 1 ¼ lb chicken into four containers', '15: Pour the sauce reduction onto the 1 ¼ lb chicken', '16: Can be refrigerated up to 4 days']

ingredients: ['½ cup soy sauce (125 mL)', '½ cup honey (150 g)', '¼ cup rice wine vinegar (60 mL)', '½ onion chopped', '2 cloves garlic', 'pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '4 breasts chicken', '3 tablespoons corn flour', '¼ cup water (60 mL)', 'spring onion to taste', 'sesame seed to taste']
instructions: ['1: Mix the ½ cup soy sauce, ½ cup honey, ¼ cup rice wine vinegar, ½ spring onion, 2 cloves garlic, pepper and 1 teaspoon ground ginger together in a small bowl and set aside', '2: Oil the slow cooker and add the chicken 4 breasts', '3:  Pour the sauce over the chicken, cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours', '4: Remove and drain the chicken and set aside in a large bowl', '5: Shred thoroughly with two forks', '6: Transfer the leftover sauce into a saucepan and add ¼ cup water mixed with the cornflour', '7:  Reduce over a medium heat until thick', '8: Add the chicken to the sauce and mix thoroughly', '9: Serve over a bed of ¼ cup rice with spring ½ spring onions and sesame seeds!']

ingredients: ['5 large egg whites', '3 large egg yolks', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter halved', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'fresh chive chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Separate the egg whites and the egg yolks in two separate bowls', '2:  You’ll only need 3 yolks, so discard the other 2 or reserve for another use', '3: Whisk the egg yolks until they become homogenous and pale in color', '4:  Set aside', '5: Transfer the egg whites to a large bowl and whisk until they triple in size and become white with medium peaks', '6: Carefully fold the egg yolks into the egg whites until fully incorporated', '7: Pour the egg mixture into a medium nonstick frying pan with a lid', '8:  Cook over medium-low heat until bottom of omelet has set, about 5 minutes', '9: Lift up each side of the omelette and drop a tablespoon of 2 tablespoons unsalted butter underneath', '10: Cover the pan and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the top of the omelet has set', '11: Remove the lid and season the omelet with salt and pepper', '12:  Remove the pan from the heat', '13: Fold the omelette onto a plate and sprinkle with chives']

ingredients: ['3 slices lime plus 1 wheel for garnish', '1 sprig fresh mint plus 1 for garnish', '1 tablespoon agave nectar or honey', '1 ½ oz white rum (45 mL)', 'ice as needed', 'soda water as needed']
instructions: ['1: To a tall glass, add lime 3 slices and mint', '2:  Muddle until juicy', '3: Add 1 tablespoon agave, 1 ½ oz white rum, ice, and top with soda water', '4:  Stir to combine', '5: Garnish with a lime wheel and a 1 sprig of mint']

ingredients: ['3 cups all purpose flour (375 g)', '3 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', '1 tablespoon granulated sugar', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon instant yeast', '1 pinch kosher salt', '1 cup ghee (220 g) room temperature', '⅓ cup warm water (80 mL)', 'Pistachio Honey Filling', '1 tablespoon ghee or butter', '1 tablespoon all purpose flour', '1 teaspoon sesame seed', '¼ cup honey (85 g)', '½ cup pistachio (50 g) coarsely ground', 'powdered sugar for dusting']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sesame seeds, 1 tablespoon granulated powdered sugar, ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon instant yeast, and 1 pinch kosher salt', '2:  Stir with a fork, then add the ghee and ⅓ cup warm water and beat with an electric hand mixer until a soft, pliable dough forms', '3: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for 1 hour', '4: Meanwhile, make the ½ cup pistachio ¼ cup honey filling: In a small pot over medium heat, melt the ghee, then add the flour and stir until golden brown', '5: Reduce the heat to low, add the sesame seeds and ¼ cup honey, and stir until thickened, about 5 minutes', '6: Remove the pot from the heat, add the ½ cup pistachios, and mix well to incorporate', '7: Let the filling cool for 10 minutes, then form into 24 small balls', '8: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '9:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '10: Once the dough has rested, roll into 24 balls', '11: Press a ball of the ½ cup pistachio filling into the center of a dough ball, then wrap in the dough and roll again into a ball that completely encases the filling', '12:  Repeat with the remaining dough and filling', '13:  Arrange the cookies on the prepared baking sheet', '14: Press the cookies lightly into a Mamoul tool, or make a crosshatch pattern using a fork', '15: Bake the cookies for 18–20 minutes or until the bottoms are golden brown', '16: Let the cookies cool on a wire rack', '17: When ready to serve, dust the cookies with powdered 1 tablespoon granulated powdered sugar']

ingredients: ['4 russet potatoes', '3 carrots', '3 stalks celery', '½ yellow onion', '2 cups chopped mushrooms (150 g)', '1 tablespoon flour', '1 teaspoon fresh thyme', '1 teaspoon fresh sage', '4 cloves garlic', '2 cups vegetable broth (472 mL)', '⅓ cup red wine (78 mL)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'soy milk or rice milk as needed', 'vegan butter as needed', '1 tablespoon tomato paste']
instructions: ['1: Peel, chop, and boil the 4 russet potatoes for 10-15 minutes until soft', '2: Meanwhile, chop the 3 carrots, 3 stalks celery, and ½ yellow onion, sauté in vegan butter or oil for a few minutes', '3: Add the 2 cups chopped mushrooms, and cook until the edges begin to darken', '4:  Add the 4 cloves garlic, and season with salt and pepper', '5: Add the 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 tablespoon flour, 1 teaspoon fresh thyme, and 1 teaspoon fresh sage', '6: Slowly add the veggie 2 cups vegetable broth and ⅓ cup red wine, stirring continuously', '7:  Let simmer for a few minutes to thicken', '8: Mash the 4 russet potatoes and add the soy milk and vegan butter', '9:  Add more if needed until smooth', '10:  Season with salt and pepper to taste', '11: Lay the veggie filling into a baking dish, the spread the mashed 4 russet potatoes over top', '12:  At this time you can get creative with designs and patterns for the top', '13:  The rougher the surface, the crispier it will turn out', '14: Spray the surface with cooking oil', '15:  Broil for 10-15 minutes, or until the top is crispy']

ingredients: ['1 sheet puff pastry thawed', '6 hot dogs', '6 slices cheddar cheese']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425°F (220˚C)', '2: Slice the puff pastry into 6 even rectangles', '3:  Place a slice of 6 slices cheddar on top of each puff pastry piece', '4: Place a 6 hot dog on the 6 slices cheddar, then roll it up', '5: Slice each roll into 3 even pieces, and arrange the pieces evenly on a baking 1 sheet lined with parchment paper with a 1-inch (2-cm) gap between the pieces', '6: Bake for 15 minutes, until golden brown and flaky']

ingredients: ['15 lb turkey (6.7 kg)', '¼ cup kosher salt (60 g)', '2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', '1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon granulated garlic', 'cooking oil of choice for drizzling', 'Turkey Stock', '1 turkey carcas', '1 medium yellow onion quartered', '3 carrots peeled and halved', '3 stalks celery cut into thirds', 'kosher salt to taste', 'cooking oil of choice for drizzling', 'cold water', '2 bay leaves', 'Gravy', '⅓ cup rendered turkey fat (75 g) or butter', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour (40 g)', '1 qt turkey stock (945 mL) or chicken stock', '1 bunch fresh sage optional', 'kosher salt to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste']
instructions: ['1: The day before serving, prepare the turkey for brining', '2:  Pat dry with paper towels', '3: Set the neck aside for the stock', '4:  Cut off the wing tips and set aside with the neck', '5: Butcher the turkey into 8 pieces: 2 breasts, 2 legs, 2 thighs, and 2 wings', '6:  Set aside the carcass for the stock', '7: Combine the salt, 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar, pepper, and 1 tablespoon granulated garlic in a small bowl', '8: Set a wire rack inside a baking sheet', '9:  Place the turkey parts skin-side up on the rack and generously sprinkle with the seasoning blend', '10:  Refrigerate, uncovered, for at least 2 hours, or overnight', '11: Make the stock: Preheat the oven to 450˚F (230˚C)', '12: Place the turkey carcass, wing tips, and neck on a baking sheet with the onion, 3 carrots, and 3 stalks celery', '13:  Season lightly with salt and drizzle with oil', '14: Roast for 30-45 minutes, or until the carcass and vegetables are deep 2 tablespoons dark brown', '15: Transfer the roasted vegetables, turkey carcass, and other parts to a large stock pot', '16: From the still-warm baking sheet from roasting the carcass, pour any rendered fat into a small bowl', '17:  Add about 1 cup (240 ml) of water to the pan and scrape off any 2 tablespoons dark browned bits from roasting process, then pour into a separate bowl', '18:  Reserve for the gravy', '19: Strain the stock, discarding the solids', '20:  The stock will keep for 5 days in the refrigerator or for 3 months in the freezer', '21: Cover the carcass with cold water', '22:  Add the 2 bay leaves and bring to a gentle simmer over 1 medium heat', '23:  Continue to simmer (don’t boil!) for 3 hours', '24: Make the gravy: Heat a 1 medium saucepan over 1 medium heat', '25:  Add the turkey fat and flour, stirring to combine', '26:  Cook the fat and flour together, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes', '27:  This is a roux--you are cooking out the raw flour taste and deepening the flavor', '28: Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly to prevent lumps', '29:  Bring to a boil, continuing to stir until thickened', '30:  Season with salt and pepper to taste', '31: Remove the pan from the heat and let cool to room temperature', '32:  Store in the refrigerator until ready to warm for serving with the turkey', '33:  The gravy will keep in the fridge for up to 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 3 months', '34: 2 hours before you are ready to serve the turkey, preheat the oven to 425°F (220˚C)', '35: Remove the turkey parts from the fridge and drizzle with oil before placing in the hot oven', '36: Roast for 30 minutes, then rotate the baking sheet to ensure even 2 tablespoons dark browning', '37:  Reduce the oven temperature to 400˚F (200˚C)', '38: Continue roasting until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of breast registers 160°F (70˚C)', '39: Or when the thigh registers 170˚F (77˚C)', '40:  Start checking after about 20 minutes, removing any parts from the oven as they reach proper temperature so that they don’t overcook', '41: Once all parts are done, loosely cover with foil and let rest for 5-10 minutes while you warm the gravy', '42: Add the gravy and 1 bunch fresh sage, if using, to a 1 medium saucepan over low heat and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally', '43:  Season to taste with more salt and pepper, if needed', '44: Serve the turkey with the gravy and your favorite Thanksgiving dishes']

ingredients: ['2 apples', 'nonstick cooking spray or oil', '1 teaspoon cinnamon']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: Cut the 2 apples into ⅛- to ¼-inch (3-to 6-mm) slices', '4:  Arrange on the baking sheet', '5:  Spray the slices with nonstick spray or brush with oil', '6:  Then, sprinkle with 1 teaspoon cinnamon', '7: Bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway, until lightly golden brown', '8:  Let cool to room temperature']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb chicken wings (680 g) patted dry', '1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt', '1 tablespoon Tasty Zesty Spice Blend']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the air fryer to 375°F (190°C)', '2: In a bowl, toss the 1 ½ lb chicken wings with the 1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt and Tasty Zesty Spice Blend until well coatedWorking in batches, add the 1 ½ lb chicken wings to the air fryer in a single layer and “fry” for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through', '3: Serve warm']

ingredients: ['1 can sweetened condensed milk', '2 tablespoons butter plus more for greasing', '⅓ cup cocoa powder (40 g)', 'chocolate sprinkle to decorate']
instructions: ['1: Put a pot on a medium low heat and melt the 2 tablespoons butter with the 1 can sweetened condensed milk', '2: Stir in the ⅓ cup cocoa powder and continue to stir for 10-15 minutes until the mixture begins to pull away from the edge of the pot', '3: It’s done when you run the spoon through the centre of the mixture and it takes a few seconds to combine again', '4: Spread the mixture onto a 2 tablespoons buttered plate and refrigerate for 2 hours', '5: When set, roll the mixture into small balls and coat them in the chocolate sprinkles (you may need to apply a small amount of 2 tablespoons butter to your hands to help them from sticking)']

ingredients: ['1 lb chicken wings (455 g)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Buffalo Sauce', '1 cup hot sauce (240 mL)', '1 teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Remove excess moisture from 1 lb chicken wings with a paper towel', '3: In a large bowl, stir in 2 teaspoons baking powder and 1 teaspoon salt until 1 lb chicken is thoroughly coated', '4: Bake on a 2 teaspoons baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes', '5:  (For best results, place 2 teaspoons baking rack on a 2 teaspoons baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings)', '6: In a skillet, combine buffalo 1 cup hot sauce ingredients on medium heat', '7: Then stir in 1 lb chicken wings until fully coated', '8: Serve with your favorite side dish or dipping 1 cup hot sauce']

ingredients: ['Tacos', '1 bag Little Potato Company Blushing Belle Potatoes', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL) plus 2 tablespoons', '10 corn tortillas warmed', '4 tablespoons olive oil divided', '½ large red onion thinly sliced', '1 ½ cups shredded chicken (185 g)', '2 teaspoons kosher salt divided', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chipotle powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', 'fresh cilantro leaf for garnish', 'lime zest for garnish', 'Elote-Style Salsa', '1 can fire-roasted whole corn kernels drained', '⅓ cup roma tomato (65 g) diced', '¼ cup crema Mexicana (60 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh cilantro chopped', '1 lime zested', '¼ cup crumbled queso fresco (30 g)', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
instructions: ['1: Add the Little Potato Company Blushing Belle Potatoes to a ½ large pot and cover with cold water', '2:  Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes, or according to the package instructions, until tender', '3:  Drain and let cool for 10 minutes', '4: In a medium pan over medium-high heat, heat the ¼ cup vegetable oil until it reaches 300°F (150°C)', '5:  Fold a tortilla in
