instructions: ['1: In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, cook the 6 strips bacon until crispy', '2:  Add 2 boneless skinless chicken and season with 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and garlic powder', '3:  Cook until the 2 boneless skinless chicken is no longer pink, then remove from the pot and set aside', '4: Add the 2 onions and garlic and cook to the pot and cook until softened', '5:  When 2 onions are caramelized, add 5 oz spinach and cook until wilted', '6:  Add the 5 cups milk and bring to boil', '7:  Add the 1 lb fettuccine to the boiling 5 cups milk and cover', '8:  Cook the 1 lb fettuccine over medium heat until the 5 cups milk thickens and the pasta is cooked, about 7 minutes', '9: Return the 2 boneless skinless chicken to the pot', '10:  Stir in the ½ cup pesto and Parmesan', '11:  Garnish with fresh parsley and more Parmesan']

ingredients: ['3 cups warm water (720 mL)', '1 vegetable bouillon cube', '2 cans jackfruit 15 ounce (425 G) cans ', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic powder', '1 ½ teaspoons onion powder', '2 teaspoons paprika', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons kosher salt divided plus more to taste', '2 cups canola oil (480 mL) for frying', '1 cup unsweetened non-dairy milk (240 mL)', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 ½ cups all purpose flour (185 g) divided', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', 'Preparation', '3 cups warm water (720 mL)', '1 vegetable bouillon cube', '2 cans jackfruit 15 ounce (425 G) cans ', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic powder', '1 ½ teaspoons onion powder', '2 teaspoons paprika', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons kosher salt divided plus more to taste', '2 cups canola oil (480 mL) for frying', '1 cup unsweetened non-dairy milk (240 mL)', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 ½ cups all purpose flour (185 g) divided', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a medium bowl, combine the warm water and bouillon cube and whisk to dissolve the bouillon', '2: Drain the jackfruit and rinse under cold water', '3:  Remove any seed pods and discard', '4:  Add the jackfruit to the bowl and marinate for 30 minutes', '5:  This will help remove some of the briny flavor from the canned jackfruit', '6:  After marinating, drain and set the jackfruit aside', '7: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)', '8:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '9: In a small bowl, combine the garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, smoked paprika, cayenne, black pepper, and 1 teaspoon of salt', '10: In a medium bowl, combine the jackfruit and 1 tablespoon of the spice blend, tossing well to coat', '11: Transfer to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15–18 minutes, until the jackfruit has partially dried out', '12: Heat the canola oil in a large, high-walled skillet over medium-high heat to 375°F (190°C)', '13: In a medium bowl, whisk together the non-dairy milk, apple cider vinegar, ½ cup (65 G) flour, the remaining teaspoon of salt, and the baking soda', '14: ', '15: In a separate medium bowl, combine the remaining cup of flour, the cornstarch, and remaining spice blend', '16:  Stir well', '17: Coat the jackfruit in the batter, letting any excess drip off', '18:  Then, coat in the flour mixture', '19: Working in batches, fry the coated jackfruit in the hot oil until golden brown, 2–3 minutes, flipping halfway and frying for another 1-2 minutes', '20:   Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and season with more salt if desired', '21: Serve hot']

ingredients: ['1 sheet puff pastry thawed', '1.5 kg apple (1.5 kg) preferably Honeycrisp or Granny Smith', '3 tablespoons water', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter', 'vanilla ice cream for serving']
instructions: ['1: Using a 9-inch (23 cm) flat-sided cake pan as a template, cut a circle out from the 1 sheet puff pastry', '2:  Using a fork, poke holes all over to provide ventilation', '3:  Set aside', '4: Peel and quarter the 1', '5: 5 kg apples, using a spoon or melon baller to remove the cores', '6: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)', '7: In a large saucepan over medium heat, distribute the 3 tablespoons water and ½ cup sugar evenly and cook until light amber in color, stirring to help melt any lumps, 5-7 minutes', '8:  Add the 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, stirring constantly until the color is a creamy light brown', '9:  Add the 1', '10: 5 kg apples, stirring until they are coated in a thick layer of caramel', '11: Cook for about 15-20 minutes, turning the 1', '12: 5 kg apples constantly so that they bathe in the caramel', '13:  Remove from the heat when the caramel has reduced and little remains in the bottom of the pan', '14:  Be careful not to burn the caramel, tasting it from time to time to ensure it does not taste bitter', '15: Arrange the 1', '16: 5 kg apple slices in concentric circles on the bottom of the cake pan', '17:  Press the 1', '18: 5 kg apples tightly against each other, then pour the remaining caramel over the top', '19: Lay the circle of 1 sheet puff pastry on top', '20:  Tuck the 1 sheet puff pastry down the sides of the pan', '21: Bake for 45-50 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and firm', '22:  Cool for about 1 hour, then invert onto a plate', '23: Slice and serve with vanilla ice cream']

ingredients: ['Cake', '1 ½ cups flour (185 g)', '1 cup dutch processed cocoa  powder (120 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 ½ cups stout (360 mL)', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon espresso powder', '1 cup butter (235 g)', '1 ½ cups sugar (300 g)', '3 eggs', '½ cup mayonnaise (120 g)', '4 oz dark chocolate (115 g) chopped', 'Buttercream', '1 ½ cups butter (350 g) softened', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '½ cup dutch processed cocoa  powder (60 g)', '5 cups powdered sugar (600 g)', '5 tablespoons milk', 'fresh fruit to decorate']
instructions: ['1: Grease and line three 8-inch (20 cm) cake tins with parchment paper', '2: In a large bowl, sift together the 1 ½ cups flour, cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon salt, baking soda, and baking powder', '3:  Set aside', '4: In a large glass measuring cup, combine the 1 ½ cups stout, vanilla, and 1 tablespoon espresso powder', '5:  Set aside', '6: In a large mixing bowl, cream together the 1 cup 1 ½ cups butter and 1 ½ cups 5 cups 5 cups powdered sugar until it is light and fluffy, about 5 minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally to ensure all the ingredients are being evenly creamed together', '7: Beat in the 3 eggs, one at a time, ensuring each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next', '8: Add the mayonnaise and beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy', '9: Preheat oven to 325˚F (160˚C)', '10: Alternate adding the prepared dry and wet ingredients to the batter', '11:  Starting with about ⅓ of the dry ingredients, beat until incorporated', '12:  Then add ⅓ of the liquid ingredients, mixing until the batter comes together', '13:  Continue until all the wet and dry ingredients have been incorporated', '14: Using a rubber scraper, fold the 4 oz dark chocolate chunks into the batter', '15: Distribute the batter evenly between the 3 prepared cake tins', '16: Bake for about 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean', '17: Place the cakes on a cooling rack and leave to cool for about 10-15 minutes, until the outside of the pan is cool enough to touch', '18: Once the cakes have cooled, loosen the edges using a 1 cup 1 ½ cups butter knife', '19:  Then place a large plate over the tin and invert to release the cake from the pan', '20:  Remove the parchment paper from the bottom of the cake and slide the cake back onto the cooling rack to cool completely', '21:  Repeat for the remaining two layers', '22: While your cakes are cooling, prepare the 1 cup 1 ½ cups buttercream', '23: In a large bowl, beat together the 1 cup 1 ½ cups butter and vanilla', '24: Gradually add in the cocoa powder, 5 cups powdered 1 ½ cups 5 cups 5 cups powdered sugar, and 5 tablespoons milk, continuously beating until all the ingredients have been incorporated and the frosting is light and fluffy', '25: Frost and fresh fruit to decorate to your liking', '26: Slice and serve']

ingredients: ['1 lb pork loin (455 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 cup asparagus (125 g) trimmed and cut', '1 cup red pepper (100 g) diced', 'Stir-Fry Sauce', '½ cup soy sauce (120 mL)', '¼ cup honey (85 g)', '2 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon ginger', '1 tablespoon sesame seed']
instructions: ['1: Mix together all ½ cup soy sauce ingredients in a small bowl', '2: Heat oil over a nonstick pan and add 1 lb pork stirring until cooked', '3: Pour ½ cup soy sauce in pan and stir to coat meat', '4: Once the ½ cup soy sauce is bubbling, add the veggies to the pan and stir again to coat', '5: Cook until meat is cooked through and veggies are soft', '6: Serve over rice or alone']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion diced', '2 stalks celery chopped', '1 carrot chopped', '1 red bell pepper diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 jalapeño pepper seeded diced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '2 tablespoons cumin', '60 oz black beans (1.75 kg) 4 cans drained rinsed', '4 cups vegetable stock (960 mL)', '1 bay leaf', 'avocado chopped to serve', 'queso fresco crumbled to serve', 'fresh cilantro chopped to serve', 'tortilla chip crumbled to serve']
instructions: ['1: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large stock-pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat until the oil begins to shimmer', '2: Add onions, 2 stalks celery, 1 carrot, and 1 red bell pepper', '3:  Cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to soften', '4: Add 4 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper, and continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes until vegetables are soft and the onions are translucent', '5: Add 2 tablespoons cumin, 60 oz black beans, vegetable stock, and the 1 bay leaf', '6:  Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer', '7: Cover the pot and cook over low heat for 30 minutes until the beans are very tender', '8: Remove the 1 bay leaf', '9:  Transfer about 4 4 cups (900 g) of the soup to a blender and puree until smooth, being careful not to splatter hot soup all over yourself and kitchen', '10: Pour blended soup back into the pot and mix to incorporate', '11: Keep over low heat until ready to serve', '12:  Garnish with fresh avocado, queso fresco, chopped cilantro, and tortilla chips']

ingredients: ['Crust', '¾ cup almond flour (70 g)', '3 tablespoons coconut oil', '3 tablespoons honey', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 pinch salt', 'Filling', '14 oz cans of coconut milk chilled overnight', '½ cup lime juice (120 mL) from about 2 limes', '⅓ cup honey (110 g)', '2 limes zested']
instructions: ['1: Line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper to hang over the edges', '2: Make the crust: in a medium bowl, combine the ¾ cup almond flour, 3 tablespoons 14 oz 14 oz cans of coconut oil, honey, ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1 pinch salt', '3:  Mix with a spatula until smooth', '4: Transfer the crust to the baking dish', '5:  Use a spatula to smooth the crust into a thin, even layer covering the bottom of the pan', '6:  Set aside', '7: Make the filling: open the 14 oz cans of 3 tablespoons 14 oz 14 oz cans of coconut milk and use a spoon to scoop the thick cream at the top of the can into a medium bowl', '8:  Set aside the remaining liquid for another use, such as in smoothies, soups, or sauces', '9: Beat the 3 tablespoons 14 oz 14 oz cans of coconut cream with a hand mixer until very fluffy, about 5 minutes', '10: Add the ½ cup 2 lime juice and honey', '11:  Continue to beat until smooth and fluffy, about 2 minutes', '12: Pour the filling over the crust and use a spatula to smooth out the top', '13: Top with the ½ cup 2 lime zest', '14: Freeze for at least 2 hours, until the filling has set', '15: Grab the parchment on both sides and lift the frozen bar from the baking dish', '16:  You may need to use a knife to release the edges or turn the dish upside down on a cutting board and tap on the bottom to release the block', '17: Quickly cut the block into 16 2-inch (5-cm) square bars']

ingredients: ['3 chicken breasts', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '6 tablespoons BBQ sauce', '½ onion sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: Place 3 chicken breast in a baking dish', '3:  Season 3 chicken with salt and pepper, to taste', '4: Spread BBQ 6 tablespoons BBQ sauce on each 3 chicken breast', '5: Layer onions on top of the 3 chicken', '6: Bake for 40 minutes']

ingredients: ['1 sheet puff pastry', '1 handful handful pecans chopped', '2 tablespoons butter melted', '1 teaspoon brown sugar', '1 apple cut into 8 segments', 'Spice Mix', '2 teaspoons cinnamon', '1 teaspoon nutmeg', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon allspice']
instructions: ['1: Stir all of the ‘spice mix’ ingredients together', '2: Roll the 1 sheet puff pastry out and cut some rough isosceles triangle shapes from it', '3: Take a thick slice of 1 apple, dip it into the melted 2 tablespoons butter and place on the end of the pastry', '4: Scatter a teaspoon of brown sugar over the pastry', '5:  Pour some roughly chopped 1 handful handful pecans on top of that', '6:  Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of spice mix over all of that', '7: Starting at the 1 apple segment, roll the pastry until everything is wrapped into a neat little package', '8: Bake in the centre of a pre-heated oven for 25-30 minutes - 180°C (350°F) Gas Mark 4', '9: Allow to cool for 3-5 minutes before eating because the contents are hot!']

ingredients: ['8 strips bacon', '1 head romaine lettuce chopped', '2 handfuls cherry tomato or grape tomatoes halved', '½ cucumber', '2 avocados chopped', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1 teaspoon mustard', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 lemon juiced', 'Preparation', '8 strips bacon', '1 head romaine lettuce chopped', '2 handfuls cherry tomato or grape tomatoes halved', '½ cucumber', '2 avocados chopped', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1 teaspoon mustard', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 lemon juiced', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Cook bacon until crispy', '2:  Drain on a paper towel, then set aside', '3: Place chopped lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, avocados and bacon in a large bowl', '4: In a small bowl, mix olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt, and lemon juice to form the dressing', '5: Toss the salad with the dressing']

ingredients: ['Filling', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '7 ½ cups small cactus pads (750 g) diced', '3 ½ cups onion (485 g) diced', '4 tablespoons garlic minced', '4 teaspoons kosher salt', '4 ½ cups crumbled queso fresco (630 g) divided', '4 ½ cups salsa verde (630 g) divided', 'Tamales', '8 cups masa harina (1000 g)', '¾ cup rice flour (95 g)', '4 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 ¾ cups lard (420 mL) melted', '6 ½ cups Kroger beef broth (1.5 L)', '1 package dried corn husks', '5 cups water (1.2 L)', 'Preparation', 'Filling', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '7 ½ cups small cactus pads (750 g) diced', '3 ½ cups onion (485 g) diced', '4 tablespoons garlic minced', '4 teaspoons kosher salt', '4 ½ cups crumbled queso fresco (630 g) divided', '4 ½ cups salsa verde (630 g) divided', 'Tamales', '8 cups masa harina (1000 g)', '¾ cup rice flour (95 g)', '4 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 ¾ cups lard (420 mL) melted', '6 ½ cups Kroger beef broth (1.5 L)', '1 package dried corn husks', '5 cups water (1.2 L)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Make the filling: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat', '2:  Add the cactus and onion, and cook until tender, 3–5 minutes', '3:  Add the garlic and salt, and cook for another 2 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant', '4:  Transfer to a medium bowl and set aside', '5: Make the tamales: In a large bowl, combine the masa harina, rice flour, salt, and baking powder', '6: Add the melted lard and 3 cups of beef stock, and mix with an electric mixer on low speed until partially combined', '7:  Add the remaining 3½ cups of beef stock and continue mixing by hand until a wet dough forms', '8:  The dough should have the consistency of a thick hummus; if it is too dry, add more stock or water', '9:  And if it is too wet, add more masa harina, ¼ cup at a time', '10: Soak the corn husks in water until softened slightly, about 2 minutes', '11: Scoop about 4 tablespoons of the masa mixture onto the center of the smooth side of a corn husk', '12:  Spread into a flat rectangular shape, leaving the bottom third of the corn husk empty', '13:  Add about a tablespoon of the cooked cactus mixture, 1–2 tablespoons queso fresco, and 2 tablespoons salsa verde to the center of the masa rectangle', '14: Bring the long sides of the corn husk together to encase the filling inside the masa, then fold the bottom of the corn husk up', '15:  Leave the top open', '16:  Tie a strip of corn husk around the tamale to secure', '17:  Repeat with the remaining ingredients', '18: Fill a large pot with the water', '19:  Set a smaller pot lid upside down in the bottom of the pot, then layer 5–6 corn husks on top to create a nest', '20:  Stack the assembled tamales on top of the nest with the open ends of the tamales facing up, filling the pot to the top', '21: Cover the pot with aluminum foil and steam the tamales over medium heat for 45–60 minutes', '22:  (To check if the tamales are cooked, carefully remove and open a tamale from the very top of the pot', '23: The masa should separate easily from the corn husk', '24: )Remove tamales from the steamer and let cool until ready to eat']

ingredients: ['1 lb spaghetti (455 g)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '3 cloves garlic minced', '2 cups cherry tomato (400 g)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '1 cup white wine (235 mL)', '1 cup parmesan cheese (110 g)', '½ cup fresh basil (20 g) chopped']
instructions: ['1: Cook 1 lb spaghetti in boiling salted water until it’s al dente', '2:  Reserve 1 cup (235 ml) of the pasta water before draining', '3: While the 1 lb spaghetti is cooking, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pan (it should be large enough to toss the pasta in)', '4:  Add 3 cloves garlic and tomatoes, and stir until well-incorporated', '5:  Season with salt and pepper', '6: Cook tomatoes down for 5 minutes until they soften and release some of their juices', '7: Then add the wine and allow that to reduce for 5-10 minutes until you’re left with a syrupy sauce', '8: Add the pasta to your sauce, along with a splash of pasta water and toss to coat it for about 1-2 minutes so the pasta finishes cooking and absorbs the flavor of the sauce', '9: Add the parmesan and basil', '10:  Add another small splash of pasta water, if needed', '11:  Toss until the cheese is melted down and you’re left with a smooth sauce', '12: Gradually add small amounts of pasta water, as needed, until the sauce reaches your desired smoothness', '13: Top off with extra parmesan and basil and serve immediately']

ingredients: ['2 cups shredded chicken (250 g)', '1 cup crushed pineapple (165 g)', '1 white onion diced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 ¼ teaspoons salt', '1 red onion diced for topping', '½ cup fresh cilantro (20 g) chopped for topping', '4 corn tortillas']
instructions: ['1: In a large, nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat', '2: Toss in the 1 white 1 1 red onion and 1 ¼ teaspoons salt and sauté for 2 minutes', '3: Add in the 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, and 2 cloves garlic', '4:  Toast for 1 minute', '5: Add in the 1 cup crushed pineapple and 2 cups shredded chicken and mix so the 2 cups shredded chicken is well-coated and warmed through', '6: Pour the 2 cups shredded chicken mixture into a large serving bowl', '7: Toast the 4 corn tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side', '8: Divide the mixture evenly between 4 corn tortillas, top with diced 1 red 1 white 1 1 red onion and ½ cup fresh cilantro, and serve']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '2 cloves garlic chopped', '½ medium onion chopped', '5 oz fresh spinach (140 g)', '1 teaspoon salt for spinach', '1 teaspoon pepper for spinach', '⅓ cup breadcrumb (40 g)', '4 oz cream cheese (110 g)', '¼ cup shredded parmesan cheese (30 g)', '2 tablespoons fresh dill chopped', '1 sheet puff pastry softened to room temperature', '1 salmon fillet', '1 teaspoon salt for salmon', '1 teaspoon pepper for salmon', '1 egg beaten']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2: In a pan over ½ medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter', '3:  Add the 2 cloves garlic and onions, cooking until translucent', '4: Add the 5 oz fresh 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for spinach, salt, and pepper, cooking until 5 oz fresh 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for spinach is wilted', '5: Add the breadcrumbs, 4 oz cream cheese, ¼ cup shredded parmesan, and 2 tablespoons fresh dill, stirring until mixture is evenly combined', '6:  Remove from heat and set aside', '7: On a cutting board, smooth out the 1 sheet of puff pastry', '8:  Place the 1 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for salmon in the middle of the pastry and season both sides with salt and pepper', '9: Place several spoonfuls of the 5 oz fresh 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for spinach mixture on top of the 1 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for salmon, smoothing it out so that it does not spill over the sides', '10: Fold the edges of the puff pastry over the 1 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for salmon and 5 oz fresh 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for spinach, starting with the longer sides and then the shorter ends', '11:  Trim any excess pastry from the ends, then fold the ends on top', '12:  Flip the puff pastry-wrapped 1 1 teaspoon salt for 1 teaspoon pepper for salmon over and transfer for a baking 1 sheet lined with parchment paper', '13: Brush the beaten 1 egg on the top and sides of the pastry', '14:  Score the top of the pastry with a knife, cutting shallow diagonal lines to create a crosshatch pattern', '15: Brush the top again with the 1 egg wash', '16: Bake for 20-25 minutes, until pastry is golden brown', '17: Slice, then serve!']

ingredients: ['¼ cup basmati rice (53 g) broken', '2 cups unsweetened coconut milk (500 mL) or whole milk', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ cup granulated sugar', '¼ teaspoon saffron thread a pinch', 'golden raisin for garnish', 'slivered almond for garnish']
instructions: ['1: Rinse the  ¼ cup basmati rice until the water runs clear', '2:  Soak the ¼ cup basmati rice in water for 20–30 minutes, then drain', '3: In a medium heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, combine the 2 cups unsweetened coconut milk and ¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', '4:  Bring the milk to a gentle simmer, then add the drained ¼ cup basmati rice', '5:  Simmer, stirring occasionally so the ¼ cup basmati rice does not stick to the bottom, until the milk is reduced by half and the ¼ cup basmati rice is tender, about 30 minutes', '6: Add the ¼ cup granulated sugar and stir until it dissolves', '7:  Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the ¼ teaspoon saffron threads', '8: Serve the kheer topped with golden raisins and slivered almonds']

ingredients: ['6 tablespoons olive oil divided', '1 cup yellow onion (150 g) diced and divided', '10 oz cremini mushroom (280 g) finely chopped', '6 cloves garlic minced and divided', '2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce', '2 teaspoons dried thyme divided', '2 teaspoons smoked paprika divided', '1 teaspoon dried oregano divided', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper divided', '3 teaspoons vegan worcestershire sauce divided', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke divided', '½ teaspoon salt plus more to taste divided', '¾ teaspoon pepper divided', '15 oz cannellini bean (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', '¾ cup bread crumbs (85 g)', '⅓ cup vital wheat gluten (40 g) or bread crumbs', '3 ½ cups vegetable broth (840 mL) plus 2 tablespoons divided', '3 tablespoons all purpose flour', '1 stalk celery diced', '2 cups okra (200 g) sliced into 1/2-in (1 cm) rounds', '1 green bell pepper seeded and diced', '1 ½ cups tomato (300 g) crushed', '15 oz red kidney bean (425 g) 1 can drained and rinsed', 'brown rice cooked for serving', 'fresh parsley chopped for serving']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat', '2:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add ½ cup (75g) diced onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent', '3: Add the 10 oz cremini mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, until most of the juices have evaporated', '4: Add 2 6 cloves of minced garlic, the soy sauce, 1 teaspoon thyme, 1 teaspoon paprika, ½ teaspoon oregano, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, 2 teaspoons vegan Worcestershire sauce, ½ teaspoon liquid smoke, ½ teaspoon salt,  and ¼ teaspoon pepper and cook for another 4-5 minutes, until all of the liquid has evaporated and the spices are fragrant', '5: Add the 15 oz cannellini beans to a medium bowl and mash until mostly smooth (a few lumps are okay)', '6:  Then, add the 10 oz cremini mushroom mixture, bread crumbs, vital wheat gluten, and 2 tablespoons vegetable broth and mix well until combined', '7:  Use your hands to knead the mixture until cohesive, then begin to roll about a tablespoon at a time of the mixture into “meatballs”', '8: In the same large pot, heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat', '9:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the meatballs and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, until golden brown', '10:  Remove the meatballs from the pot and set aside', '11: Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pot, along with the flour', '12:  Stir the roux continuously with a wooden spoon for about 3-4 minutes, until the consistency resembles wet sand', '13: Add the remaining ½ cup (75g) diced onion, the 1 stalk celery, and the okra to the pot and cook for 4-5 minutes, until the onion is semi-translucent', '14: Add the remaining 4 6 cloves of minced garlic and the 1 green bell pepper and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant', '15: Add the remaining teaspoon of vegan Worcestershire sauce, ½ teaspoon liquid smoke, 1 teaspoon thyme, ½ teaspoon oregano, 1 teaspoon paprika, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, and ½ teaspoon pepper and cook for 4 more minutes, until the spices are fragrant', '16: Add the crushed tomatoes and stir until combined', '17:  Then, add the 15 oz red beans and add the remaining 3½ cups (840ml) vegetable broth and stir until well combined', '18:  Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes, stirring from time to time, until the gumbo has thickened', '19: Season with salt to taste', '20:  Then, add the meatballs and stir to incorporate', '21: Serve over rice and garnish with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['4 strips bacon', '4 cups water (960 mL)', '1 large head cauliflower', '2 teaspoons kosher salt divided', '4 oz cream cheese (115 g)', '⅓ cup heavy cream (80 mL)', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '2 cups shredded cheddar cheese (200 g)', 'fresh parsley finely chopped for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a 1 large pan over medium-high heat, cook the 4 strips bacon for 6 minutes, or until crisp', '2:  Remove the 4 strips bacon from the pan, pat off excess grease with a paper towel, then chop and set aside', '3: Add the 4 cups water to a medium pot and bring to a boil', '4: While the 4 cups water heats up, chop the cauliflower into small pieces', '5: Add 1 teaspoon of 2 teaspoons kosher salt and the cauliflower to the boiling 4 cups water, then cover and cook for 4 minutes, or until slightly tender', '6:  Drain the cauliflower and set aside', '7: In the same saucepan, combine the 4 oz ⅓ cup ⅓ cup heavy cream cheese, ⅓ cup heavy 4 oz ⅓ cup ⅓ cup heavy cream, remaining teaspoon of 2 teaspoons kosher salt, the cayenne, and paprika', '8:  Stir to combine, then cook for 4 minutes, until smooth and thick', '9: Fold in the cauliflower, then add the 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese', '10:  Stir until the cheese has melted, then fold in the 4 strips bacon', '11: Scoop into serving bowls and garnish with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['Tilapia', '1 lb tilapia fillet (455 g)', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 tablespoon lime juice about 1 lime', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'Crema', '1 avocado', '½ cup fresh cilantro (20 g) roughly chopped', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 tablespoon lime juice about 1 lime', '¼ cup yogurt (60 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C)', '2: In a small bowl, mix the 1 tablespoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon cayenne, salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon olive oil with the lime juice', '3: Using a basting brush, generously coat each side of the 1 lb tilapia fillet with the marinade', '4: Bake fish for 12 minutes in a preheated oven until edges begin to crisp and fish is moist and flaky', '5: While fish is baking, prepare the crema', '6: In a blender, combine 1 avocado, ½ cup fresh cilantro, salt, pepper, lime juice, and ¼ cup yogurt', '7:  Blend until mixture is smooth', '8: Serve 1 lb tilapia topped with 1 avocado crema and freshly chopped ½ cup fresh cilantro']

ingredients: ['1 cup quick oat (100 g)', '½ cup hazelnuts', '½ cup walnuts (50 g)', '½ cup unsweetened shredded coconut (50 g)', '⅓ cup dried cherry (40 g)', '2 tablespoons flax seed', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ cup coconut oil (50 g) melted', '3 tablespoons honey plus more for drizzling', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', "4 ripe pears such as Bosc D'Anjou or Barlett", 'whipped topping of choice for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: In a food processor, combine the oats, hazelnuts, walnuts, shredded coconut, cherries, 2 tablespoons flax seeds, cinnamon, and ½ teaspoon kosher salt', '3:  Pulse until finely ½ teaspoon ground', '4: Add the coconut oil, 3 tablespoons honey, and ½ teaspoon vanilla, and pulse until just combined', '5:  The mixture should hold together when squeezed between your fingers', '6: Cut the  "4 ripe pears in half lengthwise', '7:  Using a tablespoon, scoop out the cores', '8:  With a paring knife, cut a “v” shape around the edges of the stem, cutting downward on an angle', '9:  Remove the stems', '10: Set the  "4 ripe pears in a baking dish, cut-side up', '11:  Fill each with ¼ cup (30 grams) of the crumble topping, pressing lightly into the  "4 ripe pears', '12: Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the  "4 ripe pears are tender when pierced with a paring knife', '13: Serve immediately, topped with whipped topping and a drizzle of 3 tablespoons honey, if desired']

ingredients: ['Tofu Ricotta', '28 oz tofu (795 g)', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '3 tablespoons nutritional yeast', '¼ cup fresh basil (10 g)', '3 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', 'Meat Crumble', '2 cups walnuts (200 g)', '3 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons oil', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon dried rosemary', '1 teaspoon pepper', '2 lb cremini mushroom (907 g)', '1 onion diced', 'Lasagna Base', '1 jar tomato sauce', '1 box lasagna noodle']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375º F (190º C)', '2: In a food processor combine 28 oz tofu, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 3 tablespoons nutritional yeast, ¼ cup fresh basil, garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper, blend until smooth, then set aside and rinse out food processor', '3: In the food processor combine walnuts, garlic, 2 tablespoons oil, 1 teaspoon liquid smoke, 1 tablespoon soy 1 tablespoon soy 1 jar tomato sauce, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried rosemary, and pepper, blend until well mixed, then set aside and rinse out food processor', '4: In the food processor chop up mushrooms so that they are in small chunks', '5: In a large pan cook mushrooms so that 1 teaspoon liquid is released and evaporated, about 6-8 minutes', '6:  Clear out a circle in the middle, add 1 onion and 2 tablespoons oil, sautè 1 onion until translucent, add walnut mixture and mix well', '7: In a large 1 tablespoon soy 1 jar tomato sauce pan cook 1 box lasagna noodles for half of time required', '8: In a 9x9 inch (23x23 cm)  1 box lasagna pan add 2 2 cups (520 g) of red 1 tablespoon soy 1 jar tomato sauce to cover the bottom, then layer 4 half-cooked 1 box lasagna noodles, then spread ricotta mixture over top, followed by “meat” mixture, and then more red 1 tablespoon soy 1 jar tomato sauce', '9:  Repeat until finished', '10:  Cover with Aluminum foil', '11: Bake in oven for 25 minutes, remove aluminum foil and bake for 5 more minutes', '12: Allow to cool about 10-15 minutes then cut into ninths, serve']

ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salt for water', '2 lb potato (905 g) cut into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion diced', '4 cloves garlic minced', '2 teaspoons cumin', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '4 teaspoons curry powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '2 centimeter pieces ginger minced', '14 oz diced tomato (395 g) 1 can', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 1 can drained', '15 oz peas (425 g) 1 can drained', '14 oz coconut milk (395 g) 1 can']
instructions: ['1: Place potatoes into a large pot or dutch oven and cover with well-salted water', '2:  Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer, cover and let the potatoes cook until fork tender–about 12 minutes', '3:  Once cooked, drain the potatoes and set them aside', '4: Return the pot to the stove and add 1 2 1 tablespoon of oil', '5:  Add onion and 4 cloves garlic and sauté over 1 medium heat until onion is tender and starts to turn translucent, about 3-5 minutes', '6: Add 2 teaspoons cumin, 1 teaspoon cayenne, 4 teaspoons curry powder, salt, 1 teaspoon cayenne 1 teaspoon black pepper and 2 centimeter pieces ginger', '7:  Stir to combine before adding tomatoes, 15 oz chickpeas, and 15 oz peas', '8: Increase heat to 1 medium-high and stir in the 14 oz coconut milk', '9:  Bring to a simmer before adding the potatoes back to the pot', '10:  Reduce heat to low and cook everything together for 3-5 minutes before serving']

ingredients: ['1 package vegan cream cheese', '1 ½ cups freeze dried berries (225 g)', '1 tablespoon vegan sugar', '1 package ciabatta roll gluten-free', '2 cups plant based milk (480 mL)', '⅔ cup chickpea flour (85 g)', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '2 tablespoons vegan butter', 'Garnish:', 'fresh berry', 'vegan whipped cream', 'powdered sugar', 'maple syrup']
instructions: ['1: Grind 1 ½ cups freeze dried berries and mix with one package of vegan cream cheese and sugar, set aside', '2: Mix 2 cups plant milk and ⅔ cup chickpea flour in a bowl large enough to fit a roll in', '3:  Then, take a roll and cut through the middle to create space for filling', '4: Put cream cheese mixture into a sandwich baggy and cut a corner off for easy filling of rolls', '5: Fill the ciabatta rolls with cream cheese then soak in the milk/chickpea flour mixture', '6: Add butter to a fry pan on low/medium heat, add rolls to the pan', '7:  About 3-4 min on each side or until desired golden brown and crispness', '8: Serve with fresh berries, whipped topping, powdered sugar and maple syrup']

ingredients: ['Grits', '2 cups unsalted chicken stock (480 mL)', '1 cup quick-cooking grits (255 g)', '1 cup heavy cream (240 mL)', '1 stick unsalted butter', '1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (100 g)', '1 cup roasted corn kernels (100 g)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '3 teaspoons cajun seasoning', 'Shrimp', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ lb andouille sausage (225 g) diced', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon shallot minced', '1 lb large shrimp (455 g) peeled deveined and tails removed', '½ cup roasted red pepper (50 g) diced', '¼ cup scallion (10 g) sliced', 'fresh parsley for garnish chopped']
instructions: ['1: Make the 1 cup quick-cooking grits: Bring the 2 cups unsalted chicken stock to a boil in a 1 lb large saucepan over medium heat', '2:  Add the 1 cup quick-cooking grits and cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has been completely absorbed, about 6 minutes', '3: Whisk in the 1 cup heavy cream, 1 stick unsalted butter, and 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese until melted and fully incorporated', '4:  Stir in the corn, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, and Cajun seasoning', '5:  Remove the pot from the heat and cover to keep the 1 cup quick-cooking grits warm while you make the shrimp', '6: Heat the 2 tablespoons olive oil in a 1 lb large cast iron skillet over medium heat', '7:  Add the ½ lb andouille sausage and cook until it begins to brown and crisp around the edges, about 3 minutes', '8:  Using a slotted spoon, transfer the sausage to a plate and set aside, leaving the rendered sausage fat in the pan', '9: Add 1 tablespoon garlic and 1 tablespoon shallot to the pan and cook until toasted and fragrant, about 2 minutes', '10:  Add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 4 minutes', '11:  Stir in the sausage, roasted red peppers, and scallions, then remove the pan from the heat', '12: Spoon the shrimp over the 1 cup quick-cooking grits and garnish with fresh parsley']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb pork rib (680 g) 2 racks', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon pepper', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 bottle BBQ sauce of preference']
instructions: ['1: Lay out the ribs on a large baking tray', '2: Season evenly with 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon pepper, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, 1 tablespoon paprika, and 1 tablespoon dried oregano', '3:  Rub in on all sides', '4: Pour half the BBQ 1 bottle BBQ sauce over the ribs and brush to evenly coat all sides', '5: Transfer the ribs to a large slow cooker', '6:  Position the ribs so they are standing up, with the meatier side down, and so the meat side is against the walls of the slow cooker, with the bone sides facing in', '7: Cover and cook on low for 7 - 8 hours, or high for 4 hours', '8:  Check after the allotted time, you want to make sure the meat is cooked through and tender, but you do not want it to be so tender it falls off the bone', '9:  If they seem a little tough, allow to cook an additional 30 minutes, as needed', '10: Remove the ribs and transfer to wire rack set over a foil-lined baking sheet', '11: Paint the ribs with additional BBQ 1 bottle BBQ sauce, ensuring they are well-coated on both sides', '12: Broil HIGH for 5-8 minutes to caramelize the 1 bottle BBQ sauce, making it slightly charred and bubbly', '13: Remove and carefully cut between the bones to separate into individual ribs', '14: Serve with additional BBQ 1 bottle BBQ sauce, as needed']

ingredients: ['3 ½ cups shredded cheddar cheese (350 g)', '1 cup shredded parmesan cheese (110 g)', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ clove garlic', '3 cups milk (710 mL)', '1 cup chicken stock (240 mL)', '1 cup broccoli (250 g) finely chopped', '1 baguette']
instructions: ['1: Over medium heat, combine cheese with 1 tablespoon cornstarch and ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2: Once melted, slowly add ½ clove garlic, 3 cups milk, and 1 cup chicken stock', '3: Add finely chopped 1 cup broccoli and allow to simmer about 5 minutes while making cheese toasts', '4: Cover slices of 1 baguette bread with shredded cheddar and broil for 3 minutes']

ingredients: ['3 mangoes peeled and chopped']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 75˚C (165˚F) (or as low as your oven will go!)Chop the mango and squeeze into a glass', '2: Blend the mango flesh until it forms a thick paste, a few bits are totally acceptable', '3: Spread an even, thin layer of the fruit onto a baking tray lined with baking paper, smooth it out using a spatula or cake knife', '4: Bake in the centre of an oven for 3', '5: 5 hours', '6:  The mango should be a tiny bit springy but not too juicy or too dry, the edges will probably dry out more than the centre', '7: Take the baking paper out of the tray and cut off the super dry edges on each side', '8: Roll up the mango, including the baking paper and cut into segments about 1', '9: 5 inches (4 cm) apart']

ingredients: ['1 clove garlic finely chopped', '2 small bay leaves fresh or dried', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon garam masala powder', '¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon asafoetida', '1 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves', '1 ½ tablespoons double cream', '¼ cup cashews (30 g) roughly chopped', '2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) or unsalted butter', '½ cup water (120 mL) or as required', '½ teaspoon salt or as per taste', 'Cooking paneer', '2 cups paneer (100 g) cut into cubes', '3 cups water (720 mL) boiling', '¼ teaspoon salt', 'Spinach puree:', '6 cups spinach (250 g)', '¼ teaspoon salt', '3 cups water (720 mL) boiling', '3 cups water (720 mL) cold', 'Gravy base:', '1 cup onion (150 g) (2 small or 1 large) roughly chopped', '1 cup tomato (220 g) (2 small or 1 large) roughly chopped', '2 green chillies roughly chopped', '2 garlic cloves roughy chopped', '1 inch piece ginger roughly chopped', 'Garnish:', '1 teaspoon ginger cut into matchsticks', '1 teaspoon coriander roughly chopped', '1 teaspoon cream']
instructions: ['1: Blanch the 6 cups spinach in salted, boiling water for one minute, then drain and transfer to a bowl with cold water', '2: Once cooled, puree in a blender until smooth and remove', '3: Heat some salted water and once it comes to a boil, switch off the gas and add the cubed paneer', '4:  Let it soak in the water till the time to be added to the gravy', '5: Add all the ingredients of the gravy base to a blender and mix until smooth', '6: Add the 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter to a hot pan with some oil (optional) to stop it from burning', '7:  Once foaming, add the ¼ cup cashews, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, finely 1 clove garlic finely ¼ cup cashews (30 g) roughly 1 cup onion (150 g) (2 small or 1 large) roughly 1 cup tomato (220 g) (2 small or 1 large) roughly 2 green chillies roughly 2 garlic cloves roughy 1 inch piece ginger roughly 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon coriander roughly chopped garlic, and 2 small bay leaves', '8:  Fry for a minute till aromatic', '9: Add the blended gravy, along with all the powders and stir well', '10:  Simmer on low heat for 15 minutes till you see oil seeping from the sides', '11:  The 1 cup onion-tomato gravy must smell fragrant by this point without any raw smell', '12: Add the 6 cups spinach puree and stir well to combine along with salt', '13:  Simmer on low heat for another 15 minutes until the rawness of the puree goes away and there is an intense gravy left', '14: Add the cream and water as required to make it velvety along with the drained paneer cubes and 1 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves', '15:  Simmer on low heat for another 5 minutes', '16: Garnish with 1 teaspoon coriander leaves, sliced ginger, and a dollop of cream', '17: Enjoy with naan bread or fluffy rice!']

ingredients: ['1 lb blueberry (455 g) frozen', '¼ cup honey (85 g)']
instructions: ['1: Add the blueberries and ¼ cup honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed', '2: Transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely 1 lb blueberry (455 g) frozen']

ingredients: ['2 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts (910 g)', '2 teaspoons kosher salt plus more to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons pepper plus more to taste', '½ cup all-purpose flour (60 g)', '4 teaspoons dried oregano divided', '4 teaspoons onion powder divided', '4 teaspoons dried basil divided', '4 teaspoons garlic powder divided', '2 large eggs', '2 cups panko bread crumbs (230 g) divided', '½ cup canola oil (120 mL)', '8 slices deli ham', '¼ cup shredded gruyère cheese (25 g)', '8 lasagna noodles oven-ready', 'fresh parsley finely chopped for garnish', 'Cheese Sauce', '6 tablespoons unsalted butter', '6 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '4 cups warm milk (960 mL)', '1 ½ cups shredded gruyère cheese (150 g)', '1 ½ cups swiss cheese (150 g) shredded', '2 teaspoons kosher salt']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Slice the 2 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts in half into cutlets and season with salt and pepper', '3: In a medium bowl, whisk together the ½ cup all-purpose 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour, salt, pepper, 2 teaspoons oregano, 2 teaspoons onion powder, 2 teaspoons basil, and 2 teaspoons garlic powder', '4: In another medium bowl, beat the eggs', '5: In another medium bowl, combine 1½ cups (75 G) of panko bread crumbs, the remaining 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 2 teaspoons basil, 2 teaspoons onion powder, and 2 teaspoons oregano', '6: In a 2 large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat', '7: Bread the 2 lb boneless skinless chicken cutlets by coating in the ½ cup all-purpose 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour mixture, then in the egg, and finally in the panko', '8: Working in batches, fry the breaded cutlets in the hot oil for 2 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through', '9:  Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain', '10: Make the cheese sauce: In a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the 6 tablespoons unsalted butter and ½ cup all-purpose 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '11:  Cook until the ½ cup all-purpose 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour is golden brown, about 2 minutes', '12: Slowly whisk in the warm milk until fully incorporated', '13:  Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until thickened, about 3 minutes', '14: Turn off the heat and whisk in the Gruyère and Swiss cheeses until completely melted', '15:  Add the salt and stir to combine', '16: Spread about ⅓ of the sauce in the bottom of a  9x13-inch (22x30 cm) baking dish', '17:  Top with 4 8 lasagna noodles, 4 2 lb boneless skinless chicken cutlets, and 4 8 slices of ham', '18:  13', '19:  Repeat to make another layer and then top with the remaining sauce', '20: Sprinkle the remaining ½ cup (25 G) of panko bread crumbs and the Gruyère cheese over the top', '21: Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and crispy', '22: Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve']

ingredients: ['4 boneless skinless chicken breasts', '1 tablespoon turmeric', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon garam masala', '½ tablespoon ground ginger', '2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', 'oil for frying', '1 red chili chopped', '2 cups tomato (400 g) chopped', '½ cup water (100 mL)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'rice to serve', 'fresh coriander to serve chopped']
instructions: ['1: Cut the 4 boneless skinless chicken into bite-size pieces', '2: Season the 4 boneless skinless chicken with 1 tablespoon turmeric, chili powder, 1 tablespoon ground cumin, 1 tablespoon garam masala, ½ tablespoon ground ginger, and 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar, and mix well', '3: Heat oil in a pot over a medium heat', '4:  Add the 4 boneless skinless chicken and cook until brown', '5: Add the chili, 1 red chili 2 cups tomato (400 g) fresh fresh coriander to serve chopped tomatoes, ½ cup water, salt, and pepper', '6: Mix well and bring to a boil', '7: Simmer for 1 hour, until the sauce has thickened', '8: Serve with rice and 1 red chili 2 cups tomato (400 g) fresh fresh coriander to serve chopped fresh coriander']

ingredients: ['8 oz lobster tail (225 g) 2 tails', '3 tablespoons butter melted', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon fresh parsley chopped', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '2 wedges lemon to serve', 'broccoli cooked to serve']
instructions: ['1: Using a clean pair of scissors or kitchen shears, cut along the middle of the top of the shell towards the fins of the tail, making sure to cut in a straight line', '2:  Do not cut through the end of the tail', '3: Using a spoon, separate the meat from the two sides of the shell, then lift the meat up and out from inside the shell', '4: Press the two sides of the shell together, then lay the meat over the seam where the two shells meet', '5: If you are having difficulty opening the shell up to lift out the meat, flip the tail over and make cuts along the carapace where the legs meet the bottom part tail', '6:  This will help break the rigid structure of the shell and allow it to be more flexible', '7: While cutting through the shell, you may have also cut into the meat, which is perfectly okay', '8:  Make a shallow cut through the middle of the 8 oz lobster meat so that you can peel down the thin layer of meat over the sides', '9:  This gives the 8 oz lobster tail its signature look', '10: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C)', '11: In a small bowl, combine the 3 tablespoons butter, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon fresh parsley, then brush the mixture evenly over the 8 oz lobster meat', '12: Place the tails onto a baking sheet, then bake for approximately 12-15 minutes, until the 8 oz lobster is fully cooked but not rubbery', '13: Serve with a side of broccoli and a lemon wedge']

ingredients: ['¾ cup raw cashews (95 g)', 'warm water for soaking', 'coconut oil for greasing', '1 ¼ cups water (300 mL)', 'kosher salt', '¼ cup organic cane sugar (50 g)', '1 vanilla bean seeded', '¼ cup hot water (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon agar agar', 'fresh berry for ganish']
instructions: ['1: Add the ¾ cup raw cashews to a medium bowl', '2:  Pour in enough warm warm 1 ¼ cups ¼ cup ¼ cup hot water to completely cover the ¾ cup raw cashews, then soak for at least 2 hours, or overnight', '3:  Drain', '4: Grease 4 4-ounce ramekins with coconut oil and set aside', '5: Add the ¾ cup raw cashews to a blender with the warm 1 ¼ cups ¼ cup ¼ cup hot water and a pinch of kosher salt', '6:  Blend on high speed for 2 minutes, or until very creamy', '7: In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the cashew cream, ¼ cup organic cane sugar, and 1 vanilla bean seeds', '8:  Warm slowly, stirring occasionally, until the ¼ cup organic cane sugar is dissolved and the mixture is simmering', '9: Add the 1 teaspoon agar 1 teaspoon agar to the ¼ cup hot warm 1 ¼ cups ¼ cup ¼ cup hot water and stir until there are no lumps and the 1 teaspoon agar 1 teaspoon agar is fully dissolved', '10: Pour the 1 teaspoon agar mixture into the warm cashew cream and whisk to combine', '11:  Increase the heat to medium, bring to a gentle boil, and whisk continuously for 3 minutes, until thickened', '12:  Remove the cream from the heat and immediately divide between the greased ramekins', '13:  Smooth the tops', '14: Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or until ready to serve', '15:  (The 1 teaspoon agar will set at room temperature, but chilling the panna cotta in the fridge will expedite the process', '16: )When ready to serve, use an offset spatula or butter knife to carefully work around the edges of the ramekins to loosen the panna cotta', '17:  Invert onto serving plates and garnish with fresh berries']

ingredients: ['1 flour tortilla burrito sized', '2 tablespoons almond butter', '1 banana peeled']
instructions: ['1: Evenly spread 2 tablespoons almond butter over one side of the 1 flour tortilla', '2: Place 1 banana along one edge of the 1 flour tortilla, and roll up', '3: Slice the roll into small pieces']

ingredients: ['1 sheet puff pastry', '15 slices pepperoni', '1 cup marinara sauce (65 g)', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese (50 g)', '1 egg for egg wash']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Cut the 1 sheet puff pastry into six rectangles and place on a nonstick baking tray', '3: On one rectangle, spread a tablespoon of 1 cup marinara, avoiding the edges of the pastry', '4:  Top with pepperoni slices and ½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '5: Place a rectangle of pastry on top and seal the edges with a fork', '6:  Repeat with remaining pastry rectangles', '7: Brush the pockets with 1 egg wash', '8: Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is flaky and golden']

ingredients: ['1 head cauliflower', '1 chicken breast diced', '1 cup peas (150 g)', '1 cup carrot (120 g)', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 teaspoons black pepper', '3 eggs beaten', '2 tablespoons sesame seed']
instructions: ['1: Remove all leaves and cut the 1 head cauliflower into small florets', '2: Place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture', '3:  Be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy', '4:  Set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired', '5: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the 1 chicken until no pink is showing', '6: Add the 1 cup peas, carrots, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and 2 teaspoons black pepper', '7: Stir until most of the liquid has reduced, then add the 1 head cauliflower rice', '8:  Cook for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables and 1 chicken are incorporated evenly into the 1 head cauliflower', '9: Spread the rice towards the edge of the pan, creating a well in the center', '10: Pour the beaten 3 eggs into the well, stirring only the 3 eggs until they are cooked', '11: Fold the 3 eggs into the rice, then mix in the 2 tablespoons sesame seeds']

ingredients: ['Mashed Potatoes', '1 lb potato (455 g) cooked and peeled', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '½ cup shredded parmesan cheese (50 g)', '1 cup milk (235 mL)', 'Meatloaf Glaze', '¾ cup ketchup (180 g)', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '¼ cup brown sugar (55 g)', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon mustard powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', 'Meatloaf', '1 tablespoon cooking oil', '1 cup onion (150 g) diced', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 lb ground beef (455 g) 85%/15% fat', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce', '½ cup shredded parmesan cheese (50 g)', '¼ cup fresh parsley (10 g)', '1 egg beaten', '½ cup panko breadcrumbs (25 g)', '¼ cup milk (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: Place 1 lb potato (455 g) cooked potatoes into a large bowl', '3:  Add 2 tablespoons butter, salt, pepper, parmesan, and a splash of milk', '4:  Mash and add more milk gradually until the potatoes are the desired texture', '5:  Set aside and let cool', '6: Prepare the glaze by mixing ketchup, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon 1 cup onion powder, 1 teaspoon mustard powder, and 1 teaspoon paprika in a bowl', '7:  Reserve half in a separate bowl to glaze once 1 lb potato (455 g) cooked', '8: Add oil in a skillet over medium heat, followed by 1 teaspoon 1 cup onions and 1 tablespoon garlic', '9:  Cook until 1 teaspoon 1 cup onions are translucent and fragrant', '10:  Set aside in a bowl to cool before adding to the meat mixture', '11: In a large bowl, combine 1 lb ground beef, salt, pepper, 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce, parmesan, parsley, cooled 1 teaspoon 1 cup onions & 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 egg, breadcrumbs and milk', '12:  Mix until combined', '13: Using a spoon or ice cream scooper, scoop the meat mixture and place into a greased 12 cup cupcake baking tin', '14: Using your fingers, spread the meat from the center to make a cup', '15:  Fill the middle with a small spoonful of mashed potatoes, and cover back up with the meat mixture', '16: Generously brush half of the reserved glaze on top of the meatloaf cups generously', '17: Bake for 25 minutes, reapplying the glaze halfway through', '18:  Once they are done 1 tablespoon cooking, brush with the remaining glaze that has Not been used on the raw meatloaves']

ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray for greasing', '1 medium spaghetti squash', '2 tablespoons olive oil divided', '1 medium yellow onion diced', '2 cloves garlic minced', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 lb ground beef (455 g)', '¼ cup tomato paste (60 g)', '1 can tomato diced', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese (200 g)', '½ cup fresh basil leaf (20 g) for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200°C)', '2:  Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with nonstick spray', '3: On a cutting board, cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise', '4:  Scoop out the seeds and discard', '5:  Drizzle 1 tablespoon of 2 tablespoons olive oil over the cut sides of the squash, then transfer to a rimmed baking sheet, cut side-down', '6: Bake the squash until fork-tender, about 1 hour', '7:  Let the spaghetti squash cool for 5 minutes, then use a fork to pull the strands of spaghetti squash and transfer to a medium bowl', '8: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the remaining tablespoon of 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat', '9:  Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook until softened and light golden, about 5 minutes', '10:  Add the 2 cloves garlic and ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes and cook, stirring constantly, until aromatic, about 1 minute', '11: Add the ground beef and cook, breaking up the meat with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes', '12:  Add the tomato paste and cook, stirring often, until combined, about 1 minute', '13: Add the diced tomatoes, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, and pepper, and stir to combine', '14:  Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 5 minutes', '15:  Stir in the spaghetti squash until well combined', '16: Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread in an even layer', '17:  Sprinkle the 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese over the casserole', '18: Bake until the 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese is melted and golden brown, about 20 minutes', '19:  Remove from the oven and let the casserole cool for 5 minutes', '20: Top with the ½ cup fresh basil, then serve']

ingredients: ['3 apples thinly sliced', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon cinnamon', '2 cups flour (250 g)', '2 cups old-fashioned oat (200 g)', '1 cup brown sugar (220 g)', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon salt', '¾ cup butter (170 g) melted']
instructions: ['1: Remove the core and thinly slice 3 apples', '2: Place apple slices in a large bowl and gently mix in ¼ cup 1 cup 1 cup brown sugar, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and 1 tablespoon cinnamon', '3:  Set aside', '4: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '5: In another bowl, combine 2 cups flour, 2 cups old-fashioned oats, 1 cup brown ¼ cup 1 cup 1 cup brown sugar, ½ teaspoon baking soda, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¾ cup butter', '6:  Mix until crumbly', '7: Line a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) ½ teaspoon baking dish with parchment paper and pour ⅔ of the 2 cups old-fashioned oats mixture in the bottom of the pan, pressing firmly to pack it down to make a crust', '8: Pour 3 apples over the crust and spread in an even layer', '9:  Pour the remaining 2 cups old-fashioned oat mixture over the top and spread evenly', '10: Bake for 30 minutes, or until golden 1 cup brown', '11: Cool completely before cutting']

ingredients: ['2 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs (1 kg)', '2 tablespoons thai green curry paste add more depending on how spicy you like it', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '3 cups red bell pepper (300 g) sliced', '½ cup green beans (200 g) topped and tailed', '1 red chili chopped and deseeded', '15 oz coconut milk (400 g) 1 can', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'oil for frying', 'rice']
instructions: ['1: Sear the 2 lb bone-in skin-on chicken in batches in a few tablespoons of oil, seasoning with salt and pepper as you go', '2: Transfer to the slow cooker and spoon over the Thai 2 tablespoons thai ½ cup green curry paste and drizzle over the soy sauce', '3: Cook on high for 2', '4: 5 hours', '5: Stir in the peppers, 2 tablespoons thai ½ cup green beans, chilli, and 15 oz coconut milk', '6: Cook for a further 30 minutes', '7: Serve over rice']

ingredients: ['4 cups potato (900 g) peeled and chopped', '¾ cup onion (115 g)', '4 cups chicken broth (960 mL)', '½ tablespoon salt', '½ tablespoon pepper', '4 tablespoons butter', '¼ cup flour (30 g)', '1 ½ cups heavy cream (360 mL)', '¼ cup sour cream (60 g)', 'shredded cheese to taste', 'bacon to taste', 'scallion chopped']
instructions: ['1: Add the potatoes, onions, 4 cups chicken broth, ½ tablespoon salt and ½ tablespoon pepper to the slow cooker', '2: Set it to low for 6 hours or high for 4 hours', '3: In a saucepan, combine the 4 tablespoons butter, ¼ cup flour, 1 ½ cups heavy cream and ¼ cup sour cream', '4:  Whisk until thickened', '5: When the slow cooker is done, pour in the thickened mix', '6:  Stir, cover and set the slow cooker to low for another 30 minutes', '7: Serve with shredded cheese, bacon and chopped scallions']

ingredients: ['Paneer', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter 1/2 stick', '2 green chillis sliced', '1 large onion finely chopped', '1 tablespoon garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon ginger crushed', '1 ½ cups tomato puree', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 tablespoon paneer masala', '1 red bell pepper sliced lengthwise', '1 teaspoon salt to taste', '2 cups heavy cream (480 mL)', '14 oz paneer cheese (395 g) 1 block cubed', 'For Serving', 'fresh cilantro for garnish', 'naan bread', 'rice cooked']
instructions: ['1: Melt the 4 tablespoons unsalted butter in a 5qt-pot over medium heat', '2: Add chili, and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally', '3:  Add the 1 large onion and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes', '4:  Add the crushed 1 tablespoon garlic and 1 tablespoon ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant', '5:  Stirring occasionally', '6:  Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook until the 1 large onion is completely softened, about 10 minutes', '7:  Stir occasionally to make sure bottom doesn’t burn', '8: Add the 1 ½ cups tomato puree', '9:  Stir well and cover again', '10:  Cook until 1 ½ cups tomato looks like it’s almost separating, and is 1 reduced in volume by half, about 10 minutes', '11: Add the 1 teaspoon ground coriander and paneer masala', '12:  Stir well', '13:  Add the 1 red bell pepper and cook until the pepper is half-cooked, about 5 minutes', '14:  Add the 1 teaspoon salt, cover again, and cook for another 5 minutes', '15: Add the 2 cups heavy cream', '16:  Stir well, then add the cubed paneer and cover', '17:  Cook for 25 minutes all the ingredients are tender', '18: Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with naan or rice']

ingredients: ['Marinade', '¼ lb chicken breast (120 g) diced', '½ lemon lemon  zest', '1 teaspoon garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Chicken Breading', '½ cup flour (50 g)', '2 eggs beaten', '1 cup panko breadcrumbs (50 g)', '2 cups oil (500 mL)', 'Lemon sauce', '¼ cup chicken stock (60 mL)', '½ lemon lemon  zest', '1 lemon juiced', '4 tablespoons sugar', '1 tablespoon water', '½ tablespoon corn flour', 'Preparation', 'Marinade', '¼ lb chicken breast (120 g) diced', '½ lemon lemon  zest', '1 teaspoon garlic crushed', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'Chicken Breading', '½ cup flour (50 g)', '2 eggs beaten', '1 cup panko breadcrumbs (50 g)', '2 cups oil (500 mL)', 'Lemon sauce', '¼ cup chicken stock (60 mL)', '½ lemon lemon  zest', '1 lemon juiced', '4 tablespoons sugar', '1 tablespoon water', '½ tablespoon corn flour', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Combine all marinade ingredients with the chicken breast and leave for 20 minutes', '2: Coat the chicken breast first in flour, then eggs, and finally panko breadcrumbs', '3: In a medium-sized saucepan heat the oil to 325˚F (170°C),Deep fry the breaded chicken for about 3-4 minutes until the coating is golden brown', '4: In a small frying pan, combine the chicken stock, lemon juice, and sugar', '5:  Bring the mixture to a boil', '6: Mix the corn flour with the water, then add the mixture to the frying pan to thicken the sauce', '7: Add the chicken to the frying pan and coat with the lemon sauce', '8: Serve on top of rice', '9:  (We garnished ours with green onions and sesame seeds', '10: )Nutrition  Calories: 4856 Fat: 436 grams  Carbs: 188 grams Fiber: 9 grams  Sugars: 47 grams  Protein: 66 grams']

ingredients: ['1 large boneless skinless chicken breast', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', 'flour as needed', '3 tablespoons butter', '½ cup chicken broth (120 mL)', '1 lemon Juiced', '2 tablespoons caper']
instructions: ['1: Butterfly the chicken breast and pound it thin', '2:  Salt and pepper to taste', '3: Dredge each piece in flour, shaking off the excess', '4: In a skillet over high heat, melt three Tbsp', '5:  3 tablespoons butter, and brown the chicken, the browner and crispier the better, 3–5 minutes on each side', '6: Remove chicken from the skillet, and, in the same pan, add chicken stock, 1 lemon, and capers', '7: Boil until the sauce reduces by ⅓, and return the chicken to the skillet', '8: Spoon sauce over the chicken several times', '9: Serve immediately, with the remaining sauce poured over the chicken']

ingredients: ['vegetable oil', '1 package kielbasa sausage cubed', '1 leek white park only sliced', '6 green onions white part only chopped', '1 can corn drained', '1 can kidney bean drained', '1 can tomato paste', '2 teaspoons McCormick dark chili powder', 'water']
instructions: ['1: Heat vegetable oil in a deep-bottomed pot and add 1 package kielbasa sausage', '2:  Cook until browned', '3: Add 6 green onions and 1 package kielbasa sausage and cook until tender', '4:  Then add 2 teaspoons McCormick dark chili powder, 1 can corn, 1 can kidney beans, and 1 can tomato paste and stir to combine', '5: Add enough water to cover the contents of the pot', '6:  Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes', '7: Serve alongside a toasted French baguette']

ingredients: ['1 egg', '1 egg yolk', '2 ¼ cups flour (280 g)', '1 tablespoon milk', '1 cup sugar (100 g)', '1 cup butter (230 g)', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '2 teaspoons lemongrass paste']
instructions: ['1: Combine all ingredients into the bowl of a heavy duty stand mixer', '2:  Mix on low speed, scraping along the side of the bowl constantly', '3: Once dough is thoroughly mixed, wrap it in plastic and chill the dough for an hour, and up to 2 days', '4: When you are ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350°F', '5: Roll the dough out until ½-inch thick and cut into desired shapes', '6:  Bake for 10-12 minutes', '7: Transfer to a rack immediately after taking them out of the oven', '8:  Decorate as desired and serve']

ingredients: ['Mojo Turkey', '1 cup shredded turkey (125 g)', '½ cup fresh orange juice (120 mL)', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '4 cloves garlic minced', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', 'Cubanos', '4 hoagie rolls', '2 tablespoons yellow mustard', '8 slices spiral cut ham', '8 swiss cheeses', '16 dill pickles', '½ stick unsalted butter melted']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C)', '2: Make the mojo 1 cup shredded turkey: Add the 1 cup shredded turkey, ½ cup fresh orange juice, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 4 cloves garlic, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, and 1 teaspoon dried oregano to a large bowl', '3:  Toss well, then set aside', '4: Split the 4 hoagie rolls in half lengthwise and spread 1½ teaspoons of 2 tablespoons yellow mustard over each roll', '5: On the bottom half of each roll, layer 2 8 slices of ham, ¼ of the mojo 1 cup shredded turkey, 2 8 slices of Swiss cheese, and 4 16 dill pickle chips', '6: Bring the sandwiches together and set on a rimmed baking sheet', '7:  Brush the top and bottom of each roll with the melted ½ stick unsalted butter', '8: Place another baking sheet on top of the sandwiches and put a cast iron skillet or other heavy pan on top to compress the sandwiches', '9: Transfer to the oven and bake for 20 minutes, until the exterior of the bread is golden and crispy and the cheese is melted']

ingredients: ['Chicken', '1 ½ cups panko breadcrumbs (75 g)', '¼ cup parmesan cheese (30 g) grated', '1 teaspoon salt plus more for taste', '1 teaspoon pepper plus more for taste', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '2 chicken breasts', '1 cup all purpose flour (125 g)', '3 large eggs beaten', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'Dressing', '⅔ cup sour cream (155 g)', '⅓ cup buttermilk (80 mL)', '¼ cup parmesan cheese (30 g) grated', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', 'Salad', '16 oz mixed greens (455 g)', '2 cups mixed cherry tomato (400 g) halved', '½ red onion thinly sliced']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 425˚F (220˚C)', '2: In a medium bowl, combine the 1 ½ cups panko bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, 1 teaspoon paprika, and garlic powder', '3:  Mix together with a fork', '4: Season the 2 chicken breasts on both sides with pepper and salt to taste', '5: Add the flour and eggs to 2 separate medium bowls', '6:  Dip the 2 chicken breasts in the flour and shake off the excess', '7:  Then, dip in the eggs', '8:  Finally, dip in the bread crumb mixture', '9:  Make sure the 2 chicken is well-coated', '10: Place the 2 chicken breasts on a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil', '11: Bake for 25 minutes, or until deep golden brown and a meat thermometer inserted in the thick part of a breast registers at least 165˚F (75˚C)', '12: While the 2 chicken is cooking, make the dressing: In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the sour cream, buttermilk, Parmesan, garlic, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper', '13:  Stir to combine', '14:  If you prefer a thinner dressing, add a few more splashes of buttermilk', '15: To assemble the salad, add the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and ½ red onion to a 3 large bowl', '16:  Drizzle about ½ the dressing over the salad and toss to combine', '17: Slice the 2 chicken, then serve on top of the salad and drizzle with more dressing']

ingredients: ['1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature', '⅓ cup sugar (65 g)', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '1 ¼ cups all purpose flour (155 g)', '1 egg yolk', 'nonstick cooking spray with flour', '3 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 large egg', '2 large egg yolks', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into pieces', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '4 cups fresh mixed berries (600 g)', '¼ teaspoon apricot jam (60 g)', 'Preparation', '1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature', '⅓ cup sugar (65 g)', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup sugar (100 g)', '1 ¼ cups all purpose flour (155 g)', '1 egg yolk', 'nonstick cooking spray with flour', '3 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 large egg', '2 large egg yolks', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into pieces', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '4 cups fresh mixed berries (600 g)', '¼ teaspoon apricot jam (60 g)', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream the butter, sugar, and salt on medium speed until pale and creamy, about 2 minutes', '2:  Once combined, add flour and mix on low for 30 seconds', '3:  Then, add the egg yolk and mix on low speed for an additional 30 seconds', '4: Lightly knead the dough into a ball', '5:  Then, press it into a 6-inch disk, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap, and let it rest in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes', '6: Lightly spray a 9-inch pie shell with nonstick cooking spray and place the chilled dough inside the pan', '7: Pinch off pieces of dough and press them against the sides of the pan to reach the top', '8:  Cover with plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 30 minutes to chill', '9: Preheat the oven to 350°F and bake the dough for 23 to 26 minutes, or until lightly golden', '10: To make the filling, heat the milk in a medium pot until just boiling', '11:  Then, remove the pot from the heat', '12: While the milk is cooling but still warm to the touch, in a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, egg, egg yolks, and cornstarch', '13:  Then, once combined, add a cup of the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to avoid curdling', '14: Return the pot to the heat and cook over medium heat, whisking until the cream thickens, about 2 minutes', '15:  Then, stir in the butter and vanilla and cook one minute more, whisking constantly', '16: Chill until cold (roughly for a few hours in a bow), covered', '17: To glaze the fruit, in a small saucepan, heat the apricot jam with 1 tablespoon of water over medium heat, whisking, until thin', '18: Assemble the tart with the filling, fruit and glaze over the fruit', '19:  Serve']

ingredients: ['Fillings', '1 lb ground chicken (455 g)', '½ red onion finely chopped', '½ cup scallions (50 g) finely chopped', '½ cup fresh cilantro (20 g) finely chopped', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon ginger grated', '1 teaspoon turmeric', '1 teaspoon red chili powder', '1 teaspoon garam masala', '2 tablespoons ghee melted or butter', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '80 small dumpling wrappers', 'napa cabbage or parchment paper to line the steamer', '2 cups chutney (640 g) optional', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '4 medium tomatoes chopped', '4 thai chilis chopped', '1 tablespoon garlic minced', '1 tablespoon ginger grated', '½ teaspoon turmeric', '1 teaspoon szechuan pepper or dried chilies', 'salt to taste', '2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (10 g)']
instructions: ['1: Make the filling: In a large bowl, combine the 1 lb ground chicken, red onion, ½ cup scallions, cilantro, garlic, ginger, turmeric, chili powder, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 2 tablespoons ghee, and 2 tablespoons 1 tablespoon olive oil', '2:  Mix well with your hands', '3: Place a tablespoon of filling in the middle of a 80 small dumpling wrapper', '4:  Using your finger, lightly wet the outer rim with water', '5: Pinch the top of the wrapper, using your fingers to pleat and tighten as you close so it looks like a little pouch', '6:  Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling', '7: Bring a large pot filled a third of the way with water to boil over high heat and top with a 80 small dumpling steamer basket', '8:  Line the basket with napa cabbage leaves', '9:  Steam the momos in batches for 12-15 minutes, until the wrapper becomes slightly translucent', '10: Make the dipping sauce: In a 4 medium saucepan, heat the 2 tablespoons 1 tablespoon olive oil over 4 medium heat', '11:  Add the tomatoes, 4 thai chilies, garlic, ginger, turmeric, and Szechuan peppers', '12:  Season with salt', '13:  Cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomato is softened, for 5 minutes', '14:  Remove the pan from the heat, and let cool for 5-10 minutes', '15: Transfer the tomato mixture to a blender and add the 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds and cilantro', '16:  Blend until smooth', '17: Serve the momos with the dipping 2 cups chutney']

ingredients: ['3 cups cooked and shredded chicken (375 g)', '1 onion chopped', '1 red bell pepper chopped', '1 jalapeño chopped', '1 cup taco sauce (260 g)', '20 taco-size tortillas', '3 cups shredded cheddar cheese (300 g)', '3 cups shredded monterey jack cheese (300 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 375˚F (190˚C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: In a large bowl, add the 3 cups cooked and shredded chicken, 1 onion, 1 red bell pepper, 1 jalapeño, and 1 cup 20 taco sauce, and mix to combine', '4:  Set aside', '5: Cut each tortilla in half', '6:  Evenly add about 2 tablespoons each of the 3 cups shredded cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and 3 cups cooked and shredded chicken mixture to each tortilla half', '7: Roll the tortillas into cones, starting fro the cut edge and making sure not to push the ingredients out of the tortilla', '8: Place a wide mouth jar or glass in the center of the baking sheet', '9: Create a ring around the jar with about 13 tortilla cones', '10:  The points of the cones should be in the center, touching the jar', '11:  Sprinkle 3 cups shredded cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese over the layer', '12:  Repeat with the remaining cones to make 2 more layers, finishing with the rest of the 3 cups shredded cheddar and Monterey Jack', '13:  Remove the jar from the center of the ring', '14: Bake until the cheese is melted and the edges of the tortillas are crispy, 15-20 minutes', '15: Carefully transfer the blooming quesadilla to a serving platter', '16:  Place your dip of choice inside the ring and top with your desired garnishes', '17:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['¼ cup maple syrup (55 g)', '1 egg', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup whole wheat flour (115 g)', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup old-fashioned oat (100 g)', '1 cup raisin (150 g)', 'Butter Substitution Options (choose one)', '¼ cup unsweetened applesauce (65 mL)', '½ avocado mashed', '½ banana mashed', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Mix ¼ cup unsweetened applesauce (or mashed ½ avocado, mashed ½ banana, ¼ cup olive oil), ¼ cup maple syrup, 1 egg, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3: Add in 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1 pinch salt', '4:  Mix until combined', '5: Fold in old-fashioned rolled oats and raisins until mixed', '6: Scoop mix onto a oil sprayed ½ teaspoon baking tray', '7: Bake for 12-15 minutes']

ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil (60 mL) divided plus more for drizzling', '20 oz riced cauliflower (565 g)', '5 oz leek (140 g) tough green ends removed cut into half moons and rinsed', '5 cloves garlic smashed', '1 tablespoon kosher salt plus 2 teaspoons divided plus more to taste', '4 cups vegetable stock (960 mL)', '2 cups non-dairy milk (480 mL) plus more to taste divided', '10 oz asparagus (285 g) woody stems removed cut into 1/2 in (1 1/4 cm) pieces', '6 oz english pea (170 g) frozen', '1 lemon zest', '¼ cup fresh basil (10 g) plus more for garnish', '1 ½ lb medium red potato (680 g) cut into 1/2 in (1 1/4 cm) cubes', 'cold water', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', 'freshly ground black pepper for garnish']
