instructions: ['1: Set up a clear, round corningware dish (i', '2: e', '3:  a Pyrex baking dish)', '4: For your first layer of beans, cook 2 2 cups (340 G) dry pinto beans in an Instant Pot or Pressure Cooker', '5:  Let cool', '6:  Transfer to a blender', '7:  Add a bit of water and blend to a smooth paste (about 1 cup)', '8:   Alternatively, you can use an 8 oz can of refried beans', '9: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a sauté pan on medium heat and add 2 cloves garlic', '10:  Sauté till aromatic', '11: Add bean paste and sprinkle in ½ teaspoon paprika, 1 tablespoon taco seasoning, and salt to taste', '12:  Mix well', '13:  Let the beans cook for a few minutes and then take off flame', '14:  Spread this paste on the bottom of the bean dip, creating an even layer', '15: Then, layer sour cream on top evenly', '16:  On top of this, layer the avocados, mashed fully and mixed with the juice of half of a medium-sized lime', '17:  (Note: Alternatively, you could use 1 cup store bought guacamole', '18: )Then, sprinkle shredded Mexican cheese along the outer layer of the dip to form a ring on top of the avocado', '19: Add your finely-diced tomatoes and red onion pieces to a small bowl', '20:  Squeeze in the juice of half a medium sized lime', '21:  Mix well', '22:  (Note: Instead of pico de gallo, you could use 2 tbsp of store bought salsa', '23: ) Spread the pico de gallo (or salsa) on top of the cheese ring', '24: Sprinkle thinly sliced 1 handful black 1 tablespoon 1 handful 1 handful black olives and thinly sliced green 1 handful scallions on top', '25: To make the spider web: add 2 tbsp of sour cream to a small squirt bottle, thinning out with a little water if needed', '26: ', '27:  Squeeze out the sour cream and draw a spider web on top of the avocado', '28: Top with a friendly 1 tablespoon 1 handful 1 handful black olive spider or plastic spider and serve alongside tortilla chips']

ingredients: ['Dressing', '1 small shallot minced', '½ cup cold water (120 mL)', '2 garlics', '½ teaspoon kosher salt plus more to taste', '1 tablespoon caper drained and minced', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '4 tablespoons white wine vinegar', '6 tablespoons olive oil', 'Salad', '1 ½ cups couscous (345 g) warm', '8 black mission figs cut into eighths', '¾ cup dried yellow apricot (140 g) halved', '¾ cup green olives (135 g) such as Calvestrano pitted and halved', '½ cup fresh parsley (120 mL) loosely packed minced', '½ cup slivered almonds (70 g) toasted']
instructions: ['1: In a 1 small bowl, combine the shallot and ½ cup cold water', '2:  Set aside while you prepare the dressing ', '3: Place the garlic cloves on a cutting board and smash with the side of a knife', '4:  Sprinkle with the ½ teaspoon kosher salt', '5:  With the blade edge of the knife facing away from you and nearly parallel to the cutting board, begin pressing against the garlic to create a paste with the ½ teaspoon kosher salt', '6: Add the garlic paste, capers, ½ teaspoon dried oregano, and white wine vinegar to a medium bowl and whisk to combine', '7:  Starting with a few drops and steadily increasing the stream, slowly drizzle in the oil, whisking continuously, until the dressing is thickened and emulsified', '8: Drain the shallots, then mix into the dressing', '9: Make the salad: Add the 1 ½ cups couscous to a large bowl', '10:  Add 3 tablespoons of the dressing and toss to coat', '11:  Gently fold in the 8 black mission figs, apricots, ¾ cup green olives, and ½ cup fresh parsley', '12:  Dress with 1-2 more tablespoons of dressing and toss to coat', '13: Just before serving, fold in the ½ cup slivered almonds', '14:  Serve with the remaining dressing alongside']

ingredients: ['unsalted butter softened for greasing', 'Option 1: Prepared Mix', '18 oz brownie mix (510 g) prepared according to package instructions', 'Option 2: From Scratch', '2 ¼ cups granulated sugar (450 g)', '1 ¼ cups dutch processed cocoa  powder (150 g)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour (190 g)', '1 cup vegetable oil (240 mL)', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '3 large eggs', '¼ cup water (60 mL)', 'Additions', '1 ½ cups chocolate chips (350 g)', '8 oz cream cheese (225 g)', '⅓ cup granulated sugar (65 g)', '1 large egg', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'whipped cream for serving', 'rainbow sprinkle for topping']
instructions: ['1: Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350°F (180°C)', '2: Grease a 9-by-13-inch (23-by-33-cm) dark metal pan with softened unsalted butter, then line with parchment paper, leaving overhang on all sides', '3:  Grease the parchment with more unsalted butter', '4: OPTION 1: If using prepared mix, make the 18 oz brownie batter according to the package instructions', '5: OPTION 2: If making the 18 oz brownie batter from scratch, in a large bowl, whisk together the sugar, 1 ¼ cups dutch processed cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '6:  Add the 1 cup vegetable oil, vanilla, eggs, and ¼ cup water and whisk to combine', '7: Stir in the 1 ½ cups chocolate chunks', '8: In a medium bowl, whisk together the 8 oz whipped cream cheese, sugar, egg, and vanilla', '9: Pour the 18 oz brownie batter into the prepared 1 teaspoon baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula', '10: Pour the 8 oz whipped cream cheese mixture over the top and swirl into the batter with a knife or skewer', '11: Bake until lightly puffed on top, about 20 minutes', '12:  Transfer the 18 oz brownie pan to a wire rack and let cool completely, about 30 minutes', '13: Use the parchment paper to lift the cooled 18 oz brownies out of the pan and cut into 12 bars', '14: Serve with a dollop of whipped 8 oz whipped cream and a pinch of sprinkles']

ingredients: ['1 freshly made chocolate cake prepared from scratch or using a packaged mix', '14 oz can of dulce de leche warmed', '16 oz can of chocolate frosting', '½ cup chopped pecans (65 g)', '½ cup mini chocolate chips (90 g)', 'caramel syrup to taste']
instructions: ['1: Using the back of a wooden spoon, poke at least 3 rows of 4 holes in the cooked cake, making 12 holes total', '2:  Pour the 14 oz can of dulce de leche over the cake and let settle into the holes for about 10 minutes', '3:  Some of the 14 oz can of dulce de leche will still stay on top, which is okay', '4:  If necessary, it can be reheated or mixed with a little milk to be thinned', '5: Spread the chocolate frosting evenly on top of the cake', '6:  Sprinkle the ½ cup chopped pecans and ½ cup mini chocolate chips on top of the frosting, then drizzle with the caramel', '7:  Chill the cake for at least 3 hours or up to overnight']

ingredients: ['Stew', '1 lb roma tomato (455 g) chopped', '½ medium red onion chopped', '1 red bell pepper seeded and chopped', '1 habanero pepper or Scotch Bonnet pepper depending on desired spice level', '1 bay leaf', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 teaspoon curry powder', '2 meggi seasoning cubes', 'Risotto', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ medium yellow onion diced', '2 garlics minced', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 cup arborio rice (200 g)', '½ cup dry white wine (120 mL)', '3 cups chicken stock (720 mL) hot', 'kosher salt to taste', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', 'Suya-Spiced Prawns', '1 lb large prawn (455 g) peeled and deveined tails left on', '3 teaspoons suya spice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 garlics minced', 'fresh flat-leaf parsley for garnish', 'salt to taste', '1 fried sweet plantain for serving', 'Preparation', 'Stew', '1 lb roma tomato (455 g) chopped', '½ medium red onion chopped', '1 red bell pepper seeded and chopped', '1 habanero pepper or Scotch Bonnet pepper depending on desired spice level', '1 bay leaf', '¼ cup vegetable oil (60 mL)', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 teaspoon curry powder', '2 meggi seasoning cubes', 'Risotto', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ medium yellow onion diced', '2 garlics minced', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 cup arborio rice (200 g)', '½ cup dry white wine (120 mL)', '3 cups chicken stock (720 mL) hot', 'kosher salt to taste', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', 'Suya-Spiced Prawns', '1 lb large prawn (455 g) peeled and deveined tails left on', '3 teaspoons suya spice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 garlics minced', 'fresh flat-leaf parsley for garnish', 'salt to taste', '1 fried sweet plantain for serving', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Make the stew: In a blender, combine the tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, and habanero', '2:  Blend until smooth', '3: Pour the tomato puree into a medium pot set over medium-high heat', '4:  3', '5:  Add the bay leaf', '6:  Bring to boil and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the water has cooked off and the sauce is reduced by about half', '7: Add the vegetable oil and fry the sauce for 10-15 minutes more', '8: Add the thyme and curry powder, then crumble in the Maggi cubes', '9:  Cook for another 10 minutes', '10:  Remove from the heat and set aside', '11: Make the risotto: Heat the olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat', '12:  Add the onion and cook for 3-5 minutes, until softened', '13:  Add the garlic and tomato paste and cook until the tomato paste is deep brick-red in color, about 5 minutes', '14: Add the rice and sauté until well-coated with the tomato oil', '15:  Deglaze the pan with the wine and reduce until the pan is almost dry', '16: Add 1 ladle of hot stock to the rice', '17:  Stir the rice until the stock is absorbed and the pan is almost dry', '18:  Continue adding stock, 1 ladle at a time, until the rice is tender, but still firm', '19:  It should be moist and creamy, but not runny', '20: Add the stew and stir to incorporate', '21:  Remove the risotto from the heat, then season with salt and stir in the butter, then stir until melted and well incorporated', '22:  Remove the risotto from the heat', '23: Make the shrimp: In a medium bowl, toss the shrimp with the suya spice until well coated', '24: Heat the olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat', '25:  Add the garlic and prawns and cook, flipping once, until the prawns are pink and opaque, 4-5 minutes', '26:  Remove the pan from the heat and sprinkle the shrimp with the parsley', '27: Divide the risotto between 2 warm serving plates', '28:  Top with the shrimp and serve with fried plantains alongside']

ingredients: ['1 bag McCain® Quick Cook Crinkle Fries', '8 oz shredded mozzarella cheese (225 g) divided', '6 slices salami', '4 pieces prosciutto', '¼ cup freshly grated parmesan cheese (25 g)', '¼ cup fresh basil (10 g) torn', '1 cup marinara sauce (230 g) warmed', 'SPECIAL EQUIPMENT', 'cast iron skillet 10 in']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2: Spread the McCain® Quick Cook Crinkle Fries in an even layer on a nonstick baking sheet and bake until cooked through, about 10 minutes', '3:  Remove the fries from the oven and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes', '4: Spread a single layer of fries in a 10-inch cast iron skillet', '5:  Sprinkle with about 2 ounces of the 8 oz shredded mozzarella', '6:  Top with another layer of fries and another 2 ounces of mozzarella', '7:  Use any smaller remaining fries to create a raised crust around the edge of the pan', '8: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake until the cheese has melted, about 5 minutes', '9: Sprinkle the remaining 4 ounces of mozzarella over the crust, then top with the 6 slices salami and prosciutto', '10: Return the skillet to the oven until the cheese melts and turns golden brown and the 6 slices salami and prosciutto are crispy, about 15 minutes', '11: Grate the Parmesan cheese over the pizza and garnish with the torn ¼ cup fresh basil', '12:  Slice the pizza into 6 4 pieces and serve with a bowl of warm 1 cup marinara sauce']

ingredients: ['2 cups spinach (60 g) 14 calories', '1 roma tomato 11 calories', '2 cups egg white (480 mL) 250 calories', 'salt to taste 0 calories', '½ teaspoon pepper 0 calories']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: Lightly grease a muffin tin', '3: Then divide equally the spinach across 6 cups', '4: Dice the 1 roma tomato, then fill the cups with the 1 roma tomato and egg whites', '5: Season with salt and ½ teaspoon pepper', '6: Bake for 15 minutes, or until the whites have set', '7: Serve hot']

ingredients: ['honey', 'peanut butter', 'honey nut cereal', 'Preparation', 'honey', 'peanut butter', 'honey nut cereal', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Put 1 part peanut butter and 1 part honey in a bowl', '2: Microwave for about a minute', '3:  Stir until combined', '4: Add 3-4 parts cereal', '5:  Stir', '6: Scoop into bit size pieces and place on wax paper to cool']

ingredients: ['Seared Salmon', '2 cloves garlic minced', '¼ cup maple syrup (85 g)', '¼ cup lemon juice (60 mL)', '¼ cup olive oil (60 mL)', 'salt to taste', 'pepper to taste', '6 oz salmon fillet (170 g) 6 fillets skin on patted dry', '2 tablespoons canola oil', 'Smoky Squash Salad', '15 oz chickpeas (425 g) 2 cans drained rinsed and dried', '½ cup olive oil (120 mL) divided', '1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '1 tablespoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon black pepper plus more to taste', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt plus more to taste', '½ teaspoon cayenne', '¼ teaspoon cinnamon', '1 butternut squash peeled and cubed', '3 sweet potatoes peeled and cubed', '½ cup tahini (120 mL)', '¼ cup maple syrup (85 g)', '3 cloves garlic finely minced', '½ cup lemon juice (120 mL)', '1 lb kale (455 g) stemmed and sliced', '2 cups barley (400 g) cooked', '2 shallots thinly sliced', '½ cup chopped pecans (60 g) toasted']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)', '2: In a small bowl, combine the garlic, maple syrup, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper', '3: Brush the marinade over the 6 oz salmon fillets', '4:  Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for 1 hour', '5: In a medium bowl, combine the 15 oz chickpeas, 2 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the 1 tablespoon smoked paprika, 1 tablespoon ground turmeric, pepper, 1 tablespoon ground cumin, salt, ½ teaspoon cayenne, and ¼ teaspoon cinnamon', '6:  Toss to combine', '7:  Set aside', '8: Add the 1 butternut squash and 3 sweet potatoes to a baking sheet', '9:  Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with 2 2 tablespoons of olive oil', '10:  Bake for 1 hour, or until the vegetables are soft', '11: Pour the spiced 15 oz chickpeas onto a second sheet pan and spread out into an even layer', '12:  Toss to coat', '13:  Bake for 40 minutes, or until 15 oz chickpeas are browned and crispy', '14: In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the tahini, maple syrup, garlic, lemon juice, remaining ¼ cup of olive oil, salt, and pepper', '15:  Whisk well', '16: In a large bowl, add the chopped 1 lb kale, roasted squash and 3 sweet potatoes, 2 cups barley, roasted 15 oz chickpeas, shallot, pecans, and tahini dressing', '17:  Toss to combine', '18: Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat', '19:  In batches, sear the 6 oz salmon skin-side down for 3 minutes, then flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes', '20: Arrange the salad on a platter and top with the seared 6 oz salmon']

ingredients: ['½ cup rolled oats (50 g)', '1 banana', '1 cup milk (240 mL) of choice']
instructions: ['1: Add ½ cup rolled oats to a blender and blend until the oats are the size of a fine crumb', '2: Add the 1 banana and 1 cup milk and blend well', '3: Pour in a glass']

ingredients: ['1 cup raspberry (125 g)', '1 cup blueberry (100 g)', '1 cup strawberry (100 g)', '1 cup blackberry (100 g)', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 package vanilla cake mix', '8 tablespoons butter cut into pieces']
instructions: ['1: Add raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, and blackberries into the bottom of the slow cooker', '2: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon cornstarch on top and mix gently', '3: Pour 1 package vanilla cake mix on top of the berries and spread out so it covers the berries', '4: Place pieces of 8 tablespoons butter on top of the 1 package vanilla cake mix and cover', '5: Cook on high for 2½ to 3 hours, until the 1 package vanilla cake is fully cooked', '6: Serve topped with ice cream']

ingredients: ['3 teaspoons salt divided', '2 teaspoons pepper', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '3 medium russet potatoes scrubbed', '1 lb skirt steak (455 g)', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 cup shredded cheese blend (100 g)', 'pico de gallo for serving', 'guacamole for serving', '1 tablespoon fresh chives finely chopped', 'sour cream for serving']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 300˚F (150˚C)', '2: In a small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon of salt, the pepper, onion powder, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, and cumin', '3: Slice the 3 medium russet potatoes on a mandolin or with a sharp knife into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices', '4: Transfer the potato slices to a large bowl and cover with water', '5:  Toss the potato slices around to remove excess starch, then drain the water', '6: Sprinkle the remaining 2 teaspoons of salt onto the potato slices and toss, then drain any excess water', '7: Sprinkle half the spice mixture over the 3 medium russet potatoes and toss until well-coated', '8: Invert a muffin tin and place the potato slices in between the muffin tin walls to create taco shapes', '9:  If you have one, use a second muffin tin for the remaining potato slices, or repeat when finished baking the first batch', '10: Bake the potato slices for 25 minutes, or until golden brown', '11: Season the 1 lb skirt steak with the remaining spice mix on both sides', '12: Heat the 1 tablespoon canola oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat', '13:  Add the 1 lb skirt steak and cook for 3 minutes on each side until it is seared with a golden brown crust', '14: Remove the steak from the pan and let rest on a cutting board for 10 minutes', '15:  Once rested, cut the steak into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes', '16: Sprinkle the 1 cup shredded cheese blend and steak into the potato taco shells', '17: Bake for another 5 minutes or until 1 cup shredded cheese is melted', '18: Serve with pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream', '19: Garnish with chopped 1 tablespoon fresh chives, if desired']

ingredients: ['1 cup raw almond (140 g)', '1 cup raw walnut (100 g)', '2 ½ cups pitted date (425 g) roughly chopped', '1 teaspoon salt plus more to taste', '½ cup water (120 mL)', '1 ½ cups brown rice cereal (45 g)', '1 ½ cups old fashion oat (150 g)', '½ cup dried blueberry (50 g)', '½ tablespoon cinnamon', '3 cups dark chocolate (510 g) chopped', '2 tablespoons coconut oil']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2:  Line a baking sheet with parchment paper', '3: Spread the almonds on one half of the baking sheet and the walnuts on the other half', '4: Toast for 10-15 minutes, or until lightly 1 ½ cups browned and fragrant', '5:  Let cool 20 minutes before roughly chopping', '6: In a food processor or blender, combine the 2 ½ cups pitted dates, 1 teaspoon salt, and ½ cup water, and process until well-combined', '7: Transfer the 2 ½ cups pitted date mixture to a large bowl and add the 1 ½ cups brown rice cereal, oats, blueberries, ½ tablespoon cinnamon, and 1 teaspoon salt', '8:  Stir until well-combined', '9:  Add the chopped nuts and fold to combine', '10: Transfer the mixture to a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread flat with a spatula', '11: Cover with plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 30-45 minutes to set', '12: In a large bowl, combine the 3 cups dark chocolate and 2 tablespoons coconut oil, and microwave for 1½ minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until melted and smoothPour ⅔ of the melted 3 cups dark chocolate over the bars and spread evenly', '13:  Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for 10 minutes, or until the 3 cups dark chocolate is set', '14: Invert the bars onto a cutting board and remove the parchment paper', '15:  Drizzle the remaining 3 cups dark chocolate over the top', '16:  Return to the freezer for 10 minutes, until the 3 cups dark chocolate is set', '17: Cut into 16 bars', '18:  Wrap individually in parchment paper and store in the fridge or freezer until ready to eat']

ingredients: ['1 refrigerated biscuit tube', '3 tablespoons butter melted', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 tablespoons fresh parsley minced', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (100 g)']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)', '2: Cut 1 refrigerated biscuits into fourths, and place in a large mixing bowl', '3: Add the 3 tablespoons butter, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, parsley, and 1 cup shredded mozzarella, and mix with your hands, coating all of the 1 refrigerated biscuit pieces', '4: Place the pieces in a muffin tin, 3 pieces per tin (you’ll have 2 extra—just use them in whichever tin you want)', '5:  Bake for 15 minutes', '6:  Best served 2 tablespoons fresh out of the oven!']

ingredients: ['4 large bell peppers try to find peppers with flat bases that can stand upright', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion diced', '3 cloves garlic minced', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup quinoa (170 g) rinsed and drained', '1 ½ cups vegetable stock (355 mL)', '15 oz black beans (425 g) drained and rinsed 1 can', '1 cup corn (175 g)', '1 cup shredded cheese (100 g)', '½ cup enchilada sauce (225 g) or salsa', 'Toppings', 'sour cream', 'guacamole', 'shredded cheese', 'fresh cilantro']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: Wash and dry the 4 large bell peppers', '3: Using a sharp knife, take off their tops and remove the seeds and pith', '4: Arrange the 4 large bell peppers in an oven-safe dish so that they stand upright', '5: Bake the 4 large bell peppers for 20 minutes', '6: While the 4 large bell peppers are baking, begin cooking the 1 cup quinoa', '7: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to a 1 medium-sized pot or dutch oven with a lid', '8:  Add onion and cook over 1 medium heat until tender, about 3 minutes, or until starting to become tender', '9: Add 3 cloves garlic and cook for an additional 2 minutes', '10: Add spices and 1 cup quinoa', '11:  Sauté the 1 cup quinoa for 1-2 minutes before adding the the 1 ½ cups vegetable stock', '12: Add the 1 ½ cups vegetable stock', '13:  Bring to a boil over high heat for 2 minutes', '14: Reduce heat to a low simmer and cook covered for 20 minutes or until the 1 cup quinoa is cooked and has absorbed all the remaining liquid', '15: Remove the pot from the heat and add in the 15 oz black beans, 1 cup corn, cheese, and ½ cup enchilada sauce', '16:  Mix everything together thoroughly', '17: Spoon the 1 cup quinoa mixture into the pre-baked 4 large bell peppers, being sure to press the mixture firmly into the 4 large bell peppers', '18: Generously top with cheese and return to the oven for an additional 20 minutes', '19: Allow the 4 large bell peppers to cool for 5 minutes before serving', '20:  Garnish with toppings of your choice']

ingredients: ['10 oz brownie mix (285 g) 1 box batter prepared according to package instructions', '3 ¼ cups heavy cream (780 mL) plus 1/2 (120 ml) cup hot divided', '½ teaspoon peppermint extract', '½ cup granulated sugar (100 g)', '3 drops green gel food coloring', '1 cup white chocolate chip (175 g)', '1 cup mini chocolate chips (175 g)', '30 mint chocolate cookies crushed plus 45 whole divided', 'fresh mint leaf for garnish', 'Preparation', '10 oz brownie mix (285 g) 1 box batter prepared according to package instructions', '3 ¼ cups heavy cream (780 mL) plus 1/2 (120 ml) cup hot divided', '½ teaspoon peppermint extract', '½ cup granulated sugar (100 g)', '3 drops green gel food coloring', '1 cup white chocolate chip (175 g)', '1 cup mini chocolate chips (175 g)', '30 mint chocolate cookies crushed plus 45 whole divided', 'fresh mint leaf for garnish', 'Preparation', 'Get the Tasty App', 'Get the Tasty Newsletter']
instructions: ['1: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C)', '2: Prepare the brownie batter according to the package instructions', '3:  Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (22 cm) round cake pan', '4:  Bake according to the package instructions, about 30 minutes, until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean', '5:  Let cool completely', '6: In a large bowl, beat the cold heavy cream with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form', '7:  Fold in the peppermint extract, sugar, and green food coloring with a rubber spatula until incorporated', '8: In a medium bowl, pour the hot heavy cream over the white chocolate chips', '9:  Let sit for 1 minute, then stir with a rubber spatula until smooth', '10:  Fold the white chocolate mixture into the whipped cream until no streaks remain', '11:  Fold in the mini chocolate chips and crushed mint chocolate cookies', '12: Line a 10-inch (25 cm) diameter bowl with the whole mint chocolate cookies', '13:  Carefully pour the whipped cream mixture over the cookies and spread evenly', '14:  Place the brownie upside down on top and lightly press into the cream', '15: Cover and freeze until solid, at least 5 hours or overnight', '16: Invert the bowl onto a serving plate and let the the ice cream dome to release from the bowl', '17:  Slice and serve, garnished with fresh mint']

ingredients: ['½ cup soy sauce (120 g)', '½ cup honey (170 g)', '1 cup onion (150 g) chopped', '¼ cup rice vinegar (60 g)', '1 tablespoon ginger grated', '2 garlic cloves grated', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '2 lb chicken thighs (910 g)', '1 broccoli head', '1 carrot', '1 zucchini', '¼ cup water (60 mL)', '3 tablespoons cornstarch']
instructions: ['1: Make the teriyaki marinade', '2:  In a medium bowl, mix ½ cup soy sauce, ½ cup honey, 1 cup onion, ¼ cup rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon ginger, 2 garlic, and ¼ teaspoon black pepper, and set aside', '3: In the slow cooker, add 2 lb chicken and teriyaki marinade', '4: Cook on high for 4 hours, or cook on low for 8 hours', '5: Cut vegetables into bite-size pieces', '6: Mix ¼ cup water into 3 tablespoons cornstarch and mix until 3 tablespoons cornstarch is melted', '7: Add 3 tablespoons cornstarch slurry and vegetables into the slow cooker for 30 minutes', '8: Serve by itself or in a bowl of brown ¼ cup rice']

ingredients: ['10 eggs', '¾ cup milk (180 mL) of your preference', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 cups broccoli floret (300 g) chopped', '½ red onion diced', '1 red bell pepper diced', '2 slices turkey bacon or of your preference cut in half', '4 slices deli meat of your preference', '6 whole grain english muffins sliced', '6 slices cheese of your preference']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 375ºF (190ºC)', '2: Spray a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish with cooking spray', '3: In the baking dish, whisk the eggs, ¾ cup milk, ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon 1 red bell pepper, and ½ teaspoon garlic powder', '4: Mix in 2 cups broccoli, red onion, and bell ½ teaspoon 1 red bell pepper', '5: Bake until the top starts to get golden brown, about 25 minutes', '6: Place the 4 slices deli meat and 2 slices turkey bacon on a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) nonstick sheet pan', '7: Bake 5-10 minutes, or until they reach desired doneness', '8: Arrange the sliced English muffins on another sheet pan', '9: Broil for 5-10 minutes, or until they reach desired doneness', '10: Once your eggs cool, slice into 6 squares', '11: Cut your parchment paper into 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) squares for each breakfast sandwich', '12: Lay a moistened paper towel across the parchment and assemble your breakfast sandwiches', '13: Wrap the assembled sandwich in the moist paper towel first, to ensure freezer freshness and even cooking when microwaved', '14:  Wrap in parchment and label', '15: Store in an airtight plastic bag or container up to one month in the freezer', '16: When ready to eat, remove the parchment paper and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes', '17:  Allow to cool']

ingredients: ['1 cup almond milk (240 mL)', '1 cup strawberry (150 g) stems removed', '⅓ cup raspberry (40 g)', '⅓ cup blackberry (50 g)', '⅓ cup banana (65 g) sliced', '1 cup ice (215 g)']
instructions: ['1: Add all the ingredients to a blender and mix on high', '2: Pour into a bowl and top with desired fruit and other toppings']

ingredients: ['1 tablespoon canola oil', '2 chicken breasts sliced into 1/2 inch (2cm) strips', '2 tablespoons garlic chopped', '½ tablespoon kosher salt', '½ tablespoon black pepper freshly ground', '¾ cup heavy cream (175 mL)', '½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g)', '¼ cup pesto (55 g)', '3 cups penne pasta (600 g) cooked and drained', '¾ cup cherry tomato (150 g) halved', 'parmesan cheese to garnish', 'fresh basil chopped to garnish']
instructions: ['1: Heat the 1 tablespoon canola oil in a pan over high heat', '2:  Combine the 2 chicken, 2 tablespoons garlic, ½ tablespoon kosher salt, and ½ tablespoon black pepper, cooking until 2 chicken is browned', '3: Then, mix in the ¾ cup heavy cream, parmesan, and ¼ cup pesto, stirring until evenly combined', '4: Next, bring to a boil and cook until the sauce has reduced, about five to seven minutes', '5: Toss in the 3 cups penne pasta and ¾ cup cherry tomatoes, stirring until evenly coated', '6:  Remove from heat', '7: To serve, sprinkle parmesan cheese and fresh basil on top!']

ingredients: ['American Patty', '1 lb ground beef (455 g) 80% lean', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 tablespoon oil', '2 oz cheddar cheese (55 g) sliced into 3 square chunks', 'Toppings', '3 hamburger buns', '3 strips bacon cooked sliced in half', '3 slices tomato', '3 pieces lettuce']
instructions: ['1: Mix together the patty ingredients until evenly combined', '2: Flatten the 1 lb ground beef into a thin layer, then place a chunk of 2 oz cheddar inside, wrapping the 1 lb ground beef completely around the 2 oz cheddar', '3:  Form a patty with your hands', '4: Repeat with the remaining 1 lb ground beef and cheese', '5: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan over medium heat', '6: Cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, then cook for 6 more minutes', '7: Assemble the burgers with the bun, 3 strips bacon, 3 slices tomato, and 3 pieces lettuce']

ingredients: ['egg', '2 slices bacon optional', 'chive optional', 'parmesan cheese optional']
instructions: ['1: Separate the yolk from egg whites', '2: In a chilled metal bowl, whisk the whites until stiff peaks form', '3:  Mix in whatever you want', '4:  We use 2 slices bacon, chives and parmesan cheese', '5: Spoon the whites into even piles on a baking sheet and create a well in the center of each pile with the back of the spoon', '6: Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 3 minutes', '7: Put a yolk in each well, bake another 3 minutes']

ingredients: ['3 cups sweet glutinous rice (600 g) rinsed', '3 ¾ cups water (900 mL)', '3 mangoes', '1 ¼ cups coconut cream (300 mL) unsweetened', '4 tablespoons sugar', '1 teaspoon salt']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot over high heat, combine the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice and 3 ¾ cups water', '2:  Cover, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low', '3:  Stir, re-cover and cook for 20 minutes', '4:  Remove the pot from the heat and set aside', '5: On a cutting board, cut a mango ¼-inch (6-mm) away from the stem on both sides', '6:  Take one side of the mango and make 3-4 cuts vertically and horizontally to create a grid', '7:  Put pressure on the skin side of the mango so the mango cubes pop out', '8:  Cut off all of the cubes of mango', '9:  Repeat with the rest of the 3 mangoes', '10:  Set aside until ready to use', '11: In a medium saucepan over high heat, combine the 1 ¼ cups coconut cream, sugar, and 1 teaspoon salt', '12:  Bring to a boil', '13:  Reduce the heat to low and cover for 10 minutes', '14:  Once sauce has thickened slightly, remove from the heat and set aside', '15: Line a small bowl with plastic wrap', '16:  Scoop about 2 4 tablespoons of 3 cups sweet glutinous rice onto the plastic wrap', '17:  Push the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice against the sides of the bowl to create an even layer', '18:  Place 3 cubes of mango inside the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice', '19:  Using the plastic wrap, form the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice into a ball and twist the plastic wrap tightly', '20:  Unwrap and repeat with the rest of the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice and mango', '21: Arrange the 3 cups sweet glutinous rice balls in a pile and pour the 1 ¼ cups coconut cream sauce over them', '22:  Serve immediately']

ingredients: ['1 ½ lb chicken breast (680 g) chopped into bite-size pieces', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 cup cornstarch (125 g) plus 1 tbsp divided', '1 large egg', '1 pineapple', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil plus more for frying', '½ red bell pepper chopped', '½ green bell pepper chopped', '½ cup white onion (75 g) chopped', '2 teaspoons garlic minced', '1 teaspoon ginger minced', '¼ cup rice vinegar (60 mL)', '¼ cup sugar (50 g)', '3 tablespoons ketchup', 'white rice cooked for serving', 'scallion sliced for garnish', 'sesame seed for garnish']
instructions: ['1: In a 1 large bowl, combine the 1 ½ lb chicken with 1 1 2 3 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 1 2 3 tablespoon cornstarch, and 1 egg', '2:  Cover and marinate in the fridge for  20 minutes', '3: Cut the 1 pineapple in half lengthwise and carefully cube the fruit in each half, leaving the outside of the 1 pineapple intact', '4:  Scoop out the cubed 1 pineapple and set aside', '5: Place the remaining cup of cornstarch in a separate 1 large bowl and toss the marinated 1 ½ lb chicken pieces until liberally coated', '6:  Shake off excess', '7: Fill medium pot halfway with oil and heat until the oil reaches 350˚F (180°C)', '8: Fry the 1 ½ lb chicken for 4-5 minutes, until the coating is golden brown and the 1 ½ lb chicken is cooked throughout', '9:  Transfer to a wire rack set over paper towels to drain', '10: To make the sauce, heat 2 1 2 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a medium frying pan over a medium heat', '11:  Sauté the bell pepper and onion for 2-3 minutes, until softened', '12: Add the 2 teaspoons garlic and 1 teaspoon ginger, and cook until fragrant', '13: Add the vinegar, sugar, and ketchup, and stir', '14:  Bring the mixture to a boil', '15: Add the 1 pineapple cubes and warm thorough', '16: Add the 1 ½ lb chicken to the frying pan and toss to coat with the sauce', '17: Scoop the mixture into the hollowed out 1 pineapple along with a scoop of ¼ cup white rice', '18: Garnish with scallions and sesame seeds']

ingredients: ['3 lb chicken wings (1360 g)', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons pepper', '1 cup BBQ sauce (286 g)', '17 fl oz root beer (500 mL)', 'BBQ sauce to taste', '¼ cup brown sugar (55 g) to taste']
instructions: ['1: Season 3 lb chicken wings with 2 teaspoons salt and 2 teaspoons pepper', '2: Spray your slow cooker pot with cooking spray, add 3 lb chicken wings, bbq sauce and 17 fl oz root beer', '3:  Cover, cook on low for 4 hours', '4: Remove wings from slow cooker, place on parchment lined tray', '5:  Brush more bbq sauce onto wings, sprinkle on some ¼ cup brown sugar', '6:  Place under broiler for 8 -10 minutes']

ingredients: ['½ cup unsalted butter (125 g) at room temperature', '½ cup white granulated sugar (110 g)', '½ cup brown sugar (115 g)', '1 large egg', '1 dash vanilla', '2 cups self-rising flour (215 g)', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 cup chocolate (175 g) good quality', 'flaky sea salt optional']
instructions: ['1: Cream the ½ cup unsalted butter, dark ½ cup brown sugar and ½ cup white sugar in a bowl', '2:  Once pale and fluffy, crack the 1 large egg in and add 1 dash vanilla if desired', '3:  Sift in your self-raising 2 cups self-rising flour and salt', "4: Fold in the 2 cups self-rising flour and salt just until you can't see any streaks", '5:  Then, fold in 1 cup chocolate', '6: Cover the bowl with Saran wrap and rest in the fridge for at least an hour or up to 2 days at most', '7:  (If freezing dough, dough can be frozen for upto 2 months)', '8: Preheat the oven to 375°F', '9: Scoop the dough into tablespoon-sized balls and place onto a baking tray with 2-inch spaces in between the cookies', '10: ', '11: Bake for 7 minutes for a chewy cookie, or 10 minutes for a crispy cookie', '12: Let cool and serve, or enjoy warm with a glass of cold milk']

ingredients: ['2 boneless skinless chicken breasts', '1 teaspoon salt for chicken', '¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '4 slices ham', '4 slices provolone cheese', '1 cup flour (125 g)', '2 eggs beaten', '1 cup breadcrumb (115 g)', '3 cups broccoli floret (450 g)', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon pepper']
instructions: ['1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)Cut about ¾ of the way through the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken horizontally, making sure not to cut through the other side', '2:  Flip the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken open and flat', '3: Lay a sheet of plastic wrap on top of the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken and pound it flatter using a pot or a pan', '4:  Remove the plastic wrap', '5: Season with the salt, pepper, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder, rubbing the seasoning in evenly', '6:  Lay 2-3 slices of ham over the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken, followed by 4 slices of provolone cheese', '7: Carefully roll the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken up', '8: Transfer the 1 cup flour, 2 eggs, and breadcrumbs into 3 separate bowls', '9: Dip the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken roll into the 1 cup flour, tapping off any excess, and then into the egg, followed by the breadcrumbs', '10:  Place on a baking sheetAdd the 3 cups broccoli to the baking sheet, mixing it with the 4 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper', '11:  Make sure to save a little oil to drizzle on top of the 2 boneless skinless 1 teaspoon salt for ¼ teaspoon pepper for chicken', '12: Bake for 20 minutes', '13: Slice, then serve!']

ingredients: ['1 lb lean ground beef (455 g)', '1 small white onion diced', '2 tablespoons garlic minced', '14.5 oz diced tomato (400 g)', '7 oz kidney bean (200 g)', '7 oz black beans (200 g) half of a can', '1 ½ tablespoons chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin', '1 teaspoon seasoned salt', '3 ½ cups chicken broth (840 mL)', '10 oz cavatappi pasta (285 g) or any other pasta', '3 cups sharp cheddar cheese (300 g) shredded', 'Optional toppings', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese', 'sour cream', 'fresh cilantro']
instructions: ['1: In a large pot, cook 1 lb lean ground beef and onions over medium high heat until browned', '2: Add minced 2 tablespoons garlic and cook for an additional two to three minutes', '3:  Carefully drain any excess fat', '4: Add the diced tomatoes, 7 oz kidney beans, 7 oz black beans, 1 ½ tablespoons chili powder, 1 ½ teaspoons cumin, 1 teaspoon seasoned salt, and 3 ½ cups chicken broth', '5:  Stir, and bring to a boil', '6: Add the 10 oz cavatappi pasta, and cook according to package instructions', '7: Stir in the cheese, and cook for an additional five minutes, or until thickened', '8: Serve with your favorite Optional toppings']

ingredients: ['½ lb self raising flour (225 g)', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup vegan butter (125 g) frozen then grated', '¼ cup caster sugar (75 g)', '1 cup currants (120 g)', '½ orange zest', '½ lemon zest', '½ cup coconut milk (190 mL)', 'vegan butter for greasing', 'Custard', '2 ½ tablespoons corn flour', '⅛ teaspoon turmeric', '4 tablespoons water', '½ cup caster sugar (100 g)', '2 cups coconut milk (400 mL)', '½ cup vegan double cream (150 mL)', '2 tablespoons vanilla extract']
instructions: ['1: In a large bowl add the flour, ½ teaspoon baking powder and vegan butter', '2:  Using the tips of your fingers rub together until it resembles breadcrumbs', '3: Next add the sugar, 1 cup currants, zest of an ½ orange and ½ lemon', '4:  Stir until fully combined', '5: Make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients and add the coconut milk', '6:  Stir until a wet dough forms', '7: Place the dough into a greased pudding basin', '8:  Place greaseproof paper over the top of the dough and cover with a lid', '9:  If your basin doesn’t have a lid simply use tin foil', '10: Take a large pot and place a small up-turned saucer into the bottom', '11:  Next take a large piece of greaseproof paper and fold into a long strip and place it into the pot', '12:  (You want it to be long enough so it sits along the bottom and up the sides of the basin)Place the basin on top of the saucer and grease proof paper', '13:  Fill the pot ¼ full of cold 4 tablespoons water, cover with a lid and place over a low-medium heat', '14: Once the 4 tablespoons water comes to a simmer cook the pudding for around 1 hour 30 minutes or until the sponge is cooked through', '15: To a small bowl add the cornflour, ⅛ teaspoon turmeric & 4 tablespoons water', '16:  Stir until combined and set aside', '17: Next add the caster sugar, 2 tablespoons vanilla extract, coconut milk & vegan double cream', '18:  Whisk until combined and then pour in your cornflour mix', '19:  Stir until fully combined', '20: Place a medium sized pan over a medium heat and your custard mix', '21:  Cook for 10 minutes (or until it has thickened and glossy) continuously stirring', '22: Once cooked, remove from heat and enjoy!']
